title: Four Dead in Shootings in Colorado Springs
description: A shooting rampage in Colorado Springs on Saturday left four people dead, including the assailant, who was gunned down after the authorities said the person fired at officers.

title: 17-Year-Old Is Charged With Murder in Downtown Brooklyn Shooting
description: A 17-year-old has been arrested and charged with murder after a shooting on a busy commercial street in Brooklyn left one teenager dead and another injured, the police said late Friday.

title: Mets Ruben Tejada Speaks, Convinced the Slide Was Dirty
description: As the Mets took batting practice Saturday before Game 3 of the World Series, Ruben Tejada emerged into the dugout in full uniform, wearing a boot on his right foot and moving gingerly, using a cane adorned with the Mets logo, a gift from the Wilpon family.

title: Noah Syndergaards Bold Statement Adds Spice to Series
description: Dickie Noles was watching the third game of the World Series on television Friday night when he saw a fastball sail up and in to a Kansas City Royals hitter. Like that, Noles had company among pitchers who had done this, to great effect, on baseballs brightest stage.

title: American Pharoahs Final Triumph Wipes Away Effects of an Earlier Loss
description: LEXINGTON, Ky.  The defeat in the Travers Stakes in August sucked the air out of the air-conditioned V.I.P. room at Saratoga Race Course. Television cameras recorded every emotion, from shock to horror to devastation, after the Triple Crown champion American Pharoah had lost his first race in more than a year.

title: Royals Are Still Stewing Over Noah Syndergaards Knockdown Pitch
description: The intrigue surrounding Noah Syndergaards high first offering in Game 3 did not fade before Game 4 on Saturday, although it did not affect the way Game 4 was played, either, with the Kansas City Royals winning, 5-3, and moving one step from a championship.

title: 3 Dead, 4 Injured After Car Crashes Into Trick-or-Treaters in the Bronx
description: Three people were killed on Saturday, including a 10-year-old girl, after a car swerved off a road in the Bronx and ran onto a sidewalk, crashing into a group of children and adults who were trick-or-treating, the police said.

title: Royals Defeat the Mets to Take a 3-1 Lead in the World Series
description: The Mets were five outs from winning a pivotal Game 4 of the World Series on Saturday night when they called on their closer, Jeurys Familia, to protect a 3-2 lead.

title: A Crushing Error, and Now a Daunting Hole
description: History is often told in thumbnails. Bill Buckner. Mitch Williams. Steve Bartman. Grady Little. They are goats of October, never mind the context or the more complicated stories that contributed to their infamy.

title: Rebecca Koenig, Michael Rosen
description: Rebecca Jill Koenig, the daughter of Rita G. Koenig and Philip J. Koenig of Stamford, Conn., was married Saturday to Michael Neil Rosen, a son of Harriet B. Rosen of Bridgewater, N.J., and the late Eugene W. Rosen. Jeffrey Rosen, the grooms brother, who became a minister through American Marriage Ministries for the occasion, officiated at the Metropolitan Building, a former factory in Long Island City, Queens.

title: Janelle Burrell and Derricke Dennis
description: Janelle Burrell and Derricke Dennis were married Friday at the Liberty House, an events space in Liberty State Park in Jersey City. The Rev. Keith C. Treadwell, a Baptist minister, officiated.

title: Mary Van Houten, Ryan Harper
description: Mary Sameera Van Houten and Ryan Matthew Harper were married Saturday in Evanston, Ill. The Rev. Sam Hamstra Jr., a minister of the Christian Reformed Church, performed the ceremony at the Alice Millar Chapel at Northwestern University.

title: Sarah Stipicevic, Colin Higgins
description: Sarah Catherine Stipicevic, the daughter of Katherine M. Stipicevic and James A. Stipicevic of Crestwood, N.Y., was married Friday to Colin James Higgins, a son of Patricia A. Higgins and Sean M. Higgins Sr. of Larkspur, Colo. Msgr. Dennis P. Keane performed the ceremony at the Church of the Annunciation in Crestwood.

title: Jessica Novick, Jonathan Justl
description: Jessica Alexandra Novick and Jonathan Max Justl are to be married Sunday. Rabbi Benjamin Herman is to perform the ceremony at Shelter Rock Jewish Center in Roslyn, N.Y.

title: Kimberly Frye, Yared Alula
description: Kimberly Krystal Frye, a daughter of Ernestine W. Frye and Walter K. Frye of West Orange, N.J., was married Saturday to Yared Hadgu Alula, a son of Cecille M. Hadgu and Alula Hadgu of Decatur, Ga. Monte Richardson, a magistrate judge of the United States District Court for the Middle District of Florida, officiated at the TPC Sawgrass Clubhouse in Ponte Vedra Beach, Fla.

title: Lucy Harris, Joshua Collins
description: Lucy Ann Harris and Joshua Caleb Collins were married Saturday in Memphis, Tenn. Andrew R. Feldman, a friend of the couple who became a minister of the Open Ministry Church for this event, officiated at the Dixon Gallery and Gardens, an art museum.

title: Danielle Gaier, Jonathan Goodman
description: Danielle Lauren Gaier and Jonathan David Goodman were married Saturday evening at the Estate at Florentine Gardens, an event space in River Vale, N.J. The officiant was Bergen V. Wheeler, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event

title: Meeta Anand, James Lucas
description: Meeta Anand, the daughter of Lissa Anand and Jaggi Anand of Forest Hills, Queens, was married at her parents house on Saturday to H James Lucas, the son of Deborah L. Hepokoski and Dr. Steven J. Hepokoski of Maple Grove, Minn. Judge Donald C. Pogue, a judge of the United States Court of International Trade in Manhattan, officiated.

title: Shilpi Gupta and Omar Kasrawi
description: Shilpi Gupta and Omar Farouk Kasrawi were married in a Hindu ceremony Saturday in Bayville, N.Y. Mahesh Shastriji officiated at the Crescent Beach Club.

title: Cassandra Henry and Brett Baptist: A Bridge to Somewhere, Everywhere
description: Cassandra Amarga Henry and Brett Boyd Baptist were married Saturday evening in the chapel at Duchesne Academy of the Sacred Heart in Houston. The Rev. Philip P. Lloyd, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Kimberlyn Lipscomb and Michael Balz
description: Kimberlyn Crockett Lipscomb and Michael Joseph Balz were married Saturday. The Rev. Katharine G. Flexer performed the ceremony at St. Michaels Episcopal Church in New York.

title: Raquefette Kilchevsky, Adam Chertok
description: Raquefette Adi Kilchevsky, the daughter of Laurie S. Kilchevsky and Dr. Eitan S. Kilchevsky of Newtown, Conn., was married Saturday evening to Adam Bradley Chertok, a son of Harriet S. Chertok and Mark E. Chertok of Roslyn, N.Y. Rabbi Ari Lucas officiated at the Loading Dock, an events space in Stamford, Conn.

title: Caryn Brough, Milan Suri
description: Caryn Helene Brough, a daughter of Cheryl K. Brough and Charles W. Brough of Fairfield, Conn., was married Friday to Milan Spencer Suri, a son of Marie Suri and Madan Suri of Darien, Conn. Peter Regan, a justice of the peace in Newport, R.I., officiated there at the Castle Hill Inn.

title: Tiffany Tribbitt, John Zoller III
description: Tiffany Amy Tribbitt, a daughter of Ronda Jane Tribbitt and Keith R. Tribbitt of Dagsboro, Del., was married Friday to John Francis Zoller III, a son of Esther Marie Zoller and Mr. Zoller Jr. of Wall, N.J. Edward Jennings, a Roman Catholic deacon, performed the ceremony at St. Catharine Church in Spring Lake, N.J.

title: Georgina Valverde and Matthew Stone
description: Georgina Valverde and Matthew Alden Stone were married Saturday in Kyle, Tex. The Rev. John E. Harnish, a United Methodist minister and an uncle of the groom, officiated at the Plant at Kyle, a former cement plant shed that is now an events space.

title: Diane Saltzman and Joshua Marks
description: Diane Lynn Saltzman and Dr. Joshua Aaron Marks were married Saturday evening by Rabbi Neil S. Cooper at the National Museum of American Jewish History in Philadelphia.

title: Courtney Clark and James Morrison
description: Courtney Marilyn Clark, the daughter of Sharon Meier Clark and Warren F. Clark of Ridgewood, N.J., was married Saturday to Dr. James Scott Morrison, the son of Mary Saloka Morrison and D. Scott Morrison of Bay Village, Ohio. The Rev. Edwin B. Diaz performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More in New York.

title: Laurie Belosa, Zachary Sharon
description: Dr. Laurie Elian Belosa and Dr. Zachary Seth Sharon were married Saturday evening in Parsippany, N.J. Cantor Menachem Toren officiated at the Sheraton Hotel Parsippany.

title: Linz Shelton and David Pashman: Hedwig Acts as a Matchmaker
description: Lindsay Barrett Shelton and David Jeremy Pashman were married Saturday evening at Angel Orensanz Foundation for the Arts, an event space and former synagogue in New York. Attiss Ngo, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, led a ceremony that incorporated Jewish elements.

title: Mets Let Game 4 Slip Away
description: An eighth-inning error by Daniel Murphy helped the Kansas City Royals rally to a victory that gave them a commanding lead in the World Series.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Ominously, business has a good chance of opting out of the legal system altogether and misbehaving without reproach.

title: Corrections: November 1, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Al Qaeda Claims Responsibility for Attacks on 2 Publishers in Bangladesh
description: NEW DELHI  Statements attributed to a regional division of Al Qaeda late on Saturday claimed responsibility for attacks on two publishers in Bangladesh who put out works critical of fundamentalist Islam, according to the SITE Intelligence Group, which monitors radical Islamic propaganda.

title: Royals Arent Perfect, but Opportunistic Does Just Fine
description: As Alex Rios stood in front of his locker and patiently explained how on baseballs biggest stage, despite being surrounded by several scoreboards and nearby teammates, he forgot how many outs there were, he could at least shrug.

title: Erdogans Party in Turkey Regains Parliamentary Majority
description: ISTANBUL  In a stunning electoral comeback, the Islamist party of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan regained its majority in Parliament on Sunday, ensuring Mr. Erdogans continued dominance of Turkish politics after months of political turmoil and violence.

title: China, Japan and South Korea Pledge to Expand Trade at Joint Meeting
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Meeting for the first time in three years, leaders from China, Japan and South Korea agreed on Sunday that they would meet annually and work toward greater trade ties, even as they continued to wrangle over territorial and historical disputes.

title: SAP Chief Bill McDermott Embarks on Health Care Mission After Losing His Eye
description: On July 6, Bill McDermott, the chief executive of one of the worlds largest software companies, fell down the stairs at his brothers house. He awoke in a pool of blood.

title: Your Weekend Briefing: Syria, Sinai, Hillary Clinton, World Series
description: Here are the weeks top stories.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know about the weeks top stories.

title: Guinea Presidents Re-election Confirmed Despite Fraud Complaints
description: CONAKRY, Guinea  After a presidential vote that prompted a spate of violence and complaints of fraud, election results were validated in Guinea late Saturday, confirming the incumbent, Alpha Cond, as the winner.

title: Popular Hotel in Somalia Is Bombed by Militants
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia  Islamist militants stormed a popular hotel in the heart of Mogadishu, Somalias capital, on Sunday, blowing up the front gate with a car bomb, shooting guests and hotel workers, and then battling with security forces from the hotels rooftop for several hours.

title: I Wanted to Stay Home With My Son. So Why Would I Lie About It?
description: The connection crackles after the applicants well-rehearsed introduction. I glance over his rsum again as I wait for the static to clear. Elyas from Blue Bell, Pa. He is only 18 years old but the page has no white space, even with Size 10 writing and a strategically selected font.

title: New York Jets at Oakland Raiders Preview
description: Jets (4-2) at Oakland Raiders (3-3)

title: Cincinnati Bengals at Pittsburgh Steelers Preview
description: Cincinnati Bengals (6-0) at Pittsburgh Steelers (4-3)

title: Green Bay Packers at Denver Broncos Preview
description: Green Bay Packers (6-0) at Denver Broncos (6-0)

title: Seattle Seahawks at Dallas Cowboys Preview
description: Seattle Seahawks (3-4) at Dallas Cowboys (2-4)

title: Minnesota Vikings at Chicago Bears Preview
description: Minnesota Vikings (4-2) at Chicago Bears (2-4)

title: Arizona Cardinals at Cleveland Browns Preview
description: Arizona Cardinals (5-2) at Cleveland Browns (2-5)

title: Tampa Bay Buccaneers at Atlanta Falcons Preview
description: Tampa Bay Buccaneers (2-4) at Atlanta Falcons (6-1)

title: Detroit Lions vs. Kansas City Chiefs Preview
description: Detroit Lions (1-6) at Kansas City Chiefs (2-5)

description: San Diego Chargers (2-5) at Baltimore Ravens (1-6)

description: San Francisco 49ers (2-5) at St. Louis Rams (3-3)

title: Tennessee Titans at Houston Texans Preview
description: Tennessee Titans (1-5) at Houston Texans (2-5)

title: Amid Vigils and Debris, Officials Seek Cause of Sinai Peninsula Crash
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia  As Russia mourned the 224 victims of a charter flight that crashed over the weekend on the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt, investigators on Sunday began the difficult process of trying to determine whether the plane, which they said had broken up in midair, was brought down by an act of terrorism or a tragic accident.

title: Why Consumers Often Err in Choosing Health Plans
description: Its open enrollment season for almost every kind of health insurance in America. Millions of Americans using Medicare plans, employer-sponsored health insurance or Affordable Care Act marketplaces select health plans each fall. Many consumers face numerous options, and research shows that they make many mistakes, often paying more than they need to.

title: Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio Grow Apart as Their Ambitions Expand
description: WASHINGTON  When he ran for the Senate from Texas in 2012, Ted Cruz welcomed the comparisons on Capitol Hill and in the news media to Senator Marco Rubio of Florida, another 41-year-old Cuban-American and oratorically gifted conservative, who had ridden a wave of Tea Party support two years earlier to victory over his states Republican establishment.

title: Running While Juggling Is Banned by Marathon Organizers
description: As an elite joggler  that is, someone who runs while juggling  Michal Kapral of Canada is used to doing things the hard way. But at this years New York City Marathon, that meant something different: settling for an ordinary 26.2 miles, empty-handed. Marathon organizers banned joggling from the course, ruling that beanbags filled with millet seed, like Kaprals, count as Prohibited Items.

title: 1915: Sarah Bernhardt Says War Took Most Leading Men
description: Mme. Sarah Bernhardt, who recently arrived in Paris to rehearse her new play, has announced that she will leave on December 25 for her postponed American tour. Though the great artist had just come from the theatre fatigued from the daily rehearsals, she received a Herald correspondent at her home on boulevard Pereire, and talked at length of her trip to America.

title: Evgeny Kissin to Take a Break in U.S., But Not Europe
description: American fans of the pianist Evgeny Kissin are about to go from feast to famine. This season Mr. Kissin seems ubiquitous at some of the countrys leading concert halls, but after May he does not plan to perform in the United States again until 2018, his representatives said.

title: On Ballot, Ohio Grapples With Specter of Marijuana Monopoly
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  As a member of the International Cannabinoid Research Society, a collector of antique marijuana apothecary jars, the founder of an industrial hemp business and a pot smoker consistently for 47 years, Don Wirtshafter, an Ohio lawyer, has fought for decades to make marijuana legal, calling it my lifes work.

title: Scenes From the New York City Marathon
description: Images from Sundays New York City Marathon, which got underway at 8:30 a.m., when the wheelchair athletes took off.

title: Daniel Murphy Hit Them High and Far, but Couldnt Reach Down Low
description: When the helium begins to leak from the balloon and the descent turns pell-mell, the earth can soar up to greet you with startling speed.

title: Bernie Sanders Is Airing His First Ad of the Campaign
description: Senator Bernie Sanders is airing the first television ad of his campaign, a biographical spot that describes his up-by-the-bootstraps childhood in Brooklyn, incorporates imagery of the late Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and paints him as an honest leader.

title: Job-Killing Obama
description: Source.

title: Inside the Trial of Sheldon Silver
description: The list of people who may testify or be mentioned at the corruption trial of Assemblyman Sheldon Silver is a whos who of Albany politics and New York City real estate.

title: Report on Bella Vista Health Center
description: A woman with Alzheimers was sexually assaulted by other residents at the Bella Vista Health Center, a nursing home in Lemon Grove, Calif., according to an investigation by the states department of public health.

title: Plastic Boat Sinks Off Greece, Killing 11 Migrants
description: ATHENS  A week of drownings in the Aegean Sea was capped on Sunday by more tragedy when a plastic boat carrying migrants from Turkey capsized and sank off the Greek island of Samos in high winds, killing 11 people including six children, according to Greek officials.

title: Beware the Fine Print
description: When she bought her car, Tinker Martin-Bowen signed a contract with an arbitration clause that took away her right to a jury trial. Only later did she realize just what she had given up.

title: In Arbitration, a Privatization of the Justice System
description: Deborah L. Pierce, an emergency room doctor in Philadelphia, was optimistic when she brought a sex discrimination claim against the medical group that had dismissed her. Respected by colleagues, she said she had a stack of glowing evaluations and evidence that the practice had a pattern of denying women partnerships.

title: Paul Ryan Says He Wont Work With Obama on Immigration Reform
description: WASHINGTON  Speaker Paul D. Ryan said in a series of televised interviews on Sunday that he would not work with the Obama administration on changing immigration policy, effectively pushing off the issue to at least 2017.

title: Elaine May to Direct Mike Nichols Documentary for PBS
description: Roughly six decades after she teamed with Mike Nichols to form one of comedys most influential duos, Elaine May has again signed on for a Nichols project. Ms. May will direct an American Masters documentary about the acclaimed director, who died in November 2014 at 83. The film will debut on PBS on Jan. 29 to kick off the 30th season of American Masters.

title: G.O.P. Debates Fail to Give Voters Basic Details
description: WASHINGTON  The Republican presidential candidates three debates have been sometimes compelling, often contentious and always amusing.

title: In Two Corruption Cases, the Culture of Albany Will Go on Trial
description: In separate federal courthouses in Lower Manhattan this month, two of the most powerful men in New York are about to go on trial, an extraordinary spectacle centering on allegations of corruption, bribery and nepotism in the states highest chambers of political power.

title: Whats On TV Sunday
description: 4:20 P.M. THE LUNCHBOX (2014) Food from (and for) the heart: A neglected Mumbai housewife sends a home-cooked meal to her husband  and ends up pen pals with a widowed office worker after it goes astray. The great Irrfan Khan stars. Its not a new conceit, but the idea of two lonely souls connecting in a vast, modern metropolis, and remaining strangers even as their intimacy grows, has a durable charm, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. (Starz Cinema) (Image: Mr. Khan)

title: Alex Rodriguez Is an October Surprise
description: Alex Rodriguez, the Fox pregame-show version of himself, was sitting on a black couch in a trailer outside Citi Field on Friday night talking about the World Series. This is a new role for Rodriguez, an unexpected diversion in a journey of athletic greatness tainted by performance-enhancing drugs, and one he is excelling at. So he looked happy to be talking about baseball as he peered into his interviewers eyes, answered some questions, avoided some others and posed a few of his own. He discussed his love of preparation, his note-taking, his working with Pete Rose (When it comes to baseball, he has an Ivy League mind) and his admiration of Keith Hernandez.

title: A Dazzling Encore for Mary Keitany, and a Promising Debut for Laura Thweatt
description: Running a marathon for the first time is hard enough, especially when your debut involves vying for the top American slot in the largest race in the world. So before she took off with the other professional women Sunday in the New York City Marathon, Laura Thweatt faced a special set of concerns.

title: Cartoon: Heng on Elections in Myanmar
description: Voting will take place on on Nov. 8 in what is expected to be a major test for the countrys military establishment.

title: Natural Confusion
description: Brad DeLong is bemused by the way Tyler Cowen makes very heavy going of the simple concept of the natural rate of interest. I will say that this kind of gratuitous complexification is somewhat characteristic.

title: Stanley Biwott of Kenya Wins New York City Marathon Mens Race
description: The New York City Marathon had not been forgiving for Stanley Biwott of Kenya. He was among the favorites in 2012, but the race was canceled in the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy. In 2013, Biwott hung near the front for about 23 of 26.2 miles, then faded to fifth place.

title: Hillary Clintons Press Operation Gets an Overhaul
description: Hillary Rodham Clintons press shop, the focal point of her campaign over the summer as she tried to grapple with questions about her use of private email while at the State Department, is adding staff members and reshuffling existing personnel as it prepares for the final months of the nominating contest and the general election.

title: 1965: Gemini Astronauts to Fly in Long Johns
description: WASHINGTON  Theres no other way to phrase it: the Gemini-7 astronauts plan to spend ten days in orbit in GI underwear. If their funnel-shaped Gemini spacecraft doesnt spring a leak, Air Force Maj. Frank Borman and his co-pilot, Navy Lt. Cmdr. James Lovell, intend to doff their silver spacesuits and continue the 14-day flight in regulation Air Force long johns. Long practiced by Russian cosmonauts, the so-called shirt-sleeve flight was not to become a part of the U.S. space program until the three-man Apollo spacecraft begin flying in 1967. Behind the change in plans is the absolute confidence that Geminis pressure hull will not expose the astronauts to the vacuum of space. If it did collide with a meteoroid or suffered explosive decompression for some other reason, the astronauts would pass out in less than a minute.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, November 2, 1965

title: Fatal Crash in the Bronx Unites Two Families in Grief
description: Two groups of children trick-or-treating with their older relatives on Saturday briefly crossed paths on a Bronx sidewalk. They were strangers to one another when an out-of-control car veered off the avenue and over the curb.

title: Patricia Canning Todd, 93, Dies; Tennis Champion Refused to Play on Side Court
description: Patricia Canning Todd, who won four Grand Slam tennis tournaments in 1947 and 1948 but lost the chance for another title when she refused to play on a side court at the 1948 French singles championships, died on Sept. 5 in Encinitas, Calif. She was 93.

title: Our Brand Is Crisis Finds Little Love at Box Office, Where The Martian Is No. 1
description: LOS ANGELES  Another one bites the dust: Our Brand Is Crisis collected a dismal $3.4 million at North American theaters over the weekend, extending a cold streak for Warner Bros. and exacerbating concerns in Hollywood about the recent failure of high-profile dramas, including Steve Jobs and The Walk, to find audiences.

title: A.C.C. Suspends Miami-Duke Officiating Crew for Allowing Final Play
description: It was one of the wildest finishes you will ever see. Using lateral after lateral, Miami managed a 97-yard kickoff return as time expired to beat Duke.

title: Willis Carto, Far-Right Figure and Holocaust Denier, Dies at 89
description: Willis Carto, a reclusive behind-the-scenes wizard of the far-right fringe of American politics who used lobbying and publishing to denigrate Jews and other minorities and galvanize the movement to deny the Holocaust, died last Monday at his home in Virginia. He was 89.

title: LeVeon Bell Carted Off After Injuring Knee in Steelers Loss
description: The Pittsburgh Steelers barely got a chance to welcome Ben Roethlisberger back from a knee injury before LeVeon Bell went down with what appeared to be a major injury to his right knee in a game against the Cincinnati Bengals. Bell was taken to the locker room on the back of a cart, and he did not return.

title: Fantastic Finishes, and a Domino Effect on the Rankings
description: Saturday would have seemed like a good day for a cocktail party if you were a college football fan, and not just because it included the actual Worlds Largest Outdoor Cocktail Party, the annual Florida-Georgia game, which the No. 11 Gators (7-1, 5-1 Southeastern Conference) dominated, 27-3.

title: For Royals Edinson Volquez, a Bittersweet Start in His Fathers Memory
description: As Edinson Volquez went from pitch to pitch, with the game on the line for every one of them, it was impossible to tell what was churning in his mind and his heart.

title: Jeb Bush Says He Was Unaware of Rubio PowerPoint Deck
description: In an interview that aired on Sunday, Jeb Bush said that he was unaware of a PowerPoint presentation his aides put together raising questions about his rival, Senator Marco Rubio, volunteered that hed kill for his father, and said he has questions about the use of the death penalty.

title: N.B.A. Game of the Week: Thunder at Rockets
description: Every week, The New York Times will choose one essential game to watch, highlighting hot teams, winning and losing streaks and statistical intrigue in the N.B.A.

title: Leo P. Kadanoff, Physicist Who Explored How Matter Changes, Dies at 78
description: Leo P. Kadanoff, a physicist who provided critical insights into the transformations of matter from one state to another, died on Oct. 26 in Chicago. He was 78.

title: In Fight to Save Young People, Brooklyn Doctor Treats Violence as a Public Health Issue
description: Dr. Robert Gore was stirred awake one morning in July by an urgent phone call from work. That was not unusual, given his job in the emergency department at Kings County Hospital Center in Brooklyn, a level-one trauma center that provides the highest level of care. Still, his years of skillful, coolheaded practice, of stopping bleeding and saving lives, had not prepared him for what he heard.

title: Lightweight Blankets With a Big Footprint at the Marathon
description: Sixty-five volunteers for New York Road Runners gathered early Sunday on the west side of Central Park to tackle an unusual job: stripping 52,000 metalized blankets from industrial-size rolls several hours before the start of the New York City Marathon.

title: Getting to the Start on Time: The Race Before the Race
description: For hundreds of New York City Marathon runners, the first line they encounter on the day of the race is along the orange rails on the outer deck of the Staten Island Ferry, where they jostle for space to photograph the Statue of Liberty, illuminated in an otherwise dark, predawn sky.

title: Adulation Aplenty as American Pharoah Heads for the Stud Farm
description: LEXINGTON, Ky.  A perky American Pharoah greeted visitors at Barn 62 on Sunday morning, a day after he won the Breeders Cup Classic to punctuate a competitive career in which he won nine of 11 races and captured the first Triple Crown in 37 years. His trainer, Bob Baffert, led him out of the barn at around 10 as his jubilant owner, Ahmed Zayat, stood guard.

title: In Pro Sports, the Fan Becomes Part of the Action
description: When Jeff Vinik bought the Tampa Bay Lightning in 2010, he wanted to connect with his new community. Born in New Jersey, he had lived most of his adult life in Massachusetts, not Florida, and as an owner, Mr. Vinik said he believed that helping the local community was not just the right thing to do but would also be helpful to his team.

title: Retiree Giving Becomes a Force of Philanthropy
description: When Carol Nash retired four years ago from Dimensions Healthcare System in Maryland after a long career in nursing, she had no inkling that she would soon be working harder than she ever did before.

title: Spotting a Thief in a Room Full of Masks at Sleep No More
description: They arrived at their appointed time, about 8 p.m. on Monday, and showed their tickets to the doorman.

title: In Bid to Counter Iran, Ayatollah in Iraq May End Up Emulating It
description: NAJAF, Iraq  In the struggle to transform Iraq from a dictatorship to a democracy after the American-led invasion in 2003, Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani, the highest spiritual authority for many of the worlds Shiite Muslims, stood out as a singular champion of the effort to hold direct elections and ensure that politicians, and not clerics, rule the country.

title: Patrick Modiano, an Author of Paris Mysteries, Keeps His Own
description: PARIS  Its often said that Patrick Modiano, who won last years Nobel Prize in Literature, keeps writing the same book. That is partly true, but only in the way that Czanne kept painting the same apples. Most of this novelists 30-odd atmospheric books, set in the murky waters and demimonde of occupied or newly liberated Paris, resemble and build on the others, yet each is completely distinct.

title: Q. and A.: Chan Koonchung on Imagining a Non-Communist China
description: Read in Chinese |

title: Zanzibar Bombings May Be Related to a Disputed Election
description: ARUSHA, Tanzania  A string of small bombings on the island of Zanzibar has residents there fearing that the explosions could be related to last months disputed election and that more trouble could be coming.

title: Your Asia Briefing: Turkeys Election, Russian Plane Crash, Asian Leaders
description: Good morning, Asia.

title: In Lee Mingweis Sonic Blossom at the Met, Schubert Is Intimate Installation Art
description: Ahead to the left on Friday morning was Yvonne Jacquettes painting Little River Farm; to the right, Chuck Closes Lucas I, a portrait of the artist Lucas Samaras. Straight ahead, some dozen yards away, a young soprano, Beibei Guan, having politely inquired, May I offer you the gift of a song? and seated me in the lone chair, sang Schuberts Nacht und Trume (Night and Dreams) directly to me.

title: A Lonely End for South Koreans Who Cannot Afford to Live, or Die
description: SEOUL, South Korea  In a culture in which funerals are often lavish three-day affairs with hundreds of guests, the recent funeral for Song In-sik was modest at best. It had only one guest  an activist who volunteered to hold a ritual for a person he had never met.

title: Review: Lionel Popkins Ruth Doesnt Live Here Anymore
description: What do a leaf blower and the modern-dance pioneer Ruth St. Denis have in common? For starters, both featured prominently in Ruth Doesnt Live Here Anymore, a multimedia work by the Los Angeles choreographer Lionel Popkin performed at Abrons Arts Center in Manhattan on Friday.

title: Chucho Valds, the Pianist, Reflects on Irakere and His Career
description: Chucho Valds, the eminent Cuban pianist, bandleader and composer, carries himself with a sly balance of statesmanlike deliberation and youthful gusto. One day last month, not long before his 74th birthday, he folded his big frame onto a couch in a Midtown hotel and spoke animatedly about the last 40 years of musical exchange between the United States and Cuba  a dialogue that has largely defined his career, and one that he in turn has helped define.

title: Review: Andras Schiff Deconstructs Sonatas
description: Deep in the second movement of Beethovens last piano sonata theres a passage thats become known as the boogie-woogie variation. The music, written in the early 1820s, suddenly breaks into a syncopated, showy dance that seems to anticipate the ragtime that would come almost a century later. A swinging riff repeats again and again, punctuated each time by two bold chords.

title: Review: Black Work, a Mystery and Drama with Sheridan Smith
description: Sheridan Smith is one of the busiest and most popular actresses in Britain, but very little of her work has made it to the United States. She won a Bafta award for playing a famous criminals wife (in Mrs. Biggs) and was nominated for another for playing a famous singer (Cilla). If shes known here at all, though, its for one role  Rudi, the foul-mouthed, fiercely loyal younger sister of James Cordens Smithy in Gavin & Stacey.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Nov. 2
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: The Diplomat, a Sons Documentary on Richard C. Holbrooke
description: In January 2011, seated alongside presidents and dignitaries at the Kennedy Center memorial service for Richard C. Holbrooke, his son David finally came to see his father as a historical figure.

title: Review: Pacific Is Simon Winchesters Latest Big-Picture Book
description: In the prologue to Pacific: Silicon Chips and Surfboards, Coral Reefs and Atom Bombs, Brutal Dictators, Fading Empires, and the Coming Collision of the Worlds Superpowers, Simon Winchester does such a virtuoso job of conveying the roiling enormity of his subject that readers may feel a kind of existential terror, wondering whether the vacant sky or the open sea will swallow them first.

description: One of the spookiest events this Halloween weekend may have been the dance concert presented by the Construction Company at University Settlement. There were no vampires or zombies, yet on Friday there was more than a suggestion of communication with the spirit world.

title: Review: In Piotr Beczalas Recital, Melancholy Mixes With Defiance
description: The Polish tenor Piotr Beczala has developed an ardent fan base in recent years. That much was evident from the adoring capacity crowd that turned out for his recital debut at Zankel Hall on Friday with the pianist Martin Katz. The program of songs by Schumann, Rachmaninoff, Dvorak and the fin-de-sicle Polish composer Mieczyslaw Karlowicz beautifully showcased his rich, virile voice, with its appealingly dark undertow.

title: Washington State Weighs Far-Reaching Law on Animal Trafficking

description: Temperatures were in the mid-50s on a cloudy morning for the start of the New York City Marathon, which was won by Stanley Biwott of the mens division and Mary Keitany of the womens.

title: Thousands Start Life Anew With Early Prison Releases
description: Michael Keatings 11-year prison sentence for methamphetamine production was supposed to end next June. But he is one of thousands of federal prisoners who are benefiting from a reduction in drug sentences, and on Friday he became an ex-prisoner more than seven months earlier than he ever had reason to expect.

title: BMG Expected to Announce Deal With the Pop Label S-Curve
description: BMG, the former record company that seven years ago started over with a new catalog and approach, has added again to its growing stable of projects with S-Curve, an independent pop label that scored a big hit this year with Andy Grammers Honey, Im Good.

If Cancer Becomes Bidens Cause, a Bold but Polarizing Doctor Is On Call
description: WASHINGTON  One day last winter, desperate as his son fought for his life against a killer brain cancer, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and his family reached out to one of Americas most famous, and controversial, doctors for help.

title: After Relenting to His Ace, Terry Collins Opens Door to More Scrutiny
description: In the eighth inning of Game 5 of the World Series, with the Mets facing elimination, Matt Harvey rushed over to Manager Terry Collins in the dugout, looking angry and shaking his head. Collins had tried removing Harvey from the game, in which he had held the Royals scoreless. The crowd was chanting Harveys name, urging Collins to keep him in.

title: John Kerry Is Cautious on Human Rights During Uzbekistan Visit
description: SAMARKAND, Uzbekistan  Secretary of State John Kerry prides himself on his willingness to deal directly with some of the worlds most repressive governments, and his insistence on engagement has yielded results this year from Iran to Cuba. But even the State Department had a hard time explaining the strategy for transforming the behavior of President Islam Karimov of Uzbekistan, a ruler whose human rights record is frequently compared to North Koreas.

title: San Francisco Ballots Turn Up Anger Over the Technical Divide
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Bruce Bennett is 52 and has a bum knee in need of surgery. But two Sundays ago he put on a knee brace and huffed his way up steep hills and dozens of stairs to implore residents to vote against a city measure called Proposition F.

title: Media Earnings, Yellens Testimony and the Jobs Report
description: Its another busy week for earnings reports in Europe as several of the regions biggest banks plan to report their third-quarter results, including the British lenders HSBC and Standard Chartered, the Swiss bank UBS and the French lenders Socit Gnrale and Crdit Agricole.

description: PARIS  The Airbus A321-200 had just reached a cruising altitude of about 33,000 feet when, around 20 minutes after taking off from the Egyptian resort town of Sharm el-Sheikh, it suddenly plummeted by some 6,000 feet.

description: A popular talking point before this postseason was guessing which pitcher would be the next Madison Bumgarner. The answer, of course, was nobody  his dominance last fall, in toppling the Kansas City Royals, was nearly unparalleled in the annals of autumn.

But Muslim, Arab and other religious and civil rights leaders who were invited to preview the program have raised strong objections, saying it focuses almost entirely on Islamic extremism, which they say has not been a factor in the epidemic of school shootings and attacks in the United States.

title: Gnter Schabowski, Whose Gaffe Helped Burst the Berlin Wall, Dies at 86

Whitney Mercilus accounted for three and a half of those sacks, a career high, and J. J. Watt had two and a half, forcing a fumble on one early in the fourth quarter. Watt, who tied a career high with nine quarterback hits, said, Thats the type of defense we expect to be.

Theyre never going to be good enough. But when we finally heard bits and pieces of Noah Solloways Descent on The Affair on Sunday night, it was hard to have much sympathy for the screenwriter (in this case the playwright Sharr White).

Her colleagues expect her to mind her own business. But when sinister secrets surface, as you know they inevitably will (like how her husband was spying on her and probably knew about the affair she was almost having), she sets out to uncover the killer. Matt Charman, a writer on Steven Spielbergs Bridge of Spies, created this three-part thriller, which stars Sheridan Smith. (Acorn TV) (Image: Ms. Smith and Matthew McNulty)

title: A Rooftop View of Insect Migration in a Warming Climate

In a study appearing in The Journal of Animal Ecology, museum researchers conclude that warming temperatures are affecting specialized insects that rely on a single food source. The nut weevil, for example, feeds only on hazelnuts; it appeared on the roof during the first half of the study but not the second. Scientists at the museum suspect that the nut weevil and other specialists are moving north, where the climate is cooler.

For the sake of enjoying a movie like Back to the Future, I may accept that time travel is possible even though I do not believe it. There seems no harm in that, and it does some good to the extent that it entertains and edifies me.

title: More Stand Your Ground Mischief in Florida

Senate committees approved legislation this month that would relieve defendants of the need to prove that they were in fear for their lives. Instead, prosecutors would be required to disprove the self-defense claim in a pretrial evidentiary hearing.

THE abandonment of the one-child policy in China is a momentous change, and there is much to celebrate in the easing of restrictions on human freedom in a particularly private sphere of life. But we need to recognize that the big fall in fertility in China over the decades, for which the one-child policy is often credited, has, in fact, been less related to compulsion and much more to reasoned family decisions in favor of a new norm of smaller families.

description: MOSCOW  In Russia, where monkey chants directed at black players and Nazi salutes by fans have been persistent problems at soccer matches, local organizers of the 2018 World Cup have created a job that sets their preparations apart from those of previous hosts: antiracism inspector.

title: Halsman, Jump on It
description: Any portrait photographer knows how hard it can be to get beyond a subjects facade, especially in a studio setting. Irving Penn famously positioned celebrities into a narrow corner. Yousuf Karsh sometimes left his subjects alone for a few minutes between exposures. Richard Avedon is said to have told the Duke and Duchess of Windsor a made-up story about a dog being run over by his taxi in order to move past the royal pretense and evoke a sympathetic expression (it worked).

title: Former Editor of Xinjiang Newspaper in China Is Ousted From Communist Party
description: BEIJING  The Communist Party has expelled the recent editor in chief of the official newspaper of the volatile western region of Xinjiang for openly discussing party policy and for corruption, according to an online announcement on Monday by the regional party anticorruption agency. The former editor is expected to face criminal prosecution on related charges.

title: Ad Helped Chris Christie Win a New Jersey Race, but Then He Had to Apologize
description: In his Williamstown, N.J., home, tucked away among family ephemera, Christopher Laureys keeps that rarest of New Jersey treasures: an apology from Chris Christie.

title: Winter Is Coming, by Garry Kasparov
description: Russians in positions of power tend to measure their countrys standing in the world against the United States, longing to be recognized as equally important and powerful and getting very angry when theyre not so treated. President Vladimir Putin has made victimhood at Americas hands a leitmotif of his reign, and many Russians have bought into his claim that Washington tirelessly seeks ways to weaken, impoverish and otherwise humiliate their country. Many critics of Putin, in Russia and in the West, similarly hold that Washingtons treatment of Russia after the collapse of the Soviet Union was disdainful and thus undermined embryonic moves toward democracy, contributing to the rise of Putinism.

title: The New Tsar: The Rise and Reign of Vladimir Putin, by Steven Lee Myers
description: Vladimir Putin has an origin story. It takes place in Dresden in the fall of 1989, in the dying days of East Germany, on the night that thousands of protesters stormed the citys Stasi headquarters. Once they were done ransacking the offices that had inspired so much terror, they directed their anger down the street toward the K.G.B. residence where Lieutenant Colonel Putin, a young intelligence officer, stood looking out the window. Watching the approaching mob, Putin called the local Soviet military command and asked for reinforcements. But no higher authority would approve it. Moscow is silent, he was told.

title: Michel Houellebecqs Submission
description: Before I begin this review, I have to make a small confession. I have never read Michel Houellebecqs books. This is odd, I concede, since Houellebecq is considered a great contemporary author, and one cannot be said to be keeping abreast of contemporary literature without reading his work. His books have been recommended to me ever since 1998, most often The Elementary Particles, by one friend in particular, who says the same thing every time I see him. You have to read The Elementary Particles, he tells me, its awesome, the best book Ive ever read. Several times Ive been on the verge of heeding his advice, plucking The Elementary Particles from its place on my shelf and considering it for a while, though always returning it unread. The resistance to starting a book by Houellebecq is too great. Im not entirely sure where it comes from, though I do have a suspicion, because the same thing goes for the films of Lars von Trier: When Antichrist came out I couldnt bring myself to see it, neither in the cinema nor at home on the DVD I eventually bought, which remains in its box unwatched. Theyre simply too good. What prevents me from reading Houellebecq and watching von Trier is a kind of envy  not that I begrudge them success, but by reading the books and watching the films I would be reminded of how excellent a work of art can be, and of how far beneath that level my own work is. Such a reminder, which can be crushing, is something I shield myself from by ignoring Houellebecqs books and von Triers films. That may sound strange, and yet it can hardly be unusual. If youre a carpenter, for instance, and you keep hearing about the amazing work of another carpenter, youre not necessarily going to seek it out, because what would be the good of having it confirmed that there is a level of excellence to which you may never aspire? Better to close your eyes and carry on with your own work, pretending the master carpenter doesnt exist.

description: To the tangle of emergency phone numbers in China  110 for the police, 119 for fire, 120 for ambulance  add another: dial 12339 to report a spy.

title: Know Your Risks, but Meat Still Isnt the Enemy
description: Smoking tobacco causes cancer. So does eating salted fish, drinking alcohol, breathing polluted air and being exposed to the sun. All of these things are classified as cancer-causing by the World Health Organization.

title: Mystery Deepens Over Russian Plane Crash in Egypt
description: MOSCOW  The mystery deepened Monday over the weekend crash of a Russian charter plane on the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt that killed all 224 aboard, with company executives ruling out technical or human error only to be upbraided by aviation officials who called such assertions premature.

title: After Rough Patch, Bush Begins His Jeb Can Fix It Tour
description: The much-discussed Jeb Bush campaign reset has come with an unsubtle name: the Jeb Can Fix It tour.

title: Mary Gaitskill and the Life Unseen
description: When the writer Mary Gaitskill was a child in the 1950s, she was once taken to a roller-skating rink. She looked around and burst into tears. She didnt understand why everybody was wearing the same thing, those poodle skirts and poodle hairdos.

title: Wireless Start-up Artemis Reaches Deal With Nokia
description: A little over a year ago, a start-up in San Francisco called Artemis Networks announced a new technology that it said could enable much faster Internet access speeds over wireless networks, which often slow dramatically when too many people use their smartphones in busy locations.

title: Visa to Buy Back Former Europe Unit for Up to $23.3 Billion
description: LONDON  Visa said on Monday that it had reached an agreement to pay as much as 21.2 billion euros, or about $23.3 billion, to acquire its former unit Visa Europe Ltd.

title: The Leftovers Season 2, Episode 5: Laughing With God
description: Sundays The Leftovers was the most compelling hour so far of season two, and thats a bold statement considering how outstanding the second season has been. No Room at the Inn  which, like season ones third episode, focused on the seemingly boundless bad luck that befalls Matt Jamison  was a pulse-pounder: intense, semi-violent, and surprising in scene after scene. It also continued to lock in on the themes of spirituality and faith that are central to The Leftovers, in ways overt (the conversation between John Murphy and Matt) and more subtle (the use of that Regina Spektor song that declares, Were all laughing with God).

title: Protecting Underage Models Becomes a Federal Issue
description: Paul D. Ryan, the new speaker of the House of Representatives, has another potential issue on his hands. For the first time since Brooke Shields donned her Calvins in the 80s, spurring a national conversation, the question of underage models has reached the white dome of the Capitol.

title: Heavy Fog Envelops Parts of Europe, Canceling Flights
description: LONDON  Dense fog caused scores of flights to be delayed or canceled early Monday across three of the worlds busiest aviation hubs  London, Amsterdam and Frankfurt  and shrouded London landmarks like St. Pauls Cathedral and the Houses of Parliament in a thick mist that was remarkable even by the capitals standards.

title: Ballys Museum of Historical Footwear
description: The familys collection includes a copy of the lunar boot worn by Neil Armstrong during his 1969 moon landing.

title: This Time Around, Royals Catcher Salvador Perez Goes Out as the M.V.P.
description: Moments after Salvador Perez was presented the World Series Most Valuable Player Award, he cradled the metallic trophy in his arms like a baby, put his head down and went jogging from the clubhouse tunnel back out to the field to find a woman he wanted to share in the moment.

title: Iran Begins Deactivating Centrifuges Under Nuclear Deals Terms
description: TEHRAN  Iran has started decommissioning the first of thousands of centrifuges used for enriching uranium as part of its commitments under the nuclear deal reached with global powers, the head of Irans nuclear energy program was quoted as saying on a visit to Japan on Monday.

title: Irish Drug Maker Shire Agrees to Buy Dyax in Deal Worth Up to $6.5 Billion
description: LONDON  The Irish drug maker Shire said on Monday that it had agreed to acquire the American biotechnology company Dyax Corporation in a deal that could be worth as much as $6.5 billion.

title: Peyton Manning of Old Shows Up, and the Broncos Stay Undefeated
description: The reports of Peyton Mannings demise may have been exaggerated.

title: A Quiet Swiss Towns Unlikely Treasure: Shoes
description: ONE OF THE MOST IMPORTANT collections of footwear in Europe  and arguably the world  is not housed in a grand museum in Rome or Paris but in a remote 18th-century manor high north of the Swiss Alps owned by Bally, the 164-year-old fashion and leather goods brand best known for its shoes. In a storybook town between Zurich and Basel is Zum Felsengarten, home to the Bally Shoe Museum in Schnenwerd. Inside, more than 1,000 pairs of footwear represent 3,000 years of history: French court heels from the 17th century, Venetian platforms from the 16th, Queen Elizabeth IIs gold coronation shoes.

title: How Donald Trump Leverages Americas Fault Lines
description: Anyone who has spent any time analyzing public opinion and voting data from the last 20 or so years has seen the fault lines that Donald Trump is leveraging. The data is clear: Anxiety about those who are different, support for traditional American values and a resistance toward openness all play a role in how people make up their minds in presidential elections.

title: When Free Speech Disappears From Campus
1890: Prince Bismarck as a Brewer
description: BERLIN  It is announced that Prince Bismarck, together with a syndicate of Hamburg financiers, will establish a large brewery at Friedrichsruhe, with a capital of 600,000 marks. The brewery will, it is estimated, produce about 25,000 hectoliters of beer yearly. The Hamburg Association will own the brewery for fifty years, paying the ex-Chancellor and his heirs during that time the sum of 3,000 marks for the rent, Prince Bismarck reserving the right for his heirs to buy up the concern at the termination of the fifty years. The promoters are confident that the export trade will be large, owing in a great measure to the Princes popularity abroad.  The New York Herald, European Edition, November 3, 1890

title: Daily Report: San Francisco Voters Have Their Say on Tech Boom
description: San Francisco is set to come face to face this week with an issue that has divided the city: the tech boom.

title: Party Victory in Turkey Bolsters Erdogans Pursuit of Power
description: ISTANBUL  With a stunning landslide victory for his party in Sundays parliamentary election, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey has revived his ambition to establish an executive system of government, with him at its head, only a few months after political analysts had pronounced that aim dead.

title: Nuremberg Nazi Site Crumbles, but Tricky Questions on Its Future Persist
description: NUREMBERG, Germany  In this city, the rallying point for Hitler, is the largest piece of real estate bequeathed by the Nazis, and a burden only increasing with time.

title: Chipotle Shuts Restaurants in Northwest After E. Coli Outbreak
description: The Chipotle chain voluntarily shut down 43 restaurants in Washington State and Oregon over the weekend after health authorities began investigating an E. coli outbreak.

title: Bird Eggs Are Fertilized by More Than One Sperm
description: Bird eggs are fertilized by more than one sperm, a process called polyspermy. Penetration by multiple sperm may be unusual in the animal kingdom, but it is somehow crucial to the development of the bird embryo, a new study finds.

title: Gaining Insight Into Some Itches
description: Some kinds of itching can be caused by the lightest of touches, a barely felt graze that rustles tiny hairs on the skins surface. This type of itch is created via a dedicated neural pathway, a new study suggests.

title: One Dead as Protesters and Police Clash in Nepal
description: KATHMANDU, Nepal  Protesters and the Nepalese police clashed near the border with India on Monday, in violence that left an Indian man dead and threatened to further complicate a political and economic crisis in Nepal.

title: Vatican Arrests 2 in Connection With Leaked Documents
description: ROME  The Vatican announced Monday that two members of a commission set up by Pope Francis to study financial operations at the Holy See had been arrested on suspicion of leaking confidential documents to journalists.

title: Reaction After Royals Win World Series
description: We never quit, said Salvador Perez, who won the Most Valuable Player award.

title: Before the Stump, Ben Carson Took the Stand as an Expert Witness
description: Fifteen years before the Baltimore police were accused of causing the death of Freddie Gray, the city was taken to court by another black man, one who had been paralyzed from the waist down after being tackled by an officer.

title: Liquidity Traps, Temporary and Permanent
description: Larry Summers reacts to an offhand post of mine, seeking to draw a distinction between our views. I actually dont think our views differ significantly now, but hes right that what he has been saying differs from the approach I took way back in 1998. And Ive both acknowledged that and admitted that the approach I took then seems inadequate now:

title: Erdogan Hails Turkey's Election Results
description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey spoke on Monday after his Justice and Development Party, or A.K.P., swept to an unexpected landslide victory on Sunday.

title: Flexible Illusions
description: Wolfgang Munchau declares that the euro was a mistake, and pinpoints a key illusion. Advocates

title: Talking Cure: A Psychiatrist Tries to Heal Mets Fans
description: To the Editor:

title: For Statins, Cholesterol Care May Be Just the Start
description: Shortly after my 60th birthday, my cholesterol level inexplicably began to rise despite daily exercise, a healthy weight and a diet low in saturated fats. I tried to bring it down by cutting cheese, eggs and most meat from my diet as well as taking a daily fiber supplement, fish oils and plant sterols. Yet at every three-month checkup, my total cholesterol  and especially artery-damaging LDL cholesterol  was higher than the one before.

title: Telemundo, With Its Republican Debate Put Off, Seeks a Democratic One
description: Within hours of the Republican National Committees decision on Friday to suspend a scheduled Feb. 26 debate hosted by NBC News and Telemundo, the Spanish-language station was on the phone with the Democratic National Committee, pushing for a greater role in the Democratic Partys early nominating process.

title: Rift Emerges Among Gun Owners Over Concealing Weapons in Schools
description: CLIO, Mich.  When Kenneth Herman visits his daughters school, the handgun holstered to his right hip is visible to anyone. And that has caused him problems.

title: ConAgra Sells Private-Label Business for $2.7 Billion
description: It took a few years, slumping sales and an activist investor for ConAgra to change its mind about the private-label business.

title: Official Rules Out Pilot Error in Crash
description: An official with Metrojet  whose plane crashed in the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt on Saturday, killing 224 people  ruled out any technical failure or human error on the part of the airline in the catastrophe.

title: 1940: Italians Bomb Crete
description: ROME  Italian planes have bombed and machine-gunned troops landing on the island of Crete, the high command said today [Nov. 2], and Italian troops were reported proceeding along the Kalamas (Thymais) River valley toward Janina, twenty-five miles within Greek territory. The attack on Crete, the high command said, had visible results, and some steamships were struck and docks and material were damaged. Informed quarters believed the troops landing to have been British.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, November 3, 1940

title: Fog Over Europe
description: A fog was so dense in parts of Europe that flights were delayed and even fog-hardened Britons took to social media to share images of the phenomenon.

title: Questions and Answers about Veteran Suicides
description: Since coming back from Afghanistan in 2008, the hard-hit Second Battalion, Seventh Marine Regiment has struggled to adjust. The battalion, known as the 2/7, lost 20 men in war. In the years since, it has lost 13 more to suicide. The battalion now has a suicide rate 14 times that for all Americans.

title: Bernard Sumner on Ian Curtis and His Joy Division Bandmates
description: Bernard Sumner, a founding member of Joy Division and later the frontman of New Order, has a memoir out this month, Chapter and Verse, in which the postpunk pioneer examines his rough early days in Manchester, the singer Ian Curtiss suicide and the hard partying that threatened to tear New Order apart. Heres what he has to say about his Joy Division bandmates:

title: The Creator of WorldStarHipHop Plots His Second Act
description: Editors Note: We published this story in 2015 on Lee ODenat, the founder of World Star Hip Hop, who died on Monday at age 43.

title: MoMA to Offer Timed Entrance Tickets for Picasso Sculpture
description: Anticipating what it believes will be a holiday bump for an already packed exhibition, the Museum of Modern Art will soon begin a timed-ticket program for Picasso Sculpture, its survey of more than 60 years of Picassos work in three dimensions.

title: HEB Grocery Chain to Give Stock to 55,000 Employees
description: As the plight of low-wage retail workers has gained national attention, HEB, a regional grocery chain and one of Texas largest private employers, is giving 55,000 employees an equity stake in the company.

title: The Rearrangement Puzzle
description: Thisweeks puzzle is an original suggested by Daniel Finkel of the Seattle-based Math for Love. Dr. Finkel has brought us some frightening challengesbefore, but this one seemed a fitting aftershock to Halloween weekend. Lets try

title: To Prevent Malaria in Humans, Scientists Try Protecting Pigs
description: For years , scientists have known of a sneaky way to kill mosquitoes: Give humans a deworming pill.

title: Northern Ireland Assemblys Vote to Approve Same-Sex Marriage Is Blocked
description: DUBLIN  A majority of members of the Northern Ireland Assembly voted on Monday to legalize same-sex marriage in the British-ruled region, but the majority Democratic Unionist Party immediately invoked a parliamentary maneuver to veto the measure.

title: Inside a Gangsters Sprawling Estate

description: Five leaders in creative fields share their favorite places to eat, drink, shop and play.

title: A Gangsters Paradise With Views, Thick Walls and a Slaughter Room
description: FORT LEE, N.J.  Mafia blood has stained many corners of this metropolis. Five Points. The Red Hook docks. The Meadowlands. Harlem. The South Shore of Staten Island.

title: The Changing Face of J. Mae Barizos Kitchen
description: J. Mae Barizos apartment is filled with the scent of roasted sugar. When Im writing, cooking is my favorite procrastination technique, said Ms. Barizo, a poet whose debut collection, The Cumulus Effect, was published last month.

title: A New Star Trek TV Series Will Debut in 2017
description: Star Trek, that venerable outer-space adventure, is boldly going where its been before, but hasnt been seen in more than a decade: back to television. The science-fiction program that chronicled the voyages of the Starship Enterprise and its intrepid crew will return to TV in 2017, CBS said on Monday, in a new series that will be introduced on the network but will be shown primarily on its digital subscription video service.

title: Pandora to Stream Serial Podcast
description: When Serial, the blockbuster podcast, returns for its second season later this year, it will have a powerful new online outlet: Pandora.

title: Letter from G.O.P Presidential Campaigns to Networks About Debates
description: A letter from the campaigns of the Republican presidential candidates makes a series of demands of television networks wanting to host debates.

title: BlackBerry Unveils an Android-Powered Phone With Security Features
description: OTTAWA

title: New York Times Co. to Name Deputy Publisher Within Two Years
description: The publisher of The New York Times, Arthur Sulzberger Jr., said on Monday that the company intended to name a deputy publisher, a role that has traditionally been a steppingstone to succeeding the publisher, within two years.

title: CBS Plans a Streaming Star Trek Series
description: CBS announced on Monday that it had ordered up a reboot for Star Trek, but its one that wont start for another 14 months and it comes with a surprising twist. Though Star Trek will premiere on CBS in January 2017, all subsequent episodes will be shown elsewhere: its digital app, CBS All Access.

title: China Unveils First Passenger Jet
description: China presented its first domestically produced large passenger jet on Monday, the C919, which is meant to compete with planes like the Airbus A320 and the Boeing 737.

title: Bette Midler and Michael Kors Help Celebrate Hulaween
description: The New York Restoration Project holds its annual benefit at the Waldorf Astoria.

title: Bette Midler and Michael Kors Help Celebrate Hulaween
description: The New York Restoration Project holds its annual benefit at the Waldorf Astoria.

title: Bien Cuit Offers a Seasonal Danish
description: A new seasonal pastry in Zachary Golpers line of Danish (or what the French call viennoiserie) at Bien Cuit has a suave center of yam seasoned with maple. I could see serving this treasure, warmed, with a scoop of vanilla ice cream alongside, one per person, as dessert at Thanksgiving dinner. It joins the raisin and apple varieties the bakery has been selling. And starting Wednesday, the pastries will also be available at 32 Whole Foods markets in the Northeast: Danish, $2 each, Bien Cuit, 120 Smith Street (Dean Street), Cobble Hill, Brooklyn, 718-852-0200, biencuit.com.

title: French Mayor Who Once Defended Journalists Now Denounces Immigrants
description: BZIERS, France  In a past life he was Frances leading advocate for journalists, fighting to spring them from dictators worldwide, a fearless defender of freedom of the press on four continents and a hero to free-speech advocates.

title: When to Put the Defendant on the Witness Stand
description: It is perhaps the most difficult question a defense lawyer and client have to answer in a criminal trial: Should the defendant testify?

title: E.P.A. Finds More VW Cheating Software, Including in a Porsche
description: The Environmental Protection Agency said on Monday that it had discovered emissions-cheating software on more Volkswagen and Audi cars than previously disclosed and, for the first time, also found the illegal software in one of the carmakers high-end Porsche models.

title: Omaha Zoos Three-Legged Tiger Bites Woman Who Tried to Pet It
description: Just in case you had any doubt, if you pet a tiger you will most likely get bitten.

title: What We Know and Dont Know About the Russian Plane Crash
description: A Russian flight crashed in the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt on Oct. 31, killing all 224 people on board. Officials are investigating what might have caused an explosion that brought down the plane.

description: This season, designers give the style a more rugged, masculine feel.

description: Lawrence Lessig, the Harvard professor who began a late campaign for president, announced that he was ending his bid for the Democratic nomination, citing his exclusion from the debate stage.

title: Off Broadway, Women Lag in Design Jobs
description: It is well known in the theater world that female playwrights are rarely produced on Broadway, and that female directors are doing only slightly better.

title: Sinai Plane Crash Threatens a Bright Spot for Egyptian Tourism
description: CAIRO  The Egyptian government has long promoted the glittering resort of Sharm el Sheikh as both the crown jewel of its tourist industry and a redoubt of security against jihadist violence.

title: Kenneth Griffin Looks Back on Citadels 25 Years
description: Twenty-five years ago, Kenneth C. Griffin got a break when, as a newly minted Harvard graduate, he drew backers to start a small investment firm in Chicago.

title: Chipotle Warning After E. Coli Outbreak
description: A Seattle public health officer said some people had been hospitalized after eating at local Chipotle restaurants.

title: A New Slogan for Jeb Bush
description: Mr. Bush unveiled a new slogan, "Jeb Can Fix It," in an effort to revitalize his campaign for the Republican presidential nomination after a poor debate performance in Colorado last week.

title: Erdogans Formula for Consolidating Clout in Turkey
description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey moved a step closer Sunday to realizing his ambition of establishing a strong presidential system of government, with him at its head, when his Justice and Development Party, or A.K.P., earned a decisive electoral victory.

title: Lawrence Lessig Quits Race
description: Lawrence Lessig, a Harvard professor, ended his campaign for the Democratic presidential nomination, despite being able to raise $1 million before Labor Day.

title: Bookstores in France Dodge a Bullet in Trade Talks
description: STE, France  Frances nearly 3,000 independent bookstores  welcoming places for literary encounters, casual browsing and helpful staff  have withstood all manner of competition, including big chain stores and digital publishing.

title: Mumbais Lavish New Palace of Jewels
description: The Gem Palace, the famous ninth-generation purveyor of exquisite Mughal-inspired jewelry, is opening a lavish new shop this month in Mumbai  its first that can be visited without an appointment. The interiors by the Dutch-born, Jaipur-based designer Marie-Anne Oudejans recall traditional Rajasthan colonial dcor: checkerboard marble floors, emerald walls, salmon silk sofas. Upstairs, a private salon and showroom boasts backlit carved panels painted with elaborate floral motifs  and a canopied bed for when the burden of choice takes its toll.

title: Live and Kicking: Soccer Games to Watch This Week
description: Its a busy week, starting with Harry Kane in London on Monday afternoon and ending with Major League Soccer in four cities on Sunday. Plenty of good stuff in between, too.

title: Whos Involved in the Metrojet Crash Investigation
description: Investigators from Egypt, Russia and Western Europe have descended on the Sinai Peninsula, hoping to find evidence that would explain why a commercial flight carrying 224 people crashed on Saturday, leaving no survivors.

title: Should Same-Sex Couples Receive Fertility Benefits?
description: We want to start a family, says Sarah Soller-Mihlek, a Brooklyn guitar instructor, speaking into a camera. Weve always dreamed of becoming parents, adds her wife, Jill.

title: Marriage May Bolster Recovery From Surgery
description: Being married may improve the odds of a good recovery after surgery, according to a new report.

description: The sleek military transport vessel inched up to the edge of the marshland and flipped down its front gate, as if to discharge troops.

description: From the archives

title: Works Sighted: Helping For-Profit Colleges Sell Themselves
description: Michael Fitzgerald has an unusual perspective on for-profit colleges: In the summer of 2008, he was hired to call admissions offices at colleges owned by a company he calls Big School, pretend to be an applicant, and then make sure the admissions officers sales techniques were both persuasive and legal.At Pacific Standard, he uses that summer as a jumping-off point to discuss student debt  including his own.

title: Death Rates Rising for Middle-Aged White Americans, Study Finds
description: Something startling is happening to middle-aged white Americans. Unlike every other age group, unlike every other racial and ethnic group, unlike their counterparts in other rich countries, death rates in this group have been rising, not falling.

title: The Dutch Polders by Bike and Schooner
description: North Holland and Friesland Bike and Sail Adventure, departing in 2016, introduces a new destination and mode of transportation from VBT Bicycling and Walking Vacations. Highlights of the seven-night trip include nearly daily cycling through Dutch polders (land reclaimed from the sea), exploring traditional fishing villages, walking along some of Europes widest beaches on the island of Terschelling and an introduction to the Frisian language, similar to but separate from Dutch.

title: Shire Turns Focus to an Easier Deal for Dyax
description: The Dyax Corporation has proved easier prey for Shire than Baxalta, but its far from cheap.

title: Start Listening to Burnish Your Reputation as a Trusted Adviser
description: You know whats crazy? The key to getting people to think youre smart is to stop talking and to start listening. Let me share a little story to demonstrate.

title: Unrest in Nepal
description: The police in Birgunj, Nepal, a town near India, fired on demonstrators belonging to the ethnic Madhesi population who have been protesting against a recently passed Constitution.

description: The biennial dedicated to live performance kicked off with a private dinner and show with Francesco Vezzoli and David Hallberg.

description: HARTFORD  Now this is what you call a room with a view.

description: The biennial arts festival dedicated to live performance kicked off with a private dinner and show with Francesco Vezzoli and David Hallberg.

title: Paul Allens Philanthropy Mirrors His Passions and Business Approach
description: Andrew Carnegie didnt give money away like this. But then, Carnegie didnt play a Stratocaster guitar.

title: More Than Half of Entire Species of Saigas Gone in Mysterious Die-Off
description: A mysterious die-off of endangered antelopes last spring in Central Asia was even more extensive than originally thought, killing more than half of the entire species in less than a month, scientists have found.

title: New York City Marathon Winners Celebrate
description: The four winners of the New York City Marathon  Stanley Biwott, Mary Keitany, Tatyana McFadden and Ernst van Dyk  discussed their victories while visiting the top of One World Trade Center.

title: ISIS Is Said to Have Killed 2 Activists in Turkey
description: Two Syrian activists who used video and social media to expose human rights abuses committed by the Islamic State were tracked down by jihadists and killed in their home in a southern Turkish city, according to their colleagues.

title: An Artful Rebound From the Mets Big Loss
description: Driven out of the park, rebounded off a kneecap or ricocheted from a shattered bat into the stands  there are lots of ways to lose a ball, as evidenced by the last game of the 111th World Series on Sunday. On average, the series requires about 500 baseballs, all assembled by hand in much the same way they were a century ago: Each cork and rubber center is wrapped in yarn, encased in white cowhide and stitched together with waxed red thread. The same details inspire the Brooklyn-born and Mets-raised artist Elissa Goldstones work, which pays tribute to the days of knee-highs and chewing tobacco with highlight-reel scenes embroidered in bright, erratic lines; cotton sculptures of the four bases; and paper drawings done in familiar red double-stitch. For Goldstone, appreciating the minutiae of the game is the best way to cope with the inevitable heartbreak of being a baseball fan.

title: 1852: Abraham Lincolns Other Party
description: The Republican Party is famously the party of Lincoln (the phrase has turned up in The Times six times since Aug. 1). But Lincoln actually spent a majority of his political career in another party  the Whigs, who were born in opposition to Andrew Jackson and his Democrats.

title: Marc Benioff, Salesforce Chief, on the Strategic Benefits of Corporate Giving
description: Marc Benioff founded Salesforce.com, one of the first and most successful cloud computing software companies, in 1999. The stock has gained over 1,800 percent since the company went public in 2004, making Mr. Benioff, a onetime Oracle executive, a billionaire.

title: Spanish Companys Moves in Ireland Hit Tax and Political Hot Buttons
description: MADRID  One part of the move had been long in the works by Grifols, a big Spanish medical company. The other came as a politically fraught surprise.

title: My Head Talks
description: Ive done very little TV lately; I will, however, be on Chris Hayes tonight at 8.

title: Supreme Court to Decide if Georgia Went Too Far in Excluding Black Jurors
description: WASHINGTON  We have an arsenal of smoking guns, a lawyer for a death row inmate told the Supreme Court on Monday.

title: The Scare Tactics of Turkeys President Erdogan Pay Off
description: Defying predictions, President Recep Tayyip Erdogans Justice and Development Party, the A.K.P., won a conclusive victory in Sundays national elections in Turkey, freeing it from the need to form a coalition to stay in power. Mr. Erdogan proclaimed it a vote in favor of stability, and that is what it apparently was  though it was Mr. Erdogan who churned up much of the turmoil that frightened voters back into his camp.

title: Gay Issues Enter the World of Philanthropy
description: When a donor made a $100,000 gift to the Girl Scouts Western Washington Council last March, it was time to break out the hand-shaped clappers.

title: Pictures of the Day: Greece and Elsewhere
description: Greece and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Nov. 2, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Greece, Egypt, Israel and Britain.

title: Putin Calls for Objective Investigation
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia asked investigators to work with Egyptian and other authorities in determining what caused the plane crash on the Sinai Peninsula that killed 224 people.

title: Special Delivery
description: Starship Technologies, an Estonian start-up, wants its robot to solve the last mile problem  getting goods like groceries, drug store items and most small packages to suburban homes.

title: Skype Founders Build a Robot for Suburban Streets
description: Menlo Park, Calif.  Almost half a century ago, the first autonomous robot project, dubbed Shakey, was started here at a laboratory that is now called SRI International. Shakey was the first machine used to pursue a range of artificial intelligence technologies such as planning, navigation, machine vision and even speech recognition. Funded by the Pentagon, it was originally modeled on the idea of an autonomous sentry for a military base.

title: Review: Fortuna Desperata, in Which David Hallberg Explores the Beginnings of Ballet
description: It hasnt really been forever, though it feels that way. David Hallberg, a principal dancer at American Ballet Theater and the Bolshoi Ballet, has been missing in action since 2014, after an ankle injury forced him to cancel performances at both companies.

title: When Adele Says Hello, Fans Listen
description: The numbers are in for Adeles Hello, her first single in three years, and they are stunning.
