description: Astronauts reflect on 15 years of humans inhabiting the International Space Station.

title: Intimate Snapshots of Madonna, Warhol and More
description: Paige Powell, Interview magazines former associate publisher and the ex-girlfriend of Jean-Michel Basquiat, shares photos from her personal archive.

title: In Performance | 'Sylvia'
description: Annaleigh Ashford plays a stray dog with Matthew Broderick as her new owner in A.R. Gurneys comedy "Sylvia," which ran on Broadway in 2015.

title: Never-Before-Seen Photos of Madonna, Warhol, Basquiat and More
description: Some It-girls of the 80s may regret that their youthful glory predated social media, but Interview magazines former associate publisher Paige Powell doesnt have to. Powell arrived in New York in 1980 from the Pacific Northwest, looking like a granola version of Edie Sedgwick and armed with the work ethic of Mary Tyler Moore. She was soon swept up in Interviews bid to be a more serious publication  At first it was more for friends, like, Fran Lebowitz drove the delivery truck to drop off issues at different newsstands, she remembers  and Andy Warhols select social whirlwind of downtown clubbing, midtown shopping and uptown lunches. Andy always said, Work is fun and fun is work, Powell says. It was just the way I thought New York City was, all the time, for everyone  exuberant.

title: In Performance: Matthew Broderick and Annaleigh Ashford of Sylvia
description: The latest In Performance video features the Tony Award-winning actors Matthew Broderick and Annaleigh Ashford in a scene from A. R. Gurneys comedy Sylvia, which opened last week on Broadway at the Cort Theater. In the play, Greg (Mr. Broderick), hoping to curtail a downer of a midlife crisis, takes home a dog (Ms. Ashford) he finds wandering around Central Park one day. An unconventional love triangle  among Greg, his wife (played by Julie White) and the dog,named Sylvia  ensues.

title: WeWork Said to Seek $750 Million Credit Facility
description: WeWork, which rents out offices and desks to freelancers and budding companies, has been on a fund-raising tear.

title: Review: A Midsummer Nights Dream in Isango Ensembles South African Setting
description: Benjamin Britten fussed over the details of his operas, working hard to get every vocal line, pungent chord and instrumental color exactly as he wanted. What might he have thought of the very freely adapted production of his 1960 opera, A Midsummer Nights Dream, by the South African company Isango Ensemble, which opened on Friday at the New Victory Theater?

title: Support Houstons Equal Rights Ordinance
description: On Tuesday, Houston voters will be asked if they want to keep or repeal the citys strong and enlightened equal rights ordinance, which was approved by the City Council last year and put on hold pending this weeks vote. Opponents of the law have perversely turned a broad, sensible measure  that protects people from discrimination in employment, city services, housing and public accommodations, among other things, into a debate about sexual predators in womens restrooms.

title: Review: Theodora, Once a Handel Flop, Is Celebrated Anew
description: A long line of people waited outside Alice Tully Hall on Saturday evening, hoping to get returned tickets for a performance of Handels Theodora. Handel would have felt vindicated. The 1750 premiere in London of this dramatic oratorio, a score of more than three hours, was a major flop for that celebrated composer. But of Handels 17 English oratorios, this was his favorite.

title: Husband Charged in Wifes 2009 Killing on Upper West Side
description: On the last morning of 2009, a 9-year-old girl went into a bathroom in her family apartment on the Upper West Side of Manhattan and found her mother lying lifeless in the tub. At first, it looked to investigators as if it might have been an accident  Shele Danishefsky Covlin, a 47-year-old finance executive, had died after a hard fall, they thought.

title: Your Morning Briefing: Egypt, Vatican, Nepal
description: Good morning, Asia.

title: Judge Rules Bill Cosby Can Be Deposed in Janice Dickinson Case
description: Bill Cosby and his former lawyer can be questioned under oath in a defamation lawsuit filed against Mr. Cosby by the onetime supermodel Janice Dickinson, a judge ruled on Monday.

title: Review: In John Irvings Avenue of Mysteries, a Blur of Aphorisms and Magical Events
description: Juan Diego Guerrero, the hero of John Irvings 14th novel, Avenue of Mysteries, is a middle-aged Mexican-American novelist who, when he travels, carries two types of prescription pills in his Dopp kit.

title: The Winemaker of Avenue C
description: Matt Baldassano, 35, works in tech and lives in Alphabet City. So when you hear that he makes wine in his apartment, you may want to roll your eyes.

title: A Hawaiian Canoe Crosses the Oceans, Guided by Sun and Stars
description: Its likely to cause a few double takes, even among seen-it-all New Yorkers.

title: As Republicans Outline Debate Demands, Donald Trump Plans to Go It Alone
description: On Monday morning, the Republican presidential campaigns circulated a detailed letter they plan to send to the television networks, outlining their demands and questions before agreeing to any future debates  everything from the temperature in the debate hall (below 67 degrees) to no lightning round.

title: Justices Hear Debate on Suing Companies for Seemingly Harmless Falsehoods
description: WASHINGTON  A case about false information on the Internet gave rise to a vivid and occasionally personal argument on Monday at the Supreme Court.

title: Halloween Week Scares Away Broadway Audiences
description: Broadway loves a good costume drama. But Halloween, not so much.

title: AmSurg Withdraws $7.6 Billion Takeover Offer for TeamHealth
description: Early Monday morning, AmSurg Corporation gave TeamHealth Holdings an ultimatum: Accept our $7.6 billion takeover proposal by 4 p.m. on Tuesday or we withdraw.

title: Serial Gems Are Painstakingly Restored for the Screen
description: Master villains and mysterious avengers stalked the serial films that gripped audiences in cinemas silent years. But in the thick of World War I, another twist on these shadowy figures appeared in the Kaisers Germany in 1916. Its hero was the Homunculus, and he was, in the impassioned words of the films title cards, a lab-created superhuman not conceived by love but through science.

title: Obamas Support for Former Prisoners
description: President Obama announced a series of small initiatives to help former inmates find jobs and live in subsidized housing, part of his broader effort to remake the criminal justice system.

title: Royals Entered With a Bitter Memory; the Mets Left With One
description: David Glass, the owner of the Kansas City Royals, stood outside the teams crazy clubhouse Sunday night, savoring the pandemonium and drying off after the Champagne showers from players celebrating their World Series championship.

title: Review: Death of a Salesman in Yiddish
Under Pressure to Stand Out, Jeb Bush Tries for Reset
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Jeb Bush has played the wide-eyed optimist, anointing himself the joyful tortoise in a campaign season low on joy and reptiles.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing: Kansas City Royals, Egypt, Republican Party
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Jets Explore Quarterback Options After Injuries to Ryan Fitzpatrick and Geno Smith
description: With Ryan Fitzpatrick having sustained ligament damage to his nonthrowing hand and his backup Geno Smith having bruised his nonthrowing shoulder, Jets Coach Todd Bowles suggested that the teams quarterback for Sundays game against the Jacksonville Jaguars might not yet be on the roster.

title: Suzanne Farrell and Kyra Nichols Carry On Balanchines Spirit
description: WASHINGTON  Since the death of the choreographer George Balanchine (1904-83), his legacy has both receded and grown. The last of Balanchines own dancers have retired. Certain aspects of Balanchine technique have lost their gleaming edge (as he himself often predicted). Yet theres been a vast posthumous Balanchine surge. Ive seen more than 60 of his ballets in the last 10 years; Balanchine Without Balanchine is a growth industry.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Stylish Headphones, Vintage Caps, Matchy-Matchy Prints
description: A sleek way to listen; repurposed baseball hats; a collaboration from Rag & Bone and Liberty; and more.

title: Jury Selection Begins in Sheldon Silver Corruption Trial
description: Assemblyman Sheldon Silver got his first good look on Monday at the prospective jurors who will hear his case and decide his fate. He did not seem to know or recognize any of them, yet many were already familiar with him.

title: African Biennale of Photography Returns to Mali Amid Unrest
description: BAMAKO, Mali  Faceless health workers in biohazard suits representing the fear of Ebola. Preachers with black spheres for heads showing the dark effects of religious obscurantism. Images conjuring a political leaders life had he not been assassinated.

title: Letter From the Office for Civil Rights
description: The letter told Township High School District 211 in Illinois that requiring a transgender student to use private changing and showering facilities was a violation of that students rights under Title IX.

title: Review: At the Amplify 2015 Festival, a Set Grounded in an Intense Investment
description: Underneath all music is a nebulous and hard-to-measure quality that might be called intention. Its the extent to which musicians imply that they have something to do and they are going to do it.

title: Fast and Free In-Flight Wi-Fi Is Uncharted Territory for Airlines
description: As broadband Internet service becomes increasingly widespread and free in public places, it has remained, to travelers annoyance, stuck in the slow lane on airplanes.

title: A Sons Illness and a Mothers Aspirations
description: Five pills in the morning. Five pills at night. And 15 pills in the afternoon.

title: Avoiding Taxes, Legally, Offshore
description: A new book looks at the baroque  and sometimes absurd  world of offshore tax havens.

title: Head of Italian Soccer Insists He Is Not Homophobic or Anti-Semitic Despite Recorded Comments
description: Despite the release of recorded comments in which he said he preferred to avoid Jews and homosexuals, the president of the Italian Soccer Federation, Carlo Tavecchio, insisted on Monday that he was neither anti-Semitic nor homophobic.

title: Families and ExpertsBegin to Identify Sinai Plane Crash Victims in St. Petersburg
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia  The people of St. Petersburg on Monday set about the grimmest task in an airplane catastrophe: identifying the dead.

title: New U.S.-Backed Alliance to Counter ISIS in Syria Falters
description: EIN EISSA, Syria  Weeks after the Obama administration canceled a failed Pentagon program to train and arm Syrian rebels to combat the Islamic State, American officials announced a new effort to equip ground forces in Syria to fight the jihadists.

title: Illinois District Violated Transgender Students Rights, U.S. Says
description: CHICAGO  Federal education authorities, staking out their firmest position yet on an increasingly contentious issue, found Monday that an Illinois school district violated anti-discrimination laws when it did not allow a transgender student who identifies as a girl and participates on a girls sports team to change and shower in the girls locker room without restrictions.

title: Mayor de Blasios Thoughts on the Joys and Pains of Baseball, Outsourced to an Aide
description: It was an unusually personal string of messages from New York Citys most powerful baseball buff, a meditation via Twitter on faith, fandom, and the joys and pains of the playoffs.

title: Unofficially 49,467th, but First Among the New York City Marathons Almost Crew
description: The finish line for the New York City Marathon, so orderly and secure throughout the morning and afternoon, resembled a carcass by Sunday evening as workers began to strip away its decorative features. A red truck slowly backed over the line, and employees hopped out to disassemble signs.

title: Yemen: Powerful Storm Strikes Island
description: A powerful cyclone struck an island off the coast of Yemen on Monday, washing away the islands main seaport and displacing more than 2,000 families, according to Saeed Bahegeba, the governor of the island, Socotra. The storm, known as Chapala, then threatened the Yemeni mainland. By Monday evening, the cyclone was bearing down on Al Mukalla, the countrys fifth-largest city, which has been under the control of the Al Qaeda affiliate in Yemen since April.

title: Speaker Paul Ryan Moves Fast to Detoxify Boehners Smoky Suite
description: WASHINGTON  There are many things Americans cannot yet know about Speaker Paul D. Ryans plans for his fancy new digs on Capitol Hill. Dark curtains or sheers? Memorabilia from the 2012 presidential campaign or his first House race in 1998? Will he hang a poster of his favorite band, Rage Against the Machine?

title: Soros Takes Back $490 Million From Bill Gross at Janus Capital
description: The billionaire hedge fund investor George Soros has withdrawn $490 million from a new investment fund set up by William H. Gross, according to investment filings.

title: World Series Television Ratings Up Over Comparable Games From Last Year
description: The Kansas City Royals victory over the Mets on Sunday night in the fifth and deciding game of the World Series was seen by an average of 17.2 million viewers on Fox, nearly 37 percent better than the average for Game 5 of last years Series, between the Royals and the San Francisco Giants.

title: Ben Carson Leads Donald Trump in New NBC Poll
description: For the second time in a week, Ben Carson took the lead in a national poll, drawing 29 percent support in an NBC/Wall Street Journal survey released on Monday evening and eclipsing Donald J. Trump, who had 23 percent.

title: Russia: Librarian Is Accused of Allowing Access to Banned Ukrainian Books
description: The director of a Ukrainian-language library in Moscow was placed under house arrest on Monday by a Russian court that accused her of allowing public access to banned literature. The director, Natalia Sharina, could face as much as five years in prison for what Russian law enforcement agencies said was the dissemination of books by a Ukrainian nationalist writer, Dmytro Korchynsky, that are banned in Russia for promoting anti-Russian propaganda. Ms. Sharina denied the charges, saying the banned books were planted during the searches, a claim that was repeated by staff members. Books cannot constitute extremism, because in my opinion extremism is an action, she said in the courtroom, the Kommersant newspaper reported. Ms. Sharinas lawyers have appealed the decision, the Interfax news agency said, and Human Rights Watch called for her immediate release in a statement.

title: New York City F.C. Fires Coach Jason Kreis
description: New York City F.C. fired Coach Jason Kreis on Monday, laying the blame for a forgettable inaugural season in Major League Soccer on him and his staff.

title: Entergy to Close Nuclear Plant on Lake Ontario, Angering Cuomo
description: The Entergy Corporation said on Monday that it had decided to close a 40-year-old nuclear power plant on the shore of Lake Ontario, disappointing Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, who said the company showed a callous disregard for more than 600 employees.

title: Republicans Talk of Taxes Leaves Much Unsaid
description: The Republican presidential candidates talked a lot about their tax plans at last weeks debate, but most of the conversation was not very illuminating. Here are some details you may have missed about the candidates who did mention plans.

title: A Day for the Dead
description: Celebrating Day of the Dead and All Souls Day around the world.

title: New York Parking Alert: Alternate-Side Parking Rules Suspended on Tuesday
description: Because of Election Day, alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended in New York City on Tuesday. Other regulations will remain in effect.

title: Whole Foods Loses Favor on Wall St.
description: A visit to the Whole Foods in Gowanus, Brooklyn. The share price of the grocery store chain has fallen, as investors worry about its high prices and increasing competition.

title: Coming So Far Leaves the Mets With One Goal: Finish the Job
description: The Mets history is not as bleak as their fans sometimes suggest. But this much is true: Blue-and-orange joy rides, like the one that just ended, should be treasured.

title: Media Earnings Results Are Awaited, a Bit Warily
description: It looked as if the world was coming to an end across the media business three months ago.

title: TransCanada Suspends Request for Permit to Build Keystone Pipeline
description: WASHINGTON  The company seeking to build the Keystone XL oil pipeline asked the Obama administration on Monday to suspend its yearslong review of the project, potentially bringing an abrupt halt to a politically charged debate that had become part of a broader struggle over President Obamas environmental policies.

title: Hillary Clinton Meets With Mothers of Black Men Killed by Police
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton took a break from fund-raising in Chicago on Monday to meet with the mothers and family members of several black men killed by white police officers and others who have been affected by gun violence.

title: Wall Street Sours on Whole Foods Market
description: Sales of organic and natural products are soaring  but you would never know it from the share price of Whole Foods Market, the premier purveyor of such merchandise.

title: Delaware Pardons an Underground Railroad Hero
description: Exactly 168 years after Samuel D. Burris, a free black man, was found guilty of helping slaves to freedom on the Underground Railroad, Gov. Jack Markell of Delaware posthumously pardoned the man he called a hero.

title: New York State Parks, After Years of Decline, Receive Infusion of Cash and Care
description: CASTILE, N.Y.  The Genesee River flows through Letchworth State Park, forming a luminous ribbon at the bottom of 600-foot cliffs of shale and sandstone, and earning the park the nickname Grand Canyon of the East.

title: Amazon Adds New Perks for Workers and Opens a Bookstore
description: Amazon, which prides itself on being surprising, is doing two predictably unpredictable things this week.

title: Thomas Blatt, Who Escaped Death Camp During Revolt, Dies at 88
description: Thomas Blatt, one of the few survivors of a rare revolt and mass escape from a Nazi death camp in occupied Poland during World War II, died on Saturday at his home in Santa Barbara, Calif. He was 88.

title: Oscar Push Is Underway for Films About Kurt Cobain, Janis Joplin and Amy Winehouse
description: LOS ANGELES  On Thursday evening, some of Hollywoods leading lights will gather at Robert Evanss Beverly Hills estate to raise a glass in honor of Brett Morgens documentary Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck.

title: A City Offers a World Series Title as Proof of Its Resurgence
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  All October, this city had been crazy for its baseball team. Locals ended their conversations with Go, Royals. The water in the famed J. C. Nichols Memorial Fountain was dyed blue. And jubilant masses turned out for viewing parties in the downtown Power and Light District, a booming shopping and entertainment area that not so long ago was a portrait of urban decline.

title: Iran Says It May Quit Talks on Syria Over Saudis Role
description: Iran suggested on Monday that it might withdraw from the new peace talks on Syria because of what Iranian officials described as the unconstructive role of Saudi Arabia, Irans rival for dominance in the Middle East.

title: The World Series: Memories of Moments to Forget
description: New York Times writers who covered the Mets loss to the Royals in the World Series offered their final thoughts.

title: Wave of New-Car Recalls Raises Questions for Takata Airbags
description: As automakers struggle to repair millions of cars with airbags made by Takata that might explode and spew metal fragments, the recalls continue to widen and now extend even to the newest models.

title: A New Look, and Label, for American Eagle Outfitters
description: The teenage-fashion retailer American Eagle Outfitters is set to acquire the high-end mens wear label Todd Snyder for $11 million in cash and stock, shifting away from the fast fashion wars that have upended the teenage apparel market, and aiming to gain a foothold with an older age group.

title: To Help Alex Ovechkin, Capitals Add Proven Scorers and Winners
description: WASHINGTON  The Washington Capitals have elevated losing Game 7s in the N.H.L. playoffs into a masochistic art form. They have been eliminated in a Game 7 six times in the past eight years, including three straight by the Rangers.

title: Colorado: Suspect Killed in Rampage Is Identified
description: The authorities in Colorado Springs have identified the man they say killed three people in a shooting rampage on Saturday before being shot to death in a gunfight with the police. The El Paso County Sheriffs Office said Monday that the assailant was Noah Jacob Harpham, 32, left, a local resident. The Colorado Springs Gazette reported that witnesses had said the assailant had a rifle in one hand and a revolver in the other when he killed a bicyclist on Saturday. He then walked less than a mile and fatally shot two women who were chatting on a porch. The victims were identified as Andrew Alan Myers, 35; Jennifer Michelle Vasquez, 42; and Christina Rose Baccus-Gallela, 34. Four Colorado Springs police officers were placed on administrative leave while the shooting is investigated.

title: Its On the House
description: Administrivial Will Shortz and Table Tennis Alert! Heres a terrific article from the New Yorker website on Will Shortz, his love for the sport of table tennis and his mentoring of 18 year old Chinese champion Kai Zhang.

title: Paul Ryan Lands at Center of a Rivalry for the Soul of the G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON  The event celebrating a new biography of Jack Kemp  a conservative hero who saw promise in the nexus of business and government  was held in the Corinthian-columned headquarters of the U.S. Chamber of Commerce across Lafayette Square from the White House.

title: In Switzerland, a Watch Atelier by Cartier
description: The artisans working on its timepieces are in a renovated farmhouse.

title: Intel is Chipping Away at Fashion
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Intel Corporation likes to fit billions of transistors on a square inch of silicon, but in September, it tried something really challenging: blending computers and fashion in a way people would actually want to wear.

title: U.S. Military Deaths in Operations Against ISIS
description: The Department of Defense has identified eight American service members who have died supporting the operation to eliminate the Islamic State militant group. It confirmed the death of the following American recently:

title: The House That Cartier Skill Built
description: LA CHAUX-DE-FONDS, Switzerland  Standing in front of a wide window with views over a green valley dotted with buildings and houses, one of Cartiers marquetry artists gently tapped his foot on the wooden power pedal of a custom-made crossbow saw.

title: Bobby Koticks Activision Blizzard to Buy King Digital, Maker of Candy Crush
description: One of the biggest names in traditional video games is making its boldest step yet into the fast-growing world of mobile gaming with the multibillion-dollar acquisition of a onetime darling.

title: Blindspot, Season 1, Episode 7: Guerrero
description: What is this, a scavenger hunt? Lou Diamond Phillips, guest-starring as the notorious criminal Guerrero, asked the team in Mondays episode of NBCs Blindspot. Exactly my question.

description: We surrender our needs to the needs of men, to our great detriment.

description: A woman who had taken Nick Ellison home noticed he had stopped snoring and his skin was cold. An autopsy revealed cough medicine and methadone in his system.

title: Nick Ellisons Contract With Teen Challenge
description: The contract that Mr. Ellison signed when he enrolled in the program stated that any dispute had to go to Christian conciliation.

title: Yankees Name Alan Cockrell as Hitting Coach
description: The Yankees announced that they had appointed Alan Cockrell as hitting coach and promoted Marcus Thames, who was the hitting coach at Class AAA Scranton/Wilkes-Barre, as his assistant.

title: U.S.G.A. Plans Five-Year Study on Challenges Facing Golf
description: Facing concerns about participation levels and sustainability of golf, the United States Golf Association announced a five-year research partnership with the University of Minnesota to study the challenges facing the sport. U.S.G.A.s previous research projects have focused on turf grass, but the Minnesota partnership will examine topics like the cost of the game, the time it takes to play, its accessibility and golfer enjoyment.

title: In Religious Arbitration, Scripture Is the Rule of Law
description: A few months before he took a toxic mix of drugs and died on a strangers couch, Nicklaus Ellison wrote a letter to his little sister.

title: Obama Chides Republican Field, Saying CNBC Is No Putin
description: President Obama couldnt resist on Monday night questioning the intestinal fortitude of the Republican candidates who have spent so much time questioning his, pointing to their complaints about the conduct of last weeks presidential debate.

title: The Digital Disparities Facing Lower-Income Teenagers
description: Teenagers in lower-income households have fewer desktop, laptop and tablet computers to use at home than their higher-income peers, according to a new study. And those disparities may influence more than how teenagers socialize, entertain themselves and apply for college or jobs.

description: contraband  \kn-tr-band\  adjective and noun

title: Twyla Tharp on the Road: Homecoming, a Photo Essay
description: Twyla Tharp is writing about rehearsing, touring and creating new work, 50 years after her first dance concert.

title: What to Watch Tonight
description: TALK TO HER (2002) 6:05 p.m. E.S.T. on Starz Cinema. Talk to her; just dont expect her to talk back: Two men (a nurse and a journalist) share an unusual friendship while they care for their girlfriends (a dancer and a matador) who are both comatose. But not all devotion is what it seems, and suddenly romance is tinged with horror. Like all great doomed affairs, Pedro Almodvars tragic comedy is full of lovely, sweet suffering, Elvis Mitchell wrote in The New York Times. (Image: Leonor Watling, left, and Geraldine Chaplin)

title: Q. and A.: David Bandurski on the Villages Within Chinas Cities
description: Read in Chinese |

title: Standard Chartered Bank to Raise $5.1 Billion and Cut 15,000 Jobs
description: LONDON  Standard Chartered, an Asia-focused bank based in London, said on Tuesday that it planned to raise up to $5.1 billion in new capital and cut 15,000 jobs as part of a widespread reshaping of the lender under its new chief executive, William T. Winters.

title: Small Towns Face Rising Suicide Rates
description: LARAMIE, WYO.  After her family moved from suburban New Hampshire to the wind-whipped plains of southeastern Wyoming, Monica Morin embraced small-town life, forging lasting friendships and celebrating her own quirky style.

title: G.O.P.: Save Your Candidates From Themselves
description: Reeling after Mitt Romneys loss to Barack Obama in 2012, the Republican Party gathered for a soul-searching exercise called the Growth and Opportunity Project.

title: The Evolution of Simplicity
description: In this country were raised to go for the gusto, to try new things and savor the smorgasbord of lifes possibilities. As Oliver Wendell Holmes put it, The chief work of civilization is just that it makes the means of living more complex. Because more complex and intense intellectual efforts mean a fuller and richer life. That means more life. Life is an end to itself and the only question as to whether it is worth living is whether you have enough of it.

title: France, Paradise Lost
description: Paris  WHEN I moved to France 12 years ago, it was like arriving in an unfriendly paradise. Sure, hardly anyone spoke to me. But there was national paid maternity leave and free preschool. Practically everyone seemed to agree on the need for strict gun laws, and access to birth control and abortion. Not only did the whole country have health insurance; most undocumented immigrants could get medical and dental care free. (Cruelly, their thermal bath cures werent covered.)

title: The Facebook Intifada
description: TEL AVIV  THREE weeks ago, my father was riding on a public bus in Jerusalems Armon Hanatziv neighborhood when terrorists from East Jerusalem shot him in the head and stabbed him multiple times. Afterward, as he lay unconscious in the intensive care unit of Hadassah Hospital in Jerusalem, fighting for his life, one question was on my mind: What inspired the two young Palestinian men to savagely attack my father and a busload of passengers?

title: And Thats My Opinion!
description: Opinions.

title: The Costs of Solar Energy to the Environment
A Last-Minute Breakthrough
description: Julia returned after the August vacation that we New York psychoanalysts customarily take. Well, not right after. She missed the first session. A family obligation, she said. Were I a traditional analyst, I might have wondered to myself: Is there ambivalence here? Perhaps she doesnt want to come back?

title: The Art of Getting Opponents to We
description: At face value, Becky Pringle and Gisele Huff would seem unlikely allies.

title: College Football Playoff: Final Four Seems Set
description: In the college football playoff rankings, many analysts focus on the teams. Thats the wrong way to think about the playoff picture.

title: UBS Profit Nearly Tripled in Third Quarter on Tax Benefit
description: LONDON  The Swiss bank UBS said on Tuesday that profit nearly tripled in the third quarter as it booked a big tax benefit and recorded lower litigation and regulatory charges.

title: Ahmad Chalabi, Iraqi Politician Who Pushed for U.S. Invasion, Dies at 71
description: Ahmad Chalabi, the Iraqi politician who from exile helped persuade the United States to invade Iraq in 2003, and then unsuccessfully tried to attain power as his country was nearly torn apart by sectarian violence, died on Tuesday at his home in Baghdad. He was 71.

title: News Qs | Cassini Seeks Insights to Life in Plumes of Enceladus, Saturns Icy Moon
description: Before Reading Cassini Seeks Insights to Life in Plumes of Enceladus, Saturns Icy Moon:

title: Nigel Cabourns Old-School Workout
description: When Nigel Cabourn travels, he usually takes along several medicine balls, weighing a cumulative 33 pounds.

title: Tom Brady, the New Face of TAG Heuer
description: One floor above a thumping party at Spring Studios in TriBeCa, where dozens of 40-something executives in Euro-cut suits sipped absinthe-infused cocktails, the man of the hour sat quietly on a directors chair, behind a door guarded by a phalanx of publicists in black cocktail dresses.

title: G.O.P. Fears Losing an Opportunity in Kentucky Governors Race
description: SHELBYVILLE, Ky.  A close contest for governor of Kentucky, where Republicans hope to win an office that Democrats have held for 40 of the last 44 years, highlights an off-year election Tuesday that also features several mayoral races and contentious ballot issues including an anti-discrimination ordinance in Houston and a marijuana legalization proposal in Ohio.

title: Avoiding Taxes, Legally, Offshore
description: The collapse of Enron, with its web of offshore companies, got Paolo Woods talking with a photo editor. As big as the story was, the editor told him, he was hard pressed to figure out just how to illustrate something rooted in a thicket of secretive corporations that  on paper, at least  were based in tax havens. Nondescript post office boxes were not exactly the stuff of great images.

title: Are You a Fair-Weather Fan?
description: Both the New York Mets and the Kansas City Royals picked up many new fans this postseason. That makes sense. People like to root for winning teams  or, at least, teams that have a chance to win a championship. If next season doesnt go as well, those fans might find a different team to root for.

title: Bowties and Arrows
description: Rugged men of style in their finest houndstooth and tweed at BDDWs annual Weenie Roast in Dutchess County, N.Y.

title: The Rugged Men Sporting Tweeds and Arrows
Islam and the Future of Tolerance and Not in Gods Name
description: Civilization has a civility problem. This I learned long before Donald Trump. In 2005, the prominent new atheist Richard Dawkins shouted his disapproval at me  from the audience  during my TED talk at Oxford University. More recently, the novelist Salman Rushdie chastised me on Twitter for suggesting that even atheists worship something. Many of Rushdies followers, worshiping their own wisdom, responded to my tweet with vitriol. Defending the value of doubt through crude certitude is a sign of our times.

Activision Blizzard plans to buy King Digital Entertainment, the maker of Candy Crush Saga, for about $5.9 billion,Michael J. de la Merced and Nick Wingfield report in DealBook.

title: U.S. Admiral, in Beijing, Defends Patrols in South China Sea
description: BEIJING  The head of the United States Pacific Command, Adm. Harry B. Harris Jr., said in Beijing on Tuesday that the Navy would continue to conduct freedom of navigation operations similar to one in the South China Sea last week that China criticized.

description: Hillary Rodham Clinton will arrive in a liberal pocket of eastern Iowa on Tuesday with a little spring in her step.

description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: With First Campaign Book, Donald Trump Throws His Hat Into the Races Literary Ring
description: As book titles go, its not exactly a beacon of optimism. But like the presidential campaign of its author, Crippled America, a new book by Donald J. Trump, is deliberately defying convention. (Its subtitle is less doomsday: How to Make America Great Again.)

title: Senate Republicans Seek End to E.P.A. Water Provision
description: Senate Republicans on Tuesday will take aim at an Obama administration rule on the environment that has become a leading target of conservatives who see it as the latest example of the administrations executive overreach.

title: Neuropolitics, Where Campaigns Try to Read Your Mind
description: In the lobby of a Mexico City office building, people scurrying to and fro gazed briefly at the digital billboard backing a candidate for Congress in June.

title: Steve Deace and the Power of Conservative Media
description: Talk of alpha and beta males is common in the suburban Des Moines studio of the nationally syndicated conservative talk-show host Steve Deace. Almost daily, he assails the wimpy betas purporting to rule todays Republican Party  the feckless politicians who, under siege, are giving ground to alpha fighters like him. Such chatter includes references to manginas and growing a pair, yet does not seem to put off the women in Deaces audience; after all, being politically incorrect has become a conservative badge of honor in 2015.

title: Mary Karr Thinks You Shouldnt Google Yourself
description: In your book The Art of Memoir, you write that one of the side effects of being a memoirist is that strangers skip the small talk and confide the most turbulent patches of their lives, which to me wasnt so surprising, but what you wrote about it was: I have never not been moved by such a tale. Small talk is boring. Politics are boring. The weather is boring. The minute somebody says to you, Ive never told anybody this before, theyve got your attention. Im not a particularly nice person, but Ive got to say, it makes me feel less lonely in the world when people confide in me.

title: Poll Watch: Republicans Diverge on Religious Liberties and Guns
description: A New York Times/CBS News poll published last week revealed deep divisions in the Republican Party not only over potential presidential nominees but also over the federal budget, immigration and whether Republicans in Congress should compromise to get things done or dig in their heels over matters of principle.

title: Shell to Focus on Liquefied Natural Gas in Deal for BG Group
description: LONDON  Seeking to reassure investors, Royal Dutch Shell on Tuesday said its $70 billion acquisition of the BG Group would allow it to realize $3.5 billion in savings, shed $30 billion in uncompetitive assets, and expand its operations in the fast-growing liquefied natural gas industry.

title: Weekly News Quiz | Oct. 27-Nov. 2, 2015
description: Have you been following the news?

title: Hamptons True Colors Show in Autumn Off-Season
description: On a windswept morning in late October, a dozen wild turkeys crashed through the oak trees and landed unceremoniously on the patch of moss, grass and leaves that my husband and I call a lawn. I was on my way out the door, looking forward to a drive on the back roads near our house in Springs, a wooded hamlet in the town of East Hampton. The sight of the birds stopped me in my tracks. The screen door slipped from my hand. The slam rang out like a gunshot. A cloud of crows burst from the trees, and the turkeys, like the fantastical airships in a Philip Pullman novel, sailed across the fence and were gone.

title: Travel Tips From the Well-Traveled Jamie Colby
description: As a television journalist specializing in news, Jamie Colby, 54, has traveled the world covering major events like the tsunami in Asia and the papal conclave at the Vatican, but nothing prepared her for being the host of Strange Inheritance on Fox Business Network. The second season of the series, debuting on Nov. 11, took her from her home in New York City to 20 states and one country, Britain, to speak with people saddled with unusual inheritances like a military tank collection in California, a frontier fort in Texas and a 17th-century shipwreck in Florida.

title: China Aims for 6.5% Economic Growth Over Next 5 Years, Xi Says
description: BEIJING  President Xi Jinping of China announced on Tuesday that the Communist Party and the national government had set a 6.5 percent target for annual economic growth from 2016 to 2020.

title: A Triumphant De Keersmaeker Takes Paris Opera by Storm
description: PARIS  Four musicians, dressed in black, walk on to the stage and sit with their instruments. Four female dancers, dressed in black, walk on to the stage and stand at the periphery in a rough semi-circle. The dancers look at each other, look at the musicians. Nothing happens. Then the dancers suddenly whip into quick turns toward the center of the stage, stand in a close line, and do little slinky, side-to-side walks. The music starts  Bartoks String Quartet No. 4  and they flop unceremoniously to the floor, legs splayed gracelessly, white underwear revealed.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: This is a vivid indication that something is awry in these American households.

title: Corrections: November 3, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Is Legitimate Satire Necessarily Directed at the Powerful?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Siddhartha Deb and James Parker debate whether legitimate satire has to punch upward at its subject.

title: Classical Music This Week: Lulu and a Museums Taste of Schubert
description: Happy November! It was a gruelingly busy but immensely rewarding October for those of us riding the surge of the fall season. Things have quieted down ever so slightly, but there is still a great deal to see and hear.

title: Dance This Week: An Eclectic Hagoromo and Jrme Bels Ballet (New York)
description: Hagoromo

title: How the F.B.I. Can Detain, Render and Threaten Without Risk
description: AT exactly 5 p.m. on March 13, 2007, just as I was preparing to leave my cubicle in Washington for the day, I got a phone call from the journalist Jonathan Landay of McClatchy Newspapers. To this day, I remember his exact words.

title: Bright Passages
description: For a brief respite from nitpicking, heres a small sampling of sparkling prose from recent editions.

title: 1915: State Rejects Womens Suffrage
description: Woman suffrage was defeated yesterday in New Jersey by a majority of about fifty thousand. Despite President Wilsons recent declaration in favor of the women and his trip to his old home, Princeton, to cast his vote for their cause, every county in the State cast a majority against the suffrage amendment. The defeat was overwhelming. The women conceded it early in the evening, but they stuck boldly to their battle flag and said they would carry the fight into another campaign, in which they felt confident they would drive their foes to cover.  The New York Herald, European Edition, November 4, 1915

title: Erl and Oil and Dad and Bernie
description: Dear Diary:

title: Prosecutors in Oscar Pistorius Case Ask Appeals Court for Murder Conviction
description: LONDON  South African prosecutors told an appellate court on Tuesday that Oscar Pistorius, the Olympic runner who was found guilty of culpable homicide in the killing of his girlfriend, should have been convicted of the more serious crime of murder.

title: Former Uber Driver in India Gets Life Sentence for Rape
description: NEW DELHI  A Delhi court sentenced a former driver for the ride-hailing service Uber to life in prison on Tuesday for raping a passenger, said Atul Shrivastava, the public prosecutor who argued the case.

title: Vice Gets Cable Channel in Deal With A&E Networks
description: Vice Media, whose brashness has made it one of the hottest media companies, is getting its own cable channel. On Tuesday, Vice and A&E Networks said they had put the final touches on a long-awaited deal for Vice to take over H2, an A&E Networks channel.

title: Brace for the Nonstop Football League
description: With November arrived, Tuesday and Wednesday prime-time football begins  tonight in college action its the Northern Illinois Huskies versus the Toledo Rockets. Next month bowl mania kicks off, followed by the N.F.L. postseason: Its pretty much wall-to-wall cleats and pads. This raises a question many might prefer not be raised: How soon till there is a nationally telecast football game every single day from school back in session till the Super Bowl? That is to say, how long till a Nonstop Football League?

title: Quarry to Table Design
description: The furniture designer Lex Pott is well regarded in his native Holland for his clever reinterpretation of basic geometric shapes: mirrors of overlapping triangles, shelves made from segmented circles. Next month, he will try to win over an American audience with the Future Perfects exhibition of his new stone pieces at Design Miami, including a table with a base of jagged Belgian bluestone that pierces the top and an elegant shelving unit made of different-colored marble slabs.

title: Vic Invades
description: UrbExers are extreme explorers who infiltrate subways and skyscrapers for adventureand the perfect photograph.

title: Vic Invades
description: I first encountered the mysterious subject of this Op-Doc video, Victor Thomas, via his Instagram account, where he is known as Vic Invades. His photos showed someone dangling his feet over the edge of a massive skyscraper, limbs hanging precariously above the incredible vista of New York City far below. The images were striking  both beautiful and dangerous.

title: Charles Koch Defends Big-Money Campaign Contributions
description: Charles G. Koch, the billionaire conservative businessman and philanthropist, defended the flow of giant donations into political campaigns, saying in an interview on Tuesday that he hoped that money from wealthy contributors would help persuade candidates to end corporate welfare.

title: Daily Report: The Entrenched Digital Divide in Our Own Backyards
description: Even as technology moguls including Facebooks Mark Zuckerberg and Alphabets Larry Page try to connect emerging countries to the web through ambitious global efforts, there is an Internet access problem closer to home.

title: GE Capital Said to Be in Talks to Sell Australian Businesses
description: SYDNEY, Australia  GE Capital is in talks to sell its Australian commercial lending and leasing businesses to Sankaty Advisors and Deutsche Bank, said a person with direct knowledge of the matter, the last of a series of auctions of General Electrics Australian financial assets this year that have included consumer lending and fleet-financing.

title: Popcast: Joanna Newsom
description: Ben Ratliff and Melissa Marturano talk about the critique of Ms. Newsom and her music.

title: Life Pulls Back in Afghan Capital, as Danger Rises and Troops Recede
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  If there had been grumbling before about the deafening intrusion of low-flying American helicopters in the Afghan capital, the discontent has surely multiplied along with the number of flights: packs of them now, coming two, four, six at a time, starting around 7 a.m., then again at midday and at dusk.

title: German Court Deems Ex-Guard at Auschwitz, 93, Fit to Stand Trial
description: BERLIN  A German court has determined that a 93-year-old man who served as an SS sergeant at the Auschwitz death camp is fit to stand trial on charges of accessory to the murder of at least 170,000 people during his tenure there, as the country presses on with efforts to bring older Nazis to justice for their role in the Holocaust.

title: Rail Industry Had Safety Technology Decades Ago
description: WASHINGTON  In 1981, while traveling on a corporate jet, Richard M. Bressler, the chairman of the Burlington Northern Railroad, hit on an idea: What if the technology used by airlines to track the location of planes and help prevent accidents was applied to the rail industry?

title: Your Ideas for Revisiting the News
description: Which news stories from decades past would you like to see re-examined? Retro Report, a series of documentary videos and essays, revisits news stories of the past that have much to tell us about news today.

title: Deal for Candy Crush Maker Favors Hope Over Experience
description: The latest play by King Digital Entertainment, the maker of Candy Crush, will leave investors short of the sugarlike high its biggest hit often induces. The London-based maker of the sweet-matching mobile game is selling out to Activision Blizzard for $5.9 billion, below the price of last years initial public offering.

title: Flash Was Detected as Russian Jet Broke Apart, U.S. Military Officials Say
description: SHARM EL SHEIKH, Egypt  American military officials said Tuesday that satellite surveillance had detected a large flash of light just as a Russian chartered jet broke apart and fell from the sky over the Sinai Peninsula on Saturday, killing all 224 people aboard.

title: Nationals Hire Dusty Baker as Manager
description: Never mind Dusty Bakers rsum, which notes that he has been a three-time National League manager of the year, that he has taken jobs with the San Francisco Giants, the Chicago Cubs and the Cincinnati Reds, and that he led every team to the playoffs (and attending heartbreak).

title: N.F.L. to Add London Games at Twickenham Stadium
description: The N.F.L. said that it would play at least three regular-season games over the next three years at Twickenham Stadium in London, the latest to host the league in Britain.

title: Is Eastern Europe Really More Racist Than the West?
description: LONDON  SOLDIERS putting up miles of razor wire fencing to keep out refugees. A mother and child stuck in a field of mud. A truck parked on the highway between Budapest and Vienna containing the decomposing bodies of 71 refugees.

title: Fink of BlackRock Bemoans Lack of Long-Term Thinking
description: Few corporate executives are better tasked to think about the long term than the chief executive of a $4.5 trillion investment behemoth. And that man, Laurence D. Fink of BlackRock, thinks there isnt nearly enough thinking about it.

title: Jane the Virgin Season 2, Episode 4: Your Roaring Twenties
description: Sometimes one line can summarize an entire situation. And in this weeks episode of Jane the Virgin, it was this one: She only has two hours to write 2,500 words on The Great Gatsby before Mateo has to nurse.

title: Obama Administration Plans Forum on High Drug Prices
description: WASHINGTON  Trying to turn up the political heat on the pharmaceutical industry, the Obama administration announced on Tuesday that it would hold a forum this month on the high prices of some prescription drugs.

title: A New Look for the Old Camera Bag
description: The retro weekend carryall loses its 1970s connotations with a fresh, polished focus.

title: Poll Shows Gains for Hillary Clinton in New Hampshire
description: In the topsy-turvy Democratic race in New Hampshire, Hillary Rodham Clinton took a small lead over Senator Bernie Sanders on Tuesday in a Monmouth University poll, reversing a deficit of eight percentage points from September.

title: Officials Discuss China Sea Operations
description: Adm. Harry B. Harris Jr. met with officials from the Chinese military to discuss the Navys operations in the South China Sea.

title: In Case You Missed It: October's Top Real Estate Stories
description: Catch up on the most popular stories of the month.

title: Jury Selected in Sheldon Silver Corruption Trial
description: A jury has been selected in the trial of Sheldon Silver, the once powerful speaker of the New York State Assembly who faces political corruption charges.

title: Health Insurance and the States: A Closer Look
description: Last week we showed how, two years into Obamacare, there are still millions of uninsured Americans.

title: Vegetarian Thanksgiving: Cauliflower Steaks
description: When it comes to Thanksgiving Day eating, vegetarian diners arent looking for fake turkey or tofu. They want what everyone else at the table wants  delicious food that celebrates the fall harvest.

title: In Free Agency, Spurs David West Sought Meaning, Not Money
description: This is a story about a players core values more than it is about a franchises valued core, R. C. Buford insisted early Monday night in the bowels of Madison Square Garden.

title: Small Donors Are Clicking More With Democrats Than Republicans
description: SOMERVILLE, Mass.  In an office here with the trappings of a Silicon Valley tech firm, a band of politically engaged twentysomethings has built a formidable Democratic fund-raising machine that is fueling the insurgent presidential campaign of Senator Bernie Sanders against Hillary Rodham Clinton and leaving even Republican rivals envious.

title: Cubs Fans Know the Feeling
description: To the Editor:

title: Netflixs Reed Hastings Sees Need for More Content
description: Attention cable cord-cutters: Do not expect to see live sports or evening newscasts on Netflix anytime soon.

title: A Chance to Improve the Community, and Himself
description: Elbert Copeland spent eight of his formative years living in the Fulton Houses, a public-housing project in the Chelsea section of Manhattan, in the late 1980s and early 90s.

title: Clip: The Peanuts Movie
description: Charlie Brown and Lucy in a scene from The Peanuts Movie.

title: On the Longest Hiking Trails, a Woman Finds Equal Footing
description: It was a busy summer on the Appalachian Trail. The movie A Walk in the Woods made its debut, the path received national attention for a perceived party culture and the well-known endurance athlete Scott Jurek set an overall record on the trail.

title: Noah Hawley on Fargo, Comic Haircuts and Living in the Coen Universe
description: Once mostly anonymous, the producers who oversee top television series have sometimes become as well known as the actors who star in them. On occasion, The Times will pose questions from readers (and pose some of our own) to notable show runners, and post their responses. (Interviews are edited for clarity.)

title: Review: The Minstrel Show Revisited Confronts Racial Stereotypes
description: Dancers, in blackface and wearing woolly wigs, stand in a row at the front of the stage. One by one, they spout racist jokes. Heres a clean one: What is the best joke in history? Answer: Civil rights!

title: I Will Be Vindicated, Silver Says
description: Sheldon Silver, the former speaker of the New York State Assembly, arrived at court saying he believed he would be vindicated in his corruption trial.

title: Chalabi Chides U.S. in 2011 Interview
description: In this 2011 interview, the former Iraqi deputy prime minister Ahmad Chalabi discussed the 2003 invasion of Iraq, criticizing the way the United States government had justified it.

title: Legal Errors in Pistorius Case
description: Opening arguments from Oscar Pistoriuss court case, in which South African prosecutors argue that legal errors led to a lesser conviction.

title: Lawyers React to Uber Driver's Sentence
description: The prosecutor and defense counsel spoke after a man convicted of a rape in New Delhi in December  Shiv Kumar Yadav, a former Uber driver  was given a life sentence.

title: M.T.A. Bus Fatally Strikes Woman in Brooklyn; Driver Is Arrested
description: A longtime Metropolitan Transportation Authority bus driver was arrested on Tuesday after his bus hit a 70-year-old woman who was crossing the street in Brooklyn, killing her just a block from the shelter where she lived, the authorities said.

title: Twitter Stars and Favorites Are Replaced by Hearts and Likes
description: Twitter users around the world were jolted to learn Tuesday morning that stars had been replaced with hearts, and favorites with likes.

title: Close Up With ISIS Captives: Reporters Notebook
description: ERBIL, Iraq  Some stories tell themselves. As soon as I sat down with four former prisoners from an Islamic State prison for an article I wrote on Oct. 27, it was clear the challenge was to do justice to their extraordinary accounts.

title: 1965: Cracking Down on Beatniks
description: ROME  Rome police today [Nov.3] threatened a major crackdown on the unwashed, unshaven, unruly beatnik bands which have made Romes stately Spanish Steps their rallying point. Foreigners in the ranks of the Spanish Steps loafers may be expelled from the country and Italian youths copying the shaggy style may be sent to the barber first and then back to their families, police warned. Climaxing a summer-long series of small incidents there, the Spanish Steps were the stage yesterday of a violent free-for-all tussle between the beatniks, soldiers and police.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, November 4, 1965

title: Speaker Ryan Holds First Press Conference
description: House Speaker Paul D. Ryan said on Tuesday that the first issue he will tackle in his new leadership role will be the highway bill.

title: The Future of Apples
description: Fruit breeders around the world have been busy creating an array of newer varieties of apples.

title: Stadium Food, for Foodies
description: Sports stadiums across America are upping the ante on their culinary offerings. At Seattles CenturyLink Field, Seahawks fans are feasting on fries with crab sauce and locally sourced sausages from the Pike Place Market butcher shop Ulis. At Portlands Moda Center, home of the N.B.A.s Trail Blazers, on draft is Widmer Brothers Upheaval IPA (the arena pours 70 percent craft beers), which pairs well with Bunk Sandwiches New Orleans-style muffuletta. At Philadelphias Lincoln Financial Field, Eagles enthusiasts are eating gourmet pizzas by the James Beard Award-winner Marc Vetri. But leading the pack is the 49ers new $1.3 billion Levis Stadium in Santa Clara, Calif. About 75 percent of the food is local, and 26 vegan items are on offer, including a vegetarian take on a pulled pork sandwich with smoked jackfruit.

title: Beyond the Honeycrisp Apple
description: ROCK ISLAND, Wash.  Take one bite of a Cosmic Crisp  dramatically dark, richly flavored and explosively crisp and juicy  and its easy to see why it is already being hailed as the most promising and important apple of the future.

title: Prix Goncourt Goes to Mathias nard
description: PARIS  Frances top literary award, the Goncourt Prize, was awarded on Tuesday to the novelist Mathias nard for La Boussole, or The Compass. Set during a long night of opium-fueled conversation, it is one of several books on this years short list to tackle the often fraught interactions between the Western and Islamic worlds.

title: Robin Williamss Widow Points to Dementia as a Suicide Cause
description: For the first time in more than a year, the widow of the actor Robin Williams is speaking publicly about the circumstances that preceded Mr. Williamss death, and sharing details about a disease he had when he died.

title: Room to Cook
description: A tour of a food bloggers home kitchen in Paris.

title: A Tour of Pastry Chef David Lebovitzs Home Kitchen in Paris
description: David Lebovitz

title: U.S. Auto Industry Posts Best October Sales in Decade
description: DETROIT  The American auto industry reported its best October sales in a decade on Tuesday, led by double-digit growth at all three Detroit carmakers.

title: Reactions to Chalabis Death
description: Officials and Iraqis on the death of the former Iraqi politician Ahmad Chalabi.

title: Inside Kado, a Licorice Lovers Dream
description: The store sells 500 varieties of the sweet imported from 10 different countries.

title: One-Thing Shops: Licorice, Berlin
description: I went from marketing to the markets themselves and lets just say people were a bit surprised, says Ilse Bge. In 1996, she gave up her job as a financial consultant in Berlin to start hawking something very different: licorice. The first bank I went to for a loan pretty firmly suggested I sell childrens clothes, nuts, chocolates, basically anything in addition to licorice, but I wanted to specialize, she says.

title: Obama Ridicules Republican Candidates
description: Speaking at a Democratic National Committee fund-raiser at the Richard Rodgers Theater in New York on Monday, President Obama made a series of jokes about the Republican candidates for president.

title: Trading Volatility Doesnt Faze Morgan Stanleys Gorman
description: A difficult third quarter for the fixed-income trading business isnt going to make Morgan Stanleys chairman and chief executive, James P. Gorman, give up and go home, and it doesnt mean the bank intends to turn away from the volatility-prone securities business.

title: Review: In Becketts The End, a Nameless Man Stares Down Death Onstage
description: On the way out of the theater after Samuel Becketts The End, part of Lincoln Centers White Light Festival, each audience member gets a little memento: a booklet of the text weve just seen performed.

title: Chomp Chomp
description: A restaurant in the West Village that serves hawker food from Singapore.

title: A Foster Child Feeling Secure, With a Future Still Unknown
description: I stared at the sweatshirt hanging in the closet for a moment before slowly pulling it off its hanger.

title: Chef Dale Taldes Must-Eat Tour of Chicago
description: Talde shares the restaurants that spawned some of his most popular dishes, including ramen with bacon and egg and buttered toastinfused broth and phot roast.

title: How The Peanuts Movie Puts a New Spin on an Old Gag
description: A familiar scene starring Lucy, Charlie Brown and a football highlights the movies old-meets-new animation style.

title: Consider the Source, Obamacare Edition
description: Maybe Im just being naive, but if it were up to me, reports on politicians pronouncements would provide some context about things those politicians have said in the past  just to help the readers, who probably dont have dossiers ready to hand.

title: Paul Ryan, Pledging Openness, Eases Path for Amendments
description: WASHINGTON  The House on Tuesday debated and voted on dozens of amendments to an important highway bill as Paul D. Ryan sought to use his first week as speaker to demonstrate his commitment to a more inclusive style of legislating.

title: First Serbian Migrants Arrive in Croatia
description: A train transported migrants from the city of Sid, Serbia, into Croatia on Tuesday. The two countries agreed to provide train service to ease border crossings for the travelers.

title: Demand Creates Its Own Supply
description: One of the intellectually horrifying things about the response to economic crisis was the way many economists, some of them famous, reinvented old fallacies in the belief that they were saying something profound. In particular, quite a few economists seemed utterly unaware that Says Law  the proposition that supply creates its own demand, that shortfalls in aggregate demand were impossible  had been refuted three generations ago.

title: Death Penalty Foes Split Over Taking Issue to Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON  In the long legal struggle against the death penalty, the future has in some ways never looked brighter.

title: Zendaya, Lorde and Karlie Kloss at the CFDA/Vogue Fashion Fund
description: Celebrities, editors, alumni and supporters attended the annual awards ceremony, where three lesser-known designers took home the big prize.

title: Swiss Chard Cedes the Spotlight
description: The classic French tourte aux blettes, a signature dish from Nice, is a Swiss chard pie in an olive-oil-based double crust, made with abundant Swiss chard, raisins, pine nuts, Parmesan or Gruyre, sugar and apples.

title: Readers Respond to Success Academys Got to Go Student List
description: Readers were divided in response to an article about the creation of a Got to Go list of students at a Success Academy charter school, part of New York Citys largest charter network. Last December, the principal at Success Academy Fort Greene, in Brooklyn, singled out 16 students he said were disruptive and hoped to see leave. Although the principal was quickly chastised, nine of the students later left, and the list seemed to validate claims that the network achieves its high test scores by weeding out weak or difficult students.

title: Zendaya, Lorde and Karlie Kloss at the CFDA/Vogue Fashion Fund
description: Celebrities, editors, alumni and supporters attended the annual awards ceremony, where three lesser-known designers took home the big prize.

title: For Donald Trump, Experience Suddenly Matters
description: Donald Trump spent some of a Tuesday television appearance discussing the need for presidential candidates to have experience and the right temperament. Wait a second isnt this is the anti-experience, anti-competence, anti-Washington campaign? And isnt Mr. Trump the most anti-experience candidate of all?

title: Fox to Open Theme Park in Dubai in 2018
description: LOS ANGELES  The 20th Century Fox studio said on Tuesday that it would make a new foray into the resort and theme park business, with an opening in Dubai in 2018.

title: The Conspiracy Consensus
description: So, are we supposed to be shocked over Donald Trump claiming that Janet Yellen is keeping rates low to help Obama? Folks, this is a widely held position in the Republican Party; Paul Ryan and John Taylor accused Ben Bernanke years ago of doing something dastardly by preventing the fiscal crisis they insist would and should have happened under Obama. If Trumps remarks seem startling, its only because the press has soft-pedaled the conspiracy theorizing of seemingly respectable Republicans.

title: Singapore Treats at Chomp Chomp in Greenwich Village
description: Whenever I find myself growing grim about the mouth, whenever it is a damp, drizzly November in my soul, Herman Melville wrote, I account it high time to get to sea as soon as I can.

title: BalletNext and Abraham.In.Motion Experiment With Jazz
description: A few weeks ago, the ballerina Michele Wiles wrinkled her nose in concern and confusion.

title: Cassette Brings French-Catalonian Flavors to Greenpoint
description: Cassette In their new venture, Henry Rich and the chef Joe Pasqualetto move from the rustic Italian they feature at Rucola in Boerum Hill, Brooklyn, to southwestern French, with some Catalonian flavors. Vegetables dominate in dishes like roasted peppers with white anchovies, potatoes with salsa verde, roasted acorn squash with red rice, and pasta with tomatoes, toasted garlic and salt cod. Desserts include crme Catalan, the Spanish take on crme brle. The wines of the region are well represented and well priced, with about a dozen under $50. Perry Chen, a founder of Kickstarter, which happens to be just around the corner, is also a partner. Unlike the cozy, cluttered Rucola, this restaurant is airy and spacious, with big windows: 113 Franklin Street (Kent Street), Greenpoint, Brooklyn, 347-682-4111, cassettebk.com.

title: Australia Deploys Sheepdogs to Save a Penguin Colony
description: Massacred, read the banner headline in the local newspaper  just the single word, as if describing an act of war. Below it was a photo of dead penguins and other birds, the latest casualties in Australias long history of imported species decimating native wildlife.

title: Clothes That Match the Wallpaper
description: Comparing someones outfit to wallpaper isnt normally a compliment  but that may change today, as Calico Wallpaper launches a collaboration. With the custom clothier Print All Over Me, the cultish indie brands stylish, nature-inspired patterns have been translated into a limited-edition capsule collection, sold exclusively by the Brooklyn concept shop Swords-Smith. Its the second time Calico and Print All Over Me have teamed up, though its the first with any fanfare: As Nick Cope, the co-founder of Calico alongside his wife Rachel, explains, We had them unofficially design our tradeshow uniforms that harmonized with our booth at this years Design Week NYC back in May. And as for Swords-Smith, the shop isnt just shilling the goods; its founders (also a married couple, Briana Swords and R Smith) were integral in developing the concept. I loved Calicos wallpaper, Swords says. Every time I saw it, I thought to myself, I would love this on a dress.

title: Vaticans Financial Troubles Run Deep, According to New Book
description: ROME  Pope John Paul I, who died in 1978, still holds more than 110,000 euros, or about $120,000, in a Vatican bank account. The Vatican pension fund is running an 800-million deficit. The Vaticans real estate holdings total 2.7 billion, seven times more than what is listed on its balance sheets. And the Vaticans governing body had agreed to push Philip Morris cigarettes, for a fee.

title: Jon Stewart Signs Production Deal With HBO
description: Three months after retiring as host of The Daily Show, Jon Stewart has signed a production deal with the premium cable channel HBO, the channel announced on Tuesday.

title: Beyond Get Well Soon  Create an Empathy Card
description: When Emily McDowell learned at the age of 24 that she had Stage 3 Hodgkins lymphoma, she discovered how difficult it is for people to talk about a life-threatening illness.

title: Obama Mocks Republican Presidential Candidates
description: Obama Chides Republican Field, Saying CNBC Is No Putin

title: Honda Drops Takata as U.S. Issues Huge Fine Over Airbags
description: Honda Motor Company on Tuesday dropped the embattled manufacturer Takata as its airbag supplier, concluding that the company, its longtime partner, had misrepresented and manipulated test data.

title: Serbia and Croatia, in Rare Cooperation, Provide Trains for Migrants
description: SID, Serbia  Two formerly warring nations, Serbia and Croatia, have forged a rare agreement to improve the journey of migrants in Europe, providing train service across their borders to ease travel through the West Balkans, a route known for its bottlenecks, chaos and misery.

title: More White People Die From Suicide and Substance Abuse: Why?
description: The big mystery is why? Why would the death rate for middle-aged non-Hispanic whites be increasing after decades of decline while rates for middle-aged blacks and Hispanics continue to fall? And why didnt other rich countries have the same mortality rate increase for people in midlife?

title: Sachin Tendulkar and Shane Warne Sell Cricket to New Yorkers
description: When Sachin Tendulkar and Shane Warne walk the streets of New York, they create an odd phenomenon. About 95 percent of the pedestrians pass them without a second look. The other 5 percent go bonkers.

title: Why Jeb Bushs Book Could Hurt Him
description: Who do I write about the problems the tractor trailers are causing now that they are not allowed in the left lane of I-75? asks a Floridian in an email to Jeb Bush, reproduced in his new book Reply All. By the way, are you really Jeb or a staff member?

title: Chicago Police Say Boy, 9, May Have Been Targeted in Fatal Shooting
description: The police in Chicago are investigating whether a 9-year-old boy who was shot dead in an alley may have been targeted in the shooting.

title: Trump on Other G.O.P. Candidates
description: Donald J. Trump talked about the other Republican contenders for the presidential nomination, saying one of them had a weak message, while presenting his new book at Trump Tower.

title: New Hillary Clinton TV Ad Focuses on One Topic: Gun Violence
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton is showing a new television spot in Iowa and New Hampshire in which the only words are the candidate talking about ending gun violence.

title: Romania Places the Heart of a Queen in Her Castle
description: BUCHAREST, Romania  It has been a busy few years for royal remains. In 2012, King Richard IIIs bones were found under a parking lot in Leicester, England, and reburied in March. In September, the Russian authorities exhumed the bodies of Czar Nicholas II and Empress Alexandra for new DNA tests. Last week, the Russians said the body of the czars father, Alexander III, would be dug up for testing, too.

title: What Is the Locker-Room Policy for Transgender Students at Your Childs School?
description: Federal education authorities found Monday that an Illinois school district violated antidiscrimination laws when it did not allow a transgender student who identifies as a girl and participates on a girls sports team to change and shower in the girls locker room without restrictions. Instead, the student, who identifies as female but was born male, is required to change beyond privacy curtains in the girls locker room and to shower separately.

title: Gary Cohn Says Goldman Sachs Will Adapt to Survive
description: Challenges have sprung up across Wall Street, making life more difficult for the industrys big banks. But the president of Goldman Sachs, Gary D. Cohn, insists that the company will adapt and survive.

title: IBM Looks to Its Next Century
description: Few companies  especially tech companies  can trace their history back more than a century.

title: Where Glamour Finds Its Levels
description: A closer look at the MP Massimo Piombo store in Milan.

title: In Milan, Massimo Piombo Opens a Shop for the Fashion Obsessive
description: Massimo Piombo, a fixation of fashion editors, if not a household name, can make the elegant seem esoteric and the esoteric elegant. He has had many micro-achievements. Among them, he says, was being at the forefront of bringing the pajama shirt out of the bedroom and into the working world.

title: Art et Industrie
description: Images of works included in the influential groups new retrospective at Magen H gallery.

title: Familial Ties to Slavery, Bound by Vintage First-Person Accounts
description: BUFFALO  The Michigan Street Baptist Church, built here in the 1840s, was a haven for fugitives on the Underground Railroad, and a place of worship for illustrious citizens like Mary Burnett Talbert, a founder of the movement that led to the creation of the N.A.A.C.P.

title: A Design Show Fit for Beetlejuice
description: Art et Industrie, founded in 1977, was an influential avant-garde design movement beloved by the likes of Jean-Michel Basquiat, who frequented the groups openings in SoHo. Years later, the gallerist Hugues Magen, newly arrived from Paris, was similarly struck: I was educated in Europe, with all of the standards that this implies, and was confronted in New York with Art et Industrie, recalls Magen, a former principal dancer with the Dance Theatre of Harlem. I was mesmerized and challenged, in front of something for which I had very little reference, and I was inspired by seeing liberty in such a way that I was not accustomed to in terms of design.

title: Donald Trump Pitches New Book (and a Campaign, Too)
description: Inside the pink marbled atrium of the Trump Tower on Tuesday, Donald J. Trump, the salesman, signed copies of his new book by the armload, gleefully demanding to know precisely how long the line of buyers had become on 56th Street. Is it all the way to Madison Avenue? he asked an aide.

title: Fear and Silence in Bangladesh as Militants Target Intellectuals
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  Fear has wormed its way into the mind of Mithila Farzana, who hosts two talk shows on a Bangladeshi television news channel.

title: Catholicism For the Time Being
description: On Sunday, with my latest broadside on matters Catholicsfiled and published, I drove with my family up into northwestern Connecticut just for the drive, no particular destination in mind. We ended up stopping for mass at a shrine near Litchfield, built in imitation and honor of Lourdes, that Id visited occasionally many years earlier with my parents. The place was mostly unchanged: A big expanse of land, gray and somewhat forbidding on a cloudy day with the trees half-gone toward winter; a grotto where they have outdoor masses in warmer weather; a long stations of the cross ascending a wooded hill to a lifesize Calvary; and various gift shops and outbuildings scattered around the grounds. One of the outbuildings doubles as a chapel, and thats where the All Saints Day mass was held: In a crowded, close, carpeted space, with a mostly-gray haired congregation (we were some of the youngest people there) dressed in suburban- Catholic casual and packed into too-small chairson three sides of the altar.

title: White House on Keystone Project
description: Josh Earnest, the White House press secretary, suggested that politics had driven the request by TransCanada to suspend the review of the proposed Keystone XL pipeline.

title: Does Anyone Own the Cornrow?
description: Theres no way to sugarcoat this: I always experience a flash of annoyance when I see white girls wearing cornrows. Maybe its because the hairstyle is being marketed as new and trendy. Or it could be that I, as a black woman, know its not a style white girls wore when I was growing up, and that they often mocked me for wearing it.

title: Robert Eatroff, a Top Morgan Stanley Deal Maker, Is Joining Comcast
description: A senior Morgan Stanley deal maker is leaving the firm to join a longtime client, Comcast, as a senior executive in charge of corporate development.

title: Officials Discuss Takata Penalty
description: Transportation Secretary Anthony Foxx and Mark R. Rosekind, administrator of the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, spoke about Takata receiving the industrys largest fine over its faulty airbags.

title: Essena ONeill, Instagram Star, Recaptions Her Life
description: With over 800,000 followers, Essena ONeill is an Instagram star. But Ms. ONeill, a 19-year-old  Australian, recently surprised her fans by abruptly speaking out against social media.

title: Troy Brauntuch: Early Work
description: The paintings, created from 1977 to 1982, go on display tomorrow.

title: VW Reveals It Misstated Emissions of Gas Cars
description: Volkswagens pollution problems took a costly new turn on Tuesday when the company said it had understated emissions of carbon dioxide, a greenhouse gas, for about 800,000 of its vehicles sold in Europe, and overstated the cars fuel economy.

title: Influential, Late-70s Paintings, Revisited
description: Youre in, youre out, youre up, youre down, the painter Troy Brauntuch says, with his trademark disarming self-deprecation. Privately, one always goes on. Nearly 40 years ago, Brauntuch had a flash of big-shot fame: he was one of five artists (alongside Jack Goldstein, Sherrie Levine, Robert Longo and Philip Smith) included in the influential 1977 group show Pictures, curated at Artists Space by Douglas Crimp. The show came to represent the brewing movement of image-based artists  those who had a broader perspective of how we read images, and really entered the picture again, and what that means, Brauntuch says. Pictures operated as a bellwether, in stark contrast to then-fashionable Minimalism and abstraction. We came out of a time when art was not what we were doing, which is why we were doing what we were doing. His years in New York in the late 70s and 1980s were spent running up the ladder alongside his friends, like Cindy Sherman, Matt Mullican, David Salle, Goldstein and Longo, whose careers exploded onto the superstar level. He counted Richard Prince and Dike Blair among his golfing buddies, too. We played religiously, Brauntuch says. We also played in a poker game for decades.

title: Pictures of the Day: Greece and Elsewhere
description: Greece and Elsewhere: Pictures of the Day

title: 20 Years After Rabin, Israeli Politics Have Shifted
description: JERUSALEM  While fiery denunciations and vitriolic rants are all too common on social media in Israel, one Facebook post was particularly chilling given its timing  and its author.

title: A World War I Memorial in Kansas City Is a Tribute to Giving
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  When John Totaro and his wife, Lynn DeLeo-Totaro, visited here in August, it didnt take them long to spot the National World War I Memorial.

title: Nov. 3, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Greece, Romania, Italy and Bangladesh.

title: When Making Donations, Know an Agencys Needs
description: Most people know the warm feeling of helping out, whether by donating clothes to the needy, taking cans of beans to the local food pantry or clicking online to contribute to a friends cause.

title: School vs. Society in Americas Failing Students
description: Heres the good news: American schools may not be as bad as we have been led to believe.

title: Michelle Obama, With Conan OBrien, Visits Troops in Qatar
description: AL UDEID AIR BASE, Qatar  Michelle Obama was greeted by roars of applause from three dozen service members in combat fatigues when she walked into the Fox Sports Sky Box bar here on Tuesday night.

title: Review: Christine Brewer in Prayer, at Alice Tully Hall
description: To clap or not to clap? Even seasoned concertgoers can be unsure of what to do between pieces when religious music is on the program.
