title: Rebel Wilsons Red Carpet Looks
description: On the advice of her stylist, Rebel Wilson gave up her red-carpet tracksuits for plunging V-necks and skimpy sleeves.

title: Rebel Wilson Goes From Fat Amy to Fashion Brand
description: LOS ANGELES  Inside Milk Studios, a marble building here on North Cahuenga Boulevard, waiters passed sushi rolls amid racks of dresses, bags and T-shirts. Outside, a starlet posed on a red carpet by a reflecting pool, wearing a crimson scuba dress overlaid with black lace. It had all the trappings of a Hollywood branding soiree, announced by a neon sign hovering overhead: Welcome to the Rebelution.

title: Long Lives and Rocky Markets Have Some Pension Systems Recalibrating
description: For decades, state and local pension systems thought of themselves as Americas ultimate long-term investors.

title: Review: A High-Energy St. Lawrence String Quartet at Zankel Hall
description: In 1826, Beethoven sent the score of a new string quartet to his publisher with a flippant annotation: Patched together from various bits filched here and there. This work, the sprawling Opus 131, would come to be considered one of his boldest contributions to chamber music.

title: Time Warner May Have Left Door Ajar for a Fox Return
description: Time Warner may have left its henhouse gate open to Fox. Its chief executive, Jeffrey L. Bewkes, last year thwarted an $80 billion takeover bid from Rupert Murdochs rival media company with some bold projections. Mr. Bewkes is now backing down from those claims and could be vulnerable to a fresh approach.

title: Ruling in Mexico Sets Into Motion Legal Marijuana
description: The Mexican Supreme Court opened the door to legalizing marijuana on Wednesday, delivering a pointed challenge to the nations strict substance abuse laws and adding its weight to the growing debate in Latin America over the costs and consequences of the war against drugs.

title: Fantasy Football Week 9: Browns at Bengals
description: Fantasy football analysis for Thursday nights game between the Cleveland Browns and the Cincinnati Bengals. Check back Friday for analysis on Sundays games and Mondays matchup between the Chicago Bears and the San Diego Chargers. You can also follow the Sablich brothers on Twitter at @5thDownFantasy.

title: Reviews: Amazon Pilots Include a Revolt and the Supernatural
description: Since 2013, Amazon has released a batch of original TV pilots several times a year for the public to review and vote on. Our TV critics take a look at the latest crop, which will be available beginning on Thursday.

title: Defining Diversity in Silicon Valley and on Wall Street
description: Jana Rich, an executive recruiter who specializes in consumer technology companies, estimates that 80 percent of the searches she has done over the last 18 months in Silicon Valley, San Francisco and New York have been for candidates lumped under the rubric of diversity.

title: British Official on Halted Flights
description: Britain's transport secretary, Patrick McLoughlin, said the government was suspending flights from the Egyptian resort city of Sharm el Sheikh after a Russian airliner crashed on Saturday.

title: Activists May Be Less Myopic Than Their Reputation Suggests
description: Are activist investors short-term traders or in it for the long term? It is the question of the moment as nearly $200 billion has poured into the coffers of activists with names like Icahn, Ackman and Peltz, among others. Last year, as a group they put some 200 companies in their cross hairs and replaced 19 chief executives, according to the law firm Sidley Austin, putting pressure on virtually every board in the country to pay attention to this vocal class of shareholders.

title: Time Warner Cuts Profit Expectations, and Media Stocks Dip
description: Media giants have fallen back into a ring of fire.

title: Amy Winehouse Documentary Team Tackling Oasis in Upcoming Film
description: LondonThe pair behind Amy, the highly successful documentary film about the singer Amy Winehouse, have signed on to make a feature-length documentary about the British pop group Oasis, which disbanded in 2009. Asif Kapadia, the director of Amy, and James Gay-Rees, the producer, will be producers on the Oasis project, which doesnt yet have a title or release date.

title: Obamas Unfulfilled Pledge to Close Guantnamo
description: To the Editor:

title: Pedestrian Fast Lanes. Why the Heck Not?
description: This is (possibly) brilliant: a fast lane for walkers in downtown Liverpool. Nimble people, keep to the left. Dawdlers, get out of the way.

title: Supreme Court Justices Fear Loss of Control Over Redistricting Cases
description: WASHINGTON  At a Supreme Court  argument on Wednesday about procedures in redistricting cases, the justices appeared to be trying to reconcile two conflicting impulses. They did not want to close the door entirely on challenges to gerrymandering, but they also did not want to be required to rule on them.

title: In Heat of August 1945, Mao and Chiang Met for the Last Time
description: BEIJING  In August 1945, Mao Zedong flew from his mountain redoubt in Yanan to Chongqing, the headquarters of Chiang Kai-sheks Nationalists and Chinas sweltering wartime capital. It was to be the last meeting between leaders of the Communists and the Nationalists, the rival factions then contending for control of China.

title: Why Buffetts Salad Oil Magic May Not Repeat for Ackman
description: Jeff Gramm is the author of the forthcoming book Dear Chairman: Boardroom Battles and the Rise of Shareholder Activism (HarperBusiness), which has a chapter about the Great Salad Oil Swindle. He is a hedge fund manager who teaches value investing at Columbia Business School.

title: Eruption Strands Passengers in Bali
description: Airline passengers were stranded at airports on the Indonesian island of Bali because of volcanic ash from the eruption of Mount Rinjani on the neighboring island of Lombok.

title: Houellebecqs Islam, Houellebecqs West
description: Like many people who pretend to parle a little francaisbut get tired after reading a page, Ive only just now read the newly-translated Submission, Michel Houellebecqs dystopian vision of a near-futureFrench republic that succumbs willingly to a vaguelyTariq Ramadan-esqueform of political Islam. When I say dystopian, the casual reader may infer as many people did when the book first appeared, literally at the same moment as theCharlie Hebdomassacre that the dystopia is the Islamicized France, that Houellebecq is trying to do for Islamism or Eurabia what Orwell once did for Stalinism. But if youve read the keener reviews(or Houellebecqs previous novels) you probably understand that no, actually, the dystopia is the contemporary West, andthe Islamified future that Houellebecqs story ushers inis portrayed as a kind of civilizational step forward, or if you prefer a necessary regression back to health.

title: Lawsuit Accuses Missouri City of Fining Homeowners to Raise Revenue
description: PAGEDALE, Mo.  This spring, officials in this tiny city near St. Louis ordered Valarie Whitner to replace her siding; repaint her gutters, downspout and foundation; and put up screens or storm covers outside every window and blinds or curtains on the inside.

title: The Lessons of Stanfords Sex-Assault-Case Reversal
description: Last February, I wrote a long article for this magazine about the relationship between Ellie Clougherty, a recent Stanford graduate, and Joe Lonsdale, a Silicon Valley entrepreneur and alumnus of the school. The couple started dating in 2012, after Lonsdale was assigned to be Cloughertys mentor for an engineering course called Technology Entrepreneurship, which combined academics with business skills and access to Silicon Valley. After the relationship ended, Clougherty accused Lonsdale of sexual assault.

title: App Smart | Home Away From Home
description: A selection of short-term rental apps for those seeking alternatives to Airbnb.

title: Video Feature: Home-Rental Apps as Alternatives to Airbnb
description: To some people, Airbnb is an innovative service that is shaking up the hotel industry by offering interesting alternative places to stay. To others, Airbnb is viewed as a tax-dodging scourge that lets tenants violate their leases subletting rules in return for a quick buck.

title: Opponents of Houston Rights Measure Focused on Bathrooms, and Won
description: HOUSTON  The predominantly black Third Ward here, a historic and struggling community, seemed like the kind of precinct that would be sympathetic to a broad ordinance outlawing discrimination based on factors such as race, religion and sexual orientation.

title: Why Parents Should Have the Sex Talk With Their Children
description: The sex talk isnt easy for parents, but new research shows that adolescents who have talked to their parents about sex are more likely to use condoms and birth control.

title: Jets Ryan Fitzpatrick Will Start Despite Thumb Injury
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  The Jets quarterback woes do not appear as severe as the team had feared.

title: Guinness Is Going Vegan
description: Guinness, the Irish stout that once famously advertised itself under the slogan Guinness is good for you, took a step this week to inject 21st-century food culture into its 256-year-old product. Guinness is going vegan.

title: Jeb Bush Apologizes to France for Workweek Remark in Debate
description: LONDON  Accused of French-bashing, the Republican presidential hopeful Jeb Bush apologized this week for making fun of Frances work ethic, saying he was sorry for insulting Americas oldest ally.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Brooklyn
description: John Crowley narrates a sequence from Brooklyn.

title: Whitney Names Curators for Next Biennial, in 2017
description: The Whitney Museum of American Arts first biennial exhibition in its new home  which goes on view in Spring 2017  will be organized by Christopher Y. Lew, an associate curator at the museum, and Mia Locks, until recently an assistant curator at MoMA P.S.1, the Whitney announced Wednesday.

title: Market Changes May Prompt New Definition of Insider Trading
description: The law of insider trading has not changed much since important Supreme Court rulings in the 1980s established a high bar for convictions.

title: For Start-Ups, Altruism as an Alternative to Acquisition or I.P.O.
description: For most private companies backed by venture capital or financial sponsors, there are two obvious paths to an exit: sell, or go public as a traditional for-profit corporation.

title: Human Rights Campaigns Letter to the N.F.L.
description: With Houston set to host the Super Bowl in 2017, Chad Griffin, the president of the Human Rights Campaign, wrote Roger Goodell, the N.F.L. commissioner, to discuss nondiscrimination protections for attendees.

title: Work Force Culture Is Buffeted by Swift Changes in Technology
description: Companies from Wall Street to Silicon Valley have been forced to adapt to technological and regulatory changes in the last seven years, but have their work force cultures adapted quickly enough?

title: Seijun Suzuki, a Symbol of Japanese Cool in Film, Is Reconsidered
description: Its rare in this country for an actual political fight to break out over a filmmaker. The current squabble over Quentin Tarantinos remarks about police shootings stands out for its oddity  we usually see controversy involving a director only when Michael Moore has a new documentary to promote.

title: Chinas Slowdown Raises Questions About Long-Term Growth
description: HONG KONG  The short-term economic signals out of China have not been reassuring.

title: E.U. Is Split Over How to Prepare for Euro Crises to Come
description: PARIS  During the height of the Greek crisis last summer, five men gathered in a war room at the Finance Ministry in Athens and began poring over the outlines of a surreptitious project. Greece was at a dangerous impasse with its creditors over a bailout, and the group needed to find a way to keep the country functioning if it were to be forced out of the euro.

title: Amy Among Nominees for Documentary Film Awards
description: LOS ANGELES  Music-themed documentaries made their mark as the International Documentary Association announced nominees, and some winners, for its annual documentary awards, to be presented in Los Angeles on Dec. 5.

title: The Risks and Rewards of Short-Termism
description: The debate has been raging in various forms for the last 30 years  whether corporate short-termism is a problem and, if it is, is it hurting American businesses and the economy? Short-termism is exactly what it sounds like: companies managed for the short term, with decisions driven by the need to meet shareholder expectations about quarterly earnings and stock prices.

title: Facebook Revenue Surges 41%, as Mobile Advertising and Users Keep Growing
description: It takes money, the adage goes, to make money. And Facebook is spending a lot of dollars to do just that.

title: Donald Trump to Run His First Campaign Ads  on the Radio
description: Donald J. Trump is buying radio air time in three early states, his campaign manager confirmed, marking the billionaire candidates first foray into paid advertising since he began his presidential campaign in June.

title: Book on Family-Planning Policy Is Banned, Then Promoted, by China
description: In just six years, Fuxian Yis book pleading for an end to the one child policy went from banned to promoted by the Chinese government.

title: Short-Term Thinking
description: From Wall Street to Washington and in the towers of academia, people are buzzing about what some say is the pernicious focus in corporate America on short-term profits.

title: Pictures of the Day: the Philippines and Elsewhere
description: The Philippines and Elsewhere: Pictures of the Day

title: Ryan McGinleys Fall and Winter
description: For his newest photo series, the artist spent time in upstate New York. He shares four photos from the series, as well as the haunts he discovered in the area.

title: Ryan McGinleys Upstate New York
description: Since 2004, Ryan McGinley has taken summer road trips across America with a gang of models  excursions that have yielded some of his best-known work. But his next two shows at Team Gallery (running semi-concurrently at both gallery locations in SoHo and Venice, Calif.), reveal a dramatic shift in thematic focus. Whereas McGinleys road trip series resulted in youthful, sometimes forlorn-feeling images of nude forms set against the backdrop of landscapes that varied according to geographic location, this most recent collection of photographs was shot entirely in upstate New York.

title: Toxin Taints Crabs and Kills Sea Mammals, Scientists Warn
description: The authorities in California are advising people to avoid consumption of crabs contaminated by a natural toxin that has spread throughout the marine ecosystem off the West Coast, killing sea mammals and poisoning various other species.

title: A Close-Up of the Sun
description: NASA released a video of the sun created from still images taken by its space-based telescope, the Solar Dynamics Observatory. The labor intensive process takes 10 hours to make one minute of video.

title: Museum of Natural History Reveals Design for Expansion
description: In designing its $325 million addition on Columbus Avenue, the American Museum of Natural History has opted for an architectural concept that is both cautious and audacious, according to plans approved by its board on Wednesday. The design consumes less coveted park space than expected, while introducing a contemporary aesthetic that evokes Frank Gehrys museum in Bilbao, Spain, in its undulating exterior and Turkeys underground city of Cappadocia in its cavelike interior.

title: One Child Culture Is Entrenched in China
description: Read in Chinese |

title: Mysteries Surround Missing Italian Marathoner After He Is Found Safe
description: This much is known: Gianclaudio P. Marengo ran 26.2 miles through the five boroughs in the New York City Marathon on Sunday. How many more miles the Italian runner traveled after finishing the race is still a mystery.

title: Your Morning Briefing: Russia Crash, Stranded on Bali, China Markets
description: Good morning.

title: Review: Evgeny Kissin the Curator Illustrates His Breadth
description: Each year Carnegie Hall invites artists to curate concert series through its Perspectives series. Evgeny Kissin is using his to let New Yorkers see double.

title: Review: Garth Fagan Dance Honors Geoffrey Holder With Festivity, Not Sorrow
description: Garth Fagan knows that mourning doesnt need to be sorrowful. That attitude guides his latest dance, an ode to the prolific choreographer, performer, painter, director and designer  and Mr. Fagans friend  Geoffrey Holder, who died last year.

title: Nov. 4, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from the Philippines, the West Bank, England and Iraq.

title: Kwaidan and House of Bamboo: Visions of, and From, the Rising Sun
description: In movie terms, Japan is the land of total mise-en-scne. Western artists from van Gogh to Chris Marker have been fascinated by the otherness of Japans seemingly aestheticized way of life  taking from and reading into the culture of a nation the French literary philosopher Roland Barthes called the empire of signs.

title: Review: BalletNext, Seeking Abandon in Jazz
description: Live music is more of a luxury than a given in dance, but when Michele Wiles started BalletNext in 2011,  it was part of her mission. At her previous job, as a principal dancer with American Ballet Theater, it was a given.

title: Review: Hagoromo Offers More Than Dance at BAM Harvey Theater
description: A central scene of Hagoromo occurs in sustained silence, as Jock Soto, playing a fisherman, toys with a mysterious veil that he has found on a remote island. We know  he does not  that this veil is the Hagoromo, a sacred mantle: we have seen an angel dance with it.

title: Officials on Pakistani Factory Collapse
description: Rescue workers and local government officials were on the scene after a factory undergoing expansion collapsed into rubble Wednesday evening in an industrial park in eastern Pakistan.

title: Review: American Classical Orchestra, With an Unseasonal Passion
description: Should it matter if a Bach Passion is performed out of season? Handels Messiah, after all, which was also written for Eastertide, is performed far more often around Christmas.

title: When Photographs Become Evidence
description: The decision to drop charges against a photographer and indict an arresting officer was based on direct evidence: the photographers own photos.

title: Review: Lionel Louekes Sinuous Serenity
description: Lionel Loueke

title: How Organic Avenue Lost All Its Juice
description: As recently as last month, one could hardly throw a lentil in New York City without hitting an Organic Avenue storefront, with its orange banner, stick-figure logo and promise of better living through $9 cayenne-infused lemonade.

title: Review: In Carla Morrisons Amor Supremo, Love and the Void
description: Carla Morrison

title: Review: Chris Janson, With Buy Me a Boat, Separates Himself From Bro-Country Genre
description: Chris Janson

title: In the Cross-Fire: Public Editors Notebook
description: I steeled myself before I took the job of public editor for The Times, and I looked on the bright side: This would be the ultimate lesson from the universe in how not to try to please anyone  an occupational hazard for a lot of women, even the most ink stained and battle hardened. What a great growth experience it would be!

title: Aftermath of Suicide Bombing in Egypt
description: Footage shows the damaged walls of a police club in northern Sinai, Egypt, where at least four police officers were killed.

title: For a New Comic Role, Carson Elrod Tips His Hat to a Stage-Costume King
description: Gusting into his ground floor studio on Walker Street in TriBeCa, William Ivey Long paused for an instant to point out a suite of artworks by his former friend and neighbor Louise Bourgeois, among them an eerie six-eyed figure traced somewhat tentatively in red over black.

title: Trumbo Recalls the Hunters and the Hunted of Hollywood
description: James Dalton Trumbo, the storied screenwriter of Spartacus and Roman Holiday, would use many names. Pseudonyms were a necessity for Trumbo (1905-1976), one of the Hollywood 10 who defied the House Un-American Activities Committee in 1947 during its witch hunt for Communists.

title: Foo Fighters, Recruited by Viral Video, Play Unplanned Concert in Italy
description: To lure the Foo Fighters to his hometown, Cesena, in northern Italy, Fabio Zaffagnini organized 1,000 musicians to play one of their hit songs, recording a video that was widely shared online in July.

title: Witness Describes Aftermath of Stabbings
description: A student described security response to the stabbing of five people on the campus of the University of California, Merced.

title: Groenlandia se desvanece entre ros helados
description: Groenlandia se est derritiendo. Ahora, un grupo de cientficos busca predecir que tan rpido subirn los niveles del mar.

title: Senate Report Says Pentagon Paid Sports Leagues for Patriotic Events
description: Ceremonial first pitches. Luxury box seats. An athletes airport greeting for a returning service member. And at least one appearance by the cheerleaders of the Indianapolis Colts.

title: Expedia to Acquire HomeAway for $3.9 Billion
description: Expedia said it had agreed to acquire HomeAway, adding vacation rentals to its wide swath of online travel booking options.

title: Review: Killing a King, on the Murder That Claimed a Peace Process
description: When contemplating the history of Israel, it is tempting to dream in counterfactuals. It is also an almost certain formula for madness. The idea that Israel generates so many wistful what-ifs is itself a sign of the countrys fraught and fragile existence. No one would mourn what might have been if all of us could agree on what should be.

title: Mercedes-Benz Recalls 126,000 Vehicles Over Problems With Airbags
description: Mercedes-Benz has joined the ranks of automakers troubled by airbag malfunctions, recalling about 126,000 vehicles in the United States, according to a report from the automaker posted this week on the website of the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing: Russian Plane Crash, Houston, Facebook
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: For Performa, One Artist Stages a Debate  Among His Own Paintings
description: One of the surprises on the lineup of this years Performa biennial, a self-reflexive puppet show by Wyatt Kahn, thrusts the artist  who identifies primarily as a painter rather than a performer  and his studio practice into the performance spotlight. Her invitation came with carte blanche, Kahn says, referring to the Performa director and curator RoseLee Goldberg. So I pitched her a puppet show. I was thrilled when she said yes.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Review: John Pizzarelli and Jessica Molaskey, Feeling Deeply, at Caf Carlyle
description: It was nearly 30 years ago that Paul Simons album Graceland introduced The Boy in the Bubble, a prescient song about our perilous, technologized world of lasers in the jungle and the bomb in the baby carriage with a fragmented expression of apocalyptic dread that still feels remarkably contemporary. And to hear Jessica Molaskey perform it on Tuesday evening with her husband, John Pizzarelli, on guitar at Caf Carlyle was to be brought up short by the songs telegraphic sense of alarm. Just like that bomb, the images explode in your mind.

title: Doctor at Sheldon Silver Trial Tells of Elaborate Arrangement, Years in Making
description: In New Yorks ornate Capitol building in Albany, a plan two years in the making was taking root. Everyone would benefit: Victims of mesothelioma, a rare but deadly form of cancer caused by exposure to asbestos, would be sent to a reputable law firm; the firm would pick up new clients; and a well-regarded cancer research clinic would receive funds.

title: Defensive Medicine May Lower Malpractice Risks
description: Some doctors practice defensive medicine, ordering extra tests and procedures believing this will ward off malpractice suits. A new study suggests that it does.

title: Putting the Cool in Cool-Weather Style
description: Parkas, boots, sweaters and gloves to help you take the perfect weekend upstate selfie.

title: U.S. Offers Account to Encourage Retirement Saving
description: After an extended test period, the federal government is widely promoting its new savings plan called myRA, which is aimed at people who do not have a retirement plan at work.

title: Quintessential Britain, Accessories and Other Shopping Events
description: Cheerio! From Thursday to Sunday, 20 British companies will celebrate home on Madison Avenue with quintessentially British in-store programming. At Jimmy Choo, you can sip tea in Wedgwood china while shopping for glamorous footwear like the Dolly 100 silver glitter pump with fox-fur pompoms ($995), while Anya Hindmarch will offer free embossing on bespoke purchases, including keepsake boxes ($510 for a large size). Jimmy Choo is at 716 Madison Avenue; Anya Hindmarch is at 795 Madison Avenue.

title: Indian Muslim, Accused of Stealing a Cow, Is Beaten to Death by a Hindu Mob
description: NEW DELHI  Amid a politically charged national debate over religious intolerance, a Muslim man was beaten to death on Monday by a mob of Hindus who suspected him of stealing a cow, a revered symbol in the Hindu religion. It was the fourth time in six weeks that Hindus had killed Muslims they suspected of slaughtering, stealing or smuggling cows.

title: Donald Trump Is Said to Have Reached Out to the Megadonor Sheldon Adelson
description: Donald J. Trump has mockingly accused Sheldon Adelson, a casino developer and one of the biggest Republican megadonors, of wanting a puppet to back when it was reported that Mr. Adelson was considering throwing his support to Senator Marco Rubio.

title: Charles Herbert, Mid-Century Child Star on TV and in Movies, Dies at 66
description: Charles Herbert, who was 4 years old when he was discovered by a Hollywood talent scout on a bus while out shopping with his mother and went on to become a top-earning child actor of the 1950s and 60s, died on Oct. 31 in Las Vegas. He was 66.

title: Actors Studio to Stage Play by Mara Irene Forns
description: The Actors Studio in New York City will stage a half dozen free performances of Mud, a provocative play by the Cuban-born American playwright and director Mara Irene Forns that deals with such themes as illiteracy, hunger and poverty, the non-profit organization announced Wednesday.

title: Buffalos Next Top Start-Ups
description: The 43North business idea contest, which recently held its second annual competition, is Americas largest, with $5 million in total prize money.

title: Buffalo Entices Start-Ups to Relocate With $5 Million Contest
description: BUFFALO  Until two weeks ago, Ace Callwood had never set foot in this chilly, postindustrial city, but he committed, sight unseen, to move his fledgling technology business and its four employees here. The lure that drew him was cash: a guaranteed investment of at least $250,000 and a shot at as much as $1 million.

title: Bitcoin Basics
description: Bitcoin is both a virtual currency and an online payment system  one that some people believe will transform the global financial system. But the details of this new technology have remained a mystery to most.

title: Brett Gardners Wrist Injury Led to Drop-Off, Coach Says
description: When the Yankees were shut out by the Houston Astros in the American League wild-card game, the crowd at Yankee Stadium saved its most vociferous boos for one of its favorite players, Brett Gardner, the Yankees only homegrown starter.

title: Highway Bill Debate Tests Paul Ryans Promise for a More Open House
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Vicky Hartzler, Republican of Missouri, wanted an amendment that would prohibit the use of federal highway money for landscaping and beautification.

title: Iran President Pushes Back Over Anti-U.S. Crackdown
description: TEHRAN  President Hassan Rouhani of Iran on Wednesday criticized the recent arrests of journalists and others by the Revolutionary Guard Corps, which has accused detainees of being part of seditious plots hatched by the United States.

title: Thursdays Matchup: Browns (2-6) at Bengals (7-0)
description: 8:25 p.m. Eastern, NFL Network

title: State Dept. Denies Request for Delay on Pipeline Review
description: The State Department on Wednesday notified TransCanada, the company seeking to build the Keystone XL oil pipeline, that it would not grant a request to suspend its review of the project. A lot of work has gone into this to date, and the secretary wants that work to continue, John Kirby, the department spokesman, said, referring to Secretary of State John Kerry. In a letter to Mr. Kerry, TransCanada said a delay would allow time for a review by Nebraska. Environmental groups said the request is a bid to avert President Obamas expected rejection of the pipeline. TransCanada said on Wednesday that it respected the State Departments decision and would continue pressing to show that the pipeline is in the national interest of the United States.

title: Bitcoin Surges, Emerging From a Lull in Interest
description: After a long period of quiet, the price of the virtual currency Bitcoin is surging again as signs of interest from China and Wall Street have helped kick off a new speculative frenzy.

title: Officials Debate Whether Ferguson Effect Is Real
description: WASHINGTON  A rift widened Wednesday within the Obama administration over the politically charged question of whether a surge in crime in some cities reflects the reluctance of the police to confront suspicious people because of increased public scrutiny of their behavior.

title: In Houston, Hate Trumped Fairness
description: Sometime in the near future, a transgender teenager in Texas will attempt suicide  and maybe succeed  because vilifying people for their gender identity remains politically acceptable in America.

title: Suicide of a Dishonest Officer
description: There is no way to fully process the betrayal by Charles Joseph Gliniewicz, a police lieutenant in Illinois who an investigator said Wednesday had committed a carefully staged suicide after years of stealing money from a local youth group that he ran.

title: Cavaliers, Taking Cue From LeBron Jamess Sleeves, Go on Tear to Beat Knicks
description: CLEVELAND  Carmelo Anthony and LeBron James go way back. They knew each other in high school. They entered the N.B.A. together as lottery picks in 2003. They became friends.

title: Ex-Prosecutor Details Robert Durst Case in New Book, but Some Fear It Could Aid Defense
description: Just when the story of Robert A. Durst, the New York real estate scion who is a suspect in two murders, could not get any stranger, a new book arrives from a former Westchester County district attorney, Jeanine Pirro, describing her quest for justice in his case.

title: Airbnb and Uber Mobilize Vast User Base to Sway Policy
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Over the last few years, so-called sharing companies like Airbnb and Uber  online platforms that allow strangers to pay one another for a room or a ride  have established footholds in thousands of communities well before local regulators have figured out how to deal with them.

title: Highlights From the Trial of Sheldon Silver
description: Sheldon Silver, an assemblyman who rose from the Lower East Side of Manhattan to become one of New York States most powerful politicians, was found guilty on Monday in a federal corruption trial.

title: Trump SNL Petitions Arrive at 30 Rock
description: Petitions from Latino and immigration groups calling on NBC to drop Donald J. Trump as the Saturday Night Live host this week were delivered to its offices.

title: Donald Trumps Scheduled Appearance on Saturday Night Live Draws Protest
description: Donald J. Trump has appeared unconcerned with the possibility of angering Latinos since declaring during the announcement of his presidential campaign in June that Mexico was sending rapists to the United States.

title: Memphis Is Powerful. The Problem: Its League Isnt.
description: Three tigers enter a room before the evening circus. They appear equally fierce. Two are sent to the big tent. The third? His pedigree is called into question, and he is sent off to a sideshow.

title: Puerto Ricos Debt Crisis and the 1975 Law Complicating Matters
description: To appreciate why it is proving so hard for Washington to help debt-burdened Puerto Rico, it helps to go back to 1975, the year New York City went broke, and consider the role played in that crisis by a prominent Republican senator from Texas named John Tower.

title: N.F.L. Says Teams Will Have to Return Improper Military Payments
description: The N.F.L. said that any of its teams found to have been paid by a branch of the military for promotional purposes would have to return the money.

title: Budget Could Be the Last of the Big Deals for President Obama
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama and Republicans in Congress are enjoying a rare season of peace and productivity, eschewing debt defaults, government shutdowns and budgetary brinkmanship as they move long-stalled legislation. But for the White House, the suspension of dysfunction has a darker side: the demise of dreams.

title: Charges for 2 Connecticut Students Said to Have Dressed Like Columbine Killers
description: Two high school students in western Connecticut were arrested on Wednesday after they were said to have worn Halloween costumes that looked like the gunmen responsible for the Columbine mass killings in 1999 and threatened to harm other students, the authorities said.

title: Divine Being
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  When youre solving a themed crossword, how long would you say it takes you to guess or solve the theme before you finish the puzzle? I see many comments from people who claim not to see themes, and it seems to me that these solvers are missing some of the fun of deciphering a crossword puzzle.

title: Empire Season 2, Episode 6: A High Hope for a Low Heaven
description: On Wednesdays Empire, a kidnapping mystery was resolved almost as quickly as it unfurled. Hakeem got snatched by three gang members with matching longhorn back tattoos, but they only held him for an afternoon and asked for a modest $40,000 ransom for his safe return. The ordeal leaves the youngest Lyon shaken, and a smack from the butt of a gun renders him temporarily hearing-impaired and unable to perform. Hakeems unearned bravado frequently makes him insufferable, so the vulnerability he radiates throughout the crisis and its aftermath is rewarding, whetever the cost, though he still manages to treat his family poorly throughout.

title: San Franciscos First Female Sheriff Plans to Improve Ties in Criminal Justice System
description: SAN FRANCISCO  San Francisco elected its first female sheriff on Tuesday: Vicki Hennessy, a city native who pledged to work with the whole criminal justice system  including the police, the district attorneys office and federal immigration officials  to build better relationships.

title: One Is Dead After Plane Crashes Off Queens Coast
description: Search crews found the body of a man amid the debris from a small plane that crashed off the coast of the Rockaway Peninsula in Queens on Wednesday night, the authorities said.

title: Official Cites Past Arrests for Driver in Fatal Brooklyn Bus Crash
description: The bus driver with the Metropolitan Transportation Authority who was charged in connection with a crash that killed a 70-year-old woman on Tuesday in Brooklyn had been arrested three times over the last decade, a law enforcement official said.

title: Brooklyn Man, 35, Is Fatally Shot in His Buildings Hallway
description: A Brooklyn man died on Wednesday after he was shot in the head in the hallway of his apartment building, the police said.

title: Kentuckys Next Governor,Matt Bevin, Rode In on Outsider Status
description: LOUISVILLE  Matt Bevin, Kentuckys new Republican governor-elect, likes to catch his opponents off guard. So on a Friday in September, while driving by the state Democratic Party headquarters  where a sign declared We Cant Trust Matt Bevin  he decided, spur-of-the-moment, to pop in.

title: Thomas Gilbert Jr. Is Fit for Trial in Wealthy Fathers Death, Psychologist Says
description: Although two court-appointed psychiatrists have found Thomas Gilbert Jr. too mentally ill to be tried on charges he killed his wealthy father, a forensic psychologist hired by the Manhattan district attorneys office said in court on Wednesday that he had reached a starkly different conclusion.

title: Elder Bush Says His Son Was Served Badly by Aides
description: WASHINGTON  After years of holding back, former President George Bush has finally broken his public silence about some of the key figures in his sons administration, issuing scathing critiques of Vice President Dick Cheney and Defense Secretary Donald H. Rumsfeld.

title: M.L.B. Decision on Nationals Rights Fees Is Overturned
description: A Major League Baseball committees decision to award the Washington Nationals five years of annual rights fees from the Mid-Atlantic Sports Network, which would have peaked at about $66 million in 2016, was thrown out Wednesday by a New York State Supreme Court judge.

title: CUNY Faculty Members Arrested After Staging Protest
description: Several dozen City University of New York faculty members were arrested on Wednesday when they blocked the entrance to the Midtown Manhattan building housing the administrations offices as part of a demand for salary increases.

title: Protesters to NBC: Dump Trump
description: Demonstrators outside NBCs headquarters in New York asked the network to cancel Donald Trump's appearance on Saturday Night Live this weekend.

title: A Love for Music and Singing, Undiminished by Parkinsons
description: Songs by scores of popular musicians  Jethro Tull, the Rolling Stones and Queen, most notably  streamed from the radio in Jorge Escalantes childhood home in San Juan de Miraflores, Peru. Although the lyrics were foreign and incomprehensible, he was besotted by the music.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | ignite
description: ignite  \ig-nit\  verb

title: Worries of Market Chill at Sothebys Auction of Ex-Chiefs Collection
description: The stakes were higher than ever at Sothebys on Wednesday night, marking the start of a fall season of global art buying as well as one of the biggest gambles for the auction house, which had put $500 million behind a sale of A. Alfred Taubmans collection.

title: What to Watch Thursday
description: Election Day was Tuesday, you say, viewers? Not at Amazon Video, where you can help decide which pilots to develop without the agony of watching debates. Those whod rather not exercise their streaming rights can partake of the mayhem known as Larrymania or navel gaze with the Norwegian writer Karl Ove Knausgaard.

title: Corrections: November 5, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: This is great news. People like me will be able to acquire it for rheumatism.

title: Crdit Agricole and Socit Gnrale Post Higher 3rd-Quarter Profits
description: PARIS  Crdit Agricole and Socit Gnrale, two of Frances largest banks, reported higher third-quarter profits on Thursday as their retail divisions posted improved results.

title: Puerto Ricos Debt Crisis
description: To the Editor:

title: Pink Ribbons in October
description: To the Editor:

title: Death Among Middle-Aged Whites
description: Two Princeton economists startled other Americans  and themselves  when they uncovered a trend that had escaped the medical and scientific world: Between 1999 and 2013, white middle-aged men and women in the United States, especially those with only a high school education, began dying at a sharply increased rate, largely a result of problems with legal and illegal drugs, alcohol-related liver disease and suicide. The health and financial implications are disturbing for the country, and for what the two economists called a lost generation.

title: Teachers for the Needy
description: To the Editor:

title: Democrats Undermine Efforts to Protect Retirement Savers
description: Forty-seven House Democrats are threatening to derail the  Obama administrations effort  to protect Americans from retirement advisers who put their own interest in earning commissions above their clients need for expert advice.

title: Why America Invented Ahmad Chalabi
description: WITH his death, the Iraqi politician Ahmad Chalabi is once again in the news. Detractors rage about his supply of fabricated intelligence on Iraqi weapons of mass destruction that supposedly tricked Washington into war. Supporters claim he was a heroic dissident who was never given the chance to transform his troubled country into paradise.

title: What We Owe the MythBusters
description: WHEN the reality TV show MythBusters debuted on the Discovery Channel in 2003, its producers werent on a mission to transform science and education in America. They just wanted to entertain. In each episode, the hosts would try to debunk or confirm a few classic urban legends. Could a penny dropped off the Empire State Building really kill a person? Could eating a poppy-seed bagel actually make you test positive for heroin? The producers cast two San Francisco-based special-effects artists, Jamie Hyneman and Adam Savage, as hosts. The show was a surprise hit  pulling in as many as 20 million viewers a season  and it helped changed our culture.

title: Drugs, Greed and a Dead Boy
description: Andrew Francesco was a rambunctious, athletic and joyful child, but also a handful. When he was 5 years old, a psychiatrist prescribed Ritalin. As he grew older, he disrupted classes and was given a growing number of potent antipsychotic and other medications.

title: Houstons Vote on an Anti-Bias Law
description: To the Editor:

title: What My Mother Wanted Us to Pack
description: After our mother died last year at age 91, my four sisters and I gathered to clear out her apartment. We didnt imagine the work would be onerous, since our mother  a modest, orderly person determined never to be a burden to her kids  had consciously downsized over the years as she and my father moved from their suburban home to a three-bedroom condo and then to a small apartment in a senior residence.

title: Trans-Pacific Partnership Text Released, Waving Green Flag for Debate
description: WASHINGTON  The release on Thursday of the full text of President Obamas trade accord with 11 Pacific Rim nations brought out opponents and supporters and officially opened what may be the last big battle of the presidents tenure: winning congressional approval of the largest regional trade deal in history.

title: News Qs | As Transgender Students Make Gains, Schools Hesitate at Bathrooms
description: Before Reading As Transgender Students Make Gains, Schools Hesitate at Bathrooms:

title: Found: A One-Bedroom in Central Harlem
description: Mark Scott had spent all of his working life in Atlanta. He bought a house, then downsized to a 1,200-square-foot two-bedroom apartment in a condominium tower downtown.

title: When Photographs Become Evidence
description: The decision to drop charges against Robert Stolarik for interfering with an arrest he had been photographing in the Bronx in 2012 and instead to prosecute an arresting officer came after prosecutors scrutinized the physical evidence: Mr. Stolariks digital images.

title: In All-Gender Restrooms, the Signs Reflect the Times
description: Before the Whitney Museum of American Art moved to its new location in Lower Manhattan, it hosted a discussion about what it means for a museum to be a safe and welcoming space.

title: Red Tape Slows U.S. Help for Children Fleeing Central America
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama vowed a year ago to give Central American children fleeing violence a new, legal way into the United States by allowing them to apply for refugee status while in their own countries instead of accepting help from smugglers or resorting to a dangerous trek across Mexico.

title: Alabama Is Rolling in Cash, With Tide Lifting All Boats
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala.  Bill Battle is near the 30-yard line with his fellow alumni, gripping hands and flashing a lighthouse smile, reassuring one and all that all is right in the University of Alabama athletics department, which he runs. Near the edge of the field, Molly Brautigan and fellow sorority sisters laugh and plot their postgame festivities.

title: Should Prostitution Be Legal?
description: This summer Amnesty International passed a resolution supporting the decriminalization of sex work. The organization decided that decriminalization is the best way to defend sex workers human rights and lessen the risk of abuse they face. But will making prostitution legal only increase the demand for sex workers, without actually protecting them from the violent abuse and exploitation that is common in the industry?

title: Before, During and After: Strategies From Our News Qs Feature for Reading Nonfiction
description: Every weekday on this blog we take an important or interesting news or feature story from the week and turn it into what we call News Qs  a quick series of questions and activities designed to help students both understand the story and connect it to their own lives.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: Ask Well: What Is the Link Between Depression and Heart Disease?
description: Question:

title: Morning Agenda: The Bitcoin Resurgence
description: THE BITCOIN RESURGENCE | The price of the virtual currency Bitcoin has surged after a quiet period, Nathaniel Popper reports in DealBook. Signs of interest from China and Wall Street have kicked off a speculative frenzy.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Egypt, Justin Trudeau, Bush Biography
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: European Union Predicts Economic Gains From Influx of Migrants
description: BRUSSELS  European Union officials on Thursday put a positive economic spin on the blocs refugee crisis.

title: New York Today: Spring Eternal
description: Updated 11:13 a.m.

title: How to Help
description: Every day in 2014, an average of 42,500 people left their homes looking for protection and safety elsewhere, and the number of refugees in the world has quadrupled in the past five years, to close to 60 million. More than 50 percent of those refugees are children, the highest figure for child refugees in more than a decade. Chuol, Hana and Oleg  the children featured in the New York Times Magazine article The Displaced  are three young refugees who were forced to leave everything behind because of violence, conflict and persecution.

title: The Displaced: Oleg
description: Oleg Teryokhin was living with his mother and father in Nikishino, a rural village of fewer than 1,000 coal miners, farmers and their families in eastern Ukraine, when fighting broke out in April 2014. Hastily formed separatist militias, goaded and armed by Moscow, rose up in a rebellion against a new, pro-Western government in Kiev. In the first months of the conflict, the fighting was far from Nikishino, and Oleg, then 10, spent the early summer tearing about the village on his bicycle, zipping past its old brick cottages and apricot orchards. Then, in July, scorched scraps of clothing and bits of paper with foreign writing blew through the village  debris from the crash of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17, the passenger jet that was shot down, killing hundreds of people whose bodies lay in fields just south of the village. When Oleg carried some of these items home, his mother, Galina, was horrified that the conflict had come so close.

title: The Displaced: Chuol
description: Chuol was only 5 in 2011, the year South Sudan, after decades of war, became the worlds newest nation. He was living with his parents, grandparents and other relatives in a village near the city of Leer, not yet old enough to understand the hope and joy sweeping through the small East African country.

title: The Displaced: Introduction
description: I have two photos on my desk. The first shows a child, a girl of about 10. She is standing behind an enormous pile of her familys belongings, which have been tightly packed for a long journey. Her face is blank with uncertainty, but she strikes a bossy pose  one hand on her hip, the other planted firmly against the bundles. Her companions are an older woman, probably her mother, and a little boy  her younger brother? Both look directly at the photographer, Henri Cartier-Bresson, who took this picture in Dessau, as scores of Germans displaced during World War II began returning home. It is 1945. Where has this girl been, and what has she seen?

title: The Displaced: Hana
description: At 4:45 in the morning on a Saturday in early August, stars were still bright in the sky above a refugee settlement in rural Lebanon where Hana Abdullah, a 12-year-old girl from Syria, now lives. The morning call to prayer floated down a dusty road and wound its way around the mostly silent tents. At 5 oclock, Hana was still sleeping on her bamboo mat by the edge of her familys tent, her arms folded, her hands under her head. Her baby brother and three of her four sisters slept nearby. Many mornings Hana was up at 4 oclock. She worked in the nearby fields of Lebanons Bekaa Valley, picking fruits or vegetables, and everyone started early. But today the truck that would take her there was late. Now came its familiar rumble, next the crunching of gravel: She stirred, her mouth twitched, her eyelids fluttered. Then she was up, vertical in one swift movement, stretching, pulling on a hat from a stash of her belongings. She grabbed lunch  a tomato, and a pita she folded around a potato  and ducked outside to wait on one of the benches in front of her tent.

title: Virtual Reality: A New Way to Tell Stories
description: One hundred nineteen years ago, the inaugural issue of this magazine published the first photographs ever to appear in The New York Times, beginning on the cover with three small halftone images of the former presidential candidates Stephen Douglas, John Bell and John Breckinridge. Elsewhere in the magazine, readers found images of X-rays, then a nascent technology, showing a hand and a foot. Now, more than 6,000 Sundays later, the magazine is proud to introduce another visual innovation: In conjunction with this weeks cover story on the global refugee crisis, we are unveiling The New York Timess first contribution to the new field of virtual-reality journalism.

title: Democrats Name Appointees to Panel Investigating Planned Parenthood
description: House Democrats have decided once again to participate in a House investigative committee they despise.

title: Bomb Is Possibility in Loss of Russian Jet Over Egypt, Obama Says
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said Thursday evening that there was a possibility that a terrorist bomb was responsible for the destruction of a Russian passenger plane that broke apart last Saturday over the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt.

title: NYT VR: How to Experience a New Form of Storytelling From The Times
description: Today, The New York Times takes a step into virtual reality. NYT VR is a mobile app that can be used  along with your headphones and optionally a cardboard viewing device  to simulate richly immersive scenes from across the globe.

title: At C.M.A. Awards, Triumph forChris Stapleton and Country Musics Fringes
description: Every so often, country music wants to cleanse itself, to show that it is more than the sum of its hits, its routines, its tics. Nashville is a company town, but sometimes heart and humility are its most valuable commodities.

title: Outrage Ripples Through Romania After Governments Collapse
description: BUCHAREST, Romania  On Tuesday night, an estimated 20,000 Romanians took to the streets of Bucharest, the capital, demanding political change. The next morning, Prime Minister Victor Ponta resigned, saying he acknowledged a legitimate anger in society.

title: European Regulators Provide Details on Next Bank Stress Tests
description: LONDON  Regulators provided more details on Thursday on next years tests of the European banking sector, as they prepare to examine the ability of the regions lenders to survive a financial crisis or severe economic downturn.

title: Chris Christie Seeks to Capitalize on a Widely Shared Personal Moment
description: When The Huffington Post put up a Facebook video on Friday of Gov. Chris Christie speaking about his mothers addiction to cigarettes and his friends death from addiction, it wasnt with the expectancy that it would become one of the most watched videos on its Facebook account. Mr. Christie, of New Jersey, has been talking about drug overhaul since 2010, and he frequently touches on the subject on the campaign trail, as have other candidates, like Hillary Rodham Clinton.

title: New Barclays C.E.O. James Staley Buys $10 Million of Banks Shares
description: LONDON  James E. Staley, the incoming chief executive of Barclays, has bought shares in the British bank valued at about 6.5 million pounds, or about $10 million, the lender said on Thursday.

title: Reaching for Vigor, Jeb Bush Slips In Some Gentle Profanity
description: Eager to demonstrate urgency and vigor in his campaign, Jeb Bush seems to be testing a new tool: gentle profanity.

title: Review: In Spectre, Daniel Craig Is Back as James Bond, No Surprise
description: Does it mean something that James Bond drinks a dirty martini in Spectre, the latest in the seemingly unkillable franchise? Its too soon to know, though true Bondologists will be parsing this new drinks significance shortly. As more of an amateur in all-things Bond, I had hoped a dirty bomb would go boom or that the actress La Seydoux would do something unspeakable to Daniel Craig, given that the pre-credit sequence features female nudes writhing alongside an octopus with busy arms. Part of the bankable pleasure of the series, after all, is that every so often, among the usual guns and girls, the unexpected happens  a bikini stops the film, a villain revs it up, Bond surprises.

title: An Arts Explosion Takes Shanghai
description: In Shanghai, the historic Bund grabs much of the spotlight  the stretch of former banks and trading houses along the Huangpu River, built a century ago in a kaleidoscope of architectural styles, is a monument to the grandeur of another era. It can also be downright suffocating on weekends, with tourists jostling for selfie positions.

title: Review: In Spotlight, The Boston Globe Digs Up the Catholic Churchs Dirt
description: Spotlight won the Oscar for best picture. Read our complete coverage of the Academy Awards.

title: Labor Reform in Vietnam, Tied to Pacific Trade Deal, Depends on Hanois Follow-Up
description: HONG KONG  A pact between Washington and Hanoi to strengthen labor unions in Vietnam could give workers more bargaining power, but the impact will depend on how Vietnam carries out the agreement, longtime Vietnamese government advisers and other specialists said on Thursday.

title: First Draft Focus: Throwback Thursday  Rigors of Campaigning
Justin Timberlake Shows Crossover Appeal at C.M.A. Awards
description: Justin Timberlake, a musician who reached the upper echelons of pop music as an R&B artist, reminded the crowd at the Country Music Association Awards on Wednesday that hes a Memphis boy at heart.

title: Adeles Album Will Be Big. But Will It Be Streaming?
description: For Adeles millions of fans, perhaps the biggest question about her next album is whether its songs will pack the same emotional wallop that helped make her last record a global smash.

title: Nathan Lane: By the Book
description: The actor and author of Naughty Mabel owns a very dusty copy of The Complete Book of Abs: You know, for the pictures.

title: Equality, Then What? New Plays Explore Modern Gay Life
description: In 2011, when the New York State Legislature announced the passage of a marriage equality bill, Mark Gerrard and his partner, Tom Broecker, raced to celebrate outside the Stonewall Inn. In the middle of the laughter and the merriment and the dancing, Mr. Gerrard recalled a moment of uncertainty. So now were supposed to get married? he thought. Now were supposed to want to get married?

title: From Army of One to Band of Tweeters
description: IT was the end of a long combat patrol near a district called Adhamiyah, in northwest Baghdad, in the fall of 2008. It started like most daily missions but ended with a hidden enemy throwing a grenade at a vehicle convoy, missing it but hitting a young Iraqi child instead. As the company commander, I met the soldiers at the site and after a few hours followed them back to our base. I left the men, went to stow my equipment and brief other officers.

title: ISIS Claims It Struck Police in Bangladesh
description: NEW DELHI  The Islamic State, in statements attributed to it, claimed responsibility for an attack near the Bangladeshi capital that left one police officer dead and another wounded, according to the SITE Intelligence Group, which monitors extremist activity online.

title: The Giant Asparagus
description: Dear Diary:

title: A Disaster! Is Coming to Broadway
description: A camp musical inspired by 1970s disaster films may not give Hamilton a run for its money at the Tony Awards next year. But like Shelley Winters plunging in the waters to save Gene Hackman in The Poseidon Adventure, its sure going to try.

title: Pyramid Schemes and Overderp Dot Com
description: Just your daily reminder that its even worse than it looks, even if you know that its even worse than it looks. The frontrunner in the Republican primary says that the pyramids  which are, you know, mostly solid  were built by Joseph to store grain. Meanwhile, the company run by the Republican candidate for governor in Utah has been hoarding gold and silver in anticipation of the coming crisis.

title: A Post-Peronist President at Last?
description: BUENOS AIRES  The last time Argentina was scheduled to hold a presidential runoff election was 12 years ago. That occasion was very unusual in that the winning candidate, intimidated by the thin margin of his victory, decided to quit the field. Rather than risk losing in the second round of voting, he chose to step down, leaving the presidency to the candidate who had been the runner-up in the first round.

title: Twenty Designers on the Art That Inspires Them
description: In a new sale curated by Paddle8, Thom Browne, Donna Karan and more select the artworks that have influenced their designs.

title: China Moves to Crack Down on Counterfeit Disney Products
description: HONG KONG  Foreign brands have put up with rampant counterfeiting in China for years, but at least one company appears to have found a fairy godmother.

title: Currency Wars at the ZLB
description: Ricardo Caballero, Emmanuel Farhi, and Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas have a new theoretical paper on how to think about a worldwide liquidity trap. Im still working through the analytics, but its clearly consistent with the kind of thing Ive been saying for years.

title: Twenty Designers on the Art That Inspires Them
description: Art and fashion are famously symbiotic  but a new auction shows just how much designers have drawn influences from works of art. For a new sale on the site Paddle8, 20 American designers  including Michael Kors, Thom Browne, Francisco Costa and Diane von Furstenberg  have each picked one piece of art that has influenced their work; the proceeds of the sale will go to benefit the CFDA and its programs. (The Alice + Olivia designer Stacey Bendet Eisner has even donated a Francesco Clemente painting.) Click through the slide show here to see the work that inspires each designer  and why.

title: Release of Balmain x H&M Collection Creates Chaos in London
description: LONDON  How long would you wait in line on a damp November sidewalk to get your hands on a jacket? Five hours? Overnight? Two full days after taking a cross-continental flight?

title: Driven | 2016 Cadillac ATS-V Coupe
description: With inspiration and parts from Corvette, the ATS-V makes driving hard an easy thing to do.

title: Video Review: Cadillacs ATS-V, a Socially Refined Muscle Car
description: LETTERS can be so meaningful. M affixed to a BMW or AMG on a Mercedes-Benz seduces performance enthusiasts. The V, found on Cadillac, is the last of them alphabetically but possibly Speed Racers first consonant of choice. Seriously. The ATS-V sedan and coupe, built to take on C63, M3 and M4, is the real deal for taming tarmac. If only Cadillac had street cred.

title: Daily Report: Airbnb Is Ready to Take On Your City
description: Airbnb laid down the gauntlet on Wednesday to regulators: Dont try to curtail us.

title: Filling a Top Post, Netanyahu Reconsiders Nominee Who Insulted Obama

title: Regulator Censures Credit Suisse and Law Firms Over Bumi Deal
description: LONDON  Britains takeover regulator on Thursday publicly censured Credit Suisse and two law firms, Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer and Holman Fenwick Willan, over their roles as advisers in the creation of an Indonesian coal mining company formerly known as Bumi.

title: Chilean Community, Once a Site of Torture, Reinvents Itself for Tourists
description: VILLA BAVIERA, Chile  Claudio Pacheco took his family on an outing recently to Villa Baviera, a picturesque farming community tucked away in the foothills of the Andes. They ate a variety of German dishes and won a live deer in a raffle.

title: Senators Seek Information About RushCards Breakdown
description: Two senators sent a letter to the chief executive of the prepaid debit card company RushCard on Thursday, seeking information on the technical issues that prevented thousands of RushCard customers from accessing their money for days at a time last month and about the companys efforts to remedy the problems.

description: Villa Baviera, a community in Chile that is trying to attract tourists, was once a site of torture, abuse and executions.

description: In a showdown of unbeatens, the Warriors improved to 5-0, beating the Clippers, 112-108, Wednesday night. Draymond Green is hitting some 3s and Festus Ezeli is blocking some shots, but Golden States fast start is mostly due to superhuman performances by Stephen Curry.

title: Aung San Suu Kyi Seems to Have Myanmars Countryside in Her Corner
description: KWUN CHAN KONE, Myanmar  This village at the end of a long, bumpy dirt road in the Irrawaddy Delta would seem a natural stronghold for the former generals who rule Myanmar.

title: A Brief Guide to Myanmars Elections
description: On Sunday, more than 30 million voters across Myanmar can cast their ballots in the countrys first relatively free elections in 25 years. The nationwide vote is a milestone in the Southeast Asian nations transformation from isolated military dictatorship to a more open society, seeking to attract foreign investment and tourists.

title: Resistance to Authority in Greece as Pessimism Takes Hold
description: LONDON  Yiorgos Kaminis has the privilege and misfortune of being the mayor of Athens, the suffering heart of bankrupt Greece, marked by both the majesty of the Parthenon and a relentless wave of graffiti hooligans, whose work he does not have the money to scrape off.

title: A Wrong Turn for Guatemalan Democracy
description: Haverford, Pa.  GIVEN how dramatic Guatemalas politics have been of late, its fitting that an actor, Jimmy Morales, would cruise to victory over a former first lady, Sandra Torres, in last weeks presidential elections.

title: 1915: Spurious Night Clubs to Close
description: LONDON  The doom of the many spurious night clubs, which have become very numerous in London and other English cities, is now practically sealed. These clubs have been the cause of a succession of scandals, and Lord Curzon, moving the second reading of the Night Clubs Bill in the House of Lords yesterday, said that officers have, in some instances, been drugged and afterwards blackmailed in these resorts. The Night Clubs Bill, he said, is designed to put an end to a great scandal  namely, the rapid and unarrested growth of what are commonly called night clubs, which are really haunts of temptation and dens of iniquity.  The New York Herald, European Edition, November 6, 1915

title: What to Do This Weekend
description: Looking for something fun? Youre in luck. We can help.

description: Do you think the Sukkel twins are identical or fraternal? Take our quiz and see if you can figure out if Lilly and Abbie and six other twin pairs are identical or fraternal.

title: Transgender Students in High School Locker Rooms
Where to Eat, Pray and Shop in Seoul
description: Edie Campbell and her sister take a quick trip to Seoul to celebrate their mother, the British architect Sophie Hicks.

title: Edie Campbell on the Influence of Seoul
description: In between modeling during New York and London fashion weeks this September, I took a 48-hour break to fly to Seoul. My younger sister, Olympia, and I went for the opening party of a new store my mum, the British architect Sophie Hicks, had designed and built for the Stockholm-based fashion brand Acne Studios. Initially, it seemed a strange fit: a small piece of Scandinavia in South Korea.

title: Natural History Museums Expansion: Part Dr. Seuss, Part Jurassic Park
description: The American Museum of Natural History recently came out with some good news  a museum expansion that for once seems as if it could work.

title: Inquiry Opens Into Shooting Death of Boy, 6, in Louisiana Police Chase
description: It started as a police car chase in a town in central Louisiana. By the time the pursuit ended, on a dark dead-end street, a 6-year-old boy had been fatally shot in the front seat of a sport utility vehicle.

title: Marco Rubio Lashes Back at Donald Trump Over Credit Card Flap
description: CONCORD, N.H.  One day after declining to return fire at Donald J. Trump for ridiculing his past difficulties with a credit card, Senator Marco Rubio of Florida lashed back, mocking the real estate magnate for his own record of business bankruptcies.

title: Sold on Alabama
description: Images from a football Saturday at the University of Alabama in Tuscaloosa.

title: Patrick Kane Will Not Face Rape Charges
description: BUFFALO  Chicago Blackhawks right wing Patrick Kane, one of the N.H.L.s highest-profile players, will not face charges related to a claim by a woman that he raped her during the summer at his off-season home here in Erie County.

title: Decoding Keith Harings Early Works
description: The art dealer and curator Jeffrey Deitch is most fascinated by both bookends of an artists career  not just the late works, which are typically profound and full of reflection, but the first compositions, too. In the early periods, you get the exuberance, the promise, he explains. Sometimes you dont get the refinement, yet you feel this sincerity.

title: Serena Williams Thwarts Phone Theft, Complete With Highlight Video
description: Serena Williams is a world-class athlete and is seen as a living embodiment of the phrase girl power, but it appears that a man who seemed to try to steal her phone on Tuesday was due for a reminder. Even so, surveillance video suggests the encounter was not quite as dramatic as Ms. Williamss widely shared tale on Facebook.

title: Why Your Kids Love Snapchat, and Why You Should Let Them
description: In the picture that sprang to life on my phone, the girls hair was an unruly nest. Her eyes were crusty slits as she squinted, unsmiling, at the camera. She was still in bed, blankets askew. It is not a glamorous shot.

title: American Horror Story Season 5, Episode 5: We Have Two Selves
description: The Hotel Cortez is pretty sick. Theres the gratuitous depravity, of course, but what I really mean is that a virus is running rampant. The Countess calls it our precious virus, a sort of vampirism that, yes, keeps one young and beautiful, but also spreads death and destruction.

title: Wine Gift Options Abound for Thanksgiving
description: A good Thanksgiving guest has one responsibility and one elective. The responsibility is to carry out with good will whatever tasks, if any, have been assigned. The elective (and lets face it, good manners would call this a responsibility, too) is to bring a little something for the hosts.

title: Juror Excused From Sheldon Silvers Corruption Trial
description: The corruption trial of Sheldon Silver, the former speaker of the New York State Assembly, has already claimed its first victim: Juror No. 4.

title: Boeing to Pay $57 Million to Settle Suit Over Retirement Plan
description: Boeing has agreed to pay $57 million to settle a lawsuit that accused it of charging excessive fees and choosing higher-cost investment offerings for the workers and retirees who participate in its 401(k) retirement plan.

title: Ben Carson Releases Rap Ad on the Radio
description: A new 60-second radio ad by Ben Carsons campaign will begin airing Friday in eight markets  including Atlanta, Detroit and Miami. The Carson campaign is putting $150,000 behind the ad, titled Freedom, which takes the form of a rap song and is aimed at African-American voters.

title: House Passes $300 Billion Bill to Improve Roads and Bridges
description: WASHINGTON  The House on Thursday overwhelmingly approved a multiyear highway bill that includes more than $300 billion in transportation and infrastructure programs to address the nations deteriorating roads and bridges.

title: Public Theater Adds Transgender-Themed Musical to Season
description: The Public Theater is adding a musical about a transgender group of friends to its winter schedule, and putting out a direct call for transgender actors to audition.

title: Pilot Was Sole Victim of Plane Crash Off Queens Coast, Authorities Say
description: The cause of a plane crash off the coast of the Rockaway Peninsula this week remained unclear, investigators said on Thursday, even as officials confirmed that only one person was killed.

title: Team From Uncle Boons to Open Diner in NoLIta
description: Ann Redding and Matt Danzer, the married cooks who have drawn acclaim (and a Michelin star) for their no-holds-barred approach to Thai cuisine at Uncle Boons in NoLIta, are planning to shift away from Asia and toward heartland Americana with a new restaurant in the same neighborhood.

title: The Magazine Leaps Into Virtual Reality
description: The magazine editor, Jake Silverstein, on a new adventure in storytelling. Susan Lehman is the host.

title: The Naturally Alchemical Power of Gold Makeup
description: Gold makeup plays a part in some of the most irresistible female archetypes  the sun-kissed blonde bombshell, the ancient queen, the glittering disco diva. Think of Brigitte Bardot and her honey-bronzed skin, Cleopatra and her gold-leaf eyes and gilded-to-the-hilt Studio 54 girls like Veruschka, Jerry Hall and Grace Jones. Its no surprise that Ian Fleming, a master of male fantasy, dreamed up Auric Goldfinger, a villain who kills his bodacious victim by drenching her skin in gold paint. Watching golden girl Shirley Eatons metallic naked body glowing on pristine white sheets in the 1964 Bond movie, one feels like dying a golden death might not be such a bad thing.

title: Where to Go in the East Village of Des Moines
description: A once-desolate downtown edge is redefining the urban heart of Des Moines.

title: Grandchamps in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn
description: A restaurant wants to evangelize on behalf of Haitian food, but also serve the neighborhood.

title: Will Airport Security Accept Your Drivers License?
description: Come 2016, your state drivers license may not be enough to get you on a commercial flight.

title: 1935 | A Family Battle for Succession
description: Adolph S. Ochs did many things brilliantly, not least among them reinventing the moribund New York Times, which he purchased in 1896, as the newspaper of record.

title: You Us We All Creates a Baroque Vision of Modern Life
description: Early in the new opera You Us We All, two fashionable women of the 17th century, wearing elaborate wigs, gowns and corsets, sing about boredom while twilight gathers over modern-day Los Angeles. I forgetith how glorious the sunset is at thy infinity pool, one sings forlornly in pseudo-antique English, sipping a martini, her voice underscored by a Baroque ensemble.

title: Scientists Study Links Between Climate Change and Extreme Weather
description: Did climate change cause that heat wave? That hurricane? That drought?

title: Forbes Sues Integrated Whale Media Over Deal
description: A year ago, when Forbes Media agreed to sell a majority stake to a consortium of Asian investors, Steve Forbes, the chairman and editor in chief, said he got nearly everything he wanted out of the deal.

title: Review: The Secret World Inside You Explores the Microbial Human
description: There are trillions of them, crawling on you, and in you. This is the disturbing news that comes early in The Secret World Inside You, an exhibition that opens on Saturday at the American Museum of Natural History. Your body is teeming with bacteria, viruses and other microbes, a small video screen announces. The screen stands near the entrance, in a cosmic sea of tiny suspended lights, as sonorous space music pours forth in a sonic ooze.

title: For Taylor Swift and Drake, Friends Serve the Brand
description: This year, Taylor Swift took her blockbuster album 1989 on tour, and as much as it was a celebration of her blossoming into a full-fledged, gleaming pop idol, it also served as a treatise on the virtues  and perks  of friendship.

title: Watches that Take the Plunge
description: New sporty timepieces are elegant enough to handle any expedition.

title: For a Single Mother, an Alternate Reality
description: The sentimentalist in me has always appreciated the idea of an alternate reality. Like the mythical farm where parents claim to send the family dog after it meets a tragic fate, the alternate reality is a place where not-so-happy endings get a second chance.

title: For Brides in the Military, Free Gowns
description: Last-minute deployments, financial constraints and injuries suffered on duty can make it difficult for military couples to marry, much less organize and enjoy their weddings.

title: Grandchamps Welcomes You to Haiti, via Bedford-Stuyvesant
description: In a photograph on the wall of Grandchamps, a Haitian restaurant near the eastern edge of Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn, a woman in a sundress and long earrings carries a plate of seemingly just-gathered string beans. The image is bucolic and sternly glamorous at once, a reminder to the chef, Shawn Brockman (who happens to be the womans son-in-law) that she has trusted him with her recipes and he had better watch what hes doing.

title: Chelsea Boots for Fall
description: Five Chelsea boots for your fall wardrobe.

title: The Sleeker Side of Diving Watches
description: These watches are elegant enough to handle any expedition.

title: Barnes Foundation Names New Chief Curator
description: The Barnes Foundation  which is still feeling out its new identity in downtown Philadelphia after relocating in 2012 from its original home in the suburb of Merion, Pa.  announced Thursday that it had chosen Sylvie Patry, a longtime curator at the Muse DOrsay in Paris, to be its new chief curator and deputy director for collections and exhibitions.

title: David Vitter Is Dealt Setback in Louisiana Governors Race
description: Senator David Vitter has had a rougher road to the Louisiana governors office than he or most anyone expected, and on Thursday it got a little bit rougher. Lt. Gov. Jay Dardenne, one of Mr. Vitters Republican rivals in the primary, endorsed the Democrat in the runoff election, State Representative John Bel Edwards.

title: Voice for the Voiceless
description: As chairwoman of the New York City Commission on Human Rights, Carmelyn P. Malalis helps the citys most vulnerable citizens find justice.

title: Miranda Lambert, Carrie Underwood and Justin Timberlake at the C.M.A. Awards
description: Guests arrived dressed in their red-carpet finest (and sometimes sparkliest) for the Country Music Associations annual awards ceremony.

title: Carmelyn P. Malalis: Leading Through Praise, Not Fear
description: This interview with Carmelyn P. Malalis, chairwoman and commissioner of the New York City Commission on Human Rights, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Shooting in Queens Leaves 2 Teenage Friends Dead
description: They were two young men close in age, growing up next door to each other on a quiet street in Queens lined with narrow, two-story houses. That is how Peyton Manwaring and Marcus Mendez became friends.

title: Greeks Move to Meet Bailout Demands, but May Need to Do More
description: ATHENS  Greek lawmakers late on Thursday approved some of the economic changes that international creditors have demanded in order to unlock the first loan installment from the countrys bailout program. But the legislation pointedly lacks some of the main measures demanded by lenders.

title: Review: Aziz Ansari, in Master of None, Negotiates Technology and Social Mores
description: In the best episode of Netflixs Master of None  I think, its hard to pick just one  Dev (Aziz Ansari) wants tacos, but doesnt know where to go. So he whips out his laptop and smartphone, consults Google, Eater and Yelp, finds lists and reviews, dozens of them, New York Citys trendiest tortillas, dissected and annotated by social media. Finally he settles on a food truck said to have the most delicious tacos in the city.

title: Two Former Traders Found Guilty in Libor Manipulation Case
description: A jury in Manhattan on Thursday found two former London traders guilty in the first convictions in the United States stemming from the global investigation into the rigging of an interest rate benchmark known as Libor.

description: ASAP Rocky, Lake Bell, Raf Simons and Mark Ronson were among the celebrants at the Guggenheim International Gala pre-party.

title: Donald Trump Sent Sheldon Adelson a Glossy Booklet of Photos
description: During the hot months of summer, when Donald J. Trump was suddenly on top of the polls as the candidate who shunned fat cats and would finance his own campaign, the real estate developer sent a personalized memento to the casino magnate Sheldon Adelson.

title: Mars Atmosphere Stripped by Solar Winds, NASA Says
description: The air on Mars  what there is of it  is leaking away, about half a pound a second sputtering into space, scientists announced on Thursday.

title: 36 Hours in Bogot, Colombia
description: Colombias newly resurgent capital boasts beautiful colonial buildings, chef-driven restaurants and cool new cafes and galleries.

title: Matt Harvey Wins N.L. Comeback Player Award; Alex Rodriguez Denied in A.L.
