description: In the midst of my raging adolescence in 1979, my mother was devoting most of her time to a Jewish nursing home in Baltimore where she was the board president.

title: Detroit Businesswomen Team Up to Get Rape Kits Tested
description: In 2009, a Wayne County assistant prosecuting attorney noticed thousands of rape kits stacked on the shelves of a Detroit Police Department storage facility. The kits are used to collect and store DNA evidence obtained from sexual assault survivors. These particular kits had been in storage for up to 30 years, and their contents had never been processed or properly investigated.

title: Giants Punter Reclaims Spotlight After Winding Road From L.S.U.
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  In Australia, Brad Wing explained recently, kickers are a big deal. They are not called kickers; they are called scorers. In Australian rules football, the nations most popular sport, the men who kick the ball typically play full-forward, a focal position, where they call the plays, direct the offense and become sort of like, well, a quarterback.

title: Afghan President Calls Off Business Deal With Banker Convicted of Fraud
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Facing a public outcry, the Afghan president, Ashraf Ghani, has called off his governments recent business partnership with a felon who was supposed to be in prison for defrauding the countrys biggest private bank.

title: The Cyberthreat Under the Street
description: WITHIN the last year there have been 16 so-called fiber cuts in the San Francisco Bay Area. According to the F.B.I., someone or some group has been going through manholes to sever fiber optic cables that supply telecommunications to large sections of the region, which is home to technology companies, academic institutions and Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, overseer of the nations nuclear weapons.

title: Sex, Lies and Houston
description: I USED to be a child molester.

title: The Pakistan Nuclear Nightmare
description: With as many as 120 warheads, Pakistan could in a decade become the worlds third-ranked nuclear power, behind the United States and Russia, but ahead of China, France and Britain. Its arsenal is growing faster than any other countrys, and it has become even more lethal in recent years with the addition of small tactical nuclear weapons that can hit India and longer-range nuclear missiles that can reach farther.

title: The Dying of the Whites
How Doctors Helped Drive the Addiction Crisis
description: THERE has been an alarming and steady increase in the mortality rate of middle-aged white Americans since 1999, according to a study published last week. This increase  half a percent annually  contrasts starkly with decreasing death rates in all other age and ethnic groups and with middle-aged people in other developed countries.

title: Poppy Bush Finally Gives Junior a Spanking
description: WESTEROS  I VISITED HBOs Game of Thrones set in Belfast last week, and after watching Daenerys Targaryen in firelight for a couple hours, I learned how to say I have to go to the bathroom in Dothraki.

title: Turkeys Troubling ISIS Game
description: SANLIURFA, Turkey  ABOVE a restaurant specializing in sheeps head soup, with steaming tureens of broth in the window, two young Syrian journalists took up residence in this ancient town in southeastern Turkey. They had fled Raqqa, the stronghold in Syria of the Islamic State, or ISIS, and devoted their time to denouncing the crimes of the barbarous jihadi group. Today, their second-floor apartment is a crime scene, with a red police seal on the door.

title: David Linde
description: David Linde, a longtime film producer and executive formerly with Universal Studios, was recently named chief executive of Participant Media, a film and television production company that mines current events and social issues for subject matter.

title: What Scented Candles Say to an Economist
description: LONDON  ECONOMISTS pay too little attention to what is happening around them. Our record at forecasting economic growth has not recovered from the failure to predict the 2008 crash, yet the profession has not done enough to improve things.

title: The Price of Denialism
description: Weve all heard the phrase youre entitled to your own opinion, but not your own facts. Opinions are the sorts of things about which we can take a poll. They are sometimes well-informed, but rarely expected to be anything other than subjective. Facts, on the other hand, are out there in the world, separate from us, so it makes little sense to ask people what they think of them. As the comedian John Oliver so aptly put it in commenting on a recent Gallup poll that found that one in four Americans disbelieve in climate change: You dont need peoples opinion on a fact. You might as well have a poll asking: Which number is bigger, 15 or 5? Or Do owls exist or Are there hats?

title: Sweet Home Mississippi
description: PLUTO, MISS.  TO move from Lower Manhattan to rural Mississippi is probably the most extreme culture shock available in this country. To do it as an Englishman adds an extra twist. But I fell in love with an old farmhouse while visiting a friend in the Mississippi Delta, bought it for next to nothing, in New York terms, and persuaded my girlfriend, Mariah, to move there with me.

title: The Doctor Who Saved 100,000 Eyes
description: Nicholas Kristof travels to Nepal to meet an ophthalmologist who may have cured more people of blindness than anyone in history.

title: In 5 Minutes, He Lets the Blind See
description: HETAUDA, Nepal  WATCHING the doctor perform is like observing miracles.

title: Arbitrating Disputes, Denying Justice
description: In recent years, Americas corporations have created a private system for handling disputes that benefits them greatly while denying consumers their day in court.

title: In Seattle, a Campaign Finance Plan That Voters Control
description: On Tuesday, Seattle voters advanced the citys reputation for progressivism when they approved a bold and unusual campaign finance reform plan. The plan will draw on real estate taxes to give every registered voter $100 in democracy vouchers to spend on candidates in the next city elections.

title: I Am Paying for Your Expensive Medicine
description: YOU may not know it, but you could be on the hook to pay at least $124 this year for a drug you probably dont take.

title: Casualties of War
description: It has been 15 years since my mother called and asked, Do you have some time at the end of July or the beginning of August? Your father and I have decided to kill ourselves and we would like you to come and find our bodies.

title: Sundays Matchup: Jaguars at Jets
description: 1 p.m. Eastern, CBS

title: Sundays Matchup: Giants at Buccaneers
description: 4:05 p.m. Eastern, Fox

title: Volkswagen May Offer Cash to Ease Owners Ire
description: FRANKFURT  Volkswagen is expected to offer cash to the owners of diesel cars in the United States this coming week as it steps up an effort to recover some of the good will it lost after admitting in September that the vehicles were programmed to cheat on emissions tests.

title: While Time Marches On, a Referee Jogs, Sprints or Dashes
description: BAY SHORE, N.Y.  On a recent Sunday on Long Island, Joe Gaeta sprinted nearly 10 miles over the course of a four-and-a-half-hour workday. Wearing an exercise tracking device, Gaeta put in the kind of day that has become rather routine for him over the last quarter-century: He officiated four Police Athletic League youth football games, jogging across the gridiron more than three dozen times to back up a fellow officials call. He dashed 100 yards on three occasions to follow long scoring plays and sprinted to the end zone a dozen other times to chase touchdown jaunts of more than 40 yards.

title: And the 2016 Nominees May Be . . .
Hillary in History
description: ITS officially one year until the presidential election. Amazing how time flies, isnt it? Once again were watching debates featuring what appears to be the entire supporting cast of Ben-Hur. Once again were asking ourselves why Iowa always gets to be first. Once again were wondering whether Hillary Clinton will make history by becoming the first woman president.

title: Thomas S. Marvel, Architect of the Tropical, Dies at 80
description: Thomas S. Marvel, an architect whose regional style of modernism left an imprint on dozens of public buildings, churches and houses across the Caribbean, died on Tuesday at his home in San Juan, P.R. He was 80.

title: Kobe Bryant Hopes to Finish With a Flourish That Isnt Orchestrated
description: Do Kobe Bryant a favor and spare him the pregame testimonials, the gold-plated plaques, the sporty cars and easy chairs. Just deposit his check, give him the ball and get in his way.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Spending Less on Football, and Beating Alabama

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: A Putin Ally Is Found Dead in a U.S. Hotel
description: WASHINGTON  The police here said on Saturday that the department was continuing an investigation into the death of Mikhail Lesin, a former aide to President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia who helped design the governments takeover of independent media in that country. Mr. Lesin was found in a high-end hotel here on Thursday morning.

title: Candidates Stick to Script, if Not the Truth, in the 2016 Race
description: I only tell true stories, Carly Fiorina assured employees during one of her first speeches as the chief executive of Hewlett-Packard in 2000.

title: Web Poets Society: New Breed Succeeds in Taking Verse Viral
description: On a recent Friday night, Tyler Knott Gregson, a blond, tattooed poet from Montana, took the stage at a Manhattan bookstore and beamed at the crowd that had come to celebrate his new haiku collection.

title: Mississippi Flag, a Rebel Holdout, Is in a New Fight
description: LOUISVILLE, Miss.  In single strokes after the massacre of nine black churchgoers in Charleston in June, Confederate battle flags were taken from statehouse grounds in South Carolina and Alabama, pulled from shelves at major retailers like Walmart and declared unwelcome, if to limited effect, at Nascar races.

title: Three-peat
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  In an unusual turn of events, I got this theme fairly quickly, and I suspect that its because I solved John Farmers puzzle from last year, which has a similar theme. More about that in Tracy Grays notes below.

title: Judge Grants New Hearing for Adnan Syed in Serial Case
description: Adnan Syed, whose conviction in the murder of his high school ex-girlfriend was the subject of the popular Serial podcast, has been granted a hearing that will allow him to introduce new evidence.

title: Palestinians Channel Their Grief Through a Song for Solidarity
description: GAZA CITY  My Homeland was once a triumphant military song, played with drums and trumpets, long the anthem of Palestinians. It has since transformed into a lament of a tumultuous region.

title: Jason Pierre-Paul Likely to Play vs. Buccaneers
description: Giants defensive end Jason Pierre-Paul was added to the teams active roster Saturday, which makes it almost a certainty that he will play Sunday against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

title: A Dancer Is Driven to Succeed After a Homeless Childhood
description: For Sonya Ortiz, being a soloist in Martha Grahams dance company for teenagers and dancing at Radio City Music Hall for the Garden of Dreams Foundation were milestones, but her greatest achievement was getting into college.

title: Drought Adds Wrinkle to Rain Room Exhibit in California
description: LOS ANGELES  For Southern Californians struggling through the worst drought in the history of the state, relief may finally be here  or at least a sprinkle of relief. Rain has arrived, but it is confined to a 2,500-square-foot windowless room in a museum exhibition on the Miracle Mile, open to a handful of people who are let in for precisely 15 minutes to experience it in all its soaking, spritzing glory.

title: Passer Recovers and Puts Clemson in One Championship Game
description: CLEMSON, S.C.  Clemson faced a third-and-3 at the Florida State 7-yard line late in the first half when the Tigers star quarterback, Deshaun Watson, took the snap, stepped back and spiked the ball into the ground, thinking he had to stop the clock.

title: Cricket Exhibition at Citi Field Gets a Boost From Sachin Tendulkar
description: Just about every big-name cricket player of the last 25 years was at Citi Field on Saturday for an exhibition match. But the thousands of mostly South Asian-Americans who fought traffic or rode the crowded, slow-moving 7 trains to the stadium were mainly there to see one man: Sachin Tendulkar.

title: A Colorado Town Unfamiliar With Attention Deals With a Flood of It
description: CAON CITY, Colo.  The last time this tiny town with the big sexting scandal made national news headlines was probably after the forest fire that burned most of an iconic tourist attraction nearby, the Royal Gorge Bridge and Park. The time before that might have been a shooting, residents said. They could not remember any recent escapes from the high-security prisons that surround them and employ many of the townspeople, but they also could not remember any good news that had put the town in the national eye.

title: Mourners Gather to Remember Two Victims of Halloween Crash in the Bronx
description: Two coffins sat side by side on the stage at Harvest Fields Community Church in the Bronx as mourners gathered on Saturday to remember a beloved military veteran and his granddaughter who were struck and killed by a car while trick-or-treating on Halloween.

title: Neediest Cases: Sonya Goes to College
description: Despite spending her youth in and out of shelters, Sonya Ortiz not only graduated from high school but is attending college. With a little help, she is now pursuing her dreams.

title: Marco Rubios American Express Statements
description: Senator Marco Rubios campaign released American Express statements from 2005 and 2006 in response to questions about his use of a card belonging to the Florida Republican Party, saying that only eight of the charges were for personal expenses and that he had paid them off personally.

title: Marco Rubios Use of Party Credit Card Reinforces a Picture of Messy Finances
description: Newly released credit card statements from the years when Senator Marco Rubio was a young Florida legislator on the fast track to leadership show a pattern of falling behind on payments while mingling personal and political spending, disclosures that reinforce the image of a politician who has long struggled with messy finances, at home and in his career.

title: The Vote in Myanmar
description: Voting in Myanmar

title: Sarah Wilson and Steven Johnson
description: Sarah Whittingham Wilson, a daughter of Bonnie McVicker Wilson and Peter W. Wilson of Princeton, N.J., was married Saturday to Steven Brooks Johnson, a son of Susan Brooks of Atlanta and the late Michael R. Johnson. The Rev. Thomas R. Daniel IV, a Presbyterian minister and a stepbrother of the groom, officiated at TPC Jasna Polana, a golf club in Princeton.

title: Carolyn Press, Andrew Chatham
description: Carolyn Ilene Press, a daughter of Kathy A. Press and Dr. Robert A. Press, both of New York, was married Saturday evening to Andrew Hughes Chatham, a son of Elaine A. Chatham and Henry E. Chatham Jr., of Jackson, Miss. Benjy Weinberger, a friend of the couple who became a minister through American Marriage Ministries for the event, officiated at the Legion of Honor Fine Arts Museum in San Francisco.

title: Halley Epstein, Adam Josephs
description: Halley Wilder Epstein, the daughter of Melanie J. Epstein of Reisterstown, Md., and David S. Epstein of Ellicott City, Md., was married Saturday evening to Adam Michael Josephs, a son of Ronald H. Josephs of Encino, Calif., and the late Marilyn K. Josephs. Rabbi Jay R. Goldstein officiated at the George Peabody Library in Baltimore.

title: Daniella Gallego, Jason Wilson
description: Daniella Gallego and Jason Edward Wilson were married Saturday at St. Patricks Church in Bedford, N.Y. Msgr. George P. Thompson performed the ceremony.

title: Nedenia Craig and Reed Edmiston

title: The Best Moments in College Football This Week

title: L.S.U.s Surging Season Crashes Against Alabama
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala.  Last November, an Alabama team ranked fourth by the College Football Playoff selection committee hosted an undefeated Southeastern Conference rival ranked higher and, foreseeably, won.

title: 1965: African-American Seeks Cabinet Post
description: WASHINGTON  It has become an axiom in the Johnson era that if a man wants a high government post, the last thing he does is say so. And a newspaper story saying that an official desires a cabinet job, or is under consideration, is regarded as the surest path to early retirement. Consequently, it raised eyebrows in official Washington today [Nov. 8] when Robert C. Weaver, the highest- ranking Negro in the government, answered yes, when asked whether he wanted the cabinet post of secretary of the new Department of Housing and Urban Development. The department, still headless, comes into being at 12:01 a.m. tomorrow. President Johnson hasnt indicated his choice for the new cabinet post, and wont until early next year, according to a White House announcement over the weekend.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, November 9, 1965

title: Donald Trump Hosts Saturday Night Live Amid Protests
description: Donald J. Trump, making his first appearance on Saturday Night Live as a presidential candidate, was satirized by two well-coiffed doppelgngers, who attempted (admirably) to outboast him in matching red ties.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: My flags been flying for 33 years, and Im not about to take it down. It doesnt stand for hate. It means a lot of people fought and died.

title: Myanmars People Joyful in Voting, Even With Final Results Days Away
description: YANGON, Myanmar  Among the voters braving long lines at polling places across Myanmar on Sunday, there was a sense of jubilation at taking part in what many described as the first genuine elections in their lives.

title: Irans President Suggests Link Between Hard-Line Media and Arrests
description: TEHRAN  Irans president publicly criticized its hard-line media on Sunday, hinting that some outlets are connected to the security forces responsible for a wave of recent arrests in the country aimed at crippling Western influence.

title: Egyptian Military Files Charges Against Investigative Journalist
description: CAIRO  Egyptian military intelligence on Sunday detained an investigative journalist who is also the founder of Egypts premier human rights group on charges of publishing false news, raising alarms about attempts to suppress domestic dissent as the government grapples with questions about the crash of a Russian passenger jet.

title: Galvanized by VW Scandal, E.P.A. Expands On-Road Emissions Testing
description: Concerned that cheating on vehicle emissions could be prevalent across the automobile industry, regulators in the United States and Canada are significantly expanding their on-the-road emissions tests to cover all makes and models of diesel cars.

title: Volkswagen Says Whistle-Blower Pushed It to Admit Broader Cheating
description: FRANKFURT  Volkswagens recent disclosure that it reported false fuel economy and carbon dioxide readings to European regulators was prompted by an internal whistle-blower, the company said on Sunday.

title: 1940: Robbing Nazi Prisoner Is Legal Under British Law
description: LONDON  Delving 192 years back into musty English jurisprudence, an attorney quoted today [Nov. 8] a decision of the Kings Bench division in the reign of William III that a British subject is entitled to what he can take from the Kings enemies. The attorney obtained freedom for a member of the Home Guard, who had been charged with the theft of a German pistol, six rounds of ammunition and a flying helmet from a Nazi airman who had bailed out over Chatham, Kent. These articles were alleged to be the property of his majesty, but Gerald Thesiger, defending Harry Foulds, member of the Home Guard, cited the judgment of a prize court of 1748. That court had held that a subject was entitled to whatever he could take from the Kings enemies and that such property had never been vested in the crown.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, November 9, 1940

title: Republican Candidates Crisscross New Hampshire
description: With a November deadline approaching to file papers for gaining a spot on the ballot, many presidential hopefuls have spent a lot of time in the state.

title: G.O.P. Candidates, Lagging, Rely on New Hampshire to Get Close
description: CONCORD, N.H.  Jeb Bush rolled across this state last week in a bus, chomping on turkey jerky and ducking into diners, general stores and town halls to plead his case to voters.

title: Two Playwrights Will Share Prize in Honor of Philip Seymour Hoffman
description: Two plays exploring the relationships between young women competing in physical endeavors are the first recipients of a new play-writing award honoring Philip Seymour Hoffman.

title: Turning a Hoax Into a Spotlight on a Neglected Steinway Mansion
description: Robert S. Singleton calls the hoax that unfolded as summer turned to fall a stupid sideshow and a silly distraction.

title: Brooklyn Museum, Acknowledging Criticism, Reaches Out to Conference Protesters
description: Brooklyn Museum officials may have been taken by surprise last week when an artist circulated an open letter saying their decision to rent the museum to organizers of a real estate conference was promoting gentrification. But the museum responded Sunday with an acknowledgment of the criticism and a description of steps the institution was taking to address it.

title: Black Football Players Lend Heft to Protests at Missouri
description: COLUMBIA, Mo.  Students at the University of Missouri have been demonstrating for weeks for the ouster of the university president, protesting the schools handling of racial tensions. But their movement received a boost over the weekend when dozens of black football players issued a blunt ultimatum: Resign or they wont play.

title: Hillary Clinton Proposes More Research Into Medicinal Marijuana
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton on Saturday proposed reclassifying marijuana to make it a less dangerous substance and to encourage more research into its medicinal benefits.

title: Ben Carson Defends His Biography as Donald Trump Pounces
description: Ben Carson emphatically defended himself on Sunday against mounting claims that he has embellished his biography as his Republican rival, Donald J. Trump, sought to cast new doubt on the honesty of the retired neurosurgeon.

title: Review: Donald Trump on Saturday Night Live
description: Its been a running question of this years Republican primary cycle: Is Donald J. Trump a clown?

title: What to Watch Sunday
description: Tuning in to the Sunday morning political chitchat is kind of a no-brainer, isnt it? How about taking a chance on a new series like Flesh and Bone or Agent X, even if it promises more camp than quality? Or for some unadulterated fantasy before the reality of Monday morning strikes, travel the world with Julia Roberts in Eat Pray Love? Javier Bardem awaits you.

title: Leslie Uggams to Star in Colman Domingos Dot
description: Leslie Uggams will star in the title role of the New York debut of Colman Domingos Dot, coming to the Vineyard Theater on Feb. 23. Ms. Uggams, a Tony and Emmy award winner, will return to the New York theater for her first extended run since 2008s The First Breeze of Summer.

title: A Texas Utility Offers a Nighttime Special: Free Electricity
description: DALLAS  In Texas, wind farms are generating so much energy that some utilities are giving power away.

title: Backed by Nail Salon Owners, a New York Legislator Now Fights Reforms
description: In a packed hall in the Bronx a few months ago, Ron Kim, a New York State assemblyman, stood clutching a ceremonial pen in his left hand, the other extended into the crowd as labor advocates, politicians and immigrant rights workers thronged to shake it. Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo had just used the pen to sign into law a bill protecting nail salon workers from labor abuses and potentially dangerous chemicals. It was a measure that Mr. Kim, who represents the mostly Asian enclave of Flushing, Queens, had spent a painstaking summer helping to craft.

title: Yitzhak Navon, 94, Israeli Ex-President, Dies; Part of Founding Generation
description: JERUSALEM  Yitzhak Navon, who took part in the founding of Israel, served as its fifth president, from 1978 to 1983, in a largely ceremonial role, and then returned to politics as a Labor Party legislator and minister of education, died late Friday night at his home here. He was 94.

title: TED Prize Goes to Archaeologist Who Combats Looting With Satellite Technology
description: Her laptop brims with satellite images pitted with thousands of black dots, evidence of excavations across Egypt where looters have tunneled in search of mummies, jewelry and other valuables prized by collectors, advertised in auction catalogs and trafficked on eBay, a criminal global black market estimated in the billions of dollars.

title: Cartoon: Heng on Chinas Economy
description: For continuing growth, some reforms might be necessary.

title: French Artist Kills Off Chinese Alter Ego, but Some Knew of Ruse
description: Last week, a French artist living in Shanghai named Alexandre Ouairy received a wave of press attention for revealing that he had been exhibiting under the Chinese pseudonym Tao Hongjing for the past decade. According to news reports, he had assumed the pseudonym a decade ago, based on a suggestion by his gallerist, in order to cash in on the market there for Chinese contemporary art, a goldmine unavailable to an artist of French descent living in China. Now, on the eve of two solo shows  at Red Gate Gallery in Beijing and Shun Gallery in Shanghai  Mr. Ouairy was finally coming clean, acknowledging that the whole masquerade had been a conceptual art project.

title: Consensus Grows for Bomb as Cause of Russian Jet Crash, Officials Say
description: WASHINGTON  Senior House members said Sunday that there was a mounting consensus among American intelligence officials that a bomb brought down the Russian charter jet that crashed last month in the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt, killing all 224 people aboard.

title: Obama and Netanyahu: A Story of Slights and Crossed Signals
description: WASHINGTON  For President Obama, it was a day of celebration. He had just signed the most important domestic measure of his presidency, his health care program. So when Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel arrived at the White House for a hastily arranged visit, it was likely not the main thing on his mind.

title: Q. and A.: Geremie R. Barm on Understanding Xi Jinping
description: Read in Chinese |

title: Jets Get Late Breaks Against Jaguars and End Their Two-Game Skid
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Jets reached the midway point of their season Sunday, when they played their second game of November, that month in N.F.L. circles akin to moving day of a golf tournament: a time to get into position for the final push.

title: Review: A Wild Swan, Michael Cunninghams Scabrous Antidote to Happily Ever After
description: Anyone familiar with the work of Michael Cunningham knows that he holds the notion of happy endings in bittersweet regard. He said as much to The New Yorker this summer: And they lived happily ever after struck me as insufficient, and a bit of a cop-out. Happy all the time? Forever?

title: Review: Chang(e) Explores a Womans Self-Immolation
description: In the final moments of Chang(e), a docudrama at Here Arts Center, an artist and activist,Kathy Change, sets herself afire. This is not a spoiler. Self-immolation is how the real Kathy Change extinguished her life, in front of a peace sign sculpture on the campus of the University of Pennsylvania, one morning in 1996.

title: Peabody Energy Agrees to Greater Disclosures of Financial Risks
description: Peabody Energy, the worlds biggest private sector coal company, has agreed to make more robust disclosures to its investors about the financial risks it faces from future government policies and regulations related to climate change and other environmental issues that could reduce demand for its product.

title: Trying to Draw In Fans, Islanders Dip Into New Palette
description: Step by step, the Islanders are trying to become part of the Brooklyn landscape, playing at a new home rink while trying new methods to build their fan base.

title: Montage of Heck: The Home Recordings, a Kurt Cobain Soundtrack
description: Even after eight years of contemplating Kurt Cobain for an authorized documentary, the writer and director Brett Morgen had trouble closing the vault.

title: Review: Eric Yves Garcias Pour Spirits, a Taste of Musical Role-Playing
description: Who is Eric Yves Garcia? This talented singer and pianist whose witty, hyper-verbal new show, Pour Spirits, opened at the Metropolitan Room on Thursday evening, is as mysterious as his programs ambiguous title. Is it a tribute to spirits, as in alcohol? Is pour to be taken as a pun on poor to elicit sympathy?

title: By Holding Off Packers, the Panthers Make the N.F.C. Theirs to Lose
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  The Green Bay Packers and the Seattle Seahawks have stood atop the hierarchy in the N.F.C. for years, with the Carolina Panthers a step behind and their quarterback, Cam Newton, a rung below Aaron Rodgers and Russell Wilson.

title: Ben Roethlisberger Injury Dulls Steelers Victory Celebration
description: The Pittsburgh Steelers finally looked like they were back to normal on offense, with Ben Roethlisberger piling up 334 passing yards against the Oakland Raiders, but a foot injury late in the game could send the quarterback back to the bench indefinitely, casting doubt onto the teams playoff chances.

title: Arne Duncan, Education Secretary, Sees Challenges for U.S. Colleges
description: WASHINGTON  American higher education is the envy of the world, with the most renowned universities attracting young men and women from around the globe.

title: For N.F.L.s Injury Carts, a History That Expands Beyond Tunnel to Field
description: One by one they roll onto the football field, accompanied by a hush, and carry the wounded away.

title: Invader Will Bring His Signature Street-Art Mosaics to New York
description: PARIS  While the eyes of many in the art world are trained on the big New York auctions this month, an emissary from a dissident faction will be at work nearby, as the French street artist known as Invader brings his signature pixelated mosaic works back to the city.

title: Review: Volmir Cordeiro, Assuming an Aspiring Celebritys Identity
description: Volmir Cordeiro, carefully placing one long leg in front of the other like a spindly supermodel, took deliberate steps to the front of the stage where he planted himself to talk about Ins, a 57-year-old with an all-too-common affliction: an insatiable need to be famous.

title: Babies (Aww )
description: MONDAY POST  Aww  look how cute! Its a delightful puzzle by Pawel Fludzinski to start off our solving week.

title: Review: Robin Rhode Takes Schoenbergs Erwartung to the Street (Broadway, No Less)
description: Like many, Ive walked through Times Square and experienced something I can only properly call despair. But I tip my hat to the lady who was drifting, crouching, shrieking and generally existing just past the verge of a nervous breakdown between 42nd and 43rd Streets on Broadway early Saturday evening. Even at my worst, she had me beat.

title: Review: Axiom Displays Its New-Music Range at Alice Tully Hall
description: Thomas Adss quartet Catch seems like a parody of chamber dynamics, a mini-drama featuring an insecure musician, ego clashes and temporary defections. The humorous piece, written in 1991, when Mr. Ads was a student, is scored for piano, violin, cello and clarinet: The first three instruments cajole the clarinetist into joining the proceedings.

title: A Selfless Caretaker, First as a Daughter, Now as a Mother
description: At 13, Celeste Lawton was sticking needles in her mothers arms: Melody Banks needed insulin injections to combat her diabetes, and there was no one else to help when the nurse was off duty.

title: Boxing Is a Brutal, Fading Sport. Could Football Be Next?
description: The sweet science. That was the lofty sobriquet assigned to boxing long ago by devoted followers with a romantic flair. But there came a time when the fight games hold on the American spirit began to loosen, when it stood widely condemned as plain brutal.

title: A Diminished Kobe Bryant Still Finds a Warm Welcome at the Garden
description: The anticipatory murmurs swelled up the Madison Square Garden stands like an incoming wave each time Kobe Bryant held the basketball in his hands.

title: Nevada State Director for Bernie Sanders Is Leaving the Campaign
description: As Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont prepares for a major rally in Nevada on Sunday, his state director there is leaving the campaign, an aide to the candidate confirmed.

title: Yales Halloween Advice Stokes a Racially Charged Debate
description: Weeks of simmering racial tension at Yale University boiled over in recent days into a debate over whether the administration was sensitive enough to concerns about Halloween costumes seen as culturally offensive, students and adminstrators said.

title: A Pilot and Holocaust Survivors, Bound by Wars Fabric, Are Reunited in Brooklyn
description: You never know when a pistol pointed in wartime will lead to hours of emotional blessings in Brooklyn 70 years later.

title: Regulators Urge Broader Health Networks
description: WASHINGTON  The nations insurance commissioners are recommending sweeping new standards to address complaints from consumers about limited access to doctors and hospitals in health plans sold under the Affordable Care Act.

title: General Counsel for Al Jazeera America Appears to Be Unlicensed
description: David W. Harleston, an executive who serves as general counsel for the media company Al Jazeera America, has had a busy year.

title: University of Missouri Football Players Exercise Power in Racism Protest
description: The news out of Columbia, Mo., this weekend is disturbing yet also exhilarating.

title: Giants Escape With Win and Credit Jason Pierre-Paul With Helping
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Trying to take the measure of the Giants season is like watching a leaf blow across a windswept landscape. Swiftly, the Giants have ascended, climbing to startling heights, and just as suddenly they have plummeted, grimacing through stomach-churning nose dives.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Nov. 9
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: VW Announcement, a Strike Planned in Greece and Retail Data
description: On Monday, Volkswagen is expected to announce that it is offering cash to the owners of diesel cars in the United States as it steps up its effort to recover some of the good will it lost after admitting that the vehicles were programmed to cheat on emissions tests.

title: A Digital Team Is Helping Obama Find His Voice Online
description: WASHINGTON  As the Internet exploded recently with the story of the 14-year-old Muslim boy arrested for taking a homemade clock that was mistaken for a bomb to his school in Texas, President Obamas small army of social media specialists wasted no time.

title: With Some Surprising Losses, the Playoff Picture Begins to Crystallize
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala.  The football gods must have felt that Saturday nights Louisiana State-Alabama game was not quite historic enough in its magnitude. In the late afternoon, the rain that had threatened to flood the area halted, and an hour before kickoff, any likely possibility that the winner would not be competing for a playoff spot in December was eliminated.

title: An Old Face on the Palm Steakhouses Wall Relocates, With His Family Included
description: So Herbert E. Nass did not have a face-lift after all. He got a new face, in a new place.

title: Bonus Pay on Wall Street Is Likely to Fall, a Report Says
description: Even as they emerge from the post-financial-crisis haze, bankers are seeing few signs that their institutions  and their bonuses  will stage a full recovery anytime soon.

title: Months After Blasts in China, Rebuilding Tianjin Homes and Lives Is a Struggle
description: TIANJIN, China  Under different circumstances, the emerald-green sod and newly planted ash and peach trees that dominate the view outside Li Junhuas deserted apartment building would be a welcome sight in Vanke Port City, a sprawling complex of high-rise condominiums in a showcase economic development zone here.

title: 9-Year-Old Girl Is Killed by a Pit Bull on Long Island
description: A 9-year-old girl was attacked by a pit bull in the back yard of a home in Elmont, N.Y., on Sunday, and died from her wounds shortly thereafter, the police said.

title: A Ferry Parked in Maine, Leaving No Wake but Debts
description: PORTLAND, Me.  This citys harbor, which glows almost indigo under clear skies, is a thoroughfare for the hallmarks of a working waterfront: tugboats, oil tankers and fishermen unloading the days catch.

title: A Castle Receives a Weekly Delivery of Delhis Secret Desires
description: NEW DELHI  Those wishing to know the secret desires of the people of Delhi can find them here, in petitions pinned to the wall of a 14th-century castle, addressed to supernatural beings created of smokeless fire.

title: Track and Field Braces for Corruption Reports Findings
description: Track and fields profound crisis is expected to deepen on Monday when an independent commission appointed by the World Anti-Doping Agency presents its findings in Geneva.

title: Confirmation of Attack on Russian Jet May Strengthen Putins Resolve in Syria
description: MOSCOW  The main bell in St. Isaacs Cathedral in St. Petersburg tolled 224 times on Sunday, once for each victim of the destruction of a Russian charter flight in Egypt a week ago.

title: Classic Comic Strips Will Return to Newspapers in Special Insert
description: Next Sunday, hundreds of newspapers around the country will give their comics readers a special treat: a colorful 16-page insert of classic newspaper strips.

title: Breakthrough Prizes Give Top Scientists the Rock Star Treatment
description: The richest awards in science were handed out Sunday as the Breakthrough Prize organization presented a total of $21.9 million to physicists, mathematicians, life scientists and one talented teenager.

title: Handful of Liberians Running to Prove a Point About Ebola
description: MONROVIA, Liberia  Theres a saying in Liberia: When wartime comes, the foot will help the body. On Sunday, Liberians lined up at the ELWA hospital compound were invoking this favorite phrase to help explain the confounding sight of their fellow countrymen running in a marathon.

title: Manhattan Woman, 88, Is Fatally Struck by Taxi
description: Nearly 16 hours after beginning his shift behind the wheel of a yellow cab, a driver struck and killed an 88-year-old woman as she crossed an Upper Manhattan street with the right of way early Sunday morning, a police official said.

title: Red Bulls Advance at Expense of an Old Rival
description: HARRISON, N.J.  This is a long, mean rivalry, one that dates back two decades and features many spikes-up tackles. On a Sunday afternoon with so much at stake, D.C. United was not about to make life easy for the Red Bulls, refusing to play pretty soccer against one of the more entertaining, attacking teams in Major League Soccer.

title: A Suspicious Death
description: These select documents are related to the trafficking and death of Eril Andrade, a Filipino seafarer who worked on a Taiwanese fishing ship.

title: Recreating a Captives Surroundings by Filming Room in a Box
description: LOS ANGELES  Filming the movie version of the novel Room, in which Joy Newsome, played by Brie Larson, and her son, Jack, played by Jacob Tremblay, are held captive in a small garden shed, was a challenge.

title: Donald Trump Questions Ben Carsons Honesty, Despite Own Record
description: Donald J. Trump, who has taken well-documented liberties with facts from his own life story and from his campaign for president, sought repeatedly on Sunday to cast doubt on the honesty of Ben Carson, his surging Republican rival.

title: In the Stream of Internet Radio, Music Stations Hold Their Own
description: SEATTLE  Internet radio was supposed to squash small FM music stations like KEXP. Someone forget to tell that to KEXP, the little station that has helped start the careers of big music acts like the Lumineers and Macklemore and Ryan Lewis.

title: Mondays Matchup: Bears (2-5) at Chargers (2-6)
Hollywood Is Producing Higher Highs, Lower Lows
description: For months, American moviegoers have either been going big or staying home.

title: Review: Allegiance, a Musical History Lesson About Interned Japanese-Americans
description: Allegiance, a new musical about the internment of Japanese-Americans in camps during World War II, could be said to suffer from a problem of divided loyalties, and Im not referring to its characters. The show wants to illuminate a dark passage in American history with complexity and honesty, but the first requirement of any Broadway musical is to entertain. While well-intentioned and polished, Allegiance struggles to balance both ambitions, and doesnt always find an equilibrium.

title: Review: Hir Sorts Through a Family in Transition
description: You may think youve seen just about every variation on the dysfunctional family play. Adultery? Check. Sexual abuse? Check. Drug addiction, incest, alcoholism. Check, check and  yawn  check.

title: The Walking Dead Recap: Season 6, Episode 5, Now
description: Toward the end of this weeks The Walking Dead, Maggie, dejected and wandering through a sewer of waterlogged walkers and broken dreams, collapsed into an emotional heap of Glenn-grief, self-recrimination and anguished uncertainty.

title: The Leftovers Season 2, Episode 6 Recap: Her Eye Is on the Sparrow
description: The Leftovers excels at many things, but its greatest strength may be its ability to convey so much narrative information so naturally. This weeks episode, Lens  which deftly explains a ton of back story and demystifies previously cryptic details  is a master class in how thats done. By the end of the hour, we know why there are numerical markers on the streets of Miracle (theyre part of the audio tour); we know why Jerry keeps killing goats (because he killed one on that fateful Oct. 14, and many think thats what made Miracle immune from departures); we know that Erika was planning to leave John; and we know why she buried that bird, and why (well, sort of) it emerged from that shoebox alive.

title: Homeland Season 5, Episode 6: Everyone Seems Off-Kilter
description: This recap contains spoilers for Sundays episode of Homeland.

title: On Screens and in Windows, Lowes Gives (and Gives, and Gives) How-To Help
description: As millennials begin to put down roots, Lowes, the home improvement chain, has been offering them tips for mending cracks, drips and scuffs with Fix in Six, a series of quirky how-to videos that it began posting two years ago on Vine, a mobile platform for short videos that play on a loop.

title: Detention of Egyptian Journalist Prompts Outrage Online
description: The arrest of Hossam Bahgat, one of Egypts leading investigative journalists, by Egyptian military intelligence on Sunday prompted an outpouring of concern, solidarity and outrage on social networks.

title: At Least 4 Killed and 14 Injured in Crash in Maryland
description: At least four people, including a child, were killed in Maryland on Sunday when a pickup truck collided with a van carrying more than a dozen people.

title: The Affair Season 2, Episode 6: Custody Fight
description: It was a tale of two custodies on The Affair on Sunday night, in an episode that departed from the shows usual format. Instead of covering overlapping time periods from different points of view, the Helen and Noah chapters took place several weeks apart  before and after they resolved their battle over the custody of their four children.

title: Review: In Olga Pericet: Flamenco Untitled, the Dancer Maintains Control
description: The flamenco dancer Olga Pericet may be a tiny thing, but she knows how to fill a stage. Shes also lightning quick with a shawl  but more on that later.

title: The Best of Week 9 in the N.F.L.
description: Antonio Brown set Steelers marks with 284 receiving yards and 17 catches, including a 57-yarder on the games final drive that set up a winning field goal. I really dont know what to say but wow, said Raiders safety Charles Woodson, who spent most of the day futilely chasing Brown around Heinz Field. Brown and DeAngelo Williams, who ran for 170 yards and two scores and had 55 receiving yards, combined for 531 of Pittsburghs 597 yards of offense.

title: N.B.A. Game of the Week: Spurs at Trail Blazers
description: Every week, The New York Times will choose one essential game to watch, highlighting hot teams, winning and losing streaks and statistical intrigue in the N.B.A.

title: Fire at Christmas Island Detention Center Follows Refugees Death
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Parts of an Australian-run detention center on Christmas Island were on fire early Monday amid anger over the weekend death of a Kurdish Iranian refugee.

title: What to Watch Monday
description: Its Monday, and in TV land that spells mobsters  from The Departed, Martin Scorseses Oscar-winning film, to Umbre, HBO Europes Romanian crime drama (think an Eastern European Sopranos), with a stop in the wintry war zone of Fargo. Meanwhile, Jane the Virgin dances with Britney Spears, and James Spader spanks Maggie Gyllenhaal in Secretary.

description: A new type of sale at Phillips on Sunday night began a week of big-ticket auctions of contemporary, modern and Impressionist art in New York that is projected to fetch at least $1.4 billion at three auction houses.

title: Detective Shoots Man Who Tried to Rob Officers in Brooklyn, Police Say
description: A detective investigating a robbery in Brooklyn shot a young man on Sunday evening after he pulled a gun and tried to rob a group of detectives on the street, the police said.

description: NATIONAL

title: Thick Smog in Shenyang, China, Draws Even State Medias Scorn
description: When it comes to PM2.5 pollution  tiny, grungy particles discharged into the air by factories, boilers and motor vehicles, which damage respiration  the Chinese government says 35 micrograms per cubic meter is a healthy maximum.

title: Tricked and Indebted on Land, Abused or Abandoned at Sea
description: LINABUAN SUR, the Philippines  When Eril Andrade left this small village, he was healthy and hoping to earn enough on a fishing boat on the high seas to replace his mothers leaky roof.

title: The Right Leader for New Yorks Courts
description: The job of running New York States highest court is open once again, and Gov. Andrew Cuomo has an important decision to make in filling it.

title: Prisons and Jails Put Transgender Inmates at Risk
description: During the many months she spent in immigration detention centers and a county jail, Estrella Snchez, who is seeking asylum, became used to mockery from guards, taunts from fellow inmates and a deep sense of isolation.

title: Ben Carson and the Truth
description: Ben Carson appears to have a somewhat complicated relationship with the truth, or at least that is the picture emerging of him as new challenges to the truthfulness of his biography surface.

title: Being Dishonest About Ugliness
description: ADULTS often tangle themselves in knots when discussing physical appearance with children. We try to iron out differences by insisting they dont matter, attribute a greater moral fortitude to the plain or leap in defensively when someone is described as not conventionally attractive, or  worse  ugly or fat. After all, there are better, kinder words to use, or other characteristics to focus on.

title: Despair, American Style
description: A couple of weeks ago President Obama mocked Republicans who are down on America, and reinforced his message by doing a pretty good Grumpy Cat impression. He had a point: With job growth at rates not seen since the 1990s, with the percentage of Americans covered by health insurance hitting record highs, the doom-and-gloom predictions of his political enemies look ever more at odds with reality.

title: Are We Raising Sexist Sons?
E.L.L. Practice | Helping the Homeless
description: Note: Every Monday during the 2015-16 school year, we present a special post for English Language Learners. Each focuses on one topic and offers an interactive quiz and a writing prompt.

title: Myanmar Election Has Aung San Suu Kyis Party Confident of Landslide
description: YANGON, Myanmar  After struggling against the heavy hand of the Burmese military for two and a half decades, the opposition party of the Nobel Peace Prize laureate Daw Aung San Suu Kyi said Monday that it was confident of a sweeping victory in the countrys landmark nationwide elections.

title: White People Need to Leave Cornrows Alone: Readers Debate a Controversial Hairstyle
description: Readers discuss whether cornrows can be worn by everyone or whether they belong to black culture.

description: Before Reading No Justice, No Football on a Missouri Campus:

title: An Island Refuge, Surrounded by Bloody Civil War, in South Sudan
description: UNITY STATE, South Sudan  The swamp is so large it can be seen from space. During the rainy season, it stretches over an area the size of France, a forbidding maze of reeds and crocodiles that long warded off even the most intrepid of explorers searching for the source of the Nile, whose waters flood these clay plains.

title: Cubas Secret Bedrooms
description: Carlos Otero Blanco has seen parts of his native Cuba that are off-limits to most people. He does not need a security clearance, just a smile and small talk. Given the pushback he sometimes gets, it might just be easier to photograph the Council of State.

title: F.C.C. Sides With Hot Spots, and Hospitality Industry Feels a Chill
description: Fed up with Internet charges that can range into six figures, more meeting planners are instead using mobile hot spots to connect at conferences and conventions. But their efforts have at times been stymied, when the venues have electronically blocked the transmissions.

title: Democratic Group Called iVote Pushes Automatic Voter Registration
description: WASHINGTON  As Republicans across the country mount an aggressive effort to tighten voting laws, a group of former aides to President Obama and President Bill Clinton is pledging to counter by spending up to $10 million on a push to make voter registration automatic whenever someone gets a drivers license.

title: How to Upgrade Your Thanksgiving Road Trip
description: While talk of Thanksgiving travel often centers around the cost and tribulations of flying, during the holiday weekend more Americans actually hit the road.  AAA estimated that nearly 90 percent of Thanksgiving travelers in 2014 would go by automobile, with about 46 million people driving 50 miles or more from home. This year, why not make the journey more enjoyable? After all, you could spend hours sitting in traffic. Or maybe dinner at your cousins house wasnt as tasty, er, filling, as you had hoped. Everyone knows to bring along the usual accessories, like phone chargers and tablet mounts. But certain extras can help shift a ho-hum road trip into the next gear. Below, a guide.

title: Would You Want to Hang Out at a Cat Cafe?
description: What do you know about so-called cat cafes? Do you like cats? What about other animals?

title: Jon Meachams Destiny and Power: The American Odyssey of George Herbert Walker Bush
description: George H. W. Bush is unusual among modern American presidents in that after he left the White House in 1993 he never produced his own full-scale autobiography. True, he co-wrote a book about his administrations foreign policy with Brent Scowcroft, his national security adviser, and then allowed a collection of his letters and diary excerpts to be published. But he showed no interest in writing the kind of doorstopper others have given us, nothing on the order of RN: The Memoirs of Richard Nixon, Ronald Reagan: An American Life or Bill Clintons My Life. Even Hillary Clinton, who may yet be president and thus get her own chance to add to the genre, has already written two thick memoirs, either of which, if you accidentally dropped it on your foot, might leave you limping.

description: Edelson PC is a class action law firm that specializes in suing tech companies for alleged privacy violations. The firm has sued pretty much every big tech firm youve heard of  Google, Facebook, Apple, Amazon, Netflix  so Silicon Valley hates them.

description: With a month to go before Congress must finish its 12 spending bills or face another case of shutdown fever, the Senate returns on Monday to focus on one of the least contentious of the measures  legislation funding veterans and military construction programs.

title: Taiwan Debates Its Presidents Meeting With Xi Jinping of China
description: While Chinese commentary was resoundingly positive about Saturdays meeting between President Xi Jinping of China and President Ma Ying-jeou of Taiwan, reactions in Taiwan to the historic encounter were decidedly mixed.

title: Obama and Netanyahu to Meet After a Tense Year
description: After months of long-distance jousting over the Iran nuclear deal, President Obama and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel will meet on Monday for the first time in more than a year and try to put their feuding behind them.

title: Good Talks Needed to Combat HPV Vaccine Myth
description: When people hear about vaccine deniers  anti-vaxxers, to some  they most often think about parents who are refusing to vaccinate their children. But theres another type of vaccine refusal, and its important that we not ignore that. Doctors sometimes promote the use of some vaccines with less enthusiasm than others. Sometimes, they dont talk about them at all.

title: Bernie Sanders Takes His Turn Questioning the Questioners
description: Republicans have made a sport out of critiquing those posing the questions in this years presidential campaign.

title: Regulators Propose New Rules to Ease Strain of Bank Failures
description: LONDON  A group of financial policy makers has outlined a new framework intended to keep banks around the world from becoming too big to fail and requiring government bailouts in a future financial crisis.

title: Donald Trump Advertises Rising Value of Free Political Publicity
description: Donald J. Trump hosted Saturday Night Live this past weekend and gave interviews to at least four national television networks on Sunday. The result: an opportunity to reach millions of potential voters, without spending a dime.

title: In a Corner of New York City That Goes Back Into the 70s, Gunman Kills One and Wounds Two
description: Sandwiched between the gleaming towers rising over the West Side of Midtown Manhattan and the bright lights of 42nd Street, a corridor of brown brick buildings along Eighth Avenue shrouds the remnants of an earlier era of New York City street life. The drug-addled loll on corners. The pornography seekers slink out of shops.

title: Standard Life Chairman to Join Barclays Board
description: LONDON  The chairman of the insurer Standard Life will join Barclays in January as deputy chairman and senior independent director, the British bank said on Monday.

title: Jordanian Police Officer Kills Five, Including Two Americans
description: AMMAN, Jordan  At least five people, including two American trainers, were killed on Monday at an Amman training compound by a Jordanian police officer who fired on them before he was shot to death, the government said.

description: The Slinky, which first appeared in the Gimbels department store in Philadelphia 70 years ago this month, didnt start out as a toy.

title: How a Small Indie Magazine Gets Fashions Hottest Tell-Alls
description: When Raf Simons left Christian Dior just over two weeks ago  a designer departure felt round the world  he did so with the usual anodyne joint news release containing generic quotes in which he and Dior management expressed their mutual appreciation and respect. That, they said, was the end of it; no one involved was giving any further interviews.

title: Google Offers Free Software in Bid to Gain an Edge in Machine Learning
description: A race is underway toward the future of computer technology with advances in a branch of artificial intelligence known as machine learning. Machine-learning software is trained to handle vast amounts of data, and then learns as it goes, often on its own.

title: 1940: De Gaulle Strikes in Africa
description: VICHY  The situation in French Africa became more tense today [Nov. 9] as reports reached here that Free French forces headed by Gen. Charles de Gaulle and Gen. de Larminat, after conquering Lambarn, in the interior of Gabon, French Equatorial Africa, had effected a landing near Libreville, the most important seaport of Gabon. British light naval units supported the landing, it was reported here. The Vichy government asserted yesterday that Libreville would remain loyal to the government of Premier Marshal Henri Ptain. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, November 10, 1940

title: Match Is Seeking $3.1 Billion Value in I.P.O.
description: The Match Group is seeking a valuation of about $3.1 billion as it prepares for an initial public offering.

title: Drugs Pervade Sport in Russia, World Anti-Doping Agency Report Finds
description: GENEVA  Members of Russias secret service intimidated workers at a drug-testing lab to cover up top athletes positive results. They impersonated lab engineers during the Winter Olympics in Sochi last year. A lab once destroyed more than 1,400 samples.

title: Daily Report: Using the Web to Transform Public Radio
description: Video  not to mention online music streaming  was supposed to kill the radio star. Instead, some longtime radio stations have found a way to transform and use all the new Internet outlets to thrive, Nick Wingfield writes.

title: Sunday TV Recaps: Homeland, The Walking Dead, The Affair and The Leftovers
description: Recaps of select Sunday night series.

title: Darth Jar Jar and the Wisdom of Fans
description: During what was a relatively slow timefor political news last week, up to and including the Ben Carson West Point controversy, the nerdier reaches of the political internet (but I repeat myself) spent a lot of time on two Star Wars-related conversations.First, the elaborate theory, first spun out by a Reddit user, that the hated Jar Jar Binks was originally supposed to be a Yoda-style Force master, a Dark Side adept cloaking his powers in bungling and clowning, until the backlash against his character persuaded George Lucas to bury the idea. Second, the controversial defenses of the Empire being spun out by Sonny Bunch (standing on the shoulders of Jonathan Last), and contested by Jediapologists and rebel sympathizers on the left, center and right alike up to and including one Senator Ted Cruz.

title: Creditors Withhold 2 Billion Euro Bailout Payment From Greece
description: ATHENS  Greeces international bailout program has hit snags, delaying release of the next payout of rescue money.

title: Conviction Offers Guide to Future Spoofing Cases
description: The recent conviction of Michael Coscia in the Federal District Court in Chicago in the first prosecution for spoofing provides more clarity to high-frequency trading firms about how they can operate. The message is to tread carefully when a strategy depends on using orders that will be quickly canceled because the government may claim they are an effort to manipulate the market by fooling others into trading.

title: As China and Europe Age, Path to More Children Lies Beyond Bedroom
description: LONDON  Chinas decision to allow more families to have a second child is an effort to confront a problem that is facing much of Europe, too  aging populations and not enough babies. But reversing a demographic slide involves a complicated set of incentives that have more to do with social mores than with government policies, experts say.

title: Ben Carson Backers Ramp Up Counterattack, Highlighting His Medical Career
description: With his biography under the microscope, supporters of Ben Carson are digging in with new plans to highlight the Republican presidential candidates most clear-cut credential: his career as a renowned neurosurgeon.

title: Russia Says Stalled Arms Deal With Iran Is Signed and Active
description: MOSCOW  Russias most senior arms executive said Monday that a contract to supply Iran with powerful S-300 air defense missiles was now active. But with no delivery date or any other details, the announcement seemed aimed more at warding off an Iranian lawsuit than a major step toward delivery of the weapon system.

title: Key Figures in the Russian Doping Scandal
description: Here is a look at the officials and athletes named in the World Anti-Doping Associations report on Russian doping.

title: Software Maker Atlassian Files to Go Public
description: Atlassian, a maker of development and collaboration software for companies, filed on Monday to go public.

title: University of Missouri Protests Spur a Day of Change
description: COLUMBIA, Mo.  Months of student and faculty protests over racial tensions and other issues that all but paralyzed the University of Missouri campus culminated Monday in an extraordinary coup for the demonstrators, as the president of the university system resigned and the chancellor of the flagship campus here said he would step down to a less prominent role at the end of the year.

title: Thanksgiving: What We Believe
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. Beginning today, that email will also appear on nytimes.com. To receive the email, register here.

title: The Crispr Quandary
description: One day in March 2011, Emmanuelle Charpentier, a geneticist who was studying flesh-eating bacteria, approached Jennifer Doudna, an award-winning scientist, at a microbiology conference in Puerto Rico. Charpentier, a more junior researcher, hoped to persuade Doudna, the head of a formidably large lab at the University of California, Berkeley, to collaborate. While walking the cobblestone streets of Old San Juan, the two women fell to talking. Charpentier had recently grown interested in a particular gene, known as Crispr, that seemed to help flesh-eating bacteria fight off invasive viruses. By understanding that gene, as well as the protein that enabled it, called Cas9, Charpentier hoped to find a way to cure patients infected with the bacteria by stripping it of its protective immune system.

title: World Anti-Doping Agency Report on Russian Doping Program
description: The report described a pervasive doping culture among Russias sports programs and implicated athletes, coaches, trainers, doctors and various Russian institutions.

title: 1965: Pacifist Sets Fire to Himself
description: NEW YORK  A young student who once tried to become a Trappist monk set himself on fire in front of the United Nations here today [Nov. 9] screaming that he was against all wars. Police said Roger Laporte, 22, identified as a student and part-time volunteer for the Catholic Worker Movement, a pacifist organization, was in critical condition in Bellevue Hospital with burns over his entire body. Last rites were administered after Mr. Laporte expressed repentance over his violation of the Roman Catholic Churchs strict religious credo against suicide. It was the second incident of its kind in a week. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, November 10, 1965

title: In Ancient Times, Salamanders Bared Their Fangs
description: Researchers have discovered amphibian fossils in northeastern Brazil that date back 278 million years, to the time of the supercontinent Pangaea. Until now, little was known about animal life in the southern tropical regions of the continent.

title: Unesco Rejects Kosovo Membership in a Victory for Serbia
description: BELGRADE, Serbia  Unesco, the United Nations cultural agency, narrowly denied Kosovo membership on Monday, handing a sizable political victory to Serbia, which had fought a fierce battle against the bid for months.

title: The True Heart of French Seaside Chic
description: Let the partiers keep the Riviera. Just a few hundred miles to the west sits the alluring little island of le de R, and its unspoiled pastures and vineyards.

title: A.D.H.D. Rates Rise Around Globe, but Sympathy Often Lags
description: Last year, Sinan Sonmezler of Istanbul refused to keep going to school. His eighth-grade classmates called him weird and stupid, and his teachers rebuked him for his tendency to stare out the window during class. The school director told his parents he was lazy.

title: Lapsing Faculties
description: Thisweeks puzzle is an original suggested by Marc Roth, amath teacher at the Woodside Learning Centerandpresenter at Math Circlesin the San Francisco Bay Area. Lets try

title: Locking in Votes and Doling Out Dogs: How Roberts Assigns Opinions
description: WASHINGTON  When the chief justice is in the majority, he gets to decide who will write the Supreme Courts opinion. This is, Justice Felix Frankfurter once wrote, perhaps the most delicate judgment demanded of the chief justice.

title: Animals Rely on Hair to Keep Clean, Study Finds
description: The honeybee and the squirrel have the same number of hairs: about three million. A moth has 10 billion hairs, while the human head has only 100,000.

title: Gansevoort Street, With Up-and-Down History, Could Grow Taller Again
description: Despite what you might have heard, the cobblestones of the meatpacking district still run red. But now it is with flecks of beef tartare and hibiscus cocktails, the crimson soles of Louboutins and what looks like a blob of plasma but is actually red paint from one of the half-dozen artists stalls that followed the Whitney Museum downtown.

title: The Gold Bug Bites Texas Politicians
description: Fantasies of secession danced like tumbleweed when Gov. Greg Abbott of Texas signed an odd new law in June authorizing the state to be the first in the nation to create its own gold bullion depository. The goal, Mr. Abbotts office announced, is to repatriate $1 billion in gold bullion from the Federal Reserve in New York. Thats repatriate, as in moving 6,643 gold bars from one country to another.

title: When to Ignore a Promise to Never Put Me in a Home
description: Our new patient, 88 years old, had been demented for years. She was admitted to the hospital with a deep, malodorous and infected pressure sore stretching from the top of her right shoulder down to the middle of her spine.

title: Human Trafficking at Sea: Reporters Notebook
description: Sometimes even open secrets are worth exploring. During the year I spent reporting on lawlessness at sea, many sources mentioned so-called manning agencies that trick seafarers into working on the worlds ships, especially fishing vessels.

title: American Prisoner in Yemen Said to Face Death Sentence
description: CAIRO  Lawyers for an American held prisoner in Yemens capital said that their client could be sentenced to death on murder charges at his next hearing scheduled for Wednesday, despite the difficulty of conducting a trial during Yemens civil war.

title: With a Mobile Website Like an App, Flipkart Takes a Swipe at Apple
description: Indias e-commerce start-up Flipkart has worked with Google to make a new mobile website that could eliminate the need for apps, in a move that takes a swipe at Apples grip on the mobile experience.

title: Weyerhaeusers Big Acquisition Looks Good on Paper
description: Weyerhaeusers new $23 billion woodland monster looks good on paper. Weyerhaeuser, the forestry giant, is paying a 14 percent premium for a $7 billion rival, Plum Creek Timber. Thats modest but fair, given the expected cost savings and a planned $2.5 billion stock buyback for both sets of shareholders.

title: One Paris Boutique Takes Inspiration From the Catskills
description: For several years, Sarah Andelman, the founder and creative director of the cult Paris boutique Colette, has been a regular visitor to the Catskills, where she and her family have owned a house for the past decade. In 2011, she got married in Woodstock, and she now spends many of her holidays and summers in the region. I think I feel a little guilty spending so much time upstate, she recently told T in an email from the house, where she and her family had come from Paris to celebrate Halloween.

title: Supreme Court Sides With Police Officer Who Shot Man in Car Chase
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday ruled for a police officer who shot and killed a fleeing suspect from a highway overpass. The courts decision was unsigned and issued without full briefing and oral argument, an indication that the majority found the case to be easy.

title: Fecal Transplants Made (Somewhat) More Palatable
description: Two years ago, Catherine Duff, then 57, tearfully described eight debilitating bouts of antibiotic-resistant Clostridium difficile infection to a government panel in Washington. She grew better, she said, only after treating the gastrointestinal infection at home with her husbands feces, a blender and an enema bag.

title: As Golf Returns to the Olympics, a Brazilian Golfer Hopes to Return to Rio, Too
description: Candy Hannemann had been sidelined from the L.P.G.A. Tour for several years because of wrist operations when she learned that golf would return to the 2016 Olympic Games.

title: Obama and Netanyahu Seek to Move Past Rift Over Iran Nuclear Deal
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel sought on Monday to move beyond their bitter rupture over the Iran nuclear deal, turning the page on a season of poisonous relations during a White House meeting that focused on collaboration over acrimony.

title: Review: In tiger tiger, a Quest for Answers in a Mauling
description: Jessica Almasys tiger tiger (on the nature of violence) at Dixon Place burns loudly and hotly, though not especially brightly. Based glancingly on a Christmas Day mauling at the San Francisco Zoo in 2007 that left a teenager dead, at first it seems to be about the need to assign meaning to catastrophe. Then it doesnt seem to be about much of anything at all.

title: Trial of Vincent Asaro Highlights Loss of Mafias Code of Silence
description: After he had helped pull off one of the biggest cash robberies in American history  the Lufthansa heist of 1978  and stashed millions of dollars, along with burlap sacks of gold chains, crates of watches, and diamonds and emeralds, in his cousins basement, Vincent Asaro thought first about the code: Protect the family.

title: N.Y.C.F.C. Hires Patrick Vieira as Coach
description: New York City F.C. named the French World Cup winner Patrick Vieira as its coach Monday, plucking him from a developmental role with its parent club, Manchester City, to try to improve on a disappointing first season in Major League Soccer.

title: Campbell Rethinks Its Soup Recipe as Consumer Tastes Change
description: CAMDEN, N.J.  Food companies tinker with the signature products in their portfolios at their own risk  and few products are as classic as Campbells chicken noodle soup.

title: Placing a Cap on Americans Consumption of Added Sugar
description: Health experts have been nudging Americans to kick the sugar habit for years, and now its official: The Food and Drug Administration is recommending a daily cap on sugar for the first time.

title: Can a Trip Ever Be Authentic?
description: In a globalized age  when a McAloo Tikki is just as Indian as the Taj Mahal  has the very word lost its meaning?

title: VW Looks at Cost Cuts and Offers Money to Diesel Car Owners
description: Volkswagen said on Monday that it would begin talks with worker representatives about how to cut costs, in the latest sign that the companys crisis over cheating on emissions tests is taking a heavy toll.

title: Ben Carson Moves Into a Tie With Donald Trump in South Carolina Poll
description: Ben Carsons surge in the polls has made its way to South Carolina, where a new poll from Monmouth University shows him deadlocked with Donald J. Trump as the leading Republican presidential candidate in the state.

title: University of Missouri President Resigns
description: Timothy M. Wolfe announced on Monday his resignation as the president of the University of Missouri, after months of student and faculty protests over racial tensions.

title: 3 Things to Know About the Sprint Blood Pressure Trial
description: New data from a major study called Sprint, released Monday, has shaken some of the basic assumptions about the treatment of high blood pressure. The trial found that lowering systolic blood pressure from currently recommended levels of 140 to 150 to below 120 could prevent heart attacks and strokes and potentially save many lives.

title: New Treatment Slows an Epidemic of Sleeping Sickness
description: Cases of human sleeping sickness have fallen greatly in parts of rural Uganda where cattle were given an experimental dual treatment that killed both the parasites that cause the disease and the flies that carry them, researchers in Scotland said Monday.

title: Kath Mainland Stepping Down as Head of Edinburgh Fringe
description: With her short hair, multiple ear piercings and penchant for wearing a leather jacket, Kath Mainland gives off an aura of hipness that has long seemed appropriate for her role in helping to oversee the Edinburgh Festival Fringe, the enormous arts festival that pops up annually in the Scottish capital and includes a lot of scrappy productions. But after seven years as chief executive of the Edinburgh Festival Fringe Society, the organizational force behind the event, Ms. Mainland is leaving. Beginning in February she will take over as executive director of the Melbourne Festival.

title: Data on Benefits of Lower Blood Pressure Brings Clarity for Doctors and Patients
description: When the federal government announced in September that it had abruptly halted a large blood pressure study because its results were so compelling, doctors were left in frustrating limbo.

title: Truth and Lies: The Orwellian World of Politics
description: To the Editor:

title: Killer Whales to Take Final Bows at SeaWorld San Diego
description: SeaWorld said on Monday that it planned to phase out next year its San Diego killer whale performance, a central point for criticism of how its animals are treated.

title: Astronauts Needed: NASA Wants to Make Mars Your Corner Office
description: Many childhood dreams come to nothing, but here is a chance to make one come true: For the first time in four years, NASA is looking for more astronauts.

title: Obama Starts Personal Facebook Page
description: The leader of the free world now has a personal Facebook page, and more than 45,000 people clicked like on it in the first hour it was live on Monday.

title: Catalan Legislators Raise Stakes in Push for Secession From Spain
description: BARCELONA  Catalan separatist lawmakers intensified their standoff with Spains central government in Madrid on Monday, approving a resolution that lays out a path for the region to disconnect from the rest of Spain by creating its own institutions, including a separate Catalan tax agency and social security system.

title: Cuban Peers Dispute Ted Cruzs Fathers Story of Fighting for Castro
description: MATANZAS, Cuba  Since he was a boy, Senator Ted Cruz has said, all he wanted to do was fight for liberty  a yearning that he says was first kindled when he heard his fathers tales of fighting as a rebel leader in Cuba in the 1950s, throwing firebombs, running guns and surviving torture.

title: Wood You Can Wear
description: Hand-carved jewelry  with gold, diamonds and gemstones  makes a statement while maintaining a natural delicacy.

title: Afghan Fighters Loyal to ISIS Beheaded 7 Hostages, Officials Say
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Afghan militants claiming loyalty to the Islamic State were found to have beheaded seven ethnic Hazara civilians who had been abducted in the southern Afghan province of Zabul, officials said on Monday, as infighting among Taliban splinter factions intensified.

title: Delayed Opening for Mamets China Doll
description: The producers of China Doll, a new play written by David Mamet and starring Al Pacino, said on Monday that the play requires more work than they had expected and so they are delaying the official opening by two weeks.

title: Judge Deals a Blow to N.S.A. Data Collection Program
description: WASHINGTON  A federal judge on Monday partly blocked the National Security Agencys program that systematically collects Americans domestic phone records in bulk just weeks before the agency was scheduled to shut it down and replace it. The judge said the program was most likely unconstitutional.

title: Starbuckss Red Holiday Cups Inspire Outcry Online
description: For some reason, Starbucks keeps trying to coax its customers to share a bit more over their coffee cups.

title: Target Keeps Thanksgiving Opening at 6 p.m. on the Holiday
description: Target doesnt want Americans to miss Thanksgiving dinner  but with its stores opening at 6 p.m. that day for a second year running, shoppers may still have to choose between sales and dessert.

title: Chris Stapleton Rides C.M.A.s to a Big Week on the Album Chart
description: Never say that television time doesnt sell records.

title: Canadian Pacific Said to Weigh Deal for Norfolk Southern
description: If at first Canadian Pacific could not succeed in buying a fellow railroad operator, it looks prepared to try again with another target.

title: Vegetarian Thanksgiving: Stuffing Muffins
description: Stuffing is a traditional Thanksgiving accompaniment to the turkey, but turning stuffing into muffins helps it hold its own on the holiday table  with or without the bird.

title: Review: Donny Deutschs Donny!, a Crass, Infuriating Talk Show Host
description: Dont watch Donny! because it might make you laugh. Then youll hate yourself for liking a sitcom that stars an advertising executive, and a moderately annoying one at that.

title: Bond Giant Pimco Calls Grosss Lawsuit Legally Groundless
description: Pimco, the bond investment giant, responded on Monday to a $200 million lawsuit filed by its former star portfolio manager, William H. Gross, by asking that his claim be dismissed as legally groundless.

title: Russian Artist Sets Security Services Door on Fire
