description: MOSCOW  The artists brush was a cigarette lighter, his paint a can of gasoline and the canvas, as it has always been for Pyotr Pavlensky, a symbol of the Russian state.

title: 1890: The Electric Chair, Far Worse Than Hanging
description: It was supposed to be a humane alternative to the noose. On March 22, 1890, The Times reported on a New York Court of Appeals ruling that a new invention, the electric chair, did not constitute cruel punishment. It would be used to execute a convicted wife killer, William Kemmler.

title: Ackman Defends Funds Valeant Losses and Digs at Snide Comments
description: The billionaire investor William A. Ackman, whose firm is among the worst-performing hedge funds this year, used an investor conference call on Monday to take a swipe at the media and those on Wall Street who he said relished betting against him.

title: Artificial Patients, Real Learning
description: BOSTON  The patients blood pressure had reportedly crashed in the ambulance; a gunshot wound had damaged the heart. In the operating room, a medical resident, Dr. Dan Hashimoto, slid a knife into the patients chest and sliced horizontally, from the sternum across the torso.

title: Hollywood in the Operating Room
description: Surgeons at Massachusetts General Hospital have four minutes to save this gunshot wound victim. So how do residents learn such a risky procedure? With a little help from Hollywood.

title: Mariners Saw the Hall of Fame Version of Ken Griffey Jr.
description: Consider these two major league ballplayers.

title: Live and Kicking: Soccer Games to Watch
description: Put away your favorite clubs jersey and get your flags out: its international break time again.

title: Deal Talks Start Early, but Mets Sandy Alderson Will Miss Meetings
description: BOCA RATON, Fla.  The general manager meetings are usually a somewhat sleepy cousin to baseballs winter meetings, but that could change this year.

title: With a Presidential Boost, Hamilton Tops Broadway Box Office
description: President Obama has been quite clear about how much he likes the new musical Hamilton. And last week, he managed to boost its grosses past those of Broadways longtime leader, The Lion King.

title: The Killer App: Storytelling
description: As MediaStorm celebrates 10 years, its founder looks ahead to the challenges and opportunities facing photographers in the online world.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Psychology

title: Tackling Racial Tensions on Campus
description: After the resignation of President Timothy M. Wolfe, students and faculty agreed that a new approach is needed to combat the rising number of racist incidents at the University of Missouri.

title: Review: In Hotels of North America, Rick Moody Examines the Middle-Aged Male in Free Fall
description: One drawback of American journalism is that newspapers and magazines dont have hotel critics. Into this cultural void steps Reginald Edward Morse, the hero of Rick Moodys new novel, Hotels of North America.

title: Pictures of the Day: Myanmar and Elsewhere
description: Myanmar and Elsewhere  Pictures of the Day

title: Prosecution Witness inLufthansa Trial Is Scrutinized in Closing Arguments
description: It was not so much Vincent Asaro but his cousin Gaspare Valenti, the key prosecution witness against him, who was under scrutiny as closing arguments in Mr. Asaros trial on racketeering charges concluded on Monday.

title: Breakthrough Prize Looks to Stars to Shine on Science
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif.  Movie stars. Red carpet. Awards.

title: Nov. 9, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Myanmar, Brazil, the United States and Germany.

title: Facts & Figures: Where People Worry About Climate Change
description: Americans are less likely than people in Latin America and Sub-Saharan Africa to believe climate change is a very serious problem, according to a recent Pew report. Forty-five percent of people in the United States see climate change as very serious, compared with 86 percent in Brazil and 79 percent in Burkina Faso.

title: A Vagabond Teahouse Pours Camaraderie, One Free Cup at a Time
description: Giuseppe Spadafora opened a side door of his white Ford bus, spread a light blue carpet on a sidewalk near McCarren Park in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, and placed a small wooden sandwich board next to it reading Free Tea.

title: ChloSevignys Wild Gucci Dress
description: The Star: Chlo Sevigny

title: Review: In Ballet (New York), Nondancers Try Their Jets
Donald Trumps Not-So-Fond Farewell on Saturday Night Live
description: Donald Trumps appearance on Saturday Night Live last weekend was memorable for a few things, none having much to do with his comedic skills.

title: Review: Dead and Breathing, About the Right to Die
description: Carolyn Whitlock, the long-ailing woman at the center of Chisa Hutchinsons play Dead and Breathing, at the National Black Theater, has wealth in abundance. Whats lacking is the ease she expects it to bring her.

title: Egypt Extends Detention of a Journalist, Hossam Bahgat
description: SHARM EL SHEIKH, Egypt  Egyptian military prosecutors on Monday extended the detention of Hossam Bahgat, an investigative journalist and the founder of Egypts leading human rights organization, in a sign that the government is moving to bring him to trial on charges of publishing false news harmful to national security.

title: Verbatim: Would Jeb Bush Kill Baby Hitler? Hell Yeah.
description: Jeb Bush, in an interview with The Huffington Post, on whether he would kill a baby Hitler if he could go back in time. The question was inspired by a New York Times Magazine survey.

title: ISIS Ally in Egypt Emerges as Key Suspect in Russian Jet Crash
description: CAIRO  Within months of the military takeover here two years ago, a little-known group calling itself Ansar Beit al-Maqdis managed to penetrate rings of checkpoints and heavy security to carry out a string of startling attacks, assassinating a senior police official at his home near here and blowing up a security headquarters here and in Mansoura, Egypt.

title: Hannah Rothschild Adds Novelist to Her Rsum
description: LONDON  There wasnt a minion in sight at the Rothschild offices here, and Hannah Rothschild  author, filmmaker, chairwoman of the National Gallery  was looking dubiously at the coffee-making apparatus on a table in a small boardroom. I think this machine works, she said.

title: Lindsey Graham to Make His Voice Heard During Debate, on Social Media
description: With poll numbers that barely register, Senator Lindsey Graham will not be participating in either of Tuesday nights Republican presidential debates, leaving the stages without the witty wisecracks that have become one of his claims to fame.

title: An Artful Homage to Roller Disco
description: When Hauser & Wirth moved into its Dieter Roth-designed West 18th Street space two years ago, the gallery inherited an unexpected treasure trove: hundreds of roller skates left over from the former tenant, the famous Roxy roller disco. With the opening of Mark Bradfords new exhibition, Be Strong Boquan, this past weekend, the history of the building comes back to life. Immediately upon entering the show, visitors encounter Deimos, a video installation depicting dozens of the little orange wheels from the Roxys skates, spinning from one end of the frame to the other. T premieres the video exclusively here (in the gallery, its displayed across three screens on one very long wall).

title: Hillary Clinton on Familiar Ground in Registering for the New Hampshire Primary
description: CONCORD, N.H.  For the fourth time in her career  as a political spouse and as a presidential candidate  Hillary Rodham Clinton made her way into the crowded and crusty office of New Hampshires secretary of state as the Clinton surname was placed on the ballot for the states primary, the first in the nation.

title: Gov. Christie Doesnt Want Your Vote
description: New Jerseys voter-turnout rate is among the lowest in the country. During the 2014 midterm elections, 30.4 percent of the states eligible voters went to the polls. Last week, only 21 percent of voters came out  the worst showing for a general election in state history.

title: A New L.A. Wellness Destination Deals in Affordable Luxury
description: In a city where ayahuasca ceremonies and crystal healings are as openly discussed as traffic and the weather, healing and wellness in Los Angeles can feel velvet rope-exclusive. Not everyone can afford to go six days off-the-grid or devote an entire weekend to juicing  and even those who do have the time and the means may find themselves at the very bottom of of a Kabbalistic intuitive counselors waitlist.

title: Martin OMalley Receives Support From Obamas Finance Circle
description: Five people who served on President Obamas national finance committee during his first presidential campaign are circulating a letter seeking to rally support for Martin OMalley, the former governor of Maryland who has been struggling to gain traction in the Democratic presidential race.

title: Mike Bartlett Turns to Shakespeare to Voice His King Charles III
description: How do you write a play about the British royal family without making its members seem risible, banal or irrelevant? Except for Queen Elizabeth, who orbits in her own special universe, todays royals often appear to be trapped in a dreary reality show whose ostensible dramas (Who did Kate wear? What did Charles say?) are anything but dramatic.

title: Laminate Maker Ark Is Accused of Selling Tainted Flooring
description: As Lumber Liquidators continues to struggle after a safety crisis over its Chinese-made laminate flooring, a much smaller flooring company has been drawn into the spotlight.

title: Students Celebrate University of Missouri Presidents Resignation
description: Students and faculty members at the University of Missouri in Columbia erupted in cheers at word of Timothy M. Wolfes resignation as president of the university system on Monday.

title: The Stonehenge Landscape
description: To many visitors, Stonehenge is not much more than some big stones and not as impressive as they imagined. But the story is not just Stonehenge.

title: Stonehenge Begins to Yield Its Secrets
description: AMESBURY, England  About 6,300 years ago, a tree here toppled over.

title: Panel: What Todays News Tells Us About the 2016 Election
description: We are a year out from the 2016 United States presidential vote, but it is clear that election madness is already in full swing. With such a long lead time, its hard to tell: Who will be in? Who will be out? And above all, which of the current political stories matter for next years election  and which dont?

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: In Mediterranea, Two Migrants Speak for Many
description: LONDON  As Europe faces its largest migrant crisis since World War II  more than 780,000 people from the Middle East and Africa have arrived this year, according to the United Nations refugee agency  it can be easy to forget that there is a story behind each decision to attempt the difficult journey.

title: A Teenage Sons Kind Acts, Revealed as He Is Laid to Rest
description: They knew that their son, Miles Kirkland Thomas, had used his time and talents to be supportive to others. They knew he made the varsity football team as a freshman. He volunteered with an organization called Health for Youths at a local police precinct house. He always saw the good in people.

title: A Design Gallery That Wants a Strong Reaction
description: There are tough acts to follow  and then theres Takashimaya, the Japanese department store that reigned over Fifth Avenue until it closed in 2010. The store itself hasnt returned, but its instantly recognizable postmodern building has undergone a face-lift at the hands of David Chipperfield and even found a new tenant grand enough to fill its duplex penthouse: Carpenters Workshop Gallery, opening tomorrow.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing: University of Missouri, Myanmar, Doping
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Digital Dig Unpacks Atlanta Dive Bar Rich in History
description: ATLANTA  The artist and documentary filmmaker Ruth Dusseault calls the stuff that has found its way onto the walls of Manuels Tavern, a beloved Eisenhower-era dive bar here, an organic archive and a 60-year installation piece.

title: Goodbyes to the Lord of the Dance and Mademoiselle Non
U.S. Soccer, Resolving Lawsuit, Will Limit Headers for Youth Players
description: The United States Soccer Federation unveiled a series of safety initiatives Monday aimed at addressing head injuries in the sport, including a policy that sets strict limits on youth players heading the ball. The new guidelines, which resolve a proposed class-action lawsuit filed against U.S. Soccer and others last year, will prohibit players age 10 and younger from heading the ball and will reduce headers in practice for those from age 11 to 13.

title: Skelos Case Hearing Offers Hint of Possible Defense Strategy
description: When the corruption trial of State Senator Dean G. Skelos and his son Adam begins next week, there will probably be snippets of salacious talk from both men, on a fathers influence and on undermining the governor in budget negotiations.

title: Scuffle Between Nevada Casino Company and Union Pulls In Deutsche Bank
description: The long-running fight between culinary workers and a casino owner in Las Vegas is about to go another round. And the workers are hoping the regulatory troubles faced by a German bank might give them the advantage they have been looking for.

title: Panel to Examine Tolls for New Tappan Zee Bridge
description: The New York State Thruway Authority announced on Monday that a new task force would examine whether to raise tolls for the crossing that is being built to replace the Tappan Zee Bridge.

title: With $170.4 Million Sale at Auction, Modigliani Work Joins Rarefied Nine-Figure Club
description: In an overheated art market where anything seems possible, a painting of an outstretched nude woman by the early-20th-century artist Amedeo Modigliani sold on Monday night for $170.4 million with fees to Liu Yiqian, a former taxi driver turned billionaire art collector, in a packed sales room at Christies. It was the second-highest price paid for an artwork at auction.

title: Hoping for His Backing, Jeb Bush Meets With a Cautious Scott Walker
description: WAUKESHA, Wis.  Leaving an event here with Gov. Scott Walker, Jeb Bush said he would be happy to land Mr. Walkers endorsement in the 2016 presidential race.

title: College Athletes Potential Realized in Missouri Resignations
description: Well, that was fast.

title: Bill Cosby Faces New Suit for Saying Accuser Lied
description: A New Hampshire woman who accused Bill Cosby last year of drugging and sexually assaulting her in 1965 has sued the entertainer, contending that he wrongly branded her a liar after she came forward.

title: Shift to Lower-Carbon Energy Is Too Slow, I.E.A. Report Warns
description: LONDON  Even as the world shifts toward lower-carbon forms of energy, the changes are happening too slowly to keep global temperatures from rising to dangerous levels in the coming decades, an international research group warns in a report released on Tuesday.

title: Egypts Brazen Crackdown on Critics
description: Update: Hossam Bahgat was released Tuesday. It is not clear whether he still faces charges.

title: U.A.W.s Tentative Deal With Ford Tops Other Automaker Contracts
description: DETROIT  Local leaders of the United Automobile Workers on Monday endorsed a proposed new labor agreement with Ford Motor Company that is slightly richer than contracts agreed to by union workers at General Motors and Fiat Chrysler.

title: NATO War Games Unwittingly Put Soviets and U.S. on Hair Trigger in 83, Analysis Suggests
description: In December 1988, Jrg Winger was a West German Army radio operator eavesdropping on Soviet military channels when he overheard a startling message: The Russians wished him Merry Christmas by name.

title: Pimco Suit Sheds Light on Murky Investor Fees
description: With the trading desks of investment banks cut to the bone, the ability to pin a fat fee on a fast-growing pile of assets has become the holy grail for financial firms.

title: Invitation List Looms as Test for Syria Talks
description: When world powers gather in Vienna this weekend to discuss a possible postwar political deal for Syria, one of the main points of contention will be to determine whom to include among opposition groups in future negotiations  and the West may back groups that are less than moderate, Britains top diplomat said on Monday.

title: Manhattan Man Charged in Wifes Killing Is Barred From Talking to Anyone but Lawyer
description: A judge denied bail on Monday to a Manhattan man accused of strangling his estranged wife six years ago and covering up the crime, then took the unusual step of barring the defendant from speaking to anyone except his lawyer  a move intended to prevent him from sending messages to witnesses.

title: A Rebuke to Indias Prime Minister Narendra Modi
description: During a national election in India last year, Narendra Modi promised development for all. As prime minister, he has yet to deliver big economic improvements, but in the meantime, members of his government and political party have shredded his promise of inclusion by inflaming sectarian tensions. Now, voters in the countrys third most populous state have sent Mr. Modi a message: Put an end to the hatemongering.

title: Brookie Maxwell, an Artist and Curator, Dies at 59
description: Brookie Maxwell, a painter, sculptor and curator who immersed herself in social causes and viewed art as a spiritual haven for homeless children, died on Wednesday at her home in Manhattan. She was 59.

title: Appeals Court Deals Blow to Obamas Immigration Plans
description: WASHINGTON  A federal appeals court said Monday that President Obama could not move forward with his plans to overhaul immigration rules by providing up to five million people with work permits and protection from deportation.

title: Bill Ackmans Enigmatic Approach to Valeant Pharmaceuticals
description: William A. Ackman, the activist investor, has described his billion-dollar bet and continuing crusade against the nutritional supplements company Herbalife as a moral obligation. In at least one presentation, he nearly cried onstage and said that if his Herbalife trade was successful, he would give the profits to charity because he would consider them blood money.

title: Jeb Bush Allies Threaten Wave of Harsh Attacks on Marco Rubio, an Ex-Mentee
description: The cash-rich group aiding Jeb Bushs White House run has filmed a provocative video casting his rival Marco Rubio as ultimately unelectable because of his hard-line stand against abortion.

title: Letter from Capitol Hill: Allow Government Officials to Read Full Torture Report
description: The executive summary of the report on C.I.A. torture was publicly released in December 2014, but the complete 6,700-page report was confined to executive branch safes. Senators Dianne Feinstein and Patrick J. Leahy wrote this letter imploring the heads of the Justice Department and the F.B.I. to allow more government officials to read the report.

title: Classified Report on the C.I.A.s Secret Prisons Is Caught in Limbo
description: WASHINGTON  A Senate security officer stepped out of the December chill last year and delivered envelopes marked Top Secret to the Pentagon, the C.I.A., the State Department and the Justice Department. Inside each packet was a disc containing a 6,700-page classified report on the C.I.A.s secret prison program and a letter from Senator Dianne Feinstein, urging officials to read the report to ensure that the lessons were not lost to time.

title: Years Later, Bittersweet Victory for Alysia Montao
description: Alysia Montao, an American 800-meter runner, woke up early in Valencia, Calif. Knowing the World Anti-Doping Agency was releasing the findings of its extraordinary inquiry into doping and corruption in Russian track and field, she devoured the details of the report in bed as soon as she awoke.

title: Don Gregory, Theater Producer of Solo Shows, Dies at 80
description: Don Gregory, a theater producer who specialized in star vehicles, including one-actor shows for Henry Fonda, Julie Harris and James Earl Jones on Broadway, died on Thursday at his home in Boca Raton, Fla. He was 80.

title: Albert Woodfox, Angola Inmate, Can Be Tried 3rd Time, Court Rules
description: A federal appeals court ruled on Monday that Louisiana could keep an inmate locked up for the 1972 murder of a prison guard and said prosecutors may try him a third time for the killing.

title: Preparing for Jets, Bills Rex Ryan Finds Way to Needle Them
description: ORCHARD PARK, N.Y.  Maybe it was sleep deprivation. Maybe it was the excitement surrounding his return to the New York metropolitan region to face his former team for the first time. But Buffalo Bills Coach Rex Ryan, normally a champion talker, uttered a few uncharacteristic linguistic lapses and malapropisms on Monday.

title: Wojciech Fangor, Painter Who Emerged From Postwar Poland, Dies at 92
description: Wojciech Fangor, one of the most distinctive painters to emerge from postwar Poland, died on Oct. 25 in Warsaw. He was 92.

title: Russia: Official Says Delayed Deal to Sell Iran Missiles Remains in Force
description: Russias most senior arms executive said Monday that a contract to supply Iran with powerful S-300 air defense missiles was now active. But with no delivery date or any other details, the announcement seemed aimed more at warding off an Iranian lawsuit than a major step toward delivery of the weapon system. Sergei V. Chemezov, Russias chief arms trade executive, made the announcement at an air show in Dubai, Russian news agencies reported. The contract to deliver the S-300 was not only signed by both sides, but has already come into force, Mr. Chemezov was quoted as saying by the RIA Novosti news agency. The initial contract to deliver the weapons was signed in 2007, before the current international arms embargo against Iran was established. But the deal was canceled in 2010 by Dmitri A. Medvedev, then Russias president, under pressure from the United States and Israel. In response, Iran filed a lawsuit claiming breach of contract that could cost Moscow as much as five times the $800 million value of the original deal. President Vladimir V. Putin reversed Mr. Medvedevs decision in April, as a nuclear deal between Iran and the world powers began to appear likely. But the system still has not been delivered. The hitch, military experts say, is that Russia wants to keep the unfulfilled contract as a bargaining chip in its relations with the West, perhaps with an eye to ending economic sanctions imposed over its actions in Ukraine.

title: Lamar Alexander Seeks Path to Change in Senate
description: WASHINGTON  Nothing touches off a political war in the Senate like proposals to tinker with the arcane rules that govern the often creaky chamber. Talk of eliminating the filibuster is called the nuclear option for a reason.

title: I Need Some Muscle: Missouri Activists Block Journalists
description: COLUMBIA, Mo.  A video that showed University of Missouri protesters restricting a student photographers access to a public area of campus on Monday has ignited discussions about press freedom.

title: Review: In Lost Girls, Derailed Blue-Collar Lives, With Zingers
description: So youre driving along through what you think is a drearily familiar landscape, when suddenly theres a bend in the road. All at once, in a single click of perception, everything looks slightly but revealingly different, and not just where you are now, but also where youve been. The view in the rearview mirror has changed.

title: Review: Dada Woof Papa Hot, About Gay Men and Parenthood
description: Spare a teardrop or two for the troubled gay fathers in Dada Woof Papa Hot, a slick, mostly enjoyable new play by Peter Parnell that opened on Monday at the Mitzi E. Newhouse Theater.

title: Keeping Everything in Balance
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  The last time we saw Will Treece, he was making his New York Times crossword debut, overzealously correcting the sensational spelling of various creatively spelled musical groups. Today, hes back with a relatively easy theme about name doppelgngers.

title: Sheldon Silvers Grants Suppressed in Budget Reports, Official Testifies in Corruption Trial
description: Until Sheldon Silvers arrest and subsequent resignation as speaker of the New York Assembly, he was considered one of the states most powerful politicians, controlling how billions of dollars of state funds were doled out.

title: Ryan Fitzpatrick Likely to Have Thumb Surgery After Game
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Ryan Fitzpatrick has a torn ligament in his left thumb that only surgery can repair. That surgery, he hinted strongly, is likely to occur Friday so that he can maximize recovery time before the Jets next game.

title: Are You Smarter Than a Billionaire?
description: Art auctions can be unpredictable. See how you match up in this interactive quiz.

title: Retrial in 90 Killing of Tourist on a New York Subway Platform Is Delayed
description: The Manhattan district attorney has decided to appeal a judges decision to grant a new trial to a Queens man convicted of taking part in the 1990 killing of a tourist on a New York subway platform, a crime that for many residents marked a low point in an era of fear and disorder.

title: Off the Field, Charting the Xs and Os of a Protest Movement
description: COLUMBIA, Mo.  Jonathan Butlers hunger strike to protest what he viewed as systemic racism at the University of Missouri, where he is a graduate student, was raised to the level of national news Saturday night, when black Missouri football players went on strike pending the removal of the university system president, Tim Wolfe. On Sunday, the rest of the Tigers squad joined in, and their coach backed them.

title: Coalition of Start-Ups and Labor Call for Rethinking of Worker Policies
description: A major threat that has loomed over so-called on-demand companies is the potential of new labor definitions that would force the companies to treat contract workers like traditional employees.

title: Fargo Season 2, Episode 5: The Butcher of Luverne
description: Children make mistakes. And as they get older, they still make mistakes  maybe not as many, but bigger and more dangerous ones. They rebel. They test their boundaries. They slip around (or smash through) the guardrails their parents have set up for their protection. For Charlie and Simone Gerhardt, the children of criminals, growing up comes with a deep moral confusion and a nefarious sense of duty. Will they be ready to run the family business? (Is that something they even want?) And what sort of twisted values are their elders instilling in them to prepare them for it?

title: Blindspot Season 1, Episode 8: Hot-Button Issues
description: Characters on NBCs Blindspot often remark on how prescient the tattoo artist or artists who inked up Jane were. How did he/she/they know we would be in this specific place at this exact time and find this obscure clue? Another sort of prescience took over Monday nights episode: The tattoos are also freakishly good at steering the plot toward hot-button real-life issues.

title: Pepsi Is Departing Citi Field, Leaving Behind a Bare Porch
description: Thanks to their surprising success in 2015, the Mets should see a healthy bump in ticket sales over the winter and more companies lining up to sign sponsorship deals with the club, which made it to the World Series after six consecutive losing seasons.

title: Hank Penza, Owner of Mars Bar in the East Village, Dies at 82
description: Hank Penza, who owned and presided over Mars Bar, a gritty, storied dive bar in the East Village and one of the neighborhoods last holdouts in the face of gentrification, died on Oct. 29 in Manhattan. He was 82.

title: Use of Long-Acting Birth Control Methods Surges Among U.S. Women
description: WASHINGTON  The share of American women on birth control who use long-acting reversible methods like intrauterine devices and implants has nearly doubled in recent years, the federal government reported Tuesday.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | incubate
description: incubate  \iN-ky-bat, in-\  verb

title: Man Is Killed as Car Jumps Curb in Brooklyn
description: A man was fatally injured on Monday when a car jumped a curb, flipped over and struck him on a Brooklyn sidewalk, the police and fire officials said.

title: What to Watch Tuesday
description: A cup of joe or a glass of blaufrnkisch? The choice is yours, thirsty viewers, as two competitions  one for baristas, the other for sommeliers  showcase the commitment and quirks of those who aspire to become masters of their domains. Or sit back with your beverage of choice while John Stamos and Dave Coulier evoke their Full House days on Grandfathered, and Ric Burns pays tribute to disabled veterans throughout American history.

title: Astellas Pharma to Acquire Ocata Therapeutics
description: Ocata Therapeutics, a sometimes controversial pioneer in developing human embryonic stem cells, will be acquired by Astellas Pharma for about $379 million, the companies announced on Monday night.

title: Corrections: November 10, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Tim Wolfes resignation was a necessary step toward healing and reconciliation on the University of Missouri campus.

title: Seeking Changes From E.U., David Cameron Outlines Conditions for Britain to Stay
description: LONDON  Prime Minister David Cameron on Tuesday formally laid out Britains conditions for remaining in the European Union, seeking changes in his countrys relationship with Brussels that he is betting are substantial enough to win over a majority of British voters but modest enough for the rest of Europe to swallow.

title: Rival Bid for Asciano, an Australian Port and Railroad Company
description: SYDNEY, Australia  A group of infrastructure investors and operators has emerged as a rival suitor for Asciano, the Australian port and railroad company.

title: White-Haired Girl, Opera Created Under Mao, Returns to Stage
description: Mao Zedong was said to have been moved to tears when he watched an early performance of The White-Haired Girl, an opera created to meet his call for rousing revolutionary art. And under President Xi Jinping, a revival is on the road, reinvented once more to appeal to a Communist Party leaders stringently ideological tastes.

title: Disabled Job Seekers
description: To the Editor:

title: Crumbling Infrastructure: Rebuild at Home
description: To the Editor:

title: Dont Just Move Guantnamo
description: To the Editor:

title: Obamas Rejection of the Keystone Pipeline
description: To the Editor:

title: Schools Cant Stop Kids From Sexting. More Technology Can.
description: YOUTH is subjected by our civilization to aggressive sex stimuli and suggestiveness oozing from every pore. So declared the education professor Clark Hetherington in 1914, condemning the proliferation of racy movies and tell-all magazines. Lest adolescents succumb to the indulgence on display, he wrote, schools needed to teach self-control and higher standards.

title: Robin Williamss Gift
description: To the Editor:

title: Rand Pauls Lost Moment
description: Senator Rand Paul doesnt like country music.

title: The Things They Carry
description: Kennedy Odede is one of the most joy-filled people Ive met.

title: The Risks of Assisting Evolution
Your Kids Will Live Longer Than You Thought
description: According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, life expectancy at birth in the United States was 78.8 years in 2013  76.4 years for men, 81.2 years for women. But I have good news. Those statistics dont mean what you probably think they mean.

title: Can Companies Be Trusted?
Smart African Politics: Candidates Debating Under a Tree
description: Political debates are good even when theyre bad. Even when candidates are cringe-worthy, theyre cringe-worthy in public view. And voters learn about all the candidates, not just new ones. In the United States, for example, Hillary Clinton has been center stage in political life for 24 years. Donald Trump is the very definition of overexposed. Still, the debates tell us new things about them  their positions, temperament, grace under pressure (or lack thereof), charisma and political skill.

title: Defeating My Anxiety
description: When the stock market crashed in 2008, my wife and I were 70. And we saw half of our retirement funds disappear. Before the crash, we felt secure in the belief that we had enough money to last as long as we lived; after the crash, we feared that we would not, and I worried about it a great deal. I had a hard time going to sleep and an even harder time going back to sleep after getting up to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night. I came to hate going into that bathroom because I knew my demons resided there and would invade my consciousness immediately.

title: Australia Uses Tear Gas in Riots at Christmas Island Detention Center
description: SYDNEY, Australia  The Australian authorities on Tuesday used tear gas and force to quell rioting at a detention center on Christmas Island that began after an Iranian refugee being held there died over the weekend.

title: Dutch Government Aims to Raise $4.6 Billion in ABN Amro I.P.O.
description: LONDON  The government of the Netherlands said on Tuesday that it expected to raise 4.3 billion euros, or about $4.6 billion, through the sale of shares of the state-owned lender ABN Amro in an initial public offering this month.

title: News Qs | Web Poets Society: New Breed Succeeds in Taking Verse Viral
description: Before Reading Web Poets Society: New Breed Succeeds in Taking Verse Viral:

title: Amazons Streaming Music Aims for More Casual Listeners
description: SEATTLE  The music industrys streaming wars are usually seen as having three major combatants: Spotify, Apple and Pandora.

title: Should Voting Be Mandatory?
description: A healthy representative democracy depends on citizens exercising their right to vote. Yet here in the United States, usually 40 percent of eligible voters dont vote during presidential elections, and typically 60 percent dont vote in congressional midterm elections.

title: Racial Tension and Protests on Campuses Across the Country
description: Instances of racism and bigotry have ignited protests at colleges across the United States, and social media has amplified students messages far beyond campus. Here are some examples.

title: Criticism and Litigation Over Renewal Clause in Rent-Freeze Program for Older New Yorkers
description: As New York City officials encourage older tenants to take advantage of an underused program that freezes their rents, they have also been cutting off participants who fail to renew on time, advocates say.

title: Afghans Arriving in Germany Find the Welcome Is Wearing Thin
description: BERLIN  A growing sense that Afghanistan is slipping into greater chaos and will not stabilize anytime soon is driving rising numbers of Afghans to flee for Europe, hopeful that they will enjoy the same welcome given to Syrians and Iraqis seeking safety from war and terror.

title: What to Look For in Republican Debate
description: Tuesday nights Republican presidential debate in Milwaukee will bring the eight leading contenders together at a time when two are confronting questions about their pasts, one faces mounting doubts about his seriousness, and another who began the race as a favorite is under intense pressure to show he can be as forceful as he was cracked up to be. Yet their ability to address those problems could actually depend on whether Fox Business Network, the host of the debate, fails to deliver on its promises for a policy-driven evening focused on sober economic issues.

title: The Killer App: Storytelling
description: Brian Storm was raised in the Detroit area and attended the College of the Ozarks on a baseball scholarship. While obtaining a graduate degree at the University of Missouris School of Journalism in 1993, he discovered computers and began making interactive CD-ROM disks. He started a company, MediaStorm, but put it on hold while working for MSNBC and Corbis over the next decade.He relaunched MediaStorm in 2005 as a film-production company and interactive design studio, which this month celebrates its 10th anniversary. He spoke with James Estrin about the future of photography and multimedia. Their conversation has been edited.

title: Nabokov in America, by Robert Roper
description: Who would have thought thered be more to say about Vladimir Nabokov? This most scholarly and mandarin of writers, an incontestable master of his craft, has been parsed and chronicled to death  the subject of Brian Boyds two-volume biography as well as Stacy Schiffs portrait of a marriage (Vra: Mrs. Vladimir Nabokov), not to mention thousands of critical studies. So my first thought when I set eyes on Robert Ropers Nabokov in America: On the Road to Lolita was, Is this book necessary?

title: In Letters to Vra, Vladimir Nabokov Writes to His Wife
description: My sun, my soul, my song, my bird, my sweetheart, my pink sky, my sunny rainbow, my little music, my inexpressible delight, my softness, my tenderness, my lightness, my dear life, my dear eyes. ... These endearments and salutations (backed up by a crowded menagerie of surrogates: Goosikins, Poochums, Tigercubkin, Puppykin) suggest a sky-filling adoration and, more than that, a helpless dependency. As early as Vladimir Nabokovs second letter to Vra Slonim, after a couple of months of chaste acquaintanceship, he lays it all before her: I cannot write a word without hearing how you will pronounce it  and cant recall a single trifle Ive lived through without regret  so sharp!  that we havent lived through it together. ... You came into my life ... as one comes to a kingdom where all the rivers have been waiting for your reflection, all the roads, for your steps.

title: Ask Well: The Health Benefits of Meditation
description: Question:

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: University of Missouri, David Cameron, World Anti-Doping Agency
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: New York Today: Book Drop
description: Updated 9:39 a.m.

title: Conference Seeks to Prompt Candidates to Discuss Education
description: Gov. Terry E. Branstad, Republican of Iowa, and Gov. Jack Markell, Democrat of Delaware, will bring a bipartisan focus to education on Tuesday in the hopes of urging the presidential candidates to focus more closely on developing strong teachers nationally.

title: Morning Agenda: Ackman Defiant Over Valeant
description: ACKMAN DEFIANT OVER VALEANT | William A. Ackman took a swipe at the news media and the people on Wall Street who relished betting against him in an investor conference call yesterday,

title: John McCain Consults Earlier Legislation in Bid for a Pentagon Overhaul
description: When he was handed the chairmans gavel of the Senate Armed Services Committee this year, Senator John McCain, Republican of Arizona, said changes to the way the Pentagon spent its money and to its overall structure would be his top priorities.

title: Hillary Clinton to Release Plan to Address Veterans Affairs Scandal
description: WINDHAM, N.H.  On Monday, just after she officially registered as a Democratic candidate in New Hampshire, Hillary Rodham Clinton declared, This election is about our veterans.

title: Donald Trump Sees a Bump in Attention After S.N.L. Appearance
description: Few candidates for president have been as deft at garnering free media attention as Donald J. Trump. His appearance on Saturday Night Live is the latest example.

title: Seeing Voting Rights Under Siege, Philip Glass Rewrites an Opera
description: WASHINGTON  Each new chapter of American history has a way of casting what came before it in a different light. So when the composer Philip Glass and the playwright Christopher Hampton decided to revive Appomattox, the opera about the Civil War that they wrote a decade ago, they found that the changing civil rights landscape cried out for a rewrite.

title: In Ireland, Milk Chocolate Reigns
description: Everyone we met in Ireland told us that our trip last year couldnt have been better timed. We were there in early summer. The countryside was at its ripest green, the characteristic clouds and rain were nowhere to be seen, and the crowds of summer tourists hadnt yet arrived. But never mind the weather and the sights. We were there for the chocolate. Well, actually, I was there for the milk chocolate. My husband, Mahir, who proclaims his allegiance to dark, was my grumbling recruit.

title: The Cult of the Amateur
description: Late in October, the retired brain surgeon Ben Carson took the stage at a Christian college in Colorado and pitched himself as president. I love it when people come up to me and they say: B-b-b-b-but-but youve never been elected to any public office! You cant possibly know how to do anything! Well, let me tell you something. The ark was built by amateurs. The Titanic was built by professionals. Carson touched his fingertips together and smiled softly to himself. The crowd went nuts. Outside, one Carson supporter pinpointed the surgeons appeal: People are sick of politicians.

title: You, Only Better
description: Dave Asprey does not like infomercials. He didnt want our conversation to feel like one, he said, raising both hands in a gesture of innocence, like a magician showing there was nothing up his sleeve. But once he planted the suggestion, it wouldnt go away. There was the register of his voice, oscillating between breathy and enthusiastic, and the complete absence of qualifiers to soften his bold claims. And then there were the wares clustered on the table in front of him. He had laid out cups of his signature product, Bulletproof Coffee, which is made with grass-fed butter and Brain Octane, a trademarked oil extracted from coconuts. Next to the cups lay Bulletproof-branded protein bars in chocolate and vanilla. I am not plugging my stuff, he said with a semi-embarrassed laugh. Im just talking about how things work.

title: A Visit to the Strange, Secretive World of David Bowies Lazarus
description: On a recent weekday morning, the Belgian director Ivo van Hove sat at a corner table in the bar of the Standard Hotel. A bound script of Lazarus, his latest stage project, nestled on the table beside his Americano.

title: Economists, Biologists and Skrillex on How to Predict the Future
description: Lots of people pretend theyve got tomorrow figured out: tech gurus, politicians, C.E.O.s and (yes) journalists. But if were honest with ourselves, the view ahead of us has never been murkier. Thats because the problems that most haunt our world today  climate change and pollution, inequality and war  are problems for which technology, long our spur to envisioning better futures, looks more like a cause than a solution. Our future is hard to imagine because we have trouble imagining how we can possibly act to improve it.

title: Poll Watch: Overseas Elections Offer Warnings for U.S. Pollsters
description: Pre-election polls in numerous countries this year have widely missed their marks, often by underestimating support for candidates on the ideological fringes. The polling failures in countries like Britain, Poland and Israel point to technical issues that could well foreshadow polling problems in the United States, many analysts believe.

title: Chinese Taxi Driver Turned Billionaire Bought Modigliani Painting
description: BEIJING  Liu Yiqian, a former taxi driver turned billionaire art collector, confirmed on Tuesday that he was the buyer of the painting of a nude woman by Amedeo Modigliani that sold for  $170.4 million at Christies New York on Monday night.

title: Hossam Bahgat, Journalist and Advocate, Is Released by Egypts Military
description: CAIRO  The Egyptian military on Tuesday released the journalist Hossam Bahgat, hours before planned demonstrations in Cairo, London and other cities to call for his freedom.

title: Atulya Pandeys H-1B Visa Is Denied
description: The Department of Homeland Security denies a temporary worker visa.

title: How the H-1B Visa System Can Hurt American Workers
description: Congress set up the H-1B visa program to help American companies hire foreigners with specialized skills. But in recent years, many H-1B visas have gone to temporary immigrants who lacked special skills and displaced American workers from jobs.

title: How Outsourcing Companies Are Gaming the Visa System
description: How 20 companies took more than a third of the H-1B visas available in 2014.

title: Large Companies Game H-1B Visa Program, Costing the U.S. Jobs
description: Tho Ngri, a young software engineer from France, had come up with so many novel ideas at his job at an Internet start-up in San Francisco that the American entrepreneur who hired him wanted to keep him on.

title: Weekly News Quiz | Nov. 3-9, 2015
description: Have you been following the news?

title: Even as House Speaker, Paul Ryan Sleeps in His Office
description: WASHINGTON  The speaker has no house.

title: Do We Romanticize Writers Who Die Young?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Dana Stevens and Benjamin Moser discuss how we view authors who die before their time.

title: What Mass Incarceration Looks Like for Juveniles
description: After two decades of researching mass incarceration  and advocating for its demise  I decided in 2005 to take more direct action and accepted a job running corrections departments, first in Washington, D.C., then in New York City. It was a rude awakening.

title: Subject, Meet Verb
description: Singular subject, singular verb; plural subject, plural verb. What could be simpler? And yet

title: Emma Roberts Shares Her Beauty Routine
description: Emma Roberts, 24, plays the lead character Chanel Oberlin, a terrifying sorority co-president who lords over her minions (the Chanels) on the hit fall show Scream Queens. In real life, Ms. Roberts, who was born in the Hudson Valley but grew up in the Hollywood Hills, is quite a bit more approachable and a beauty product junkie to boot. Here, the actress and Aerie model shares her beauty favorites.

title: Football Inequality, and a Patriots-Panthers Super Bowl?
description: Midway through the N.F.L. season is often the juncture at which sportstalk obsesses about parity driving every team toward .500. Instead, in this midway point there are three 8-0 teams and 16 losing clubs. No ones ever satisfied  there are complaints of not enough parity.

title: Let Go of Irrational Fears
description: When we talk about the chances of something bad happening, people tend to fall into three general groups.

title: Where Humans and Computers Agree in College Football
description: Cover your ears, Bowl Championship Series haters. Many computer rankings, which rely on statistics and algorithms to rate teams, tracked closely with how the committees 12 flesh-and-blood experts ended up listing the teams in the seasons first College Football Playoff ranking last Tuesday night.

title: Allen Toussaint, New Orleans R&B Mainstay, Dies at 77
description: Allen Toussaint, the versatile producer, songwriter, pianist and singer who was a fixture of New Orleans R&B, died after appearing in concert in Madrid on Monday night. He was 77.

title: Ex-British Soldier, 66, Is Arrested in Bloody Sunday Massacre
description: LONDON  The police in Northern Ireland arrested a 66-year-old man on Tuesday in connection with Bloody Sunday, the infamous massacre of unarmed civilian marchers by British soldiers in Londonderry on Jan. 30, 1972. It was the first time anyone has been arrested in the massacre, for which the British government formally apologized in 2010.

title: Chinas Crackdown on Financial Markets Gets Top-Level Support
description: HONG KONG  President Xi Jinping of China called for more measures to protect stock market investors after meeting with financial regulators, the state news media said on Tuesday, signaling top-level support for a national campaign to crack down on market manipulation and to increase transparency.

title: Everywhere a Bodhisattva
description: Dear Diary:

title: TAG Heuer, Intel and Google Raise the Stakes in Smartwatches
description: It wasnt quite the frenzy of the Balmain x H&M event last week, but by noon on Monday, there were lines outside the TAG Heuer store on Fifth Avenue stretching at least partway down the block, as watch aficionados awaited their first glance at what has been thought of as the first real luxury competitor to the Apple Watch: the TAG Heuer Connected, a Swiss-engineered smartwatch with an Intel chip and a Google platform.

title: 1915: Japan Crowns Emperor
description: With all the strangely picturesque ceremony customary to the occasion, the coronation of Emperor Yoshihito of Japan took place yesterday at Kyoto, the Holy City. Strictly speaking, by reason of the fact that in Japan the sovereign has no crown nor does he receive any anointment, the ceremony was not so much that of a coronation as of the consecration of the new Emperor by a solemn ritual homage paid by him to his ancestors. The festivities in connection with the celebration of the Emperors accession to the throne last a month and began on Saturday with the departure from Tokyo of the sovereign and his suite for Kyoto, where on Sunday he deposited in the sacred pavilion called the Shunko-Den the sword, mirror and jewels bequeathed by the first Emperor of the Meiji dynasty. The New York Herald, European Edition, November 11, 1915

title: Ben Carson Fans in Iowa Stand by Their Man and Against the News Media
description: DES MOINES  As he faces a swirl of questions about whether elements of his compelling biography are true, Ben Carson is finding stubborn allies: his many fans in Iowa, who are shrugging off accusations that he made things up, calling them reflective of news media bias.

title: American Ambassador Builds Diplomatic Bridges With British Teenagers
description: LONDON  Matthew Barzun, the American ambassador to the Court of St. Jamess, stood before a buzzing, boisterous audience of several hundred teenagers in a poor borough on the southern edge of greater London and asked them what frustrated or concerned them the most about the United States.

title: Daily Report: The Match and Square Road Shows
description: Let the road shows begin.

title: Man, 90, Dies in Queens Apartment Fire
description: A 90-year-old man died on Tuesday after he was found unconscious by emergency workers responding to a fire in his apartment in Queens, the authorities said.

title: Helmut Schmidt, Assertive West German Chancellor, Dies at 96
description: Helmut Schmidt, the former West German chancellor who marshaled personal dynamism, managerial brilliance and often acid-tongued impatience to push his country into an assertive international role as the Cold War dragged on into the 1970s, died on Tuesday at his home in Hamburg. He was 96.

title: Court Rules Against French Comedian Dieudonn in Free-Speech Case
description: LONDON  In 2008, the French comedian Dieudonn Mbala Mbala finished a performance in Paris by inviting a Holocaust denier onstage to receive a prize from an actor dressed in striped pajamas resembling a concentration camp uniform, with a yellow star bearing the word Jew.

title: Facebook to Appeal a Belgian Courts Ruling on Data Privacy
description: Facebook intends to appeal a privacy ruling in Belgium that forces the social media giant to stop collecting digital information about people who are not its users.

title: Vito J. Lopez, Ex-New York Assemblyman Tainted by Scandal, Dies at 74
description: Vito J. Lopez, a former community organizer and New York assemblyman who parlayed a small antipoverty center in Brooklyn into a political machine that made him a power broker in New York City and Albany until he was brought down by a sexual harassment scandal, died on Monday in Manhattan. He was 74.

title: Now for the Positive: Jay Cutler Becomes Bears Top Passer
description: When you think about Jay Cutler, you might think about ... well, what do you think about?

title: Jane the Virgin Season 2, Episode 5: Who Will She Choose?
description: Jane the Virgin has done a superb job navigating the love triangle, a common television plot device that is often done poorly, as when series allow it to overtake the main narrative or spend too long building multiple will-they/wont they- scenarios. Yet Jane the Virgin has deftly managed its triangle in a way that remains engaging and new, and doesnt make viewers sick of the love between either Jane and Michael or Jane and Rafael.

title: 1940: Italians Flee in Greece
description: ATHENS  The Italian lines in the Epirus sector have broken and the Fascist troops are in full retreat there, at the extreme left, or southern, end of the Greek front, according to the latest reports reaching here tonight [Nov. 10]. The Italians are retreating in disorder and are abandoning quantities of war material, it was stated in the reports. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, November 11, 1940

title: Why Tuberculosis Is Back
description: WASHINGTON  New data from the World Health Organization shows that we have allowed a preventable, curable disease to become the worlds biggest communicable killer. The millenniums-old lung disease tuberculosis now outranks even H.I.V./AIDS in the number of lives it claims. The fact is that weve been very successful at curing people of TB since the 1950s  so why is this illness still such a scourge?

title: The Designer Who Doesnt Want You to Sit Down
description: The Spanish industrial designer Patricia Urquiola tackles the ultimate frontier of bad design: the American office.

title: Miami City Ballet Returns for Joyce Season
description: Miami City Ballet will give a season in New York for the first time since 2009. Alessandra Ferri and Herman Cornejo team up for a program of contemporary ballet pieces with the pianist Bruce Levingston. These are some of the highlights of the Joyce Theaters offerings for its spring and summer season, announced on Tuesday, which also includes the tap ensemble Dorrance Dance, the Stephen Petronio Company, Pennsylvania Ballet and a Cuba Festival.

title: Escaping Reality With Brazils Globo TV
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Last year, The Economist published an article about TV Globo, Brazils largest broadcast network. It reported that 91 million people, just under half the population, tune in to it each day: The sort of audience that, in the United States, is to be had only once a year, and only for the one network that has won the rights that year to broadcast American footballs Super Bowl championship game.

title: Cuffing Season Is Here: Till Spring Do Us Part
description: Camille Sanches, a Columbia University sophomore, was eating lunch with friends when another girl stopped by with some news: A guy had asked her out on a date.

title: A Bleak Future in Eastern Ukraines Frozen Zone
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  The 28-year-old accountant with a bob of chestnut hair would dash from work to meet her wide circle of friends at bars, restaurants and dinner parties. Its not how you spend your time, but who you spend it with, Irina Filatova, the accountant, said of her humming social life.

title: Opening Eyes
description: On my 2015 win-a-trip journey with Nicholas Kristof through India and Nepal, I spent most of the time reporting on issues related to extreme poverty, malnutrition and human rights abuses. As I wrote these columns, I battled feelings of futility and hopelessness. I was determined to change hearts and minds through human-centered stories, but I was afraid that the scale of the problems I was witnessing would engulf any efforts made to combat them.

title: Scott Campbell Wants to Tattoo You
description: As the best man at Justin Theroux and Jennifer Anistons wedding; the husband of the actress and filmmaker Lake Bell; and the tattoo artist who has inked the likes of Sting, Marc Jacobs, Robert Downey Jr. and Courtney Love, the New York tattoo artist turned fine artist Scott Campbell has enjoyed a degree of media attention not usually afforded the anonymous skin-scribblers of the East Village.

title: A Pre-emptive Strike From Marco Rubio, Using Jeb Bushs Words
description: Senator Marco Rubio is ready for an onslaught of attacks from Jeb Bush, and ahead of Tuesday nights Republican presidential debate he offered a preview of the comeback that he may use should Mr. Bush go on the offensive.

title: Prosecutors Allege Persistent Heating Oil Fraud in New York City
description: In a city of glittering office towers and computerized transactions, of records kept in the cloud and fuels that send less soot into the sky, the authorities say old-fashioned corruption of the most brazen kind still poisons the heating oil industry.

title: Tasting and Testing a Genetically Modified, Non-Browning Apple
description: Innovations in biotech crops arent known for getting children excited, but there is a new fruit trait on its way to the market that families may appreciate and children may actually notice. Its a genetically modified apple that doesnt turn brown when it is bruised or sliced. My children and I had a chance to try some last week. We beat them up and put them through a battery of tests to see how child-friendly and tasty they really are  a snack and a science lesson in one.

title: Obama to Appeal Immigration Ruling to Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will ask the Supreme Court to clear the way for his far-reaching overhaul of the nations immigration system, administration lawyers said Tuesday, setting up a battle in the nations highest court over whether nearly five million undocumented immigrants can legally live and work in the United States.

title: A History of Racism at the University of Missouri
description: Timothy Wolfes resignation on Monday from the presidency of the University of Missouri system will not resolve the racial tensions that forced him from office. His tone-deaf style certainly inflamed the problem at the flagship campus in Columbia. But racist acts and utterances aimed at black students and black faculty have been an issue there for many years.

title: Hindu Nationalist Killed in Clashes at Indian Celebration of Muslim Ruler
description: NEW DELHI  Tension between Hindus and Muslims flared anew in India on Tuesday when a Hindu nationalist in the southern state of Karnataka died from injuries he suffered while protesting a celebration honoring an 18th-century Muslim ruler.

title: New York Regulator Seeks Proposals to Improve Cybersecurity
description: New Yorks financial industry regulator is seeking suggestions from other regulators on proposed regulations to shore up digital security defenses in the industry.

title: Obama Turns to Diplomacy and Military in Syria, and Is Met With Doubts
description: WASHINGTON  For the first time in the four-year Syrian civil war, President Obama is beginning to execute a combined diplomatic and military approach to force President Bashar al-Assad to leave office and end the carnage.

title: Raymond Kelly, Former New York Police Commissioner, Joins K2
description: Since leaving his role as the longest-serving commissioner of the New York Police Department two years ago, Raymond W. Kelly has hardly retired.

title: Modern Vessels With an Ancient Feel
description: The stoneware vessels crafted by the Los Angeles-based ceramist Eric Roinestad evoke the persevering elegance of water jugs pulled from the volcanic soil of Pompeii. Yet while the objects nod to the past, with their whitewashed bisque palette and smooth matte surfaces, they are clearly of their time. After giving these substantial pieces, which range between 14 and 20 inches tall, a flat wash, Roinestad fires them and then sands them to let some of the clay show through the glaze, giving the vases the feel of having been hauled, gently, from the ashes of time.

title: Myanmar Military Still Big Power Despite Opposition Victory
description: YANGON, Myanmar  Amid the mold-covered facades of downtown Yangon are police stations, a five-story building housing the Special Branch state security agency and government offices where citizens are required to register out-of-town houseguests.

title: Volkswagen Hires Expert in Self-Driving Cars From Apple
description: Volkswagen has hired an expert in self-driving car technology from Apple, sending a signal that it will continue to invest in leading-edge technologies despite the financial burden created by its emissions cheating crisis.

title: Beware the Beer Belly
description: A beer belly is a dangerous thing.

title: Arrest of Jose Reyes May Test Baseballs New Domestic Violence Policy
description: BOCA RATON, Fla.  Colorado Rockies shortstop Jose Reyes, who was arrested in Hawaii recently on charges of assaulting his wife, may become the first player to face discipline under Major League Baseballs new domestic violence policy.

title: Jams
description: Jonathan Waxman reboots the restaurant that helped bring nouvelle California cuisine to New York.

title: Jams Gets a Reboot in Midtown
description: By the early 1980s, New Yorkers knew that something major was happening in the kitchens of California. They had heard about the revolution, but most of them hadnt tasted it until Jonathan Waxman opened Jams in 1984. Here was a report from the West Coast front lines brought by a chef fresh from Michaels in Santa Monica and, before that, Chez Panisse in Berkeley.

title: New Tour Reveals Vietnams Many Sides
description: A new tour to Vietnam from Adventure Life combines cultural and outdoor activities in urban and rural settings. Highlights of the 12-day trip include trekking through remote Hmong villages, exploring Hanoi and spending two nights on a junk cruising around the towering limestone islands in Ha Long Bay, above. On the way back to Hanoi from Ha Long, travelers will visit the porcelain ceramics factory at Bat Trang and take a rickshaw ride along the bank of the Perfume River to the Hue Imperial City. On some days, guests will be able to choose among cycling, rock climbing or a trek to the massive Son Doong Cave in Phong Nha-Ke Bang National Park, open to the public only since 2013.

title: Tale of Gowanus Canals Three-Eyed Fish May Be Too Good to Be True
description: A lot of strange things lurk in the murky, tainted depths of the Gowanus Canal in Brooklyn. But a three-eyed catfish is very unlikely to be one of them.

title: A Star Wars Fan Dies After Getting His Last Wish
description: After learning that he was losing his two-year battle with cancer, Daniel Fleetwood, a longtime Star Wars fan, had one last wish: to see an early version of the newest film.

title: In the South of France, a Sophisticated Ease
description: Exaggerated tailoring and classic stripes take new shape by the sea.

title: Justice Department Opposes United-Delta Swap for Newark Landing Slots
description: The Justice Department said on Tuesday that it would seek to block United Airlines from further expanding its hold at Newark Liberty International Airport because the carrier already has a near monopoly there.

title: Readers Respond: Kicked Off a Plane
description: Last week, several airplane passengers in Los Angeles who had boarded their Spirit Airlines flight to Dallas got kicked off the plane after an exchange over a seat that had been double-booked. (The passengers say the decision was racially motivated; the carrier says its looking into the matter.)

title: Atmospheric Greenhouse Gas Levels Hit Record, Report Says
description: Global concentrations of carbon dioxide in Earths atmosphere surpassed 400 parts per million for a monthly average this past spring, breaching a symbolic barrier set by climate scientists and policy makers, according to a report released Monday.

title: Prosecutors Announce More Charges in Hacking of JPMorgan Chase
description: Billing it as the largest hacking case ever uncovered, federal prosecutors in Manhattan on Tuesday described a global, multiyear scheme to steal information on 100 million customers of a dozen companies in the United States and use the data to advance stock manipulation activities, illicit online gambling and fraud.

title: In Russia, Doping Accusations Are Taken in Stride
description: MOSCOW  The sweeping accusations that a Kremlin-backed program facilitated doping by elite Russian track-and-field athletes in the Olympics and other top sports events earned a collective shrug Tuesday from the Russian public and even, to some extent, from the officials who oversaw the debacle.

title: Neel Kashkari, Ex-Treasury Official, Named Minneapolis Fed President
description: WASHINGTON  Neel T. Kashkari, who oversaw the governments bailout of the banking industry as a Treasury official in the George W. Bush and Obama administrations, was named the next president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis on Tuesday.

title: Fashion by the Sea
description: Exaggerated tailoring and classic stripes inspire a more sophisticated ease.

title: Valeant Chief Says Issues Stem From Fast Growth
description: J. Michael Pearson, the embattled chief executive of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International, sought on Tuesday to reassure investors that the once highflying company still had a solid future despite a steep fall in its stock price and growing questions about its business model and debt levels.

title: Aziz Ansari on Acting, Race and Hollywood
description: Fisher Stevens was cooking dinner when I got him on the phone. I had wanted to talk to him for years because, as I recount in my new Netflix series, Master of None, this actor played a strange role in my relationship to television and film.

title: Cuomo to Raise Minimum Wage to$15 for All New York State Employees
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo announced on Tuesday that he would unilaterally establish a $15 minimum wage for all state workers, making New York the first state to set such a high wage for its public employees.

title: How to Watch the G.O.P. Debate
description: Republican presidential candidates will get another opportunity to share their views on the economy on Tuesday night in Milwaukee, when Fox Business Network and The Wall Street Journal host the partys fourth debate this cycle.

title: Deployment Solace From an Earlier Generation of Military Spouses
description: When my husband, a Navy helicopter pilot, deployed a little over a month ago, I drove our two children home in relative silence, wondering how we would handle the better part of the next year. I found my answer  my solace  in an unlikely place: love letters that arent mine.

title: Meatballs and Instruction Manuals: Indiana Braces for Ikea.
description: Lingonberries, Swedish meatballs and the frustrations of furniture assembly manuals are coming to central Indiana: Ikea, the Swedish home furnishings retailer, announced plans on Tuesday to open a new store outside Indianapolis.

title: Einat Admonys New Restaurant Set to Open
description: Combina The chef Einat Admonys latest restaurant, a wide room with an open kitchen and bar and an expanse of windows, will feature her trademark Israeli-Middle Eastern fare, but often with a bright Spanish inflection. The haloumi (cheese) comes dressed with chimichurri; a burger is made with merguez, the North African sausage; fried eggplant comes on a tostada; and there are salt cod doughnuts. Not fritters, real doughnuts, Ms. Admony said. The drinks list includes sherries, ciders, vermouths and homemade limoncello made with Moroccan-style preserved lemons. Joining her as chef in this venture is Molly Breidenthal. Lacking basement storage, the owners installed shelving all around to hold ingredients. (Opens Saturday): 330 West Broadway (Grand Street), 212-226-1248.

title: University of Missouri Professor Who Confronted Photographer Quits Journalism Post
description: After a University of Missouri professor was seen on video calling for some muscle to remove a journalist from a public demonstration, the professor cut her ties to the universitys journalism school on Tuesday as protest organizers  and the professor herself  joined college officials in stating that journalists had a right to be present.

title: Liberty Global and Discovery Communications Take Stakes in Lions Gate
description: John C. Malone, the media and telecommunications billionaire, has never been one to shy away from making deals. And in a year when he helped orchestrate one of the biggest cable transactions in recent years, he has struck another play.

title: Senate Passes Military Bill That Bans Transfers of Guantnamo Detainees
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate on Tuesday approved an annual military policy bill, and the White House spokesman said President Obama would sign it despite provisions that will make it extremely difficult for him to fulfill his promise of closing the terrorist detention center at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba.

title: Reese Witherspoon, Caitlyn Jenner and Others Honored by Glamour
description: Activists, celebrities, athletes and businesswomen were celebrated at the magazines annual Women of the Year awards.

title: Portugals Government Ousted in Challenge to Austerity
description: An alliance of left-wing Portuguese lawmakers on Tuesday brought down the government of Prime Minister Pedro Passos Coelho, turning the countrys politics on its head just weeks after inconclusive elections and offering up a strong new challenge to the austerity policies that have divided Europe.

title: Caitlyn Jenner, Reese Witherspoon and Others Honor Women With Glamour
description: At the Glamour Women of the Year awards on Monday night, the dresses were designer and the heels hard to walk in, but the speeches were fiery and progressive.

title: Helmut Schmidt, West Germanys Assertive and Popular Chancellor
description: Mr. Schmidt, elected in 1974, pushed his country into a forceful international role during the waning Cold War years. He died Tuesday at 96.

title: Have You Encountered Racial Conflict on Campus?
description: New York Times journalists would like to hear about readers experiences with racial conflict on college campuses.

title: Why People Actually Like the Denver Airport
description: Airports are an inevitable part of the lives of most travelers. But few would say that they have a passion for them. Kim Day, the chief executive of Denver International Airport, is an exception. In a previous life, Ms. Day, 61, was an architect, and she says that shaped her career running airports. I see the world, and airports, differently than most people, she told the audience at the Skift Global Forum, a travel conference held last month in Brooklyn. I cant walk into a space without critiquing it and wanting to rearrange the furniture. And I plan every vacation around buildings and spaces around the world that I want to see.

title: Caution Needed on Push Into Repo Lending
description: Regional lenders like Wells Fargo, Nordea and the Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group have been bulking up in repo, a form of short-term collateralized lending that principally helps nonbank financial groups fund themselves and their clients. Its not a wholly positive trend.

title: Montreal to Dump Raw Sewage as It Makes Repairs
description: OTTAWA  The mayor of Montreal, Denis Coderre, said Tuesday that the city would begin dumping about 2.1 billion gallons of raw sewage into the St. Lawrence River early Wednesday morning.

title: Romanias President Picks Dacian Ciolos as New Prime Minister
description: BUCHAREST, Romania  Romanias president on Tuesday nominated an expert on agriculture to replace Prime Minister Victor Ponta, who was ousted last week after major demonstrations by protesters angered by graft and lethargy in the government.

title: No Charges Against Rio Police in Fatal Shooting of 10-Year-Old Boy
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Just seven months ago, this city was stunned by images of the lifeless body of Eduardo de Jesus, a 10-year-old boy fatally shot by a police officer on the doorstep of his home. The authorities promised justice to Eduardos parents. Protests flared in Complexo do Alemo, the maze of cinder block homes where Eduardo lived.

title: No Rio, Pacificao Sem Paz
description: No Alemo, uma das maiores favelas do Rio, a vaga de violncia custa a vida de crianas e policiais, colocando em causa a estratgia das Unidades de Polcia Pacificadora.

title: Merkel Praises Former Chancellor Schmidt
description: Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany praised the former West German chancellor Helmut Schmidt, who died on Tuesday, citing his service and sense of duty.

title: Hedda Hopper Bold Brand of Fashion
description: Who knew better than Hedda Hopper the value of an eye-popping look?

title: For Gossip Columnist Hedda Hopper, Flamboyance Was Her Brand
description: The geniuses who conduct the motion picture business killed glamour, Hedda Hopper once lamented.

title: Netflix to Finance Film by Snowpiercer Director
description: LOS ANGELES  Netflix will provide financing for the Korean director Bong Joon-hos adventure film Okja, which will be co-produced by Plan B Entertainment, Mr. Bong said in a statement. The film, about the travels of a girl and a friendly beast, is expected to cost about $50 million, and will feature Jake Gyllenhaal, Tilda Swinton, Bill Nighy and others.

title: 2 Accused of Being Russian Soldiers Appear in Court in Ukraine
description: MOSCOW  A Ukrainian court on Tuesday opened preliminary hearings in the trial of two Russian men captured in combat in eastern Ukraine and suspected of serving as active-duty members of the Russian military.

title: Commissioner Hopeful of 2016 Spring Training Game in Cuba
description: BOCA RATON, Fla.  Commissioner Rob Manfred expressed hope Tuesday that a Major League Baseball team would play exhibition games in Cuba during spring training next year, saying that it would be a good thing for baseball.

title: Attack of the Seagulls? Nope. Appendicitis Felled Pianist.
description: It had nothing to do with the seagull attack.

title: Korean War Memorial Group Finds More Aid in Korea Than in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON  The Korean War Veterans Memorial on the National Mall is often considered one of the most striking of the war memorials, with the seven-foot-tall stainless steel statues of soldiers anticipating combat, and its dark gray granite wall etched with images of those who supported the troops.

title: New York Parking Alert: Alternate-Side Rules Suspended on Wednesday
description: Because of Veterans Day, alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended in New York City on Wednesday. Other regulations will remain in effect.

title: From Hotel to Hospital: The Perils of Reporting in Pakistan
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The last time I worried about being the victim of a poison gas attack was in Baghdad, back when we still believed in the WMD fairy tale. The last place I ever expected a poison gas attack was in a five-star hotel here in Pakistans capital.

title: Lois Colley, Westchester County Socialite, Was Murdered, Police Say
description: A prominent socialite and the wife of a millionaire McDonalds franchise owner was found dead in her Westchester County home this week, and the New York State Police said on Tuesday that they believed she was murdered.

title: Former Prison for Women to Become a Place That Serves Them
description: Over the years, as West Chelsea went from gritty to glamorous, Bayview Correctional Facility, a notorious womens prison, became an increasingly odd fit.

title: Fantasy Football Week 10: Waiver Wire Picks
description: Heres a look at the players worth adding to your fantasy football roster this week:

title: Supreme Court Hears Case for Tyson Foods Class-Action Lawsuit
description: WASHINGTON  Facing a Supreme Court generally hostile to class actions, thousands of workers at an Iowa pork processing plant may nevertheless have found a narrow path toward victory at an argument on Tuesday, one that would allow them to band together in a single lawsuit seeking overtime pay.

title: Rehabilitating a Prison
description: A former womens prison in Chelsea is being converted into offices, by developers who will rent mainly to nonprofit organizations focused on providing services for women.

title: Survey Finds Corporations Looking to Reduce Outside Legal Spending
description: Close to half the corporate law departments that responded to a recent survey plan to cut spending on outside legal work, according to Altman-Weil, a legal consulting firm that surveyed 258 corporate law departments. Instead, corporate counsel offices plan to parcel out more work among their own employees and to contract lawyers.

title: Mayor de Blasios Group Abandons Plans for Inequality Forum in Iowa
description: The liberal advocacy group founded by Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York has abandoned its plans to hold a forum in Iowa focused on income inequality, bringing an abrupt and anticlimactic end to his initial efforts at shaping the economic debate in the 2016 presidential campaign.

title: New Yorks Funniest Stand-Up Finalists Gear Up for a Serious Smackdown
description: Its a maxim that stand-up comedy, like many artistic pursuits, is a marathon, not a sprint: There arent many lightning victories, just one long slog. But after taking part in the New Yorks Funniest Stand-Up semifinals last month, Randy Syphax seemed to think that the competition gave comics an incentive to pick up the pace. Nights like this definitely feel like someone shot a gun, he said.

title: Review: How to Pet a Dog and Other Gnawing Issues in Going Deep With David Rees
description: Dont overthink it is usually pretty good advice; the list of things that can be made worse or less enjoyable by too much analysis is endless. But Going Deep With David Rees turns overthinking into an art form.

title: Facebook Complaint
description: The lawsuit filed against Facebook and its directors over directors compensation.

title: Learning to Dress and Other Lessons From a Mafia Trial
description: The long profile of Vincent Asaro that I wrote for Tuesdays paper stemmed from good old-fashioned competition.

title: India Is Caught in a Climate Change Quandary
description: Spare a thought for poor India.

title: Pictures of the Day: Afghanistan and Elsewhere
description: Afghanistan and Elsewhere: Pictures of the Day

title: Sheldon Silver Was Paid for Referrals, Not Legal Work, Law Firm Leader Says at Trial
description: The exact nature of Sheldon Silvers lucrative outside legal work had long been one of the best-kept secrets in New York politics.

title: How Much to Pay a Director? Theres No Clear Answer
description: If you are tired of high chief executive compensation, youre probably not going to like the latest issue du jour: rising director pay.

title: When Ted Cruzs Father Campaigned for Fidel Castro
