description: Long before he headlined Republican dinners and wooed donors on behalf of his son, Ted, Rafael Cruz  now an evangelical pastor and a major draw for Tea Party audiences  campaigned across Texas for none other than Fidel Castro.

title: Nov. 10, 2015 Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Afghanistan, Syria, Greece and Myanmar.

title: WADA Acts on Doping Report, Revoking Accreditation of Russian Lab
description: In an interview Tuesday, the president of the World Anti-Doping Agency defended his handling of the Russian athletics scandal, even as his organization moved to revoke the accreditation of a Moscow lab at the heart of the scandal.

title: Eike Batista Banned for 5 Years From Serving as a Corporate Officer
description: SO PAULO  The fallen businessman Eike Batista lost another legal battle Tuesday as Brazils markets regulator banned him from serving as an officer of a publicly traded company for the next five years.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Vegetarian Thanksgiving: A Festive Vegan Torte
description: As a transplanted American living in Paris, Ann Schreifels had the task of hosting Thanksgiving, a holiday the locals didnt celebrate, in a city that is arguably the culinary capital of the world, to a guest list that included meat eaters and vegans.

title: Russian Airplane Crash Shakes Egypts Tourism
description: The Oct. 31 downing of the Russian airliner Metrojet over the Sinai Peninsula of Egypt, which killed all 224 passengers and crew aboard, represents the latest blow to Egyptian tourism, which has been reeling since the 2011 Egyptian uprising that ousted President Hosni Mubarak.

title: Hillary Clinton Pledges to Make Better Treatment of Veterans a Priority
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton on Tuesday called the Department of Veterans Affairs an archaic system that was built for the past, not the future, as she unveiled a multipronged set of proposals to expand care and medical services to the countrys 21.8 million veterans.

title: Review: Flora Crockett, a Forgotten Abstract Painter
description: The paintings of the American abstractionist Flora Crockett have not been exhibited in New York since a group show at the Overseas Press Club of America in 1965. That was the year she turned 73 and began her most productive period as a painter.

title: On Mr. Misunderstood, Eric Church Pays Homage to His Influences
description: Eric Church is the sort of singer who sings earnestly about other singers, whose songs posit music as a magical sun shower to bathe in blissfully. In his songs, music is fuel for love, for anguish and, naturally, for other music.

title: A Beloved L.A. Surf Hangout Gets a Second Act
description: When the Rose Caf  a longtime artist hangout in Venice Beach  closed its doors earlier this year, many of its fans feared a big change was underway. But for its next incarnation, open now, the new owner Bill Chait wanted to honor the spaces history and reflect the neighborhoods culture. So he called on Jeffrey Deitch, the New York-based art dealer and curator who just a few years earlier had served as the director of the Museum of Contemporary Art Los Angeles. We talked to Ed Ruscha, and Ed Moses, and reached out at some point to John Baldessari, and ended up talking to Craig, Chait says, referring to the artist Craig Stecyk, who decorated the new space. Craig knew a lot of these artists and obviously had been very involved in the Venice surf and skateboard scene, and so I think what hes doing was very sort of trying to enhance the history of the Rose.

title: Oy or Yo? Sculpture With Something to Say Lands at Brooklyn Bridge
description: The rude interjection is a staple of New York life. Now, the landscape of the city will itself heckle residents and tourists, with a brash new sculpture in Brooklyn Bridge Park that yells YO if you are looking at it from Manhattan or OY if you are gazing out from Brooklyn.

title: Review: With Charles Francis Chan Jr.s Exotic Oriental Murder Mystery, Lloyd Suh Takes on a Legacy
description: Ah. So.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Review: Ride the Cyclone, About Teenagers, and Angst, in Purgatory
description: CHICAGO  Ride the Cyclone, an unceasingly delightful new musical having its premiere at the Chicago Shakespeare Theater, does bring a smidgen of sad news. Apparently the rivalries, insecurities and peer-fearing angst of the teenage years survive even beyond the grave.

title: Gordon Parkss Harlem Argument
description: A look at Gordon Parkss first photo essay for Life shows how editors choices of words and pictures can manipulate meaning.

title: Review: Mad Libs Live!, a Musical With a Few Missing Pieces
description: Poop was popular at the matinee I attended. So was Donald Trump. That figures: Playing Mad Libs, the fill-in-the-blank word game, always has been license to go a little lowbrow.

title: Attorney General Tells DraftKings and FanDuel to Stop Taking Entries in New York
description: The New York State attorney general on Tuesday ordered the two biggest daily fantasy sports companies, DraftKings and FanDuel, to stop accepting bets from New York residents, saying their games constituted illegal gambling under state law.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing: Republican Debate, University of Missouri
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: My Life on the Road, Gloria Steinems Journey as a Traveling Feminist
description: As a young journalist in the early 1960s, Gloria Steinem famously went undercover as a Playboy bunny. In the early pages of her new book, My Life on the Road, Ms. Steinem, now 81, claims another unlikely job description.

title: When Buying Gift Cards, Know Your Audience (and Their Age)
description: Shoppers stumped about what holiday gifts to give friends or relatives often fall back on gift cards. When choosing such a card, it may be wise to take the recipients age into account, a new analysis finds.

title: Avi Hoffman and Suzanne Toren on Death of a Salesman and Yiddish
description: Before he was a salesman, Willy Loman was a peddler on the Lower East Side.

title: Hillary Clinton Is Criticized for Not Condemning Mans Talk of Strangling Carly Fiorina
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton is under fire from Republicans for failing to come to the defense of Carly Fiorina on Tuesday after a man at a campaign event said that he wished he could reach out and strangle Ms. Fiorina.

title: Violent Loop Engulfs Youths in Jerusalem
description: JERUSALEM  The younger cousin took his allowance from his father on Tuesday morning and said he was off to school as usual. He and his older cousin decided to skip class instead.

title: A Conversation With Martin Cohen
description: Mr. Cohen, 66, is the executive chairman and a founder of Cohen & Steers, a publicly traded investment company known for its real estate investment trust, or REIT, mutual funds. The company, which Mr. Cohen started in New York in 1986 with Robert Steers, was among the first to specialize in listed real estate. It manages around $50 billion in assets, which now also include infrastructure, natural resource and commodity equities.

title: U.S. Unseals Indictment in Hacking Case
description: Preet Bharara, the United States attorney for the Southern District of New York, announced charges in the the largest hacking case ever uncovered.

title: The Fight for $15 Comes to the Republican Debate
description: When an estimated one thousandFight for $15 protesters gather on Tuesday night at the Milwaukee auditorium where the Republican presidential debate is being held, it will mark the end of a long day of strikes and protests in some 400 cities nationwide.

title: Alabama 8-Year-Old Charged With Murder in Toddlers Beating
description: ATLANTA  An 8-year-old boy has been charged with murder in Birmingham, Ala., where the police said Tuesday that he had viciously attacked a toddler whose mother had left children alone while she visited one of the citys nightclubs.

title: Designing Arthur Miller: Simple Gestures, Big Ideas
description: A compelling silhouette appears on the cover of a new digital edition of the playwright Arthur Millers Playing for Time, about a womens orchestra in Auschwitz. (The script was produced as a 1980 television movie starring Vanessa Redgrave.) Against a somber purple background, white pages of a score spill from a skinny music stand. It takes a second to notice the swastika at the base.

description: View the New York attorney generals letter to FanDuel.

description: View the attorney generals letter to DraftKings

title: McDonalds Says Its Acting to End Slump
description: The McDonalds Corporation will increase its spending to buy back shares and for heftier dividends for shareholders, Steve Easterbrook, its chief executive, said on Tuesday.

title: Redpoint Joint Venture in Brazil Adds Romero Rodrigues, a Top Entrepreneur
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Redpoint eventures, a joint effort between Redpoint Ventures and e.ventures of Silicon Valley, has added Romero Rodrigues, one of Brazils best-known Internet entrepreneurs, as a full-time general partner.

title: Nevada: Lack of Oxygen Is Cited in Death in Cryotherapy Tank
description: The woman who died at a cryotherapy center in Henderson while giving herself a cold-air treatment died from lack of oxygen, the Clark County coroners office said Tuesday. The woman, Chelsea Ake-Salvacion, 24, was an employee at Rejuvenice, which allowed customers to spend up to three minutes encased in capsules cooled to minus 240 degrees. She was found dead in one of the chambers on Oct. 20, prompting questions about safety in the growing industry. The coroners office said nitrogen used to cool the chamber had displaced the oxygen Ms. Ake-Salvacion needed to breathe, and ruled her death an accident.

title: Seeking a Better Life While Trying to Forget the Long, Terrible Years of the Holocaust
description: Rain tapped lightly on the windows of Dora and Motel Shkolnicks one-bedroom apartment in Brighton Beach, Brooklyn. Inside, Mr. Shkolnick, 96, and Mrs. Shkolnick, 91, sat at a dining room table and shared warm pastries she had baked.

title: Thanksgiving for All
description: There is no more inclusive holiday on the American calendar than Thanksgiving  and perhaps no more ambitious for the home cook. From turkey to the trimmings, Sam Sifton, Melissa Clark, Julia Moskin, Eric Asimov and the editors of The New York Times Food department tell you everything you need to know to plan the menu, prepare the food and serve it all with style and grace.

title: SABMiller Is Said Near Deal to Sell MillerCoors
description: Molson Coors Brewing Company is close to an agreement to buy the rest of MillerCoors from SABMiller, a person briefed on the deal said.

title: The G.O.P. Debate in Milwaukee
description: Chris Christie and Mike Huckabee appeared onstage for the first time with other Republican candidates, Bobby Jindal and Rick Santorum, in the undercard debate Tuesday. Then the leading candidates took the stage.

title: Pat Eddery, Prolific and Steely Jockey, Dies at 63
description: Pat Eddery, one of the greatest jockeys of the postwar era, with three victories in the Epsom Derby and four in the Arc de Triomphe to his credit, as well as two Breeders Cup races in the United States, died on Tuesday. He was 63.

title: Egyptian Resort, Bruised by Sinai Jet Crash, Is Accustomed to Shocks
description: SHARM EL SHEIKH, Egypt  The sidewalk vendors selling colorful scarves, leather necklaces and pharonic refrigerator magnets would be the first to lose their livelihoods, said Ishak Haleem, a grocery store owner here.

title: Private Jet Hits Building in Ohio, Killing at Least 2
description: At least two people on a private jet were killed Tuesday when the aircraft clipped power lines and crashed into a small apartment building in northern Ohio, officials said.

title: Torn Asunder in 1943 Battle, Twins Are Reunited Under Florida Soil
description: During World War II, the Reilly brothers were part of a unit that stormed the beach of a small Japanese-held island in the Pacific. It would be their last hour together.

title: Torn Asunder in 1943 Battle, Twins Are Reunited Under Florida Soil
description: James P. Reilly and Michael J. Reilly, fraternal twins born on Nov. 9, 1923, remained close throughout their abbreviated life together. As allies and co-conspirators, they were always within each others orbit, attending the same public schools in Queens, playing sports together and jointly enlisting in the Marines.

title: Testimony at Sheldon Silvers Trial Suggests How Lucrative Mesothelioma Was
description: A 10-minute break. The doors swing open from Courtroom 443 at the federal courthouse in Foley Square, Manhattan, and spectators file out, followed, eventually, by the defendant.

title: Support for Israel Must Be Bipartisan, Netanyahu Tells U.S. Audience
description: WASHINGTON  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel made a direct appeal on Tuesday to Democrats still troubled by the public feud over the nuclear deal with Iran, appearing at a leading liberal think tank aligned with President Obama to declare that support for his country in the United States must remain a bipartisan proposition.

title: Domestic Violence Is a Recurring Quandary for the N.F.L.
description: The N.F.L. has long been known for its lock-step precision and discipline, from the players on the field to the executives in the league headquarters.

title: Los Angeles Police Urged to Review Use of Force After Alarming Rise in Shootings
description: LOS ANGELES  Citing an alarming rise in shootings by police over the last year, the civilian board that oversees the Los Angeles police called on Tuesday for an extensive review of the departments policies on the use of force.

title: Ren Girard, French Theorist of the Social Sciences, Dies at 91
description: Ren Girard, whose explorations of literature and myth helped establish influential theories about how people are motivated to want things, died on Nov. 4 at his home in Stanford, Calif. He was 91.

title: Kevin Durant Is Mr. Popular in an Opponents Town
description: WASHINGTON  On Tuesday morning, about 30 reporters and 10 television cameras formed a semicircle around Kevin Durant after the Oklahoma City Thunders morning shootaround at Verizon Center. Durant wore a camouflage jacket (which did little good) and large headphones that he had draped around his neck.

title: West Virginia Ruling Could Clarify the Rights of Criminal Defendants
description: The West Virginia Supreme Court said Tuesday that a man could withdraw a guilty plea he made in 2002 for a robbery and rape because prosecutors had withheld DNA testing results suggesting that he was probably innocent.

title: Rampage by a Soldier Known for Loyalty Shakes Jordan, and a Family
description: RAYMUN, Jordan  He was a fierce Jordanian nationalist, following his father and uncles into the military from this village loyal to King Abdullah II. He was also a deeply conservative Muslim, at the mosque most days by 3 a.m. to lead the first and most challenging of the five daily prayers.

title: A Real Missouri Concerned Student 1950 Speaks, at Age 89
description: They named themselves Concerned Student 1950, in reference to the year the first black students were admitted to the University of Missouri.

title: Chris Christie Saves All His Shots for Clinton in G.O.P. Undercard Debate
description: At the risk of seeing his campaign slipping away, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey used an appearance in the second-tier Republican debate on Tuesday to seize center stage and project himself as above intraparty conflict while inviting the Republican Party to view him as its warrior against Hillary Rodham Clinton.

title: Dizzying Ride May Be Ending for Tech Start-Ups
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The worth of hot technology start-ups seemed for years to go in only one direction: straight up.

title: Fact Check: The Fourth Republican Debate
description: We checked the accuracy of candidates remarks in the Republican debate in Milwaukee.

title: Transcript: G.O.P. Presidential Undercard Featuring Jindal and Huckabee
description: Following is a transcript of the undercard Republican debate, as transcribed by the Federal News Service.

title: More Rex Ryan, More Geno Smith, More ... Is It Thursday Yet?
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  The Jets and the Buffalo Bills will play football this week. If Thursday ever comes.

title: Old Rush Participants
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  This one by David Steinberg kept its secrets from me for the longest time and it was worth it. I say this because its very easy to put your nose up in the air and critique a puzzle that has  lets just call it odd fill and cluing, shall we?  but its a downright hoot when you find out toward the end of the solve that the oddness was deliberate and to a purpose.

title: Fatal Crash in a Brooklyn Creek, Seen Only on Camera
description: The car traveling at high speed down Gerritsen Avenue in Brooklyn early Monday morning smashed through a wood construction fence, through a yard and into thin air. It crashed into the water of Shell Bank Creek, by the Belt Parkway, and sank.

title: Express Scripts Cuts Ties to New York Specialty Pharmacy
description: The nations largest pharmacy benefit manager has stopped doing business with a specialty pharmacy used by the drug maker Horizon Pharma, in a sign of a further crackdown on the use mail-order dispensaries to help lift sales of expensive drugs.

title: Republicans Tangle in Milwaukee
description: The leading rivals took the stage on Tuesday night for the fourth G.O.P. presidential debate.

title: Scream Queens Season 1, Episode 8: Snuffed Out
description: You knew she had to go sooner or later  she was that kind of character; not fringe, but not really major either  and on Tuesday nights Scream Queens the chapters candle blogger was, as it were, snuffed out. She was never given much to do in the show, but Ill miss her waxy obsessiveness anyway.

title: In Republican Debate, Candidates Battle Sharply on Immigration
description: MILWAUKEE  After weeks of personal sniping, the Republican presidential candidates clashed sharply over immigration and other policies in their debate here on Tuesday, with Gov. John Kasich of Ohio and former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida trying to energize their campaigns by heaping scorn on Donald J. Trumps plan to deport unauthorized immigrants.

title: Canada: Montreal to Dump Sewage Into River During Repair Work
description: The mayor of Montreal, Denis Coderre, said Tuesday that the city would begin dumping about 2.1 billion gallons of raw sewage into the St. Lawrence River early Wednesday. The diversion, which may continue for up to seven days, will allow workers to repair and alter a major collector sewer. If we could have avoided this choice, we would have done it, Mr. Coderre told reporters. After initially approving the citys plan, the former Conservative federal government banned the city from diverting the sewage in the midst of the recent election campaign. The Conservatives were routed by the Liberal Party last month. The new Liberal government said Monday that the diversion could go ahead, provided that the city addressed concerns raised by a panel of scientists. That review found that while dumping the sewage was not ideal, it was preferable to the potential consequences of a sewer failure.

title: A Troubled G.O.P. Debate for Donald Trump and Jeb Bush

description: JERSEY CITY  There was trouble after only six moves, and everyone in the room knew it. I think hes going to try to beat us in the most painful way possible, a quiet voice in the back row said.

title: A Criminal Record and a Fair Shot at a Job
description: Nineteen states and 100 cities and counties forbid public agencies  and in some cases, private businesses  to ask job applicants about criminal convictions until later in the application process, when they have had a fair chance to prove their qualifications. Last week, President Obama added the weight of the federal government to this movement when he ordered federal agencies to stop asking most people about convictions at the outset.

title: The Misuse of Interpols Database
description: Fugitive alerts issued by Interpol, the international law enforcement clearinghouse, can make it hard for fugitives to slip across borders. But the groups red notice database, which can be reviewed by authorities across the world to identify people facing prosecution, is frequently used by authoritarian governments to control and persecute dissidents, human rights activists and journalists.

title: Voters, You Can Have Everything!
description: I confess, as much as I am troubled by Donald Trumps anti-immigrant, anti-free-trade tirades, I do find The Donalds campaign strategy truly interesting. Hes not, as people say, an anti-politician. Hes actually caricaturing politicians. And like any great caricaturist, Trump identifies his subjects most salient features and then exaggerates them.

title: How Much Do Black Lives Matter to the Presidential Campaign?
description: The onslaught of confrontations between blacks and the police, as well as intense coverage on TV and online of college campus protests and of the Black Lives Matter movement, have decisively affected the Democratic Partys position on a core issue: the use of force to maintain public order.

title: Hope and a Laptop for College
description: Someday, Jada Williams hopes to become a veterinarian. Ive always loved animals, she said. They always seem to make me happy. But the path toward attaining that goal has not been an easy one.

title: Obama Should Let Fossil Fuels Lie
description: PRESIDENT OBAMAS rejection of the proposed Keystone XL pipeline last week had the ring of a great victory for the environment. But even as he declared the United States a global leader in the transition to cleaner energy, he revealed a challenge that neither he nor his administration has confronted: If were going to prevent large parts of this earth from becoming not only inhospitable but uninhabitable in our lifetimes, the president said, were going to have to keep some fossil fuels in the ground, rather than burn them and release more dangerous pollution into the sky.

title: Should Drug Addicts Be Forced Into Treatment?
Anheuser-Busch InBev Completes Agreement for SABMiller
description: LONDON  Anheuser-Busch InBev said on Wednesday that it had completed an agreement to acquire its closest rival, SABMiller, for nearly $106 billion, creating what it said would be the first truly global brewer.

title: Who Won the Republican Debate? Its Hard to Say
description: There was no runaway winner of the fourth Republican presidential debate on Tuesday night, according to commentators, journalists and pundits who watched. Senator Ted Cruz of Texas drew some scolding for an oops moment when he failed to name five agencies he wanted to eliminate, and Donald J. Trump may be remembered for shushing Carly Fiorina. But unlike after earlier debates this cycle, no consensus emerged about the outcome.

title: Tullett Prebon Agrees to Buy ICAPs Global Brokering Business
description: LONDON  The British brokerage firm Tullett Prebon said on Wednesday that it had agreed to acquire the global brokering business of its British counterpart ICAP in an all-stock deal.

title: Saving Richard Haass SoHo Mural, Chipped Away by Time and Vandals
description: The artistic equivalent of demolition by neglect is playing out in SoHo, an area of Lower Manhattan that was once synonymous with the arts.

title: When the Famous Dressed Themselves
description: Imagine a time before the red carpet.

title: Groupies, From Sex Symbols to Style Icons
description: Cultural photographers try to capture images others miss. But even when they do, some people dont see what is really there.

title: What Do We Owe Our Veterans?
description: Thank you for your service. Its a common expression of gratitude that our country offers veterans. But is a quick thank you all we owe returning soldiers? In a society with an professional military, where fewer families have a connection to service, is there a growing disconnect between those who serve in the military and everyone else?

title: Gordon Parkss Harlem Argument
description: Fresh from assignments at Vogue and Glamour in 1948, Gordon Parks appeared one morning at Lifes New York headquarters, determined to show his portfolio to Wilson Hicks, the magazines esteemed picture editor. Mr. Hicks was initially reluctant, but he warmed to Mr. Parkss work and the story he pitched about the gang warfare then plaguing Harlem.

title: Singles Day in China Draws New Suitors: Foreign Sellers
description: HONG KONG  Over the last year, A2, an Australian milk company, made an unexpected discovery: A sharp increase in domestic sales came from Chinese bulk buyers, not local mothers.

title: David Mitchells Slade House
description: At one point in this novel a character is led through an aperture into a magical, intradimensional garden. Her host is planning to dine on her soul, after using a kind of science-fiction thingy to reach in through her nostrils and pluck it out. To do this, the host must first get her victim to eat or drink something containing banjax, a substance that makes the soul easier to harvest. When she refuses to eat a wild strawberry, the would-be victim gives the following explanation: In all the tales, the myths, the rule is, if you eat or drink anything  pomegranate seeds, faerie wine, whatever  the place has a hold on you. ... When Im in doubt  as I am now  I ask myself, What would Carl Jung do?  and act accordingly.

title: Hotel and Resort News: Winter in New York; Holiday Packages
description: AFFORDABLE NEW YORK? THINK WINTER

title: Apps to Improve Your Swing, Lift or Stride
description: My husband and my iPhone did not agree about my running form. My husband, eyeing me critically as I ran back and forth in our backyard while he filmed me, told me that I needed to keep my head up and stop flailing my arms like Jerry Lewis in The Nutty Professor.

title: China Corruption Fight Extends to Top Officials in Beijing and Shanghai
description: BEIJING  President Xi Jinpings sweeping crackdown on corruption has claimed senior officials in Chinas two largest cities, the latest indication that Mr. Xis effort to consolidate power and sideline political enemies shows no signs of abating.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Republican Party, Missouri, Myanmar
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Cybersecurity Looms as Obstacle for Nominee to Lead the Office of Personnel Management
description: Nominating someone to lead the Office of Personnel Management  the federal governments version of the human resources department  does not typically result in a high-profile showdown. But it might be a different matter with the White Houses announcement on Tuesday that President Obama wants Beth Cobert, currently the acting director, to officially assume the top job.

title: New York Today:Honoring Veterans
description: Updated 9:47 a.m.

title: Glut of Coal-Fired Plants Casts Doubts on Chinas Energy Priorities
description: DONGXIANPO, China  Just outside the southwest border of Beijing, a new coal-fired power and heating plant is rising in Dongxianpo, a rural town in Hebei Province. Cement mixers roll onto the site. Cranes tower above a landscape of metal girders.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: Morning Agenda: Anheuser-Busch InBev Finalizes SABMiller Deal
description: ANHEUSER-BUSCH INBEV FINALIZES SABMILLER DEAL  | Anheuser-Busch InBev said it had finalized an agreement to buy its closest rival, SABMiller, for about $105 billion, Chad Bray reports in DealBook.

title: E.U. Move to Label Israeli Settlement Goods Strains Ties
description: JERUSALEM  In a stinging rebuke to Israel, the European Union insisted on Wednesday that some goods produced on land seized in the 1967 war must be labeled made in settlements, a mandate that added to Israels deep unease over a growing international boycott.

title: Should I Tell My Friends Husband That Shes Having an Affair?
description: I am a man (if it matters) and friends with a married woman, Jane, and her husband, Peter. The friendship is more with Jane than with Peter. Jane and I have known each other for years and work in the same profession, and I knew her before she married Peter, and I am closer to Jane. But Peter has become a friend since the marriage. Peter and I share some typically male interests and occasionally bro bond. Jane and I are quirky intellectuals.

title: The Dream Life of Driverless Cars
description: On a brisk afternoon in October, an oddly-equipped Honda CR-V inched through London traffic. At the wheel was Matthew Shaw, a 32-year-old architectural designer; with him was a fellow designer, William Trossell, 30, and a small team of laser-scanner operators. All were skilled in their technical fields, but their goal was art. What they hoped to scan was not just the shape of the city streets but the inner life of the autonomous cars that may soon come to dominate them.

title: John Hodgman on What Makes a Creepy Christmas Card
description: Matt writes: My wife wants to include a photo with our Christmas card. We do not have children, and two adults sending out a photo of themselves seems creepy and vain. My wife says that we see the people on our card list less often than we would like, and they look forward to the photo.

title: The Taste of Serendipity
description: Genius, E.B. White wrote, is more often found in a cracked pot than in a whole one. Judging by how many of my possessions are chipped, broken, worn, bowed and burned, its apparent Ive invested in his odds. Its not a popular attitude  certainly not in cookbooks, where kitchens often seem embodiments of sunny, enameled perfection  but I hold to it. I was particularly glad recently to open the cookbook This Is Camino, by Russell Moore and Allison Hopelain, the owners of the Oakland restaurant Camino, and find in its pages a catechism for my crackpot ways.

title: Perfect and Unrehearsed
description: I couldnt believe such a thing could be caught with the camera. I said, Damn it, took my camera and went out into the street. This was Henri Cartier-Bressons dazzled and vexed reaction to Martin Munkacsis photograph of boys running into the surf in Liberia. He saw it in 1932: the dark, sinuous bodies of three African boys  their rhyming legs at the place where sea meets land; their interweaving arms dialed to varying heights; their interlocking limbs creating abstract shapes; and the grace note, on the left side, of a single silhouetted arm. This image, Cartier-Bresson said, inspired his own approach, showing him that photography could reach eternity through the moment.

title: On the Road? You Can Still Eat Like Its Thanksgiving
description: As more travelers are on the go during Thanksgiving, many global destinations are offering traditional dinners blended with regional fare.

title: Detroit Symphony Tackles an Adventurous Premiere
description: DETROIT  The composer Tod Machover sat on the floor in a circle of third graders one recent morning at the brightly colored, mural-filled Detroit Achievement Academy. He spoke with them about their city and asked for their help with his new piece, Symphony in D, which the Detroit Symphony Orchestra will play for the first time on Friday, Nov. 20.

title: Communist Party Warns Secret Dalai Lama Followers in Its Ranks
description: BEIJING  The Chinese Communist Party in central Tibet is aiming to peer into the hearts of its members to hunt down secret worshipers of the Dalai Lama or people who secretly hold religious beliefs.

title: Supply, Demand, and Neel Kashkari
description: So, if the Minneapolis Fed felt the need to maintain conservation of NK, they could have chosen to replace Narayana Kocherlakota with a New Keynesian. Instead, they chose Neel Kashkari. Brad DeLong isnt happy, and this Twitter exchange suggests that he has good reason to worry.

title: In The Bedford Stop,Reality in Williamsburg Is the Perfect Parody
description: The young stars of an online reality show about life in Williamsburg are finding out what happens when viewers on the Internet stop being polite and start writing blog posts.

title: Slovenia Builds Border Fence to Stem Flow of Migrants
description: LJUBLJANA, Slovenia  Slovenia began erecting a razor-wire fence at its border with Croatia on Wednesday to stem the inflow of migrants, as winter closes in and countries to the north tighten their own border controls.

title: Drone Racing Dreams
description: Drone racing is a fast-growing extreme sport in which pilots compete head-to-head with small flying drones while wearing first-person-view goggles.

title: A Day at the Drone Races
description: Images from the California Cup in Pomona, Calif., an event in the emerging sport of drone racing.

title: What Victorias Secret Has to Teach Us About Fashion
description: When you tell someone  a friend, colleague, a fellow parent waiting at the school gate  that you are going to the Victorias Secret show to look at the clothes, you are liable to get pretty much the same response: Clothes?

title: Classical Music This Week: Modern Baroque, Workers Union and Rachmaninoff
description: Good morning, classical listeners!

title: Boys Do Cry
description: In 1972, the former N.F.L. star Rosey Grier sang Its All Right to Cry on the Free to Be . . . You and Me album, inviting a generation of boys to let their softer feelings show. It seemed like a watershed moment. The Vietnam War was nearing its end, and the grown-ups were emotionally exhausted. Finally, little boys would be freed from the tyranny of the tough-guy stereotype! But that hasnt exactly happened. Perhaps even more now than in the 1970s, an ever-growing pantheon of superheroes and ninjas and other tough-guy fantasy figures surrounds American boyhood. These imaginary figures show vulnerability only in tiny doses, and preferably while theyre encased in protective, muscle-hugging spandex.

title: Psychiatrys Mind-Brain Problem
description: Recently, a psychiatric study on first episodes of psychosis made front-page news. People seemed quite surprised by the finding: that treatment programs that emphasized low doses of psychotropic drugs, along with individual psychotherapy, family education and a focus on social adaptation, resulted in decreased symptoms and increased wellness.

title: Meet the Mystery Dancer Who Performed With Sia on S.N.L.
description: Who was that lithe, bewigged doppelgnger dancing next to Sia on Saturday Night Live this past weekend? In Alive, she was a karate-kicking warrior; in Bird Set Free, she escaped from a sheath of fabric, writhing on the floor and rising to discover her dancing voice. She wasnt, as Rolling Stone described, a young martial artist, but the Butoh-trained Japanese dancer Mina Nishimura, an important presence on New Yorks downtown dance scene who is still in shock about the experience of performing on television. She sees herself, she said, as a quirky starfish, which draws attention from only a few certain people.

title: Briton, 74, Jailed for Having Alcohol in Saudi Arabia, Returns Home
description: LONDON  A 74-year-old British grandfather who spent more than a year in a Saudi jail for possessing homemade wine has returned home, the British foreign secretary, Philip Hammond, said on Wednesday.

title: Gentlemen, Start Your Drones
description: LOS ANGELES  On a cool October night, after the stores in a shopping mall had closed, six young drone racers gathered in a subterranean parking garage to hone their aviation skills. Using remote-control joysticks, they navigated small X-shaped drones around pylons and beneath shopping carts, each vying for the lead.

title: Indonesia Wont Slide Back Into Military Rule, Security Minister Says
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Indonesia will not allow the countrys armed forces to make a political comeback and undermine civilian rule, the countrys security minister said on Wednesday, amid growing fears that Indonesias nascent democracy was backsliding toward its authoritarian past.

title: Ramen Noodles With a Hells Angel
description: Dear Diary:

title: Protest in Kabul for More Security After Seven Hostages Are Beheaded
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Through a persistent rain in the Afghan capital on Wednesday, thousands of protesters carried the coffins of seven beheaded Hazara hostages to the presidential palace, demanding greater security and an end to a wave of targeted violence.

title: Europe Banks on Incentives and Persuasion to Keep Migrants Home
description: Along the Sahara trail that tens of thousands of Africans take each year to reach the shores of Italy, Europe is paying for a pit stop, of sorts  one that it hopes will give these young people on the move a reason to go back home.

title: Why Did the Twitter Revolutions Fail?
description: Sofia, Bulgaria  SHORTLY after Louis Napoleons 1851 coup in Paris, five of the greatest political minds in Europe hustled to their writing desks to capture the meaning of the events.

title: J.C. Penney Settles Shoppers Suit Over False Advertising
description: The J.C. Penney Company announced on Wednesday a settlement to a class-action lawsuit that had accused the retailer of marking up prices on apparel and accessories before putting them on sale to deceive shoppers into thinking they were getting heavy discounts.

title: What You Get for  $1,175,000
description: A contemporary in Colorado, a penthouse in Washington, D.C., and a house in Hawaii

title: $1,175,000 Homes in Hawaii, Colorado and Washington, D.C.
description: CENTENNIAL, COLO.

title: In Bucharest, the Old Town Sees New Life
description: On a recent warm evening, the cobbled lanes around Strada Lipscani in the historical heart of Bucharest were bustling as young Romanians and tourists filled the many bars and restaurants in this once-dilapidated part of the city.

title: Dometic Group Could Be Valued at Up to $1.7 Billion in I.P.O.
description: LONDON  Dometic Group, a Swedish maker of appliances for boats and recreational vehicles, said it could be valued at as much as 15 billion Swedish kronor, or about $1.7 billion, in an initial public offering this month.

title: Is Rubio Too Young for Republicans?
description: This article was initially published as a letter to subscribers of The Upshots newsletter. You can sign up for the email here to get this and all of the best of The Upshot.

title: Dale Taldes Six Must-Eat Chicago Dishes
description: Here are the dishes that Dale Talde says you cant miss in Chicago, with some commentary from the chef himself. Read more on Talde and his favorite Chicago restaurants.

title: Saying Goodbye to Seattles Gum Wall
description: After accumulating for 20 years in a deeply encrusted display, about 2,200 pounds of gum is being removed from the gum wall near Pike Place Market in Seattle.

title: Saying Goodbye a Little Longer as Seattle Scrapes Off Its Gum Wall
description: SEATTLE  William Ward sells a lot of gum. He works at a newspaper stand just around the corner from a bizarre attraction called the gum wall near Pike Place Market just off the waterfront here, and people show up unprepared. He also sells a lot of hand sanitizer.

title: Even Famous Female Economists Get No Respect
description: Mens voices tend to dominate economic debate, although perhaps this is shaped by how we talk about the contributions of female economists. This is easiest to see in how we discuss the work of economist power couples.

title: Share Your Story
description: We invite you to share your experiences confronting issues of race in your life.

title: A Conversation With Police on Race
description: Over the past year or so, our nation has been embroiled in a difficult conversation about our history of police brutality and racial profiling. Stories of young black men shot by officers, and footage of police behavior before many of those deaths, have raised hard questions about institutional racism and misconduct within our police force. They have sparked protests, investigations and policy changes.

title: A City Choking on Cars Hopes Commuters Will Return to Two Wheels
description: BEIJING  In the early morning haze, Sun Jian pedaled his bicycle along a bustling ring road in Beijing, dodging buses and cars as he weaved his way through multiple lines of traffic.

title: Drinking In the Beauty of Picassos Sculptures at MoMA
description: At the moment, Lynda Zycherman, the Museum of Modern Arts sculpture conservator, is in her element. Shes supervising what might be called the care and feeding of the 120 objects in the Moderns extraordinary Picasso Sculpture, an array that traces the artists breathtaking inventiveness in bronze, wood, clay, plaster, sheet metal and stones through six decades.

title: Both Parties Have Equal Chance to Win White House
description: Its a mismatch  and an even match.

title: A Five-Bedroom House in a Cotswold Cottage Style in Victoria
description: With mountain and sea views from its back deck, the home is on the market for $1.291 million.

title: House Hunting in ... British Columbia
description: A COTSWOLD COTTAGE-STYLE HOME IN VICTORIA, BRITISH COLUMBIA

title: App Smart | Apple TV Apps
description: New devices for the televisionlike Apple TV can now run apps, including shopping apps like Gilt and games like Asphalt 8.

title: Video Feature: Playing to the Strengths of the New Apple TV
description: The new Apple TV has been out for only about two weeks, but there are already hundreds of apps available for downloading to the set-top box. The apps have the potential to make your television truly smart, so its time to experiment with the best gaming, shopping, video and utility apps and see how they transform the set in your living room.

title: Airbnb Pledges to Work With Cities and Pay Fair Share of Taxes
description: SAN FRANCISCO  A week ago, Airbnb  fired off a warning shot to cities that it would fight back if municipal officials proposed rules that might curtail its home-sharing service.

title: A Software Firm That Wines and Dines the Restaurant Industry
description: Celebrity chefs and other food maestros who oversee four- and five-star restaurants are a discerning and confident lot who typically dont like anyone outside interfering with  let alone offering advice on  how they buy ingredients for their menus.

title: A Typical American Life, a Very American Death
description: Last month, after working a long shift at the hospital, I walked to a restaurant in my neighborhood to have dinner with a male friend. The weather was unseasonably warm, so we ate outside. As we sat talking, our conversation was interrupted by something that sounded like a car backfiring. We paused, made a joke about the crowd at the nearby grocery store, and continued our meal. On my walk home, I didnt notice the flashing lights at the end of my street.

title: 1940: Czechs and Poles Drop Feuds
description: LONDON  Laying the groundwork for a possible new order in central Europe, the Polish government and the provisional government of Czecho-Slovakia buried their past quarrels and jointly declared today [Nov. 11] their intention at the end of the war to enter into a closer economic and political association. The two governments-in-exile expressed the hope that they would be joined by other countries in the same part of Europe, and that free people throughout the world would help their cause by combating the German menace to the full extent of their power. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, November 12, 1940

title: Ranking George Washington, the General
description: The 1918 truce that halted fighting in World War I went into effect at the 11th hour of the 11th day of the 11th month. Today, that is commemorated in the U.S. as Veterans Day.

title: Theyre With the Band
description: A book by the photographer Baron Wolman shows the playful energy and style of the classic groupies of the late 1960s.

title: Ex-Allies of Christie Didnt Receive Evidence in Lane Closings Case, Lawyers Say
description: Lawyers for two former allies of Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey have complained to a federal court that prosecutors and the governors lawyers had not provided emails and other documents related to the scheme to snarl traffic at the entrance to the George Washington Bridge in Fort Lee.

title: Rankings Indicate Big 12 Could Miss College Football Playoff Again
description: With the release of the seasons second college football playoff rankings, the pecking order at the top continues to clarify. If No. 1 Clemson wins the Atlantic Coast Conference, No. 2 Alabama the Southeastern Conference and No. 3 Ohio State the Big Ten, and if No. 4 Notre Dame wins the rest of its independent schedule, they are likely to be the four teams in the playoff.

title: Incident at Vichy, a Revival of Arthur Millers Harrowing Wartime Drama
description: Guilt is as inescapable as oxygen in the works of Arthur Miller, whose centennial is being celebrated this season with a formidable assortment of revivals, including Broadway productions of A View From the Bridge and The Crucible. But seldom did he dissect the nature of moral responsibility as rigorously as he did is in his lesser-known Incident at Vichy (1964), which opens Sunday, Nov. 15, in a Signature Theater production. Set in France during World War II, the play centers on a group of male detainees, most of them Jewish, who have been rounded up by German and French officers for interrogation. As the men try to figure out why they have been brought together, their conversation widens to embrace the most fundamental questions of identity, both ethnic and ethical. Michael Wilson (The Orphans Home Cycle) directs a cast that includes Richard Thomas and Jonathan Hadary. (Through Dec. 13, Pershing Square Signature Center, Manhattan; 212-244-7529, signaturetheater.org.)

title: Macys Lowers Its Guidance on Sales Slump
description: A slump in tourist spending and warmer weather hit Macys business in the third quarter, driving sales lower and prompting the department store chain to lower its guidance for the year.

title: Jean Butler Brings Her Irish Dance to St. Marks Church
description: This tale of two Irish dance stars began with a six-minute performance at the Eurovision Song Contest in Dublin in 1994. They were the central couple backed up by a rousing ensemble: Jean Butler, a poised redhead, and Michael Flatley, a flamboyant blond in a shiny teal blouse who would later become the self-proclaimed Lord of the Dance. Together, they created and starred in Riverdance, the international megahit spawned by that TV appearance.

title: At University of Missouri, Black Students See a Campus Riven by Race
description: COLUMBIA, Mo.  At first, Briana Gray just chalked up the comments and questions from her new roommate at the University of Missouri to innocent ignorance: How do you style your hair? What do you put in it?

title: A Philharmonic Menu of Young Composers
description: American composers 40 and under are the focus of the New York Philharmonics latest Contact! new-music concert, on Monday, Nov. 16. The first Contact! to be hosted at the recently opened performance space National Sawdust, in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, the event features chamber works by Kate Soper, Adam Schoenberg, Nathan Heidelberger and Caroline Mallone. Mario Davidovsky, born in Argentina but a resident of the United States for the past half-century, represents an older generation with his sextet Flashbacks. (7:30 p.m., 80 North Sixth Street, 646-779-8455, nationalsawdust.org.)

title: The Art of More, on Crackle, Reveals the Ugly Side of Pretty Things
description: Sex, blood, dirty money. Smuggled, stolen and forged art is a $10 billion business, intones a voice more Bensonhurst than Beekman Place. The big collectors are more than willing to look the other way. Thats where Graham Connor (Christian Cooke)  a former soldier in Iraq turned antiquities thief who has maneuvered his way into a top Manhattan auction house  comes in. I get them to look my way, he says in The Art of More, a new series streaming Thursday, Nov. 19, on Crackle.

title: In Fat City, Boxing Has a Starring Role
description: Another Rocky movie, this one called Creed, is just days away from release, but before the manipulative hero-making of that franchise, there was John Hustons Fat City, a whole different kind of boxing movie. A new restoration of it begins a one-week run on Friday, Nov. 20, at Film Forum, and Leonard Gardner, who wrote both the screenplay and the novel it was based on, is scheduled to be on hand at the opening night showing at 7 to introduce this 1972 movie. The film was an early showcase for Stacy Keach and Jeff Bridges, Mr. Bridges playing a young boxer just starting out, Mr. Keach a somewhat older one who tries a comeback. In his review in The New York Times, Vincent Canby had high praise for the acting and for the script, full of the kind of dialogue that movies usually cant afford, that defines time, place, mood and character while seemingly going nowhere. (At 209 West Houston Street, South Village; 212-727-8110, filmforum.org.)

title: Living In Easton, Conn.
description: Easton is home to at least 20 farms of varying sizes, from part-time specialty operations to large-scale agritourism attractions.

title: Easton, Conn.: Embracing a Farming Culture
description: Patti and Allan Popp didnt move to the rural town of Easton, Conn., to take up farming. They were simply searching for more privacy than they had at their previous home in Stratford. Ms. Popp happened to fall in love with a 1740 house in foreclosure along one of Eastons main routes, Sport Hill Road.

title: Coltranes A Love Supreme, Rereleased and Celebrated at Lincoln Center
description: The saxophonist John Coltrane released his most revered album, A Love Supreme, on the Impulse! label in 1965, and from the start it was understood as something special: a four-part suite that drew Coltranes magnificent quartet into deep, devotional focus. The album has been reissued in a deluxe edition before, but a boxed set due out on Friday, Nov. 20, A Love Supreme: The Complete Masters, offers the deepest dive yet, with alternate takes, studio chatter, photo reproductions and a new essay by Ashley Kahn, who once wrote a book on the subject.

title: Coney Island Culture, at the Brooklyn Museum
description: It is a microcosm of American popular culture in all its ersatz glory, the anti-Disneyland, a realm of tawdry spectacle and mindless distraction catering to the basic instincts of hoi polloi. It is, of course, Coney Island, whose history and culture are chronicled in Coney Island: Visions of an American Dreamland, 1861-2008, opening Friday, Nov. 20, at the Brooklyn Museum.

title: Le1f Speaks Out, Like His Fearless Models, on Riot Boi
description: On his first full-length album, Riot Boi, the New York rapper Le1f is playful, painfully clever, aloof, outraged and deadly serious, often in the span of a few lines. Rats and roaches running all over the hood in the daytime, he begins on Track 1, but I still dont see none of that in their raps, their rhymes or their headlines. Topical issues covered across the 12 songs include homophobia, misogyny, transgender rights and Black Lives Matter. You just wanna ignore it all, dont you? Le1f scoffs. Basic.

title: Empathy Card Contest: And the Winner Is . . .
description: Last week, we introduced Well readers to Emily McDowell, a writer and graphic artist, and her line of empathy cards, a series of greeting cards that helps provide support during times of serious illness and loss.

title: Is Fat Stigma Making Us Miserable?
description: Being overweight doesnt necessarily make a person distraught, researchers are learning. Rather, its the teasing, judgment and unsolicited advice directed at overweight people that can cause the greatest psychological harm.

title: Facebooks Notify App Funnels Custom Updates Onto Phone Screens
description: In this age of data overload, information providers and social networks are competing to provide just the highlights that you want, when you want them. News outlets send alerts with breaking news and editors picks of top stories. Twitter curates top tweets, organized by subject, into collections it calls Moments. Weather apps warn you of rain minutes before the droplets arrive.

title: Theres Kung Fu, and, in Into the Badlands, Theres Hong Kong Kung Fu
description: WEST HOLLYWOOD, CALIF.  In AMCs new martial arts series, Into the Badlands, Daniel Wu plays Sunny, a motorcycle-riding, katana-wielding assassin whose loyalty to his flinty-eyed master is matched only by his prodigious kill count (400 and climbing).

title: Lauren Pritchard on Her Musical Childhood and Her New Show, Songbird
description: One grandfather played ukulele at family gatherings while she was growing up in Jackson, Tenn., and the other was a Hank Williams fan, so perhaps its unsurprising that Lauren Pritchard was evolving as a singer-songwriter before she was 10.

title: Podcast: Beware Fine Print
description: Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Michael Corkery share insight into their report on arbitration and the way it circumvents justice for millions of Americans.

title: A Lesson in Journalism at the University of Missouri
description: To the Editor:

title: 1965: Rhodesia Claims Independence
description: SALISBURY  Rhodesia today [Nov. 11] declared its independence in the most momentous defiance of Britain since America threw off colonial rule nearly 200 years ago. The white-ruled colony in the heart of Africa immediately found itself outlawed in a largely hostile world. Britain imposed economic sanctions and called for a meeting of the United Nations Security Council to recruit world-wide support. In Pretoria, South African Premier Dr. Hendrik Verwoerd declared that his country would continue normal relations with Rhodesia, thus becoming the first government to recognize the rebel nation. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, November 12, 1965

title: Great Midweek Recipes
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. Beginning today, that email will also appear on nytimes.com. To receive the email, register here.

title: Another Setback for Immigration Action
description: President Obamas effort to overhaul the immigration system through executive action has lost in court again.On Mondaya federal appeals-court panel, in a 2-1 vote, blocked the administration from moving forward with programs to shield up to 5 million people from deportation.

title: Review: In The Bachelors, Three Men Are Mired in Frat-Boy Misogyny
description: Its Friday night on fraternity row in the unnamed college town of Caroline V. McGraws The Bachelors. But by the end of this unlikely comedy, presented by Lesser America and Rattlestick Playwrights Theater, no one feels much like a party.

title: Cruz vs. Rubio: The Overture
description: The most interesting story out of last nights Republican debate is probably the one written up by McKay Coppins here: In several different moments we watched a preview of the way that Ted Cruz intends to go after Marco Rubio if and when thefield begins to winnow and the two of themrise toward the top. Coppins cites a couple of Cruz lines on immigration andsugar subsidies that were clearly implied digs at Rubio; I would add Cruzs stress on how his own tax and spending plan adds up (it doesnt, really, but compared to Rubios it does) and his attempt to position himself in between Rubio and Paul when the two clashed on foreign policy. Add them all togetherand you have a clear blueprint for an anti-Rubio offensive: Attack sharply on immigration, find his Floridian weakness on corporate welfare, claim the mantle of fiscal hawkishness at home and cast Rubio as a little too Wilsonian abroad.

title: New Marco Rubio Backer Bankrolls Ad and Writes It, Too
description: Senator Marco Rubios newest financial backer not only bankrolls his own super PAC, but also writes its TV ads.

title: Unicredit of Italy to Cut 18,200 Jobs as Part of Overhaul
description: LONDON  UniCredit, Italys largest bank by assets, said on Wednesday that it would eliminate up to 18,200 jobs and accelerate its cost-cutting over the next three years as part of a revamping of its operations that it hopes will help it avoid the need for a capital increase.

title: Weighing Benefits of Windows 10 Upgrade
description: Q. Should I update to Windows 10 now that Ive gotten used to Windows 8.1? How big a change is it?

title: What It Takes to Save a Mockingjay
description: LONDON  The pressure is on. The endgame is near. There will be blood, brutality, death and scary lizard mutants smashing through a sewer. The final film installment of Suzanne Collinss best-selling trilogy, The Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part 2, will reach American screens on Friday, Nov. 20, and millions of fans worldwide will scrutinize the movie for its fidelity to the books; the portrayal (by Jennifer Lawrence) of its intrepid, taciturn heroine Katniss Everdeen; and its evocation of the civil war that rends Panem, the totalitarian state built from the ashes of North America at some unspecified time in the future.

title: 10 Years With Times Video
description: Erik Olsen, senior video journalist, talks about a decade of filmmaking with The Times.

title: Stephen Colbert to Follow 2016 Super Bowl
description: CBS is handing the coveted post-Super Bowl programming block to its newest late-night host, Stephen Colbert.

title: Bottles Upon Bottles of Wine at Heights Chateau
description: The wine shop on a stretch between Brooklyn Heights and Cobble Hill is an oenophiles apothecary.

title: At Heights Chateau, a Welcoming Home for Wine Lovers
description: On a recent brisk Saturday afternoon, at the point where the tail of Atlantic Avenue dips toward New York Harbor, wine and spirits buyers ducked into Heights Chateau to assemble their weekend libations. Behind an antique-looking facade, the store is an oenophiles apothecary.

title: At Paradise Cove, Where Less is More
description: Americas most glamorous trailer park, Paradise Cove in Malibu, has million-dollar views, hip residents and a location on one of the worlds most iconic beaches.

title: Justin Bieber Announces 58-Date Purpose Tour
description: Justin Biebers all-grown-up album, Purpose, comes out on Friday, and all the final pieces are falling into place for his meticulously crafted, apology-filled comeback. After a steady stream of convincing singles, including Where Are  Now, made with Diplo and Skrillex, and What Do You Mean?, Mr. Biebers first No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100, he has announced a 58-date North American tour for 2016, promoted by AEG Live.

title: Americas Most Glamorous Trailer Park
description: In 1979, David Carter, then a 30-year-old surfer, decided to move from Maui, where hed spent a few years chasing waves and making surfboards, to Southern California. He and his wife were in search of that real estate oxymoron: an affordable place close to the ocean where they could raise their two sons. On the advice of friends, they went to visit a curious little subdivision called Paradise Cove, a private waterfront community of 265 trailers in Malibu.

title: Steelers Antonio Brown Has Been Only as Good as His Quarterback
description: N.F.L. wide receivers are some of the most athletic people on the planet. Speed, leaping ability and the ability to change directions quickly are hallmarks of the position.

title: Silicon Valley Tries to Alter Your Perception of Cannabis
description: One morning in September, I logged on to the website of HelloMD, a medical start-up that promises to connect patients with doctors instantly over the Internet. I filled out my personal details, explained my ailment  I often get heartburn  and entered in my credit card number to cover the $50 consultation fee.

title: Podcast: Beware the Fine Print
description: Arbitration clauses. They sound innocuous enough. But, in a three part-series about clauses buried in tens of millions of contracts, Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Michael Corkery (along with another reporter, Robert Gebeloff) reported on the way these clauses have deprived Americans of one of their most fundamental constitutional rights: their day in court.

title: Daily Report: Breezes Could Become Headwinds in Silicon Valley
description: For months now, the scorching tech industry has shown signs of feeling a slight breeze. As early as September, for example, Nicole Perlroth reported that some security start-ups, used to easily raising new money, were being asked something almost novel: Where are the profits?

title: Bridget Anne Kelly Court Filings
description: Lawyers for Bridget Anne Kelly filed discovery motions.

title: Bill Baroni Court Filings
description: Lawyers for Bill Baroni filed motions seeking evidence and a change of venue.

title: The Victorias Secret Fashion Show
description: Top models, such as Gigi Hadid and Kendall Jenner, donned feathers and jewels on the runway at the Victorias Secret fashion show.

title: Borrowing From Solar and Chip Tech to Make Diamonds Faster and Cheaper
description: Just a decade ago, Silicon Valley had high hopes of becoming a vibrant manufacturing center by making solar panels. But price competition from abroad, particularly from China, quickly dashed those dreams.

title: In the Studio With MarquesAlmeida
description: T visits Portuguese design duo Marta Marques and Paulo Almeida at work in Hackney, London.

title: Review: Michael Flatleys New Show Has Unicorns, Rainbows and Some Footwork, Too
description: The main reason to see Michael Flatleys Lord of the Dance: Dangerous Games, which opened on Tuesday at the Lyric Theater, is to watch Michael Flatley dancing. Its your last chance. This Irish-American step-dancing star, now 57, has announced that he will retire from performing at the end of this eight-week run. The trouble is, to see Michael Flatley dancing, you have sit through a Michael Flatley show.

title: A Debate With Bernanke Over the Feds Easy Money Policies
description: By the end of our recent conversation, Ben S. Bernanke, the former chairman of the Federal Reserve, and I had a gentlemans bet. I believe the easy money policies he pushed for and put in place while serving as Fed chairman starting in 2008 (and that remain in place under his successor, Janet L. Yellen) will lead inevitably to a near-term financial crisis; he thinks that idea is beyond ridiculous.

title: Inside the Denim-Filled Studio of MarquesAlmeida
7 on Business Trip Among Dead in Akron Plane Crash
description: A Florida company confirmed Wednesday that seven of its employees were on a private jet that crashed into an apartment building in Akron, Ohio, on Tuesday, bringing the death toll to nine.

title: To Win a Free I.V.F. Cycle, Contestants Share Losses, Grief and Hope. Is it Worth It?
description: Please, the woman says, staring directly into the camera at the end of a video that lays bare her infertility, her attempts, her losses, her hopes, her dreams, her fears. Vote for me.

title: Confrontation Brews as Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio Vie for Conservative Vote
description: After a Republican presidential debate in which sober policy discussions edged out the loud personality clashes that have dominated so far, the campaigns focus narrowed on Wednesday into a battle for the partys most conservative voters.

title: Saks Fifth Avenue
description: The landmark store opened in 1924.

title: Shelley Poem, 200 Years Later, Returns to Oxford
description: LONDON  A poem written by Percy Bysshe Shelley during his first year as an Oxford student has been acquired by the Bodleian Libraries there and placed on public display.

title: With Los Angeles in Play, Cities and Teams Update N.F.L. on Plans
description: The N.F.L. season is just past the halfway mark, but team owners are already preparing for the biggest decision of the new year: whether to allow one or two teams to move to Los Angeles in 2016.

title: Michael Leonard, Whose Songs From Failed Musicals Endured, Dies at 84
description: Michael Leonard, a composer and arranger whose songs, especially from the 1965 musical The Yearling, lived on as standards for singers like Barbra Streisand and Nancy Wilson, died on Oct. 31 at his home in Manhattan. He was 84.

title: Republican Debate Draws 13 Million Viewers as Ratings Slip
description: More than 13 million people tuned in to Fox Business Network to watch the fourth Republican presidential debate on Tuesday night in Milwaukee, according to Nielsen ratings data provided on Wednesday by the business news network.

title: Waiting for the Republican Shakeout
description: Watching Tuesdays Republican presidential debate, with the eight prime-time contenders talking over and past one another, the question arises: Should the party show a few of these candidates the door?

title: Goose Barnacle Caters to Its Brooklyn Neighbors
description: The other afternoon, a sharp-looking guy opened the door of Goose Barnacle and asked for help. The old-style door  the heavy wooden kind where one side bolts into the ceiling and floor  was only half open, and therefore not wide enough for what he was pushing, which was a stroller.

title: Why Has Trust in the News Media Declined?
Buffalo Bills at New York Jets: Who Has the Edge?
description: 8:25 p.m. Eastern, NFL Network

title: On the Road in Syria, Struggle All Around
description: RMEILAN, Syria  After boiling crude oil from the ground near here all day in a metal tank to refine it into diesel, Ali Mohammed braved the fumes to bang the tanks drain open with a shovel. He stepped back as the dregs oozed into the dirt and burst into flames.

title: Shia LaBeouf Offers View of Himself Viewing His Movies
description: Shia LaBeouf, an actor whose erratic behavior often veers into the realm of bizarre performance art, has invited us all to watch him watch his movies  all 29 of them, in reverse chronological order.

title: Amundi Raises $1.6 Billion in I.P.O. in Paris
description: LONDON  Amundi, one of the largest asset managers in Europe, said on Wednesday that it had raised 1.5 billion euros, or about $1.6 billion, in its initial public offering of stock in Paris.

title: South Africa Court Sentences 8 Ex-Policemen in Immigrants Murder
description: LONDON  A South African judge on Wednesday sentenced eight former police officers to prison for the murder of a taxi driver from Mozambique who was handcuffed to the back of a police van, dragged about a third of a mile and then placed in a police holding cell, where he was beaten.

title: Philosophers (and Welders) React to Marco Rubios Debate Comments
Effort to Revive City Opera Includes a Tosca Staging
description: If the death of New York City Opera was tragic, attempts to revive it have sometimes entered the farcical territory of opera buffa: a bidding contest for its name that yielded no sale, a legal battle and a skirmish over a bequest from a patron who died just as the company did.

title: A Landscape of Blooms, in Dorset
description: Charlie McCormick takes a modern approach to a traditional English country garden.

title: Egyptian President Makes First Visit to Sharm El Sheikh Since Russian Crash
description: SHARM EL SHEIKH, Egypt  The Egyptian president, Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, made an unannounced, and somewhat belated, visit to this seaside town on Wednesday, saying he was here to reassure people after a Russian plane that took off from the local airport broke apart in midair over the Sinai Peninsula late last month.

title: An English Garden for All Seasons
description: In Dorset, Charlie McCormick has created an embroidered tapestry of blooms that lasts well into fall.

title: Anheuser-Busch InBev Deal for SABMiller Pays Off for Molson
description: Molson Coors Brewing is getting a tasty chaser from its rivals mega-deal.

title: Donald Trumps Deportation Force
description: Some of Donald Trumps rivals mocked him at the Republican presidential debate on Tuesday night for saying he could deport 11 million unauthorized immigrants.

title: European and African Leaders Near Deal on Returning Migrants
description: VALLETTA, Malta  The European Union was closing in on a deal Wednesday to return more migrants to Africa, but there was skepticism that the plan would meet the goal of reducing the numbers of refugees arriving in Germany, Scandinavia and other destinations.

title: Promised Bipartisanship, Obama Adviser Found Disappointment
description: WASHINGTON  When President Obama first won the White House, he recruited Ray LaHood, a Republican congressman, to join his cabinet. The appointment, Mr. Obama said, reflects that bipartisan spirit that would distinguish his presidency.

title: Israelis Condemn E.U. Labeling Move
description: Officials from Israel and the Palestine Liberation Organization disagreed on whether the European Union should label goods from Israeli settlements, and a factory manager spoke out against the move.

title: Expansion of T-Mobile Data Plans Comes With Higher Prices
description: The phone carrier T-Mobile USA made lots of noise this week about allowing many subscribers to stream content from some video services over their cellular connections without burning through their data allotments  so much noise that it was easy to overlook that T-Mobile also raised prices on many of its data plans.

title: Donald Trump Insists That Wages Are Too High
description: Donald J. Trump on Wednesday morning repeated a statement he made the night before in the Republican presidential debate: that wages are too high in the United States, an argument he made to explain his opposition to raising the minimum wage.

title: VWs Emissions-Test Trickery May Not Be Illegal in Europe
description: LONDON  Four years ago, European auto regulators identified and debated a loophole in their pollution testing rules that could render vehicle emissions tests ineffectual, but it was ultimately left in place, internal documents show.

title: In Iowa, Jeb Bush Tries to Capitalize on Latest Debate Performance
description: JOHNSTON, Iowa  It wasnt quite a victory lap. Call it more of a coffee klatch lap.

title: Elizabeth, N.J., Explosion Kills One and Injures 15
description: A man in his 20s was killed and 15 people were injured in an explosion at a two-story duplex in Elizabeth, N.J., on Wednesday morning, city officials said. Investigators believe it was related to gas.

title: The Flat Tax Goes Mainstream
description: Remember when the flat tax was a fringe idea? Competitors and others derided itwhen Steve Forbes made it the center of his 1996 presidential campaign. Though Mr. Forbes won the Arizona and Delaware primaries, he did poorly in Iowa and New Hampshire and dropped out of the race in March of that year. He did even worse in 2000, finishing third in the Delaware primary and ending his campaign soon after.

title: Cuomo Signs 2 Bills to Speed Up Medical Marijuana Distribution
description: ALBANY  In a surprising move, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo signed two bills on Wednesday to establish an emergency medical marijuana program for qualified patients, two months before the planned debut of a statewide program providing for the medical use of the drug.

title: Review: W/ Bob & David Resumes a Mr. Show Vibe
description: The great television resurrection machine has been busy lately. Fox is bringing back The X-Files next year. Showtime is reviving Twin Peaks. Netflix brought back Arrested Development, is making a sequel to the family comedy Full House and is reportedly planning the return of Gilmore Girls. Death, for a TV show, is an increasingly temporary state, as long as enough mourners are lighting the candles.

title: The Modern Princess, On and Off the Runway
description: Inspired by young girls fantasies (and a hint of irony), designers have begun to think pink.

title: Review: Aquaria, a Dark Debut Album by Boots
description: Aquaria

title: When a Childs Project Shows a Parental Hand at Work
description: When my younger son, Finn, was in third grade, his class staged a wax museum as the culmination of a biography project. Each student researched a historical figure they admired, prepared a monologue about that persons life and historical significance, and on the day of the wax museum presentation, dressed up like their chosen hero. As no academic project is complete without the requisite trifold poster, each student also had to create an illustrated, informative display.

title: El Pas Columnist Says Dismissal Tied to His Criticism of Media Independence
description: MADRID  A veteran journalist said on Wednesday that El Pas, Spains leading newspaper, had ended his column after he questioned editorial independence in Spain in an article in The New York Times about the growing financial and government pressures on the Spanish news media that also discussed recent newsroom tensions at El Pas and other publications.

title: To Reach the Truly Rich, Television Ads Wont Do
description: Private jets. Grand estates. Fast cars. High fashion.

title: Investing in Racehorses, Despite the Long Odds
description: One morning this past summer, Ahmed Zayat was in a stall at Del Mar racetrack in California alongside the 2015 Triple Crown winner American Pharoah.

title: Stronger Dollar Emboldens More Americans to Seek European Dream Home
description: BARCELONA  With the exchange rate against the euro persistently not in his favor and his retirement still 20 years away, Dr. Kenneth Bermudez had decided to delay his dream of owning a villa in Tuscany, Italy.

title: Supersavers Focus on the Goal
description: During the 2007-8 financial crisis, Chris Reining said, he panicked. His state of anxiety wasnt brought on by the collapse of the United States stock market or the global economic crisis that followed. It was prompted by his office mates in Madison, Wis.

title: Making an Adviser Relationship Work
description: In spring 2001, after losing about $75,000 in the dot-com crash, Jerrie Champlin and her husband, Robert Baranowski, decided it was time for professional help.

title: For Investors, Portfolio Insurance Against Market Declines
description: Whenever the stock market shows a bad hand, as it did in the third quarter, nearly all stock investors hope they have something akin to an ace in the hole.

title: Plan Your Digital Legacy, and Update Often
description: Andrew Magliochetti, 38, always feared dying without an estate plan. In his 20s, he prepared a will. But after consulting with his money manager, Mr. Magliochetti took an even more unusual step: He listed his digital assets, which include digitized family movies and social media accounts, as well as some assets that are more esoteric, like digital currencies and domain names.

title: Indias Rising Tides and Temperatures
description: Ghoramara and its sister islands in the Bay of Bengal are vanishing, their shoreline borders shifting, shrinking and sinking with rising temperatures and tides.

title: Giving Up the Affluent Suburbs for City Living
description: Pete Fader often looks eagerly out the window of his office in West Philadelphia, where he is a marketing professor at the Wharton School of Business at the University of Pennsylvania, at the rising One Riverside, a 22-story luxury condominium building across the Schuylkill.

title: Estate Planning for the Never-Married
description: When Adam Cooperman opened a technology consulting firm in New York City eight years ago at age 33, he also prepared a will and other legal and medical documents. If I have all these professional matters, I should probably have my personal affairs in order, as well, he explained.

title: Stormy Markets Today May Offer Steady Growth Tomorrow
description: There are times when a cautious investor can take risks that a rough-and-ready speculator cannot.

title: Irrational Game Aims to Steer Consumers Toward Rational Choices
description: In his 2008 best-selling book, Predictably Irrational, Dan Ariely, a Duke University professor of psychology and behavioral economics, proposed the idea of a self-control credit card.

title: The Metal Chair, Elevated
description: Two major design fairs are on the horizon: the Salon Art + Design in New York this week and Design Miami at the beginning of December. But before they open, a trio of New York shows are making a case for investing in industrial metal furniture this fall. At Friedman Benda, Paul Cocksedge debuted a room of furniture cast entirely of metal. The London-based designer achieved seamless joints using an experimental sealing technique that uses freezing in place of welding. A haven for self-reflection, Cocksedges circular tables and mirrored bookshelves possess unexpected warmth  perhaps its the touch of brass?

title: Jeb Bush Says Hes a Better Bet (Than Marco Rubio) to Beat Hillary Clinton
description: ATLANTIC, Iowa  Though Jeb Bush stood alongside Senator Marco Rubio of Florida on Tuesday night at the Republican debate, he largely steered clear of his former-mentee-turned-political-rival.

title: An Old Chinatown Lounge Gets a New Life
description: Looking to wade through the squalor of an after-hours party but lack the endurance for all-nighters? Thats the subtext of Tropical, a gucky 14-year-old lounge that has surged in popularity since new owners took over recently.

title: Republican Debate on Fox Business Draws 13.5 Million
description: Fox Business Network has long stood in the shadow of its much larger and louder sibling, Fox News Channel, and its outsize personalities like Bill OReilly. And in the financial world, the network consistently trails its competitor CNBC in television ratings.

title: Review: In Dear Mr. You, Mary-Louise Parker Writes to Men, With Lust and Rue
description: Mary-Louise Parker, the luminous, bright-eyed actress, makes her literary debut with the equivalent of a one-woman show. Even though Dear Mr. You is nominally about men, theres no question about who has the starring role. This book is enchantingly arranged as a set of letters to men who have mattered to Ms. Parker, many of them alive only in her memory or imagination. But the narrator has endless ways of upstaging them, and why not? They exist in Dear Mr. You only to define who Mary-Louise Parker is and how she got that way.

title: Take Two: George Saunders and Carly Rae Jepsen
description: George Saunders and Carly Rae Jepsen go ballistic while considering a levitating light and the most expensive socks ever made.

title: Velvet Suits Are a Holiday Alternative to Sparkly Dresses
description: Plus: Fort Gansevoort, a space for artisans, also serves barbecue; Live the Process and Moon Juice team up on workout wear and Annie Costello Brown offers dangly cutout earrings.

title: Ruth Bells Breakout Fashion Season
description: Ms. Bell was one of the star models from the spring 2016 shows.

title: First Draft Focus: In Memory of the Fallen
Tarantinos The Hateful Eight Resurrects Nearly Obsolete Technology
