description: DISPUTING mistakes found on your credit report has become a bit easier because of expanding electronic options for challenging errors.

title: Roof Dogs
description: San Miguel de Allende, Mexico  TO wander among the working-class neighborhoods here is to think, at times, that the world is a cacophony of barking dogs. When the sun goes down, in the middle of the night and at first light, they bark. How long can they keep it up? I have often asked myself.

title: John Kerry Says U.S. Will Give Tunisia More Financial Aid
description: TUNIS  Secretary of State John Kerry announced on Friday that the United States would extend an additional $500 million in loan guarantees to Tunisia, increasing American investment in a country that is working on a transition to democracy.

title: On Road to World Cup, Some Players Dont Go the Whole Way
description: The United States national mens soccer team starts down the long road to the 2018 World Cup on Friday night, but despite a string of disappointing recent results, its first step does not figure to be a steep one.

title: Ted Cruz Lets Out His Inner Actor With The Princess Bride
description: Hes been known to drift into a drawl when quoting Ronald Reagan on the campaign trail and once jokingly auditioned for The Simpsons. But Senator Ted Cruz of Texas, who once aspired to be an actor, saves his best impressions for his favorite movie, The Princess Bride.

title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn and Manhattan
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in New York City:

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are on the Upper East Side, in Clinton and Clinton Hill, Brooklyn.

title: The Fashion News to Know This Week
description: The end of the tour

title: My $120,000 Vacation
description: Thanks to the Four Seasons new 24-day, round-the-world fantasy trip, you get all the indulgences of travel without any of its hassles. But like all fantasies, is this too much of a good thing?

title: Volkswagen Global Sales Fell 5% in October
description: FRANKFURT  Worldwide sales of Volkswagen brand cars fell 5 percent in October, the company said on Friday, providing one of the first solid indications of the market impact of the automakers emissions cheating scandal.

title: How Tom Hardy Plays His Own Twin in Legend
description: Since the 1961 film The Parent Trap with Hayley Mills, weve come a long way in depicting one person playing twins on screen. Or have we? Digital technology now allows for much more elaborate depictions of the screen double, but even the latest films still rely on some simple visual sleights of hand.

title: The Secret to Sustaining High Job Performance
description: How do you drive sustainably high performance in an era of relentlessly rising demand?

title: Sinjar Victory Bolsters Kurds, but Could Further Alienate U.S. From Iraq
description: ISTANBUL  It was a full two months after Islamic State militants stormed through Iraq, massacring captured troops and driving to within a few miles of Baghdad that the United States began taking direct military action in the country.

title: Nail Salon Regulations: A New York Assemblyman Responds
description: To the Editor:

title: College Football Games to Watch on Saturday
description: Saturday

title: Victims of Debt Collection Scheme in New York Win $59 Million in Settlement
description: Tens of thousands of New Yorkers who had their wages garnished or bank accounts frozen in a surreptitious debt-collection scheme will receive $59 million in a class-action settlement that also bars a major network of collectors from continuing the practice.

title: Hillary Clinton Plans Event to Tap Big-Dollar Donors for Democrats
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton and former President Bill Clinton next month will hold their first event for the Hillary Victory Fund, an arrangement that allows donors to give tens of thousands of dollars to the national and state Democratic Parties.

title: Irmat, a Mail-Order Pharmacy, Sues OptumRx in Latest Drug-Price Skirmish
description: Irmat Pharmacy on Park Avenue in Manhattan still looks like the neighborhood drugstore it has been since the 1970s.

title: Racial Justice and Freedom of Speech: Readers on Missouri and Yale
description: Readers praised racial-justice activists on university campuses this week, but also criticized those who blocked media access, in response to recent opinion pieces.

title: Sketching to the Music
description: Just before the first set at Birdland, the jazz club on West 44th Street in Midtown Manhattan, Jonathan Glass, 42, settled into a front row table and pulled out pens, his inkwell and his large sketch pad.

title: Supreme Court to Hear Texas Abortion Law Case
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Friday agreed to hear its first major abortion case since 2007, one that has the potential to affect millions of women and to revise the constitutional principles governing abortion rights.

title: The Barometer Earthstar, a Cosmopolitan Fungus
description: There is nothing like a walk through rustling leaves on a warm November day to forestall the onset of winter. Profiting from our long, dry fall, I stole an hour from errands to hike in the piney, dry barrens at Floyd Bennett Field. Relatively few know the pleasures of southern Brooklyns sparsely vegetated fields, with their wildly rich salt air, sand and stunted trees.

title: Gluten-Free (if Not Guilt-Free) Thanksgiving Desserts
description: For some, perhaps most, Thanksgiving is a day of feasting bordering on gluttony.

title: Time Inc. Donates Archives to New-York Historical Society
description: Time Inc. has donated its vast archives to the New-York Historical Society, which will open a dedicated gallery to showcase highlights from what it called a unique chronicle of the past century and the people who shaped politics, culture and society.

title: Enough Is Enough: The Last Word From Mark Bittman, For Now.
description: In the end it was simply enough.

title: Taliban Close to Taking Over Key Afghan District
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A crucial district in Afghanistans southern Helmand Province is close to falling to the Taliban after three days of heavy fighting left more than 60 Afghan troops dead, government officials said Friday night.

title: U.S. Sanctions 4 North Koreans, Including Myanmar Envoy
description: The United States Treasury said on Friday that it had imposed sanctions on four North Koreans, including the ambassador to Myanmar, over what American officials described as connections to North Koreas illicit weapons proliferation activities.

title: AMuseum of Cash, Guns and Gangsters in the East Village
description: The East Village has presented a carnival of night life for nearly a century, even during Prohibition. An elevated railway brought uptown swells downtown to a speakeasy at First Avenue and St. Marks Place, where a butcher shop led to a back alley and Scheibs Place, now Theatre 80 St. Marks and the William Barnacle Tavern. That dissolute era  as well as a murder mystery and diabolical booby trap  is vividly recounted at the Museum of the American Gangster.

title: Carson Responds After Attack by Trump
description: The Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson spoke after Donald J. Trump said Mr. Carson had a pathological temper as a young man, suggesting that Mr. Trumps advisers educate him on the meaning of the word pathological.

title: Lobbyist Testifies of Unusual Phone Call From Sheldon Silver
description: In his nearly four decades of experience lobbying in the State Capitol, Brian Meara grew close to numerous power brokers and became intimately familiar with the intricacies of how Albany functioned.

title: Love the Coopers and Other Films About Christmas Discontent
description: Love the Coopers, a new holiday film directed by Jessie Nelson and starring Diane Keaton and John Goodman as Charlotte and Sam, a couple of ex-hippies who find themselves with a large Pittsburgh family after four decades of marriage, provides all the time-honored trimmings of classic seasonal fare. Theres warm, wintry music, snowy hills full of sledders and boarders, wrapped gifts and glittering evergreens.

title: Ian Schragers NewCondos on the Hudson
description: Ian Schrager has a long list of New York real estate hits, from Studio 54 to Morgans hotel to the 40 Bond condominium. Now hes hoping to do it again, but this time in the West Village, with a new blocklong condominium at the edge of the Hudson River.

title: Vegetarian Thanksgiving: Kasha Caliente
description: It was a love of kasha and memories of family that inspired Nancy Jane Richer of Knoxville, Tenn., to create this holiday recipe.

title: The War on Campus Sexual Assault Goes Digital
description: As the problem of sexual assault on college campuses has become a hot-button issue for school administrators and federal education regulators, one question keeps coming up: Why dont more students report attacks?

title: David Leonhardt to Join New York Times Op-Ed Page
description: David Leonhardt, the founding editor of The New York Timess digitally focused The Upshot, will join the Op-Ed page in the new year as a staff columnist.

title: A Cast of Characters and Crooked Brooklyn
description: WHAT WAS BILLED in The Guinness Book of World Records as the worlds shortest piece of criticism  the single word, Ouch!  proved apocryphal, but fortuitously it introduced Thomas Vinciguerra to the wit Wolcott Gibbs.

title: Presidential Candidates on the Death Penalty
description: Most candidates support the existence of the death penalty, but many have acknowledged problems or reservations with the current system.

title: Death Penalty Politics
description: Political positions on the death penalty have evolved since 1988, when Michael S. Dukakiss presidential campaign was damaged because of his opposition to it.

title: Death Penalty Takes On New Dimension in 2016 Campaign
description: Less than a month before the New Hampshire primary in 1992, Bill Clinton left the campaign trail and tended to a pressing matter.

title: Derek Ridgerss The Others
description: The photographers latest book includes images from 1980s London.

title: Getting Hot and Heavy in the 1980s
description: The English photographer Derek Ridgerss latest book doesnt really pick up where his earlier efforts, When We Were Young and 78-87, left off. Instead, The Others, out today, gathers what these much-lauded publications left out: 100 previously unpublished snapshots (pared down from 650) that had been living in Ridgerss hard-drive folder under the same name. He captured the kids at London hot spots like the Mud Club, Le Beat Route, Heaven, Cha-Cha and Cafe De Paris because I was there and had the access, he explains, but very quickly, I realized I was documenting people who were not going to be looking like that for that long  in some cases, they were only ever going to look like that for one night. Here, he shares with T a selection of couples caught mid-liplock. As I felt like I needed to ask permission of my subjects, I would sometimes have to stop them kissing, ask, and then let them get on with it, he remembers. No one ever said no and no one ever stopped kissing. They just went right back to it.

title: Suspect in Midtown Manhattan Shooting Is Arrested in Rhode Island
description: A man the police believe fatally shot one person and injured two others at a Midtown Manhattan subway station this week has been arrested, the authorities said on Friday.

title: DraftKings Leaves Door Unlocked for Barred Fantasy Sports Players
description: Starting next week, the two leading daily fantasy sports sites will be barred from taking bets from a lucrative market: New York State. But one of them, DraftKings, leaves open a simple digital loophole that may let New Yorkers play anyway.

title: New Rules Make Companies Do More to Police Imported Food
description: WASHINGTON  Five years after Congress passed a landmark law meant to prevent the importation of contaminated food, the Food and Drug Administration on Friday made final new rules that for the first time put the main responsibility on companies for policing the food they import. The rules also include new safety standards for produce grown on American farms. Some take effect in a year.

title: Pari Livermore, Nancy Levine and The New York Times: A Saga
description: In 2007, the Times Styles section published a profile of a California matchmaker named Pari Livermore. Ms. Livermore often didnt take payment for her services, the story reported, but instead asked her clients to donate to her charities.

title: The Regime Change Problem in American Politics
description: This post isnt about what you think its about. Im not talking about a looming coup; Im talking about the problems facing political science, which  it recently occurred to me  are a bit like the problems facing macroeconomics after 2008.

title: Solving the Many Mysteries of What Became Carol
Standing Out in a Glassy West Chelsea
description: Tall, slender and glassy might be the design choice du jour, but a condominium rising in West Chelsea harks back to an era when terra-cotta and copper signaled the pinnacle of luxury.

title: In Hosting G-20, Turkey Strives to Bolster Its Status
description: ANTALYA, Turkey  Just to the west, the flood of migrants from Turkey to Greece continues, with deaths at sea almost daily. To the east is the raging civil war of Syria, the brutality of the Islamic State and the violence of Turkeys own conflict with Kurdish militants.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review Podcast: The Life of George H. W. Bush
description: Listen to this weeks podcast | Subscribe: iTunes | Stitcher

title: Maybe Obama Shouldnt Lecture Donald Trump
description: This is infuriating.

title: Gene Norman, Music Producer With an Ear for Jazz, Dies at 93
description: Gene Norman, a music promoter, nightclub owner and record producer who helped bring some of the most renowned jazz artists of midcentury to the West Coast and, through his independent record label, to the world, died on Nov. 2 at his home in Los Angeles. He was 93.

title: The Key to Political Persuasion
description: IN business, everyone knows that if you want to persuade people to make a deal with you, you have to focus on what they value, not what you do. If youre trying to sell your car, you emphasize the features of the sale that appeal to the buyer (the reliability and reasonable price of the vehicle), not the ones that appeal to you (the influx of cash).

title: Anne Franks Diary Gains Co-Author in Copyright Move
description: PARIS  When Otto Frank first published his daughters red-checked diary and notebooks, he wrote a prologue assuring readers that the book mostly contained her words, written while hiding from the Nazis in a secret annex of a factory in Amsterdam.

title: Latest Donald Trump Outburst Not Seen as Damaging in Iowa
description: MARSHALLTOWN, Iowa  It may not be a good idea to call voters whose support you seek stupid, but none of the iron rules of presidential politics have applied so far to Donald J. Trump.

title: On Location | Snowmass Village, Colo.
description: A dramatic, angular, family house on a bluff

title: Designing a Home With a Mountain in Mind
description: When Diego and Wendy Reyes found a vertiginous lot in Colorado with panoramic views of Snowmass Village and the surrounding mountains and forests, it didnt take them long to decide what they wanted to do with it: build a vacation home there as breathtaking as the scenery.

title: Sothebys to Offer Buyouts to Staff
description: On Friday, just as the fall auction season was drawing to a close, Sothebys offered its employees voluntary buyouts to cut costs.

title: Scott Campbell Turns Blind Trust Into Tattoos
description: It was hard to place the look on John Gachots face as he was seated on a draped chair next to a wall in a downtown Manhattan art gallery, his right arm stuffed through a hole the size of a discus for minute after excruciating minute.

title: Mysterious Ink
description: The artist Scott Campbell offered free, anonymous tattoos to a select few visitors to his Whole Glory installation at Milk Gallery in Manhattan.

title: Roasted Sweet Potatoes
description: Melissa Clark makes a savory sweet potato dish with horseradish compound butter.

title: Thanksgiving Vegetables Get Freshened Up
description: Like many other Americans, the chef Michael Anthony grew up accustomed to the soggy green-bean casseroles and marshmallow-topped sweet potatoes on his grandparents Thanksgiving table in Indianapolis.

title: A Restaurant Where Art is on the Menu
description: In 1992, the art dealer Gavin Brown helped the artist Rirkrit Tiravanija transform 303 Gallery, then on Greene Street, into an operational kitchen for a part performance, part installation piece titled Untitled (Free). The seminal solo show, which found the artist serving up gratis curry and rice out of the converted gallery, represented a critical development in Tiravanijas practice. It also marked the beginning of his friendship with Brown, who at the time worked as an assistant at the gallery. Now in the collection of MoMA, Untitled (Free)  considered a masterwork of relational aesthetics  was the first of many interactive projects realized by the twosome. Their latest scheme: a gallery-meets-kitchen in Hancock, N.Y. Lovingly referred to as Unclebrother (the name is an inside joke), the hybrid restaurant revives the generous spirit of Tiravanija and Browns inaugural partnership, but adds in a full-time, brick-and-mortar locale. Its the first time hes had a commercial kitchen, so its a departure in that sense, Brown says. Its a natural progression, in a way. Its about entering into the same place but from a different direction.

title: Jay Zs Tidal Loses Another Executive
description: Since Jay Z  bought Tidal early this year, the music streaming service has been plagued by frequent management changes and the perception both inside and outside the music industry that it was unlikely to succeed in a market dominated by Spotify, Apple and Pandora.

title: Readers Respond to Alabama 8-Year-Old Accused of Killing a Toddler
description: A story this week about an 8-year-old boy in Birmingham, Ala., charged with the murder of a 1-year-old girl who had been left with him while her mother went to a nightclub, sparked intense debate among Times readers about who should be held accountable when a child commits a crime.

title: Sunday Cycling and Soccer
description: Victor Calise, commissioner of the Mayors Office for People With Disabilities, started a recent Sunday in the park and ended it with an Italian dinner.

title: Pictures of the Day: Iraq and Elsewhere
description: Iraq and Elsewhere: Pictures of the Day

title: For Brands Like Toms, Its All About the Experience
description: When Blake Mycoskie, the founder of the shoe company Toms, began talking with its executives a few years ago about opening retail outlets, he faced an impasse right from the start. It was over the word store.

title: Chinese Overtures to Syngenta at a Time of Susceptibility
description: China has broken the future of Syngenta, the Swiss pesticides giant, wide open. The company has rejected a $42 billion bid from the China National Chemical Corporation, Bloomberg News reported. But the worlds big agrochemical companies look ripe for consolidation. Syngenta may find itself among the first to be harvested.

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks properties include a five-bedroom in Hamilton, N.J., and a four-bedroom in Lloyd Neck, N.Y.

title: Homes for Sale in New York and New Jersey
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in the New York region:

title: Paris Attacks Kill More Than 100, Police Say; Border Controls Tightened
description: PARIS  The Paris area reeled Friday night from a shooting rampage, explosions and mass hostage-taking that President Franois Hollande called an unprecedented terrorist attack on France. His government announced sharply increased border controls and heightened police powers as it mobilized the military in a national emergency.

title: How Victor Calise, Disabilities Commissioner, Spends His Sundays
description: When Mayor Bill de Blasio reappointed Victor Calise this year as the commissioner for the Mayors Office for People With Disabilities, he remarked on Victors relentless pursuit to make New York City the most accessible place in the world. Mr. Calise, 43, was raised in Ozone Park, Queens, and has been using a wheelchair since a mountain biking accident in 1994 that left him paralyzed from the waist down. He competed on the United States sled hockey team at the 1998 Paralympics in Japan. Later, he worked with the parks department to help bring the citys parks, beaches and recreational facilities into compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act. He lives on the Upper West Side with his wife, Susan, and their daughters, Sophia, 13, and Lola, 10.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: My 10 Favorite Books: James Dyson
description: For his bookshop installation, One Grand, the editor Aaron Hicklin asked people to name the 10 books theyd take with them if they were marooned on a desert island. The next in the series is the British vacuum-cleaner entrepreneur Sir James Dyson. He shares his list exclusively with T.

title: Columbia Rises for Opener and Quickly Shines
description: Many of the teams expected to be a part of the N.C.A.A. tournament field opened the mens basketball season Friday night in front of capacity crowds. At Duke, students began lining up Thursday night for the teams home opener against Siena, scheduled for 7 p.m. Friday.

title: Nov. 13, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Iraq, the Philippines, the West Bank and Indonesia.

title: Nina Griscom Pushes Her New Handbag Line With a Can-Do Spirit
description: Should I bill this directly to your husband? the uptown doyenne Nina Griscom asked with a laugh at a recent trunk show for her handbag collection, Nina Griscom for GiGi New York.

title: First Draft Focus: The Week in Political Pictures
Deadly Attacks in Paris
description: More than 100 people were killed and others injured in shootings and explosions that rocked the Paris area Friday. A blast at a stadium forced the evacuation of the French president.

title: Paris Attacks: The Violence, Its Victims and How the Investigation Unfolded
Daniel Murphy Rejects Mets Qualifying Offer
description: Daniel Murphy, the slugging star of the Mets charmed sprint through the National League playoffs last month, declined the teams qualifying offer on Friday and will test the open market in free agency.

title: Scene of Deadly Attacks in Paris
description: More than 100 people were killed Friday in multiple acts of violence in and around Paris.

title: Review: Isabel Leonard and Sharon Isbin in a Duet of Voice and Guitar
description: Most of the opera singers who appear at Carnegie Hall follow the traditional route of singing alongside a pianist. The mezzo-soprano Isabel Leonard chose a more unusual partner for her concert on Thursday evening at Zankel Hall, performing mostly Spanish music with the guitarist Sharon Isbin.

title: Wary of Mainstream Medicine, Immigrants Seek Remedies From Home
description: On a recent afternoon, Ina Vandebroek was poking around the shelves of La 21 Division Botanica on the Grand Concourse in the Bronx. Its narrow aisles were crammed with thousands of votive candles, herbal potions and brightly colored plaster statues of saints.

title: Immigration: A Hard Line in Politics, but an Applause Line on Broadway
description: At the very first out-of-town performance of On Your Feet!, the new Broadway musical about Gloria and Emilio Estefan, the pattern was established: The audience erupted in cheers when an angry Mr. Estefan rebuked a hostile record company executive, saying, You should look very closely at my face, because whether you know it or not  this is what an American looks like.

title: Saying He Has Cancer, Missouri Coach Is Resigning
description: Saying that he has cancer and wants to focus on his family and his treatment, the head coach of the University of Missouri football team, Gary Pinkel, announced his resignation Friday. The move shocked the college football world after racial protests had put it in the national spotlight and Pinkel had backed his players threat to boycott a game.

title: Daniil Trifonov, New to Rachmaninoff, but a Bold and Youthful Echo
description: David Geffen Hall is nearly empty. An usher roams the aisles. A technician adjusts microphones. A New York Philharmonic woodwind player fiddles with his reeds. Near the stage door sits a piano technician, his work on a Steinway being tested.

title: Review: Daniil Trifonov Brings Subtlety to Rachmaninoff
description: For three weeks, on behalf of Rachmaninoff, the New York Philharmonic is putting itself at the disposal of the dazzling 24-year-old Russian pianist Daniil Trifonov. On Wednesday night at David Geffen Hall, Mr. Trifonov was a brilliant, uncommonly poetic soloist in that composers Rhapsody on a Theme of Paganini and Piano Concerto No. 2. Given the familiarity of these pieces, you might wonder why a Rachmaninoff festival was called for.

title: Photographers and Filmmakers Using Drones to Reach New Heights
description: A group recently congregated in a grassy field at the LongHouse Reserve gardens in East Hampton for a photography workshop, watching intently as a white drone the size of a seagull hovered nearby, its lights flashing and four propellers buzzing. It sounded like a small hive of bees.

title: Andy White, Drummer on the Beatles Love Me Do, Dies at 85
description: Andy White, a studio drummer with a thriving career in London in the 1960s whose best-known work was on the Beatles first single, Love Me Do, died on Monday at his home in Caldwell, N.J. He was 85.

title: As Lives Lengthen, Costs Mount
description: Frederick Jones and Ping Wong are both over 85; both live on fixed incomes; and both have health problems that limit their mobility. From there, their lives diverge in ways that illuminate the uneven challenges facing New Yorks oldest old.

title: Review: Danish String Quartet Plays at the Rose Studio
description: The young players of the superb Danish String Quartet have been performing the four quartets by Denmarks own Carl Nielsen ever since their student days. Yet these players had never performed all four on a single program until Thursday evening at the intimate Rose Studio, in a concert presented by the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center.

title: Kia Issues a Second Recall of Soul Models in 2 Years
description: For the second time in about 17 months, Kia is recalling its Soul model for possible steering loss.

title: First Draft Focus: Summit in the Sunshine State
M.L.B. Picks Tampa Bay Rays to Play Possible Exhibition in Cuba
description: If a major league baseball team plays a spring training game in Cuba next year, it will be the Tampa Bay Rays.

title: Review: Sylvie Guillem Says Goodbye, Her Way
description: Sylvie Guillem is a trailblazer, notably in the decisive way she has commandeered her ballet career, but shes only human. After dancing for nearly four decades, shes calling it quits. In the charming program note for her farewell performance, Life in Progress, Ms. Guillem writes that she gave a friend the final say, or a license to kill, if she remained onstage longer than she should. Frankly, she writes, Id like to spare him this task.

title: Andrew Richardson, the Man Who Named a Magazine After Himself
description: When Andrew Richardson visited Japan last month, customs officials confiscated copies of his magazine, Richardson, for its sexually explicit photos. About a year ago, his Instagram account was temporarily suspended for showing a part of a womans derrire.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Review: Men Are From Mars, Women Are From Venus, Live!
description: Peter Story brings an awful lot of energy and an engaging delivery to Men Are From Mars, Women Are From Venus, Live!, a one-man show at New World Stages, but his efforts dont always overcome the creakiness of the source material.

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing: Paris, Russia, Islamic State
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: At Salon Art + Design, What to Check Out
Professors Dispute Depiction of Harvard Case in Rape Documentary
description: The veracity of one of this years most talked about documentaries, The Hunting Ground, has been attacked by 19 Harvard Law School professors, who say the films portrayal of rape on college campus is distorted, specifically when it comes to their schools handling of one particular case.

title: Win a Trip 2016
description: The Op-Ed columnist Nicholas Kristof invites students to enter a contest for an international reporting trip in 2016.

title: Three Hours of Terror in Paris, Moment by Moment
description: Many of the attacks were just minutes apart.

title: Syria Talks: What Countries Want
description: Diplomats from more than a dozen countries are meeting in Vienna on Saturday for talks on ending the Syrian civil war. Here is a rundown of what these countries want in these talks.

title: Bill Cunningham | In Living Color
description: Autumn in New York seemed to reach a crescendo last week, with nature and fashion producing an unbeatable spectrum. Urns in Central Park were filled with chrysanthemums, the Conservatory Garden dazzled with its Impressionist floral display and the New York Public Library was trimmed in blossoms  all reflected in the colors of stylish people. The urns on the parks Bow Bridge, missing for decades, were once again filled with flowers.

title: Evening Hours | Friends in High Places
description: Celebrations of art, politics, public service and more.

title: Abortion, Back at the Supreme Court
description: On Friday, the Supreme Court agreed to hear a case that involves one of the most serious threats to womens reproductive freedom since Roe v. Wade.

title: An Oil-Soaked Globe as Production Keeps Climbing and Demand Falls
description: HOUSTON  Such is the state of the oil industry these days that there is sometimes nowhere to put the oil. Off the coast of Texas, a line of roughly 40 tankers has formed, waiting to unload their crude or, in some cases, for a willing buyer to come along. Similar scenes are playing out off the coasts of Singapore and China and in the Persian Gulf.

title: An Aspiring Actor Refuses to Be Defined by His Past
description: To hear Michael Terry tell it, everything about his life seemed difficult. But anything was possible.

title: Soccer Fans Sing La Marseillaise
description: Soccer fans responded to a series of explosions and shootings in Paris by singing the French national anthem as they were evacuated from the stadium.

title: The Seduction of Safety, on Campus and Beyond
description: I HAVE been searching for safety for most of my life. I experienced a brutal assault when I was young and in that terrible moment, I learned I was vulnerable in unimaginable ways. I have come to crave safety, the idea that I can live free from physical or emotional harm. As an adult, I understand that there is no such thing as safety, that safety is promised to no one, but oh the idea of it remains so lovely, so elusive.

title: Paris Terror Attacks Leave Awful Realization: Another Massacre
description: PARIS  The night was chilly but thick with excitement as the big match between Frances national soccer team and archrival Germany was underway at the national stadium in a northern suburb of Paris. President Franois Hollande watched with the crowd as the French players pushed the ball across midfield.

title: Kentucky Governor Issues Parting Plea to Successor on Health Care System
description: WASHINGTON  Gov. Steven L. Beshear of Kentucky offered a vivid defense of his expansion of Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act on Friday, imploring Matt Bevin, the Republican governor-elect, to look at this from a business standpoint, if not from a human standpoint, and keep the program in place.

title: Defamation Suits Against Cosby Point to Peril of Belittling Accusers
description: In the last 12 months, dozens of women who for years stayed silent or said little have come forward to accuse the entertainer Bill Cosby of sexually assaulting them, only to find that it was too late to sue him on grounds directly related to the accusations, because of the statute of limitations.

title: Sharpening Attacks on Marco Rubio, Ted Cruz Urges New Immigration Limits
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Escalating a confrontation with Senator Marco Rubio of Florida over immigration policy, Senator Ted Cruz of Texas, one of his rivals for the Republican presidential nomination, introduced proposals on Friday outlining his own approach, calling for a halt to increases in legal immigration so long as American unemployment remains unacceptably high.

title: I.M.F. Officials Back Inclusion of Renminbi in Funds Currency
description: International Monetary Fund staff members recommended Friday that Chinas renminbi be included in the funds benchmark basket of currencies, a big step forward for the countrys long campaign to turn its currency into one of the pillars of international finance.

title: Dismissed Pentagon General Held Wide Influence Behind the Scenes
description: WASHINGTON  Lt. Gen. Ronald F. Lewis held a job that is little known beyond Washington. But his abrupt and public firing on Thursday called attention not only to a senior officers potentially career-ending scandal but also to the huge influence over military policy that his position, senior military assistant to the defense secretary, wields.

title: A Daunting Trip to School for Some Homeless Children
description: The daily trek to school begins outside a cluster of budget-price hotels in an industrial area in the middle of Staten Island.

title: Some See Attacks by Donald Trump as Start of His Downfall
description: First he compared Ben Carson to a child molester in a nationally televised interview. Then, at a campaign rally in Iowa, Donald J. Trump asked for someone to come try to stab him in the abdomen, twisting his own belt buckle as if to prove that Mr. Carsons account of having knifed a friend, as a wild-tempered youth, had to have been a lie.

title: Californias Prison Experiment
description: What happens when you release thousands of prison inmates before the end of their sentences?

title: Scene of Carnage Inside Sold-Out Paris Concert Hall
description: PARIS  The band had been playing to the crowd at one of this citys most popular music venues, the Bataclan, for about an hour. The 150-year-old music hall was sold out for the show by the American group Eagles of Death Metal.

title: Jack Yufe, a Jew Whose Twin Was a Nazi, Dies at 82
description: One day in 1954, Jack Yufe, a store owner from Southern California, stepped off a train in Essen, West Germany, and began searching the crowd at the station. He was looking for someone he had not seen since he was a baby, 21 years earlier.

title: With a Big Lead, Mrs. Clinton Can Afford to Take Some Risks
description: As Hillary Rodham Clinton, Bernie Sanders and Martin OMalley head into their second debate on Saturday, Democratic primary voters favor Mrs. Clinton over Senator Sanders of Vermont by 52 percent to 33 percent, according to a new New York Times/CBS News poll. But a much larger number  78 percent  expect Mrs. Clinton to be the Democratic nominee.

title: In Paris, a Night Disrupted by Terror
description: PARIS  IT is a perfectly normal dinner party until someone stands up, checks his phone, and says: I think theres been an explosion, at the Stade de France.

title: Tim Valentine, 89, 6-Term Democrat in Congress From North Carolina, Dies
description: Tim Valentine, who narrowly won the first of six terms in Congress in 1982 by defeating a rival who would have become North Carolinas first black congressman in decades, died on Tuesday at his home in Rocky Mount, N.C. He was 89.

title: Bruce B. Dayton, Minnesota Retailer and Arts Patron, Dies at 97
description: Bruce B. Dayton, the last of the five brothers whose retailing empire included department stores, some of the nations first enclosed shopping malls and the Target discount chain, died on Friday at his home in Orono, Minn., near Minneapolis. He was 97.

title: Paris Attacks on Social Media
description: Scenes from sites of attacks across the Paris area on Friday were shared on social media.

title: Panel Backs 1% Raises for New York Police Officers
description: A state arbitration panel decided on Friday to approve 1 percent raises for rank-and-file New York police officers who have worked for years without a labor pact with the city.

title: Date Night With the Democrats
description: This weekends Democratic debate is going to be a tough sell. Two hours on a Saturday night, and not a single candidate who appears to be certifiably deranged.

title: Theft of a Boxers Championship Belts Devastates His Upstate Hometown
description: CANASTOTA, N.Y.  To drivers who take Exit 34 off the New York Thruway, the International Boxing Hall of Fame pops up like a quick jab, welcoming them to this small central New York village about 25 miles east of Syracuse.

title: Uses Pickup Lines
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  First of all, this puzzle by Kameron Austin Collins is awesome. Its not perfect, but its fresh and fun and I enjoyed almost every moment of it. And that, to me, more than balances out a less-than-desirable spot or two. Thats what makes a puzzle that is fun to solve.

title: When Red (Bills) Met Green (Jets), Colorblind Fans Lost
description: For some fans, the N.F.L. Week 10 game on Thursday night did not become unwatchable when the Jets committed two turnovers in a two-minute span or bungled a late comeback attempt. Or even when the Buffalo Bills punter muffed a snap.

title: Acquittal of Vincent Asaro Is Latest Setback in Mafia Prosecutions
description: After 12 jurors acquitted the reputed mobster Vincent Asaro on all charges Thursday and left the courtroom, lawyers and trial observers were left asking: What happened?

title: St. Johns Gives Nervous Chris Mullin First Coaching Victory in His First Try
description: When it was over, and Chris Mullins first win as a coach was in the books, he made his way toward the southeast corner of the stands, to kiss the left hand of the man who brought him to St. Johns.

title: Terror and Confusion in Paris
description: On the Boulevard Beaumarchais, there was shock on Friday over a siege at a concert hall that took place a short distance from the attack on Charlie Hebdo in January.

title: Red Sox Acquire Star Closer Craig Kimbrel
description: The revival of the San Diego Padres was a flop last season, and the Boston Red Sox are the latest team to poach one of their talented players. In their first major move under baseball operations president Dave Dombrowski, the Red Sox traded four prospects Friday for Craig Kimbrel, a four-time All-Star who is only 27 years old.

title: More Scrutiny, Better Policing
description: THE director of the F.B.I., James B. Comey, recently offered an explanation for a reported uptick of violent crime in some of our cities. A chill wind, he said, has blown through American law enforcement over the last year  a reference to the so-called Ferguson effect that increased scrutiny on police conduct has led to reduced law enforcement in some urban neighborhoods.

title: The Knick Season 2, Episode 5: Rapid Progress
description: If the small staff of the Knickerbocker Hospital has its way, there wont be any diseases left for us to worry about a century later. In Friday nights episode of The Knick alone, John Thackery was zeroing in on the causes of addiction while the former (and presumably future) Knick surgeon Bertie Chickering was about to use radiation to treat his mothers cancer (based on a tip from Algernon Edwards). In the same spirit of constant innovation, Thackery rigged a telephone for use as a metal detector to find shrapnel in the body of a subway worker  a nurse held the receiver to her ear and when she heard static, Thackery pulled out a nail from deep within the mans body.

title: LeBron James Springs to Life and Forces Knicks to Relive a Collapse
description: Seconds remained in the first half when Carmelo Anthony started sizing up Tristan Thompson along the right sideline, near the Knicks bench. Hunched over, Anthony braided low, hypnotizing dribbles between his legs, back and forth across his body. Then, midstep, he rose and slung a parabolic 3-pointer that splashed through the net.

title: Braves Fans Can Put Their Money on the Team
description: Atlanta Braves fans can now bet on the future of their team, and not just by buying tickets.

title: Eagles of Death Metal, a Band Known for Wit, Now Mired in Tragedy
description: The band that was playing Friday evening at the Bataclan concert hall in Paris, where about 100 people were killed in one of a wave of attacks on the city, has an inadvertently alarming name: Eagles of Death Metal.

title: How Paris Terror Attacks Unfolded
description: A series of attacks in Paris from the main sports stadium to the Bataclan concert hall spread terror across the city Friday night.

title: Dont Pit the Healthy Against the Sick
description: To the Editor:

title: The Virtues of Arbitration
description: To the Editor:

title: A Nuclear Arsenal in Pakistan, and Far Beyond
description: To the Editor:

title: Columbia? An Ivy League Power?
description: Columbia greeted the mens basketball season Friday with an 11 a.m. game amid excitement that it can make the N.C.A.A. tournament this season.

title: Conservationists Decry Slaying of Cambodian Forest Guards, Pointing to China Timber Trade
description: One week ago, two members of a four-person team patrolling for illegal loggers and wildlife poachers in the Preah Vihear Protected Forest in northwestern Cambodia were shot and killed in their sleep, as Mongabay reported. Six men suspected in the murders, including a soldier, were arrested early in the week, but have beencharged only with illegal loggingfor the moment as authorities continue to sift for evidence.

title: CBS Shifts Emphasis of Democratic Debate to Reflect Paris Attacks
description: DES MOINES  In the hours after the deadly attacks in Paris, CBS News significantly reworked its plans for the Democratic presidential debate it is hosting here on Saturday night to focus more on issues of terrorism, national security and foreign relations.

title: What to Watch Saturday
description: Todays lineup  crime; travel through time, space, dimensions and tundra; home repair; 70s teenagers; Steve Jobs; and James Taylor  pairs well with popcorn.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: As I speak, terrorist attacks of an unprecedented scale are taking place in the Paris region. There are several dozen dead, lots more wounded. Its horrific.

title: Corrections: November 14, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: News Media Scrambles to Cover Paris Shootings
description: The American news media scrambled on Friday evening and early Saturday to cover the deadly attacks in Paris, an event unfolding thousands of miles away in multiple locations across a city gripped by terror and uncertainty.

title: Three Teams of Coordinated Attackers Carried Out Assault on Paris, Officials Say; Hollande Blames ISIS
description: PARIS  Three teams of Islamic State attackers acting in unison carried out the terrorist assault in Paris on Friday night, officials said Saturday, including one assailant who may have traveled to Europe on a Syrian passport along with the flow of migrants.

title: Attacks in Central Paris
description: At least 127 people were killed and dozens were wounded in six apparently coordinated attacks.

title: Meet the Instamom, a Stage Mother for Social Media
description: It was a gorgeous fall day in Dumbo, Brooklyn, and Keira Cannon was holding one of the weekend photo shoots she does with her favorite subject: her son, Princeton.

title: IBMs Design-Centered Strategy to Set Free the Squares
description: Phil Gilbert is a tall man with a shaved head and wire-rimmed glasses. He typically wears cowboy boots and bluejeans to work  hardly unusual these days, except hes an executive at IBM, a company that still has a button-down suit-and-tie reputation. And in case you dont get the message from his wardrobe, theres a huge black-and-white photograph hanging in his office of a young Bob Dylan, hunched over sheet music, making changes to songs in the Highway 61 Revisited album. Its an image, Mr. Gilbert will tell you, that conveys both a rebel spirit and hard work.

title: A Princess Aboard the Queen Mary 2
description: Who are we meeting? Tony Perrottet, an Australian-born historian, asked one recent Thursday. Is it a princess? Its not a queen, is it? It couldnt be the queen. Am I meant to know this? Was it on the invitation?

title: Using High Heels for Self-Defense
description: On a recent rainy evening, about 30 women, most wearing high heels, gathered in a Midtown Manhattan rehearsal space and engaged in a series of brisk maneuvers: hammer fists, elbowing out of chokeholds, fierce kicks.

title: Ruth Bader Ginsburg and Gloria Steinem on the Unending Fight for Womens Rights
description: The room went still when the women hugged. All of the staff, bustling in preparation just moments before, paused when Ruth Bader Ginsburg emerged quietly from her private chambers at the Supreme Court last month and embraced her old friend Gloria Steinem.

title: How to Pick a Meditation App
description: By now youve probably read about how meditation may help you manage anxiety, stress and blood pressure, and help you sleep better, be more creative and improve your relationships. While researchers are still debating many of these claims, a number of apps offer guided meditation specifically designed to take you from a first-time meditator to mindfulness guru.

title: ISIS Claims Responsibility, Calling Paris Attacks First of the Storm
description: SINONE, Iraq  The Islamic State claimed responsibility on Saturday for the catastrophic attacks in the French capital, calling them the first of the storm and mocking France as a capital of prostitution and obscenity, according to statements released in multiple languages on one of the terror groups encrypted messaging accounts.

title: The Week on Instagram
description: Photos posted on @nytimes this week took followers from the roads of Liberias countryside to a boatyard in Washington State

title: Feeling Woozy? It May Be Cyber Sickness
description: If you are watching computer-generated mayhem in the latest action film or scrolling rapidly on your smartphone, you may start to feel a little off. Maybe it is a dull headache or dizziness or creeping nausea.

title: Farhad and Mikes Week in Tech: Robots vs. Jobs
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: Attacks in Paris Add Urgency to Talks on Ending Syria War
description: VIENNA  The top diplomats from more than a dozen countries agreed Saturday to press forward on an ambitious timetable to engineer a political transition and cease-fire in Syria, but remained deeply divided on major issues after a round of talks that gained intensity following the terrorist attacks in Paris.

title: Putting a Stop to a Neighbors Slurs
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Paris Terror Attacks May Prompt More Aggressive U.S. Strategy on ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  When the Islamic State stormed onto the scene in Syria and Iraq, it seemed focused on seizing territory in its own neighborhood. But in the last two weeks, the so-called soldiers of the caliphate appear to have demonstrated a chilling reach, with terrorist attacks against Russia, in Lebanon and now in France.

title: France Attacks to Dominate Agenda at G-20 Conference in Turkey
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will consult about the Paris terrorist attacks with world leaders in Turkey this weekend as the annual gathering of presidents and prime ministers from the worlds largest economies there is poised to become an urgent summit meeting on confronting extremism.

title: Tens of Thousands March in Seoul, Calling for Ouster of President
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The police on Saturday fired water cannons and tear gas at thousands of protesters shouting for President Park Geun-hyes resignation while marching toward her office in Seoul in the largest antigovernment demonstration here in several years.

title: As Paris Attacks Unfolded, Players and Fans at Soccer Stadium Remained Unaware
description: PARIS  Shortly after 9:45 p.m. Friday, at halftime of an exhibition soccer match between France and Germany, the players on both teams went to their locker rooms to rest while the coaches, who normally would have been reviewing their strategies, instead received shocking news.

title: Paris Attacks: What We Know and Dont Know
description: Here is the latest:

title: The Real Problem With the Economy
description: The slumping stock market this week and the weaker-than-expected retail sales report are blips.

title: Saks and Gimbels, a Merchandising Legend
description: It was just a country store in Indiana that sold itself into the hearts of shoppers and became a merchandising legend.

title: Saks Is Shaking Off Retail Gloom With a Fifth Avenue Face-Lift
description: Marc Metrick stepped off a freight elevator at Saks Fifth Avenue one recent afternoon and navigated his way past mangled wires and bare concrete beams, his Prada lace-ups crunching on broken glass.

title: Terror in Paris
description: On Saturday morning, after an evening of incomprehensible barbarism against a free and civilized society by armed terrorists, President Franois Hollande of France declared the attacks an act of war. More than 125 people were slaughtered in multiple venues in Paris  in a concert hall, at several restaurants, near a sports stadium, on the street. Mr. Hollande declared a nationwide state of emergency, imposed checks at all of Frances borders, and called in the army to protect the city.

title: Amber Guild of Collins: Call Out the Elephant in the Room
description: This interview with Amber Guild, president of Collins, a brand consultancy, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Israeli Forces Destroy Family Homes of 4 Palestinians Accused in Shootings
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank  Israeli forces on Saturday destroyed the family homes of three Palestinian men charged with carrying out a drive-by shooting last month that killed a couple in front of their four children, and the forces also demolished the home of a man accused of fatally shooting an Israeli in June.

title: No Dot on i, but Pitt Crosses the ts in a Return to Its Signature Script
description: The Pitt Script, the iconic helmet insignia made famous by University of Pittsburgh legends like Tony Dorsett and Dan Marino, has made a full comeback this fall. The current football team loves it.

title: Lexie Sachs: A Sentry for the Good Housekeeping Seal
description: Lexie Sachs, 28, senior product analyst at the Good Housekeeping Institute in New York

title: A Tax-Cutting Move That Pfizer Can Hardly Resist
description: Give Pfizer, the giant drug maker, points for boldness and persistence: The company has bravely put tax inversions back in the headlines.

title: Immigration Sanctuary Ban Creates Uncertainty in North Carolina
description: DURHAM, N.C.  A day after Gov. Pat McCrory signed a bill prohibiting so-called sanctuary city policies in North Carolina, Jose Lopez, the police chief in Durham, was assessing the effect it would have on this city, where, for the last dozen years, police officers have been instructed to limit inquiries about a persons immigration status.

title: Jerry Stritzke of REI: If You Cant Be Outside, Bring the Outside In
description: The great outdoors

title: Marco Rubios History on Immigration Leaves Conservatives Distrustful of Shift
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.  Joyce Kaufman sat in her radio studio here the other day and said the first word that comes to mind when she thinks of Marco Rubio. A chameleon, she scoffed.

title: In Paris: Darkness of Terror in the City of Light
description: To the Editor:

title: Variety: A Lettered Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Whew! Did it seem to you like Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon were pulling our collective legs with this acrostic?

title: For Gary Pinkel at Missouri, an Evolution Followed by a Revolution
description: COLUMBIA, Mo.  Coaching at the high altitude of Division I college football is only partly about football. It requires a deep hike into regions controlled by state politicians and high-rolling boosters and alumni, not to mention an occasional grapple with societys most intractable problems.

title: Rising Mortality Rates for Working-Class Whites
description: Readers offer their theories to explain why middle-aged whites are dying earlier.

title: The Exploitation of Paris
description: Cant we wait until weve resolved the body count? Until the identities of all of the victims have been determined and their families informed? Until the sirens stop wailing? Until the blood is dry?

title: How to Watch the Democratic Debate
description: While the eyes of the world are on the aftermath of terrorist attacks in Paris, the Democratic presidential debate in Iowa will go on.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Egyptian Leaders Blame a Familiar Foe, Conspiracy, but Citizens Are Dubious
description: CAIRO  President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi of Egypt sought on Wednesday to reassure residents of Sharm el Sheikh about the exodus of tourists after the crash of a Russian charter jet after takeoff from the resorts airport. But to Egyptians worried about putting food on their tables, he offered little comfort.

title: ISIS Leader in Libya Is Targeted in U.S. Airstrike
description: WASHINGTON  The United States has broadened its fight against the Islamic State, targeting the groups senior leader in Libya on Friday night, the Pentagon announced on Saturday.

title: Many Say High Deductibles Make Their Health Law Insurance All but Useless
description: WASHINGTON  Obama administration officials, urging people to sign up for health insurance under the Affordable Care Act, have trumpeted the low premiums available on the laws new marketplaces.

title: Lindsey Vonn Is Fearlessly Forging Ahead
description: VAIL, Colo.  This past summer, sitting by herself inside the first house she has ever owned, Lindsey Vonn took stock of the rollicking past decade in the public eye.

title: To Weld, Perchance, to Dream
description: Its not often that one finds oneself uniquely qualified to comment on a matter in the popular media, but when Marco Rubio argued at the Republican debate last week that the country needs more welders and less philosophers, I had my moment. My father was a welder, and I am a philosopher. I actually did have a choice to make some decades ago: to weld or to philosophize?

title: A New Way to Improve College Enrollment
description: AMERICAN public schools do a good job of getting students into college, but a poor job preparing them to succeed once theyre there. While more than two-thirds of high school graduates enroll in college, nearly two-thirds of those arrive on campus unprepared for college-level rigor.

title: Angus Deaton
description: Angus Deaton is a professor of economics at Princeton and winner of this years Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Science.

title: Gifts With Meaning
description: ITS time for my annual holiday gift guide, the chance to recommend presents more meaningful than a tie or sweater.

title: Why Free Can Be a Problem on the Internet
description: T-Mobile, the wireless company, said last week that it would let customers watch as many movies as they wanted on services like Netflix and HBO as well as all other kinds of video, without having it count against their monthly data plans. Given the growing popularity of streaming video, its plan, called Binge On, should appeal to many consumers. But there are real concerns about whether such promotions could give telecommunications companies the ability to influence what services people use on the Internet, benefiting some businesses and hurting others.

title: Policing for Profit in St. Louis County
description: As many unwary drivers can attest, small-town speed traps have long been a steady source of income for local governments. But policing for profit acquired sinister overtones when a Justice Department investigation into the shooting and racial unrest in Ferguson, Mo., drew attention to the fact that some towns in St. Louis County derived 40 percent or more of their revenue by repeatedly nailing citizens with traffic fines and fees for petty violations.

title: Dont Let the Aid for 9/11 Responders Expire
description: In a positive signal from Congress, bipartisan majorities in both houses are on record as approving permanent renewal and financing of the emergency health care and compensation programs needed by thousands of first responders to the 9/11 attacks who are suffering illnesses as a result of their labors at the devastated sites.

title: Mens Lib!
description: SO far the gender revolution has been a one-sided effort. Women have entered previously male precincts of economic and political life, and for the most part they have succeeded. They can lead companies, fly fighter jets, even run for president.

title: Win a Trip in 2016
description: Im pleased to invite university students to apply for my 2016 win-a-trip journey. Ive been holding my win-a-trip contest since 2006, then taking the winner along with me on a reporting trip to the developing world. My aim is to generate interest in neglected global issues, and frankly its also an occasion for me to write about the issues in my column.

title: A Poets Election Victory Over a Former General Speaks of a New Myanmar
description: KYI DAUNG KAN, Myanmar  It was the poet versus the soldier  and the poet won.

title: Plan to Export Chimps Tests Law to Protect Species
description: When the Fish and Wildlife Service decided in June to classify all chimpanzees, captive or wild, as endangered, the ruling meant that any biomedical experiment or export of chimps from the United States, whoever owned them, would be subject to a strict permit process under the Endangered Species Act.

title: To Save Paris, Defeat ISIS
description: MILAN  The Paris slaughter claimed by the Islamic State constitutes, as President Franois Hollande of France declared, an act of war. As such, it demands of all NATO states a collective response under Article 5 of the North Atlantic Treaty. This says that, An armed attack against one or more of them in Europe or North America shall be considered an attack against them all.

title: Steely Veteran of the Sea to Make a Voyage Home
description: The Peking has faced gale-force winds and hurricanes. It has seen war and rough seas and rogue waves. Through it all, from its construction in 1911, it survived, and in 1974, it found a port where it could rest.

title: Players on Fringes of Tennis Chase a Status Symbol to Cherish
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala.  The crowd was tiny, but the emotions were quite the contrary. As Korey Lovett finished off his comeback victory in the first round of the Players Choice Open here this month, one of his coaches at the University of Alabama, Ryler DeHeart, rushed to congratulate Lovetts father.

title: One Small Rankings Point Feels Like a Giant Leap, When It Is the First
description: Jim Courier, a former No. 1, said a tennis player never forgets a first ranking point.

title: At Metropolitan Opera, Support for Paris Sounds Out With Singing of  Frances National Anthem
description: The Metropolitan Opera showed its support for the people of Paris in the wake of the terrorist attacks by opening its Saturday matinee of Puccinis Tosca with Plcido Domingo conducting the orchestra and chorus in the French national anthem, La Marseillaise.

title: The Tricky Terrain of Virtual Reality
description: The arrival of a small cardboard box with last Sundays Times represented, in its unobtrusive way, a collision of cultures.

title: Kevin Love Is Back With Cavs and More Determined
description: Kevin Love went nearly four months without shooting a basketball after he dislocated his left shoulder in a playoff game against the Boston Celtics last April. He spent much of his rehabilitation at altitude in Utah, where he focused on his conditioning. By early September, he was ready to return to the court.

title: Challenged by Bullies, but Channeling the Anger
description: On many occasions, Julio Mattos has used some of his allowance to buy pizza slices for homeless people or snacks to feed to stray animals.

title: Ted Cruzs Laughable Disguise
description: THE venerated political strategist David Axelrod once described a presidential campaign as an M.R.I. for the soul. It winds up being precisely that.

title: Half-Century Later, 76ers Again Pursue the Warriors Path
description: The Golden State Warriors never lose and the Philadelphia 76ers never win. Two original N.B.A. franchises linked forever when one took the place of the other in Philadelphia, they now represent the polar opposites of where a team can be in its development.

title: Republican Candidates Urge Aggressive Response After Paris Attacks
description: Visions of two Americas emerged from the 2016 presidential field on Saturday, at the Democratic debate and at Republican campaign events, as the candidates sought to project leadership after the Paris attacks and maneuver for political advantage in a rare moment when national security held voters attention.

title: For 3 Royals, Gold Gloves Cap a Perfect Season
description: During spring training in 2013, when a Rawlings representative delivered two new gloves to Kansas City Royals first baseman Eric Hosmer, he tried on one of them and immediately smiled, feeling his fingers against the leather.

title: French Prosecutor Details Suspects Past
description: Franois Molins, the Paris prosecutor, said that officials had identified one suspect in Friday's attacks as a man born near Paris who had been listed as an extremist since 2010.

title: They Have Met the Enemy in New England, and His Name Is Eli
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  At the Faneuil Hall Marketplace in downtown Boston, outside Fenway Park and even on Marthas Vineyard, seven miles off Cape Cod, stores for years routinely sold T-shirts that read, I Hate Eli Manning.

title: Sundays Matchup: Patriots at Giants
description: 4:25 p.m., CBS

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Origin of the Slippery Rock Mystique Dates to the 1930s

title: Paris Attacks Could Bolster Hillary Clintons Support, Focus Group Indicates
description: DES MOINES  The Paris terrorist attacks, raising questions about American leadership in the world and national security, will most likely bolster Hillary Rodham Clintons strengths in Saturdays debate, according to a focus group of undecided Iowa Democrats.

title: The Virtue of Contradicting Ourselves
description: IF youre a politician, there may be something worse than being called a liar, a cheater, a jerk or a wimp. In America, you dont want to be known as a flip-flopper. Jeb Bush and Hillary Rodham Clinton have both been criticized for changing their positions from yes to no on invading Iraq. A decade earlier, flip-flopping was one of the biggest knocks against John Kerry. In a JibJab video gone viral, an animated George W. Bush mocked Mr. Kerry: You have more waffles than a house of pancakes.

title: Attackers in Paris Did Not Give Anybody a Chance
description: PARIS  Franois Granier, a wine consultant and rock music fan, thought the concert he was attending Friday night had simply taken a particularly raucous turn.

title: A Crisis Our Universities Deserve
description: BETWEEN the 19th century and the 1950s, the American university was gradually transformed from an institution intended to transmit knowledge into an institution designed to serve technocracy. The religious premises fell away, the classical curriculums were displaced by specialized majors, the humanities ceded pride of place to technical disciplines, and the professors role became more and more about research rather than instruction.

title: Parisians Fear Terror Attacks Will Divide, Not Unite, the City
description: PARIS  Tony Balet came to work on Saturday with a ribbon pinned on his shirt. It was red, white, blue and black.

title: Is Mark Zuckerberg Ready for Facebook Parenthood?
description: IN a Manhattan cafe, I sit near a mother and her young daughter having tea. The daughter looks out the window. The mother takes pictures of her own shoes on a marvelously tiled floor, and of her daughter, who ignores her assiduously. I watch the mother artfully arrange the daughters teacup for a shot. I watch the daughter set her jaw. I watch the mother take a photo of the daughter and her teacup. The light is just so. I watch the mother consider her caption and hashtags and post it. I watch the mother scroll through her newsfeed. I watch the daughter stare out the window.

title: Teaching Peace in Elementary School
description: FOR years, there has been a steady stream of headlines about the soaring mental health needs of college students and their struggles with anxiety and lack of resilience.

title: America, the Not So Promised Land
description: ONE of the great myths Americans have about their country is that everyone wants to come here. Advocates and enemies of immigration share this assumption, which dates at least as far back as the turn of the 20th century. As reports of American fever circulated in Eastern Europe, one Polish economist, Leopold Caro, claimed that entire villages were becoming ghost towns. Many houses stood empty, and in many others only old women and small children remained behind. In some villages the entire young generation left home.

title: As Paris Terror Attacks Unfolded, Social Media Tools Offered Help in Crisis
description: As the attacks in Paris were still unfolding on Friday night, social media sites lit up as sources for information that went beyond the news.

title: Robert Craft, Stravinsky Adviser and Steward, Dies at 92
description: Robert Craft, an orchestral conductor, scholar and writer who was called an elegant Boswell by his supporters and a calculating Svengali by his detractors for his long professional association with Igor Stravinsky, died on Tuesday at his home in Gulf Stream, Fla. He was 92.

title: Having Aspirations
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Remember to inhale in between theme entries with todays puzzle by Alan Arbesfeld, or you might get dizzy and pass out. And thats no way to enjoy a Sunday puzzle.

title: Out for Fun on a Friday Night, Victims Are Mostly Young
description: As the world joined Parisians in mourning for the people killed in Fridays terrorist attacks, the identities of the victims, who included a young lawyer, a music critic and an American college student, slowly began to emerge.

title: How ISIS Expanded Its Threat
description: The Islamic State emerged from a group of militants in Iraq to take over large portions of Iraq and Syria, and now threatens other countries in Europe and elsewhere.

title: Day After Paris Attacks, Familiar Fear Grips a Wary New York
description: They paused outside concert halls and in the middle of Broadway shows, on subways and buses carrying people into some of the countrys most crowded areas, reckoning with how the spasm of terror that struck Paris on Friday, seemingly at random, might pierce American lives, too.

title: Kurds Investigate Reports of Mass Grave of Yazidis in Sinjar
description: DOHUK, Iraq  Kurdish officials are investigating reports that a mass grave has been found near the town of Sinjar that holds the remains of more than 70 Yazidis, including older women, a Kurdish security official said Saturday.

title: Attackers Possible Link to Migrant Trail Heightens Security Fears
description: BERLIN  For months, hundreds of thousands of men, women and children have literally marched their way into Europe, fleeing war, poverty and hunger, arriving in such huge numbers that they set off uncommon displays of compassion  and outright acts of fear.

title: Rivals at Democratic Debate Attack Hillary Clinton
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton, who had set out to use the second Democratic presidential debate to portray herself as the strongest potential commander in chief while France reeled from terror attacks, instead found herself pummeled by rivals on Saturday over her ties to Wall Street and her foreign policy record.

description: The leader of the National Front party, Marine Le Pen, said on Saturday that France is no longer safe after attacks in the capital claimed 129 lives.

description: Gauthier, 24, was in the Bataclan concert hall in Paris when assailants opened fire. He was shot but escaped when a man dragged him to safety.

title: Paris Gunmen Single Out Franois Hollande, and Leave Him With Few Palatable Responses
description: PARIS  For the second time this year, France has found itself singled out for calculated terrorist attacks that have at once stunned and united the country. But perhaps no one was singled out by Fridays carnage more than the nations leader, President Franois Hollande.

description: The day after the deadly attacks in Paris, people around the globe turned out to light candles, lay down flowers and console each other.

description: Muhamad Karim Tahir, a Kurdish fighter, recorded the scene as an Islamic State truck bomb hurtled down a highway toward his Humvee. A Kurdish missile hit the truck, causing it to explode.

title: Kurds in Iraq Face Fast and Erratic Threat in ISIS Suicide Drivers
description: SOLAGH, Iraq  Its coming! a Kurdish fighter screamed as a truck barreled down the road. The explosion is coming!

title: Riding to the Scene in the Paris Attacks
description: The photographer Jerome Delay covers West Africa for The Associated Press. He was in Paris Friday night during the terrorist attack that killed at least 129 people. After covering the attacks and todays reaction, he spoke to James Estrin about his experiences. The conversation has been edited.

title: Strategy Shift for ISIS: Inflicting Terror in Distant Lands
description: WASHINGTON  Defying Western efforts to confront the Islamic State on the battlefield, the group has evolved in its reach and organizational ability, with increasingly dangerous hubs outside Iraq and Syria and strategies that call for using spectacular acts of violence against civilians.

description: CORK, Ireland  As lord mayor of this quiet seaside city in southern Ireland, Chris OLeary seems to have a situation most other local politicians can only dream about.

title: A Baby Dies at Day Care, and a Mother Asks Why She Had to Leave Him So Soon
description: As he did most mornings of the 117 days of his life, the first thing Karl did that Monday morning in July was to give me a smile like sunlight. He lay in the bed for a while, between his dad and me, looking from one of us to the other, working himself up with gurgles of delight. That morning, which started the same as all his others, would be a little different, however: it was his mommys first day back at work.

title: Supporting France, Obama Loath to Add Troops to ISIS Fight
description: ANTALYA, Turkey  For President Obama, the short-term response to the terrorist attacks in Paris was straightforward and relatively easy: The American military and intelligence agencies provided information to help French warplanes bomb Islamic State targets on Sunday in the groups stronghold in northern Syria.

title: 1940: Worst Nazi Raid Leaves Coventry in Ruin
description: LONDON  Subjected last night to one of the most furious bombing attacks of the war, the industrial city of Coventry, in the heart of the Midlands, presented today [Nov. 15] scenes of ruin never before equaled in England in this ruthless and devastating conflict. From dusk on Thursday until dawn Coventry was battered and blasted by wave after wave of Nazi planes, which, according to German assertions, dropped 1,000,000 pounds of high explosives and 60,000 pounds of incendiary bombs.

title: Rollie Massiminos Latest Act: A Smaller Stage, but Just as Frenetic
