Recovering from a collapsed lung, under treatment for small recurrences of the cancer that was surgically removed four years ago, and on medication, Rollie Massimino was under strict doctors orders to take it easy for 48 hours and especially to avoid driving his car.

title: Grief in Paris
description: At least 129 people were killed and dozens more were wounded in coordinated attacks.

title: France Strikes ISIS Targets in Syria in Retaliation for Attacks
description: PARIS  France bombed the Syrian city of Raqqa on Sunday night, its most aggressive strike against the Islamic State group it blames for killing 129 people in a string of terrorist attacks across Paris only two days before.

title: 1965: Anti-Red Law in U.S. Is Voided
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court today [Nov. 15] unanimously ruled that Communist party members do not have to register with the government because they might incriminate themselves. The high tribunal declared a requirement that Communist party members register under the 1950 Subversive Activities Control Law, sometimes referred to as the McCarran Act, violates the Fifth Amendment privilege against self-incrimination.

title: Paris Attacks: What We Know and Dont Know
description: French warplanes struck Islamic State militants in Syria, two days after Islamic State terrorists killed at least 129 people in Paris. The airstrikes appeared to be focused on Raqqa, the self-proclaimed capital of the Islamic State.

title: Pope Condemns 'Barbarity' of Paris Attacks
description: Pope Francis expressed condolences to all the citizens of France and said that using the name of God to justify violence and hatred was "blasphemy."

title: Beirut, Also the Site of Deadly Attacks, Feels Forgotten
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Ali Awad, 14, was chopping vegetables when the first bomb struck. Adel Tormous, who would die tackling the second bomber, was sitting at a nearby coffee stand. Khodr Alaa Deen, a registered nurse, was on his way to work his night shift at the teaching hospital of the American University at Beirut, in Lebanon.

title: Mary-Louise Parker on Life With and Without Men
description: The other day in the Brooklyn Heights duplex Mary-Louise Parker shares with her two children and Mrs. Roosevelt, a cocker spaniel in a red diaper, the actress was stroking one of the oyster shells she keeps in a bowl in her living room.

title: A Street-Level Search for Women to Put on a Manhattan Pedestal
description: Joan of Arcs armor glistened in the noonday sun as she walked slowly through the lunchtime crowds rushing past the Flatiron Building in Manhattan recently. Every now and then, she paused and scanned the sidewalk, slightly tilting her head back as she announced her mission.

title: Invoking Nazis, Marco Rubio Hits Hillary Clinton for Not Saying U.S. Is at War With Radical Islam
description: Senator Marco Rubio of Florida, arguing that the United States is at war with radical Islam, sharply criticized Hillary Rodham Clinton for declining to characterize the perpetrators of the Paris attacks in that way, invoking Nazi Germany to make his point.

title: Saturday Night Live Honors Paris
description: Saturday Night Live skipped its usual cold open on Saturday, instead delivering a message of support to Paris after Fridays attacks.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. Lets put aside Thanksgiving planning for a moment. Its not just the horrible news out of France. You thought about Thanksgiving yesterday, and will think about it tomorrow, and next weekend will be filled with preparations large and small. For this day, at least, were going to concentrate on the short term: dinners for the week ahead.

title: Efforts to Rein In Arbitration Come Under Well-Financed Attack
description: A television ad during the Republican presidential debate last Tuesday depicted pale bureaucrats rubber-stamping the word DENIED on the files of frustrated Americans, beneath a red banner of Senator Elizabeth Warren evoking a Communist apparatchik.

title: Muslims in Paris Condemn Attacks
description: Muslims in the French capital condemned the terrorists that attacked their city, saying they tarnished Islam.

title: Fear and Friends
description: The news from Paris was horrifying, and deserved a break in the usual round of commentary, but surely nobody who has been paying attention was completely shocked. We know that there are jihadists out there, and even the best efforts at prevention will fail sometimes. Well have to see how this fairly elaborate plot went undetected, but really nothing about the story so far suggests that it should fundamentally change how we see the world.

title: Love the Coopers Beats Expectations, but James Bond and Charlie Brown Win the Box Office
description: The feel-good comedy Love the Coopers seemed to arrive just in time for moviegoers weary of word events, while the ripped-from-the-headlines drama The 33, about the 2010 Chilean mining tragedy, may have been a little too real.

title: Unraveling the Connections Among the Paris Attackers
description: As many as six of the assailants in the coordinated Islamic State terrorist assault in Paris were Europeans who had traveled to Syria.

title: Jeb Bush Says U.S. Should Declare War in Fight Against Islamic State
description: Jeb Bush said the United States should declare war as it responds to the Paris attacks and the rise of ISIS in general.

title: Cartoon: Heng on Democracys First Steps in Myanmar
description: Daw Aung San Suu Kyis party, the National League for Democracy, won a solid majority in parliamentary elections.

title: Irish Repertory Theater Set to Honor Brian Friel
description: The Irish playwright Brian Friel, who died last month at 86, will be honored in a memorial service on Dec. 7, presented by The Irish Repertory Theater at the Manhattan Theater Clubs Samuel J. Friedman Theater. Additionally, Broadway theaters will dim their lights for Mr. Friel on Dec. 8.

title: Projection Kicks Off Countdown to Black History and Culture Museum Opening
description: By this time next year, a new Smithsonian museum dedicated to telling the history of black Americans will be welcoming visitors on the National Mall.

title: Man Who Gave Psychics $718,000 Just Got Sucked In
description: He sat in a Dennys restaurant, drinking coffee between cigarette breaks after a long and sleepless night, answering question after question.

title: What to Watch Sunday
description: If you need an escape from all the news, Anthony Bourdain will take you to a sunny island, and Bobs Burgers will bring you an early Christmas.

title: For Once, the Knicks Protect a Fourth-Quarter Lead
description: Frustrated with his limited role on the Knicks, Kevin Seraphin recently went to Coach Derek Fishers office and asked what he could do to earn more playing time. It was a long and frank conversation, Seraphin said, and Fisher essentially told him to focus on his defense and rebounding. Fisher also preached patience: Seraphins time would come.

title: Obama and Putin Discuss ISIS and Syria in Informal Conversation
description: ANTALYA, Turkey  President Obama and President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia met face-to-face here on Sunday, broaching once again their longstanding disagreement about how to confront the Islamic State and deal with the civil war in Syria.

title: Fear Rising Among Refugees in Paris
description: Refugees in central Paris have heightened fears about their security and their future in France following Friday's attacks.

title: Hillary Clinton Botches Wall Street Questions
description: Hillary Clinton should have seen that Wall Street shot coming. Instead, she compounded the damage.

title: Review: The Latin Explosion: A New America, on HBO, Is a Music Civics Lesson
description: The best moments come early in The Latin Explosion: A New America, an hourlong HBO documentary on Monday night. Desi Arnaz dancing with his conga and wailing Babal. Rita Moreno laying down the law in West Side Story. A series of early rock n roll one-hit wonders matched with their real names: Sam the Sham, a.k.a. Domingo Samudio; Question Mark (of Question Mark and the Mysterians), a.k.a. Rudy Martinez; Cannibal (of Cannibal and the Headhunters), a.k.a. Frankie Garcia.

title: Penguins, Known for Dangerous Attack, Are in Peril Themselves
description: NEWARK  As usual, the crowd at Prudential Center directed an obscene chant at Pittsburgh center Sidney Crosby, the Penguins captain. But this time was different: When the jeers began in the middle of the third period on Saturday night, the Penguins were three goals behind.

title: Paris Attacks Pose Test for U.S. Presidential Candidates
description: WASHINGTON  The tragedy in Paris is roiling American politics, bolstering the Republican rights anti-immigration demands in the short run and perhaps ultimately enhancing Hillary Rodham Clinton and her credentials as the candidate with experience.

title: Review: St. Thomas Church Season Honors John Scott
description: When John Scott, the revered organist and choirmaster at St. Thomas Church Fifth Avenue, programmed Mozarts Requiem to open the churchs concert season on Thursday evening, he could hardly have anticipated that the performance would be dedicated to his memory. But in August, having returned from the first leg of a triumphant European recital tour, Mr. Scott, a vigorous 59, died of a heart attack.

title: Review: The Mezzo-Soprano Anne Sofie von Otter at the Frick Collection
description: Lovely as it was, it had an air of unreality. To have canceled the concert or significantly altered the program on Friday night  a delicious mix of the sublime and the ridiculous, featuring the Swedish mezzo-soprano Anne Sofie von Otter  would have achieved nothing.

title: Israeli Forces Arrest Palestinian in Drive-By Shooting in West Bank
description: JERUSALEM  The Israeli authorities announced on Sunday the arrest of a Palestinian man suspected of carrying out a deadly drive-by shooting against Israelis in the West Bank, and said the suspects father had informed the military about his sons involvement in the hope of preventing the demolition of their family home.

title: Watching Missouri From Afar, and Seeing Lesson for All Black Athletes
description: More than a week after the president and the chancellor of the University of Missouri were forced to resign, the activism of the football players who helped bring about those changes is being celebrated as an example of what can be achieved when athletes lend their celebrity to a cause. What many found extraordinary about the affair is that athletes stepped out of the sports cocoon.

title: 15 Sudanese Migrants Killed at Egypt-Israel Border, Officials Say
description: CAIRO  At least 15 Sudanese migrants trying to cross from Egypt into Israel were shot and killed at the border early Sunday, possibly by Egyptian police officers, according to security officials and news reports.

title: More Than 8.5 Million Watched Democratic Debate on CBS
description: More than 8.5 million people watched the second Democratic presidential debate on CBS on Saturday night, according to Nielsen data provided by the network.

title: Review: Prem Ratan Dhan Payo, a Bollywood Tale of a Prince-and-Plebe Double
description: The Bollywood movie Prem Ratan Dhan Payo is set in contemporary India, though its one of palaces and quaint villages and low-rise cities, with the occasional iPhone and Mercedes thrown in for modernity and luxury brandings sake.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Nov. 16
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Review: Appomattox at the Kennedy Center
description: WASHINGTON  Eight years ago, the composer Philip Glass unveiled a new opera, Appomattox, at the San Francisco Opera. Set to a libretto by Christopher Hampton, it centered on the gentlemanly negotiations between Generals Grant and Lee at a rural Virginia home that effectively brought the Civil War to a close in 1865. But the appearance of a chorus of civil rights protesters signaled that the operas true subject was race relations in America.

title: Review: Ry Cooder, Ricky Skaggs and the Whites, a Roots-Music Celebration
description: Ry Cooder began the first encore at Zankel Hall on Saturday night with a shadowy, droning solo on electric bouzouki, in no hurry to settle on a tempo. After a few moments, Ricky Skaggs joined him on mandolin, and their searching interplay coalesced into a slow processional. Only as Mr. Cooder started singing, with a light husk in his baritone, did the shape of a song become clear.

title: Review: Spectator at the Japan Society
description: When a friend heard I was going to a production at the Japan Society, he guessed I would see one of the traditional Japanese genres  Noh, Kabuki, Bunraku  and said at once, Interesting. My visit on Friday, however, was for Shuji Onoderas Spectator, which, certainly interesting, was new in Tokyo in 2013.

title: Paris Attacks Shift Europes Migrant Focus to Security
description: WARSAW  With hundreds of thousands of migrants pouring across its borders, and economic and political pressure growing to enact tighter controls, Europe has nevertheless stayed fairly steady in its response to the humanitarian emergency.

title: Review: In Destiny and Power, George H.W. Bush Epitomizes a Vanishing G.O.P.
description: For better or for worse, George Herbert Walker Bush has been enshrined in collective memory as a series of caricatures, all of them evoking ineffectuality. He was the effete Yale man and the blue blood wimp; the awkward statesman who, when called upon to speak, diced the English language into an uneven and mysterious julienne. It didnt help that his face was generally a fresco of befuddlement. The last thing one would have expected of him was tigerish ambition. Unlike so many politicians who thrust their way into the Oval Office  TheodoreRoosevelt, Lyndon B. Johnson, Bill Clinton  there seemed nothing overtly appetitive about him.

title: Tic-Tac-Toe Win
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  If youre an experienced solver, you will find this debut puzzle by Jim Holland pretty easy. You probably wont stop writing in entries from the time you start until you write in the last letter.

title: For Spike Lee, an Honorary Oscar, but Diversity Takes Center Stage
description: LOS ANGELES  We can talk, you know, yabba, yabba, yabba, but we need to have some serious discussion about diversity, and get some flave up in this! Spike Lee admonished members of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, as he accepted an honorary Oscar at a black-tie banquet in Hollywood on Saturday night.

title: Beneath New York Public Library, Shelving Its Past for High-Tech Research Stacks
description: As they skate or snack in Bryant Park, visitors might dismiss the stately New York Public Library next door as a dog-eared relic in an age of digital information.

title: Blacks Are Challenged to Buy From Black-Owned Businesses to Close Gap
description: CHICAGO  Should black people go out of their way to patronize black-owned business?

title: What Will Come After Paris
description: The terrorist attacks in Paris on Friday, along with twin bombings in Beirut on the day before and the downing of a Russian jetliner over the Sinai Peninsula on Oct. 31, show a new phase in the Islamic States war against the West, a readiness to strike far beyond areas it controls in Iraq, Syria, and increasingly, Libya.

title: Blocks From Charlie Hebdo, Area Known for Bonhomie Is Shaken Again
description: PARIS  The massacre Friday night  by militants wielding assault rifles provoked an eerie and disturbing sense of familiarity for all of France. But that feeling was even more profound for one quickly gentrifying, multicultural neighborhood of Paris known for its bourgeois bonhomie  the 11th Arrondissement.

title: Joel Schumacher, Directing Neighborhood 3, Gets an Education
description: On the first preview night for the Flea Theater premiere of Neighborhood 3: Requisition of Doom, the set was not quite finished, the music was temporary and the sound designer was not even due to begin work until after the curtain call. I have no idea whats going to happen tonight, said the director, Joel Schumacher, before the show. But he was not sweating it. I dont mind anything, except the Republican debates, he said breezily.

title: Layoffs Coming at Weinstein Company, Mostly in Film Division
description: LOS ANGELES  The Weinstein Company on Sunday confirmed that it will lay off as many as 50 of its more than 200 employees, mostly in its film division. The layoffs were first reported by Variety. Weinstein has been shifting much of its focus toward television, but continues to work on future films, including The Six Billion Dollar Man, planned for 2017, and has high-profile films set for release this year. Those include a pair of likely awards contenders, Todd Hayness Carol and Quentin Tarantinos The Hateful Eight.

title: Hillary Clinton Takes a More Defined Stance on ISIS
description: AMES, Iowa  The day after a debate in which Democratic presidential candidates tangled over the causes of Islamic State terrorism but not how to confront it, Hillary Rodham Clinton offered a more forward-looking view of American leadership in response to the threat.

title: 5 Yemeni Guantnamo Inmates Are Sent to United Arab Emirates
description: WASHINGTON  The Department of Defense announced on Sunday that it had transferred five lower-level Yemeni detainees from the Guantnamo Bay prison in Cuba to the United Arab Emirates. The United States had held each for nearly 14 years as wartime prisoners, and none had been charged with a crime.

title: Tensions in Iran After Nuclear Deal Grow in Hostility
description: Tensions between the Iranian president, Hassan Rouhani, and more conservative authorities over the countrys nuclear agreement and its future are turning increasingly bitter, punctuated by public exchanges and growing signs of an anti-American backlash, including arrests.

title: Mormon Resignations Put Support for Gays Over Fealty to Faith
description: SALT LAKE CITY  Ever since she was an infant being blessed during a church naming ceremony, Lindsay Matson had been on the books of the Mormon Church. As it has done with millions of other members, the church kept note of her spiritual life as she moved from congregation to congregation, took youth leadership posts and married at age 19 in a Mormon temple.

title: Japan Economy Contracts 0.8%, Returning to Recession
description: TOKYO  The Japanese economy deteriorated more severely than expected in the third quarter, government data released on Monday showed, extending a downturn into a second consecutive three-month period and putting the country in technical recession.

title: New York State Workers Laud Higher Minimum Pay
description: Tessa Sheehy works full time as an office assistant for the New York State Department of Labor but lives at home with her mother because she does not earn enough to move out.

title: How Belgium Became Home to Recent Terror Plots
description: The attacks in Brussels on Tuesday have refocused attention on the Belgian capital as an incubator of radicalism and center for terrorist plots.

title: Charleston Mayor, Champion for Integration, Prepares to Bow Out
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  Mayor Joseph P. Riley Jr. sat behind the big desk in his formal and stately City Hall office here, with a photo of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. on one wall and a portrait of Gen. Robert E. Lee staring down from another.

title: Boko Haram Attacks Persist, but Nigerian Officials Say Group Is Losing Ground
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Boko Haram has lost significant ground in northern Nigeria, according to some of the regions top officials and international security experts, dealing a setback to a group that for years has menaced the nation with murder, abductions and other violence.

title: First Responders by Accident
description: Dear Diary:

title: A Strip. A Drop. Then aGiants Win Over thePatriots Slips Away.
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  In the Giants locker room minutes after Sundays 27-26 loss to the New England Patriots, the players and the coach could not stop replaying all the ways the game could have ended differently.

title: Inquiry Finds Mounting Proof of Syria Link to Paris Attacks
description: PARIS  On both sides of the Atlantic, the fast-moving investigation into the deadly Paris terrorist attacks steadily accumulated clues on Sunday: a car discovered in the Parisian suburbs with a cache of weapons. Mounting proof of links between the Islamic State in Syria and the attackers. And intense scrutiny on three brothers, living in Belgium, as crucial suspects in the elaborate plot.

title: Global Soccer Brings Its A Game to Brooklyn at BlazerCon
description: I feel like I just wandered into the soccer-themed bar mitzvah I never had, said Roger Bennett, one-half of the Men in Blazers duo, seconds after bounding up onto the stage Friday evening to open the festivities at the first BlazerCon, a Comic-Con for soccer nerds.

title: Retailers Earnings, the Star Wars Battlefront Video Game and 2 Technology I.P.O.s
description: Several of the nations largest retailers are expected to report earnings this week, and their financial health will be closely watched after dismal numbers from two department store stalwarts  Macys and No (Friday)rdstrom  spooked investors last week.

title: N.B.A. Game of the Week: Warriors at Clippers
description: Every week, The New York Times will choose one essential game to watch, highlighting hot teams, winning and losing streaks and statistical intrigue in the N.B.A.

title: Could Paris Happen Here?
description: Hanover, N.H.  SURVEYING the aftermath of the terror attacks in Paris, most Americans probably feel despair, and a presentiment that it is only a matter of time before something similar happens here. Even as Americans have felt the pain of the French, they have worried, not surprisingly, considering 9/11, about whether their country is next.

title: At Trial, Prosecutors to Detail Dean Skeloss Favors for His Son
description: Hydrofracking would seem unlikely fodder for an emotional moment between a father and his son.

title: For-Profit College System Expected to Pay Millions
description: The nations second-largest for-profit college operator, Education Management Corporation, is expected to agree to pay nearly $90 million to settle a case accusing it of compensating employees based on how many students they enrolled, encouraging hyperaggressive boiler room tactics to increase revenue.

title: Four Teams Will Rise Above the Rest, if Only by Default
description: After a day in which four of the top 10 teams in the College Football Playoff selection committees rankings lost, it is fair to ask how anyone can know which teams are good enough to qualify for the Playoff.

title: Iowa TV Gets Its Close-Up, Enjoying Outsize Influence
description: DES MOINES  The news team at the station KCCI buzzed with nervous anticipation here at Drake University on Saturday night, less than two hours before the start of the Democratic candidates debate.

title: Brands Look Far and Wide for a Niche in Virtual Reality
description: Even in virtual reality, it seems, there will be no escape from advertising.

title: In Presidential Campaign, Its Now Terrorism, Not Taxes
description: WASHINGTON  Bernie Sanders dispensed with the threat from the Islamic State in two sentences at the start of the Democratic debate before abruptly pivoting to the dangers of a rigged economy. Ben Carson struggled to answer a simple question on Sunday about how he would form a coalition to fight the militant group. And Marco Rubio, after pushing out a new video about the clash of civilizations, revamped his plans for an important Monday appearance before a group of executives on the assumption that terrorism, not tax rates, would be their most pressing concern.

title: Yale College Dean Torn by Racial Protests
description: NEW HAVEN  His cellphone started humming at 11:20 p.m. on Thursday. An urgent voice jolted Jonathan Holloway from his slumber. Students protesting racism on campus were streaming toward the home of the universitys president, the caller said.

title: Cosmos Win Title in Last Game for Two of Their Stars
description: The Argentine striker Gastn Cellerino scored three goals to lead the Cosmos to a 3-2 victory over the Ottawa Fury in the North American Soccer League championship game on Sunday, stealing the thunder of two more famous teammates but delivering the title they craved in their final competitive game.

title: Ankle Monitors Weigh on Immigrant Mothers Released From Detention
description: HUNTINGTON, N.Y.  On a recent afternoon, Grace, a 33-year-old mother from El Salvador, sat on a bench inside the train station in this Long Island town, crossed her ankle over her knee, carefully rolled up the cuff of her flared jeans and pointed to the black plastic fist-size object strapped to her ankle. A tiny green light flashed, indicating that the device was charged.

title: The Leftovers Season 2, Episode 7: Crossing Over
description: Kevin Garvey is not dead. Virgil probably isnt either, not permanently.

title: Review: In Misery, With Bruce Willis and Laurie Metcalf, the Ghost of Productions Past
description: Though it is based on one of Stephen Kings most terrifying novels, the stage version of Misery will not, I promise, leave you cold with terror. The production that opened on Sunday night at the Broadhurst Theater, which stars a vacant Bruce Willis (in his Broadway debut) and a hardworking Laurie Metcalf, sustains a steady, drowsy room temperature throughout.

title: Review: Incident at Vichy, an Arthur Miller Tale Set in World War II
description: We dont want to alarm people, says a police captain to a colleague near the beginning of Incident at Vichy, Arthur Millers 1964 drama about the rounding up of Jews in France under German occupation. The remark resounds with irony, since most of the men surrounding them, who have been pulled off the streets, supposedly so their identity papers can be verified but in fact so they can be revealed as Jews and sent to concentration camps, are practically vibrating with anxiety and subterranean fear.

title: Homeland Recap: Season 5, Episode 7, Oriole
description: Season 5, Episode 7 Recap: Oriole

title: The Walking Dead Season 6, Episode 6 Recap: A Tough Week for Daryl
description: We saw a new romance blossom and a cherished one torn asunder on Sunday as The Walking Dead finally wrapped up the great walker drive of 2015, cutting the herd loose to  what? Cool their rotting heels on the highway? Ease on down the road?

title: Mondays Matchup: Texans (3-5) at Bengals (8-0)
description: Texans (3-5) at Bengals (8-0)

title: A Reunion Is Cut Short by a Mothers Illness
description: Throughout his childhood, Rajon Thomas relished putting pencil to paper and sketching all manner of subjects. He drew one particular image time and time again.

title: Nordic Countries, Overwhelmed by Migrants, Retreat From Generous Traditions
description: RAASEPORI, Finland  Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland, countries that long set the standard for welcoming refugees from war and persecution, are rapidly rethinking their generosity as the tide of migrants to Europe strains their budgets and roils their politics.

title: The Best of Week 10 in the N.F.L.
description: Redskins quarterback Kirk Cousins took advantage of a matchup against the Saints struggling defense, throwing a career-high four touchdown passes  each one longer than any he had completed all season  as Washington routed New Orleans. Cousins was 20 for 25 passing for 324 yards, with no interceptions and a perfect passer rating of 158.3. His scoring throws came on passes of 78 yards, to running back Matt Jones; 16 and 8 yards, to tight end Jordan Reed; and 11 yards, to receiver Jamison Crowder. Cousins did not have a scoring toss of more than 7 yards this season.

title: Marchers Warn of Safety Crisis Amid Spate of Pedestrian Deaths in New York
description: Ronica Kelly saw that she had the light, and began crossing at 87th Street and Third Avenue on June 10, 2013.

title: The Affair Season 2, Episode 7: The Prize Turkey
description: Noah Solloway forgot to pick up the Thanksgiving turkey in Sunday nights episode of The Affair  distracted by a play date with Jonathan Franzen and possibly by the charms of his abrasive but sexy book publicist, Eden.

title: Patriots Plan to Play Hard for 60 Minutes Pays Off in Final Ones
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  As Stephen Gostkowskis kick sailed through the uprights, New England Patriots players, including Patrick Chung, LeGarrette Blount and Rob Gronkowski, poured onto the field, helmets held aloft. Jonathan Freeny danced.

title: Key Figures in the Trial of Dean Skelos
description: A list of central players in the corruption trial of State Senator Dean G. Skelos, who was one of the states three most powerful politicians until his arrest.

title: Q. and A.: The Trial of Dean and Adam Skelos
description: Who are Dean and Adam Skelos?

title: Moment of Shooting at Bataclan
description: A member of the audience captured the moment that terror suspects opened fire during an Eagles of Death Metal concert at the Bataclan music hall in Paris.

description: onomatopoeia  \-n-m-t-pe-, -ma-\ noun

title: Perfect Ending for Patriots
description: New England improved to 9-0 with a 27-26 victory over the Giants at MetLife Stadium on a 54-yard field goal with one second left.
Melissa Clark

title: What to Watch Monday
description: For those curious about Raf Simonss departure from Dior, Netflix has added a documentary about his time there. And that rare thing  a Thanksgiving movie  should ease you into the week ahead of the holiday.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: We decided to come here on purpose to show that we are not afraid, that we will not be cowed by terrorists.

title: Corrections: November 16, 2015
description: NATIONAL

title: After Paris Attacks, Waiting for Shopping and Culture to Come Back to Life
description: PARIS  The Christmas market and festive lights had just gone up on the Avenue des Champs-lyses, and merchants were hoping for a strong retail season, when the weekends brutal terrorist attacks cast a pall on Paris.

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: Ted Cruz and the Anti-Gay Pastor
description: EARLIER this month, in Des Moines, the prominent home-schooling advocate and pastor Kevin Swanson again called for the punishment of homosexuality by death. To be clear, he added that the time for eliminating Americas gay population was not yet at hand. We must wait for the nation to embrace the one true religion, he suggested, and gay people must be allowed to repent and convert.

title: Race, College and Safe Space
description: Before there were the Paris terror attacks that changed everything and the second Democratic presidential debate that changed nothing, much of America had been transfixed by the scene playing out on college campuses across the country: black students and their allies demanding an insulation from racial hostility, full inclusion and administrative responsiveness.

title: Fearing Fear Itself
description: Like millions of people, Ive been obsessively following the news from Paris, putting aside other things to focus on the horror. Its the natural human reaction. But lets be clear: its also the reaction the terrorists want. And thats something not everyone seems to understand.

title: Questions for President Obamas Nominee to lead the F.D.A.
description: President Obamas nominee to lead the Food and Drug Administration has a long history of close ties to industries the agency regulates. At Dr. Robert Califfs confirmation hearing on Tuesday, senators will need to ask whether those connections will influence his judgment about the safety or effectiveness of prescription drugs.

title: U.S. Warplanes Strike ISIS Oil Trucks in Syria
description: ISTANBUL  Intensifying pressure on the Islamic State, United States warplanes for the first time attacked hundreds of trucks on Monday that the extremist group has been using to smuggle the crude oil it has been producing in Syria, American officials said.

title: E.L.L. Practice | The Global Refugee Crisis
description: Note: Every Monday during the 2015-16 school year, we present a special post for English Language Learners. Each focuses on one topic and offers an interactive quiz and a writing prompt.

title: Should Europe Shun Refugees After the Paris Attacks?
Grief Interrupted in Paris
description: A vigil at Place de Rpublique in Paris on Sunday was disrupted by reported gunfire, which was later determined to be a false alarm, highlighting the capitals blend of grief and anxiety.

title: What Would You Like to Say to the People of Paris?
description: What is your reaction to Friday evenings terror attacks in Paris? What have you heard, read and seen about them? To what extent have you followed the news about them, and the retaliatory airstrikes in Syria that followed on Sunday? What aspects of this news story have you thought about the most?

title: Resources | The Attacks in Paris
description: Note: This piece began as an extended edition of our daily News Qs feature, but now includes a much great range of Times reporting on the Paris attacks, along with suggested questions and activities. We will continue to update the post.

title: Two Finals Entail Two Surfaces for Andy Murray
description: One year ago, eager to return to the ATP World Tour Finals after a hiatus brought on by back surgery, Andy Murray played in six tournaments in six weeks in September and October. This year, with Murray set to lead his country in the Davis Cup finals just days later, he might be forgiven for wanting to sit out the World Tour Finals.

title: JetBlues Airport Farm Adds a Touch of Green to J.F.K.
description: As the temperature on an October afternoon began to dip, Sophia Leonora-Mendelsohn walked briskly outside JetBlues departures lobby at Kennedy International Airport and ran her hand across the top of a crate of kale seedlings just beginning to sprout.

title: Whos Who? The Changing Nature and Uses of Portraits
description: If having ones portrait taken in the mid-19th century was a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity, today we picture ourselves easily and often.

title: Call to Arms in France Amid Hunt for Belgian Suspect in Paris Attacks
description: PARIS  President Franois Hollande of France called on Monday for constitutional amendments to fight potential terrorists at home and for an aggressive effort to eradicate the Islamic State abroad.

title: Philippines Detaining Homeless Before APEC Summit, Rights Group Says
description: MANILA  The Philippine government is conducting clearing operations to round up and detain hundreds of homeless people, including children, so that they will not be visible during this weeks Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation meeting, the group Human Rights Watch said on Monday.

title: The Blue Touch Paper: A Memoir, by David Hare
description: When David Hare was a child, nothing excited him more than getting lost. From the outset of his adult professional life, however, he knew very well where he was  and how to get from there to where he wanted to be. With his singular combination of talent and tenacity, he always found himself at the center of wherever theatrical daring and excellence were recruited. In 1974, with Knuckle, Hare broke through to the West End, among the first of his generation of Oxbridge Young Turks to do so. As a resident dramatist, he ascended the food chain of British theater: from disputatious bouts at the Royal Court to the Nottingham Playhouse during Richard Eyres brilliant regime and all the way up to the National Theater, where by 1984 he was an associate director, co-creating the influential Joint Stock Company along the way.

title: Mindy Kalings Why Not Me?
description: Why Not Me? is the title of Mindy Kalings breezy new book, arriving on the heels of similar volumes by Tina Fey, Lena Dunham, Sarah Silverman, Amy Poehler and, notably, Kaling herself. Soon, Amy Schumer will tender her offering (which recently sold for a reported $8 million to $10 million, and will doubtless sell like hot cakes, if indeed hot cakes sell in the zillions) to the growing canon of memoir-slash-essay collections by women comedians and comedy writers. Clearly, there is something about the combination thats working.

description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: Morning Agenda: Stocks Fall After Paris Attacks
description: STOCKS FALL AFTER PARIS ATTACKS | Stocks fell as investors trimmed positions in riskier assets after the terror attacks in Paris, Bloomberg News reports.

description: As the fast-moving corruption trial of Sheldon Silver, the former speaker of the New York State Assembly, moves into its third week on Monday in Federal District Court in Manhattan, here are some of the issues that may arise:

title: Paris Attacks Could Bolster Congressional Efforts to Block U.S. Refugee Plan
description: Repercussions from the Paris attacks will ripple through Congress as lawmakers return on Monday and begin to weigh in from the floors of the Senate and the House.

title: Youth Coding Event Gets a Hand From Minecraft
description: SEATTLE  For the past two years, schools around the world have participated in an event called the Hour of Code in early December, using a variety of gimmicks to make computer programming interesting and accessible to students.
