description: LYFT IS SAID TO SEEK $500 MILLION | Questions are swirling over the fund-raising environment, but that hasnt put the brakes on the ride-hailing sector,Leslie Picker and Mike Isaac report in DealBook.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Jeb Bush Brings a Crab to a Frog Metaphor
description: CONWAY, S.C.  Youve heard the one about the frog in boiling water, right?

title: New York Today: Nature, Preserved
description: Updated 8:38 a.m.

title: Congressional Democrats Cautiously Defend Refugee Program
description: Well aware of the potential political dangers of getting crossways with public opinion on the Syrian refugee question, top Democrats responded cautiously on Tuesday but generally defended the program and highlighted its existing protections to keep terrorists from infiltrating the ranks of refugees.

title: Britain Calls for Closing of Coal-Fired Power Plants by 2025
description: LONDON  The British government on Wednesday called for the closing of all coal-fired power plants in the country by 2025, and proposed that use of the plants be restricted two years before that.

title: Thailand Deports 2 Dissidents to China, Rights Groups Say
description: BEIJING  Two Chinese dissidents who had sought sanctuary in Thailand have been sent back to China, despite winning official recognition as refugees, rights groups said Wednesday.

title: Republican Candidates Chase Donald Trumps 12 Minutes on S.N.L.
description: As Donald J. Trump danced to Hotline Bling, several of his Republican rivals were preparing a legal dance of their own.

title: Going Postal in Turkey
description: You have a package at the Karakoy post office. The card was in my mailbox, but there was no address for the post office. Just my name and the message in Turkish.

title: Judge John Hodgman on a Bone of Contention
description: Dan writes: When I finish a steak at a restaurant, I like to chew on the bone. My fiance, Liz, thinks it is rude to others and humiliating to her. But steakhouses are expensive. I want to make the most of it. If Liz would like to excuse herself to the restroom while I gnaw, Id be O.K. with that.

title: Small Country, Many Tastes
description: Everyone just wanted to talk about the guinea pigs: Yes, they were cute. Yes, they come roasted. Yes, they were delicious, and if you couldnt get into them, were you sure youd come to the right message board? My first brush with Ecuadorean food on the Internet made it sound fairly single-minded. This was circa 2000, and I confess that I never learned much more after that, as a cuisine seemingly built on guinea pig seemed a little too bony for me.

title: Letter of Recommendation: Christopher Logue, War Music
description: As an illiterate  which is how Thoreau, one of our supposed avatars of democratic life, saw those of us who have neither Greek nor Latin  I realize that its an act of public self-shaming to vouch for a favorite translation of Homer. But its even worse than that for me, given I know very little about English translations of the Iliad. There are at least 100 of them, and to boast, as I will now, that Ive read seven, maybe eight, is  at least to the literate set  a little like bragging that Im the shortest guy on the Brooklyn Nets, and, hey, did I mention I cant dunk?

title: Can My Workplace Ask Me for a Donation?
description: Every year, members of the faculty and staff at my university are asked to make a donation to support the university. Letters and brochures are sent by mail and email and posted on the website.

title: Coney Island: The Cyclone! The Hot Dogs! The Art!
description: In the days when Coney Island was in ruins, there was a carny at the broken-down game arcade who would, to draw a crowd, sometimes have his schnauzer smoke a cigarette. This was in the 1980s, when a pet dog with a Pall Mall was probably not the strangest thing you could find at the park. Coney back then was a derelict dystopia of burned-out lights and empty rides and sea gulls lying dead beneath the boardwalk  a place of which the smoking dogs owner once explained, Its an interesting kind of crazy.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: In Some Birds, Love Trumps Hunger Pains
description: Attachment trumps hunger in some wild birds, a new study reports. Researchers at Oxford University devised a clever way to prevent mated pairs of great tits from dining simultaneously: birds were fitted with radio tags linked to feeding stations and were not allowed to access a station if their mates were eating at it. Instead of foraging elsewhere, the researchers found, the excluded birds stuck close to their feeding partners. The study was published in the journal Current Biology.

title: Coffee Tied to Lower Risk of Dying Prematurely
description: More good news on coffee: A large study has found that drinking coffee is associated with a reduced risk of dying from heart disease and certain other causes.

title: Fact Checks of the 2016 Election
description: The New York Times will be checking assertions made throughout the 2016 presidential campaign.

title: Sepp Blatter and Michel Platini Lose FIFA Appeals and Remain Suspended
description: Sepp Blatters latest effort to keep hold of power at FIFA, the governing body of world soccer, has failed.

title: Classical Music This Week: Stops in Detroit, New Jersey and Berlin
description: Good morning, music lovers! If youve attended performances over the past few days, you may well have heard La Marseillaise played as a show of solidarity with France after Fridays terrorist attacks; The New York Timess Michael Cooper wrote about the history of the stirring anthem.

title: Silver Lake Is Said to Invest $100 Million in SolarCity
description: At a time when investors have darkened on the solar power industry, a big investment firm has moved in to buy a stake in SolarCity, the biggest company in the sector.

title: To Save on New York Hotels, Look Outside Manhattan
description: Over 56 million people visited New York City in 2014. How many more stayed away because hotels in Manhattan are so expensive?

title: Tracing Frank Lloyd Wright in Oak Park, Illinois
description: As an architecture buff, I had been drawn to the work of Frank Lloyd Wright for years before finally seeing his innovative Frederick C. Robie House on the South Side of Chicago last year.

title: Ghostwriting in the Family
description: Dear Diary:

title: What You Get for  $1,200,000
description: An old brick house in Kentucky, a contemporary in Connecticut and a new farmhouse in Maryland

title: $1.2 Million Homes in Kentucky, Maryland and Connecticut
description: LOUISVILLE, KY.

title: What Middle Class Means in Malaysia
description: One of my earliest memories of the place where my father grew up, Kelantan  a predominantly rural state on Malaysias far northeastern coast  is of its famous flood-measuring point. Built around 1929 and known as Tangga Krai, it consists of a series of flood markers beside a set of steps that rise steeply from the banks of the Kelantan River to a height of about 100 feet  a simple but effective warning in the countrys most flood-prone region.

title: 1940: U.S. to Lease 7 British Bases
description: WASHINGTON  Anglo-American co-operation advanced another step tonight when the Navy Department announced that the British authorities had reached an agreement with Washington on the location of the sites to be leased to the United States government for naval and air bases in the Bahamas, Jamaica, Antigua, St. Lucia, British Guiana, Bermuda and Newfoundland. No agreement has yet been reached regarding Trinidad, the last of the bases involved in President Roosevelts trade of fifty American destroyers for the base sites on eight British possessions in the Western Hemisphere. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, November 19, 1940

title: In Guyana, a Land Dispute With Venezuela Escalates Over Oil
description: BARTICA, Guyana  At a little tin-roofed beer joint on the west bank of the Essequibo River, Rawle Huggins relaxed on a wooden bench and considered his tiny countrys escalating border spat with its much bigger neighbor, Venezuela.

title: A Five-Bedroom House With a Pool in Rio de Janeiro
description: The house, terraced into a hillside near the citys botanical garden, is on the market for $3.9 million.

title: House Hunting in ... Brazil
description: A FIVE-BEDROOM HOUSE IN RIO DE JANEIRO

title: Daily Report: Lyft Looks to Raise More Money
description: Dont tell the money-raising folks at Lyft that the days of so-called tech unicorns are numbered.

title: Refugees Across Europe Fear Repercussions From Paris Attacks
description: BERLIN  Asylum papers in hand, Raz Mohammad Aryubi recalled his arrival in Austria from his native Afghanistan in spring 2014, and how, at 21, he is now studying for an M.B.A. at the University of Vienna. But his feeling of security in the country he wishes to make his home evaporated, he said, when he saw what happened in Paris.

title: Democratic Socialism Will Be Topic of Bernie Sanders Speech at Georgetown
description: Dogged for months by questions about being a self-proclaimed Democratic Socialist, Senator Bernie Sanders will address the subject of his political philosophy head on in a long-awaited speech on Thursday.

title: Revisiting the Mayflower Story
description: The story behind the first Thanksgiving  the full story, which starts with a band of harassed outsiders living in exile, then cramming aboard an iffy ship and arriving bedraggled and sick on a different continent, where half of them promptly died and the other half had little idea how to stay alive in the frigid wilderness  has the makings of a great adventure tale. Yet its rarely treated that way, perhaps because its so bound up in our national mythology. It tends to sag under the weight of its own symbolism, whether the narrative its used to uphold emphasizes the upbeat-spiritual or the oppressive-genocidal strain of United States history.

title: Sarah Treem on The Affair and Why She Loves the Character You Hate
description: Once mostly anonymous, the producers who oversee top television series have sometimes become as well known as the actors who star in them. On occasion, The Times will pose questions from readers (and pose some of our own) to notable show runners, and post their responses.

title: Shopping for Health Insurance Is New Seasonal Stress for Many
description: WASHINGTON  For 2014, the first year she got health coverage through the Affordable Care Act, Gail Galen chose a plan from a new nonprofit insurer, Oregons Health CO-OP. But the price jumped for 2015, so Ms. Galen switched to a policy from a different company, LifeWise Health Plan.

title: Andreessen Horowitz Starts Health Care Fund
description: When the venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz opened its doors in 2009, its founders consciously sought to focus on their core expertise of software and stay away from specialties like biotechnology.

title: Kristaps Porzingis Looks Good, Despite Problems With Fouls
description: After suffering through a miserable 17-win season by the Knicks last season, Madison Square Garden fans are getting excited again, thanks in large part to the play of Kristaps Porzingis. When a 7-foot-3 Latvian rookie comes to town, you might expect him to be a novelty act, beloved by fans but unproductive. But it is starting to look as if Porzingis is actually going to be good.

title: Jeb Bush Cites Paris Attacks in Calling for Stronger Military
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  Jeb Bush plans to use a long-scheduled speech at the Citadel on Wednesday to outline his vision for overhauling the nations military and responding to the growing threat of the Islamic State.

title: Inside the Hillary Clinton Campaign
description: Carolyn Ryan, the Times political editor, chats with national political reporters about life inside Hillary Rodham Clintons presidential campaign.

title: 7 Bryant Park Embraces Its Place in the City
description: With little fanfare, an eye-catching work of corporate architecture has landed in Midtown: a 30-story, glass-and-stainless-steel building called 7 Bryant Park, between 39th and 40th Streets, along Sixth Avenue.

title: The Nutcracker and Its Many Mysteries
description: The Nutcracker, though such a familiar fixture in the calendar, is among the most layered of all works of art. Yes, it contains kitsch and cuteness and adorability. Yes, its surrounded by merchandising. Even so, this ballet is larger, stranger, more moving than all of that  and more unknowable. There are mysteries at its heart that dont vanish and wonders that dont diminish.

title: Miley Cyrus and the Flaming Lips Hit the Clubs
description: It was improbable enough that Miley Cyrus would collaborate with the Flaming Lips, the long-running Oklahoma band steeped in psychedelia, despite a shared interest in altered mental states. In August, they suddenly released a free online stream of the album Miley Cyrus & Her Dead Petz, which also had some contributions from the producer Mike WiLL Made-It. The album was an outlet for jokey thoughts on drugs and sex, for studio high jinks and for lyrics flaunting cuss words, but it also had a handful of full-fledged songs and glimmers of thoughtfulness. Now, even more improbably, Ms. Cyrus and the Flaming Lips are briefly touring clubs together. Dan Deacon, opening the show, is a synthesizer-wielding composer who stokes enthusiastic audience participation. (8 p.m. on Saturday at Terminal 5; 610 West 56th Street, 212-260-4700, $69.69.)

title: 1965: Hijacker Shoots Up Plane
description: NEW ORLEANS  A frail teen-ager pulled out two pistols aboard a jetliner last night [Nov. 17] and nearly shot Christopher Kraft, Gemini space mission flight director, in the face. The youth was Thomas Robinson, 16, of Brownsville, Texas. He fired six shots aboard a National Airlines DC-8 jetliner before a passenger subdued him. No one was injured. Mr. Kraft, with a score of other top U.S. space officials traveling to Cape Kennedy for a flight readiness review for the next Gemini mission, was threatened by the frail-looking pistol-waving youth who said he was trying to hijack the plane and take it to Cuba. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, November 19, 1965

title: Foiling Electronic Snoops in Email
description: IT didnt take much for Florian Seroussi, a technology investor in Manhattan, to become suspicious of his email.

title: Podcast: Inside the Hillary Clinton Campaign
description: Carolyn Ryan, the Times political editor, says that one of the thrills and pleasures of her job is hearing from reporters about what they see on the campaign trail.

title: Combining Food Preparation and Athletic Participation
description: The Culinary Institute of America in Hyde Park, N.Y., is not known for sports, but it fields intercollegiate athletic teams whose stars are future chefs.

title: Topping Studies With a Dollop of Athletics at the Culinary Institute of America
description: HYDE PARK, N.Y.  The basketball teams starting center missed the home opener because he had to work at Bocuse, the on-campus French restaurant. A 19-year-old woman was a frequent starter at striker for the mens soccer team. And two years ago, the star of the womens cross-country team missed out on a fourth straight conference championship because the schools rolling enrollment schedule meant she graduated two weeks before her final meet.

title: New Recipes for Thanksgiving
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears on nytimes.com. To receive the email, register here.

title: Video Review: New Kia Optima Arrives, Sleek and Stylish
description: BEFORE the Nike Air Jordan, there was the Converse Chuck Taylor  a classic design that stood the test of time. But even the classics evolve. Chucks were recently tweaked to be more cushioned and comfortable.

title: The Zoolander 2 Trailer and All Its Looks
description: Its the season of prestige pictures, with many films competing for the attention of Oscar voters. But lets forget about all that for a moment. The Zoolander 2 trailer is here.

title: Covering Your Browser Tracks
description: Q. Do all web browsers have the anti-tracking feature? How do I turn it on in Firefox and does it actually work?

title: Barclays to Pay $150 Million More in Currency Inquiry
description: From 2009 to 2014, employees of Barclays automated foreign exchange trading system were directed to obfuscate and stonewall if anyone asked why client trade orders were being rejected by the system.

title: Eagles of Death Metal Make First Statement on Paris Attacks
description: Love overshadows evil.

title: Kurt Sutter Ends The Bastard Executioner
description: Kurt Sutter swung the ax on his own series, opting to end The Bastard Executioner after its debut season, which concluded on Tuesday.

title: Police in China Kill 17 Linked to Mine Attack, Report Says
description: BEIJING  The authorities killed 17 people, including several women and children, in a raid last week in the volatile Chinese region of Xinjiang, a news report said Wednesday.

title: Scream Queens Season 1, Episode 9: Ghost Stories
description: Sorry this recap is late. For the past 12 hours Ive been frantically trying to lock down the marketing rights for red and blue toilet paper.

title: Old-School Flavor at Brancaccios Food Shop
description: Brancaccios Food Shop, in the Windsor Terrace section of Brooklyn, combines home-style Italian cooking with a 1990s hip-hop soundtrack.

title: At Brancaccios Food Shop in Brooklyn, Love of Food and Hip-Hop
description: On a recent weekday afternoon, Joe Brancaccio stood behind the counter of Brancaccios Food Shop in Windsor Terrace, Brooklyn. He wore a black T-shirt with Raphaels angels looking skyward, baggy pants and sneakers. And in black-rimmed glasses and a baseball cap, he looked like a cross between Ira Glass of public radio and one of the Beastie Boys.

title: BlackRock to Wind Down Macro Hedge Fund
description: BlackRock, the worlds biggest asset manager, is closing a billion-dollar hedge fund that made money for investors with bets on macroeconomic trends around the world.

title: Verbatim: Chris Christie Gives John Kerry the Goodnight
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, a Republican running for president, in an interview with Fox News, referring to Secretary of State John Kerry and his claim that there was a rationale to the Charlie Hebdo terrorist attacks in Paris in January.

title: Europes Refugee Problem, and Ours
description: There are two ways to think about the potential dangers involved inadmitting large numbers of refugees from the Middle Easts present chaos into Western countries, and both of them have ratherdifferent implicationsfor Europe than for the United States.

title: Obama Criticizes Rhetoric on Refugees
description: President Obama addressed the debate over whether to block the entry of Syrian refugees to the United States, saying some of it was "political posturing."

title: In Many Obamacare Markets, Renewal Is Not an Option
description: Last year, we encouraged returning Obamacare customers to shop around for a better deal. This year, a lot of people will have no choice.

title: Roundabout Adds Chekhov (by Way of Karam) and Bartlett to Next Season
description: The Roundabout Theater Company will bring two playwrights with current New York hits on board for its 2016-17 season.

title: Merce Cunningham Exhibitions in Minneapolis and Chicago
description: The Walker Art Center in Minneapolis and the Museum of Contemporary Art in Chicago are to hold an extensive two-city exhibition, Merce Cunningham: Common Time, opening in February 2017, the museums announced on Tuesday. The Walker  which has all the sets and costumes that once belonged to the Merce Cunningham Dance Company, including items designed by Jasper Johns, Robert Rauschenberg, Frank Stella and Andy Warhol  is organizing both shows. It investigates Cunninghams groundbreaking practice and multidisciplinary collaborations.

title: No Comment Necessary: Ben Carsons Campaign Has a Geography Problem
description: Ben Carsons campaign shared the map below on Facebook on Tuesday, according to Talking Points Memo, as part of a post opposing the admission of Syrian refugees to the United States. Pay particular attention to the upper right.

title: Rugs With Personality
description: From the very beginning, its been an open conversation between me and the Rug Company team, says the designer Sir Paul Smith, on the 15th anniversary of his partnership with the British home-textile brand. As time has passed, Ive certainly come to understand the process better.

title: Todd Hayness Flash and Finesse at the Film Society of Lincoln Center
description: In The Other Side of Dreams, the Film Society of Lincoln Centers lovingly curated retrospective of the films of Todd Haynes, selections are paired with films chosen by Mr. Haynes that influenced them. His suburban melodrama, Far From Heaven, is coupled with Max Ophulss The Reckless Moment, which also deals with a scandalous family secret. His HBO mini-series, Mildred Pierce, is connected to Klute, in which Jane Fondas Oscar-winning role as a hardened prostitute is markedly similar to Kate Winslets devoted, hard-driving mother in Pierce. The flamboyant David Bowie-like rocker (Jonathan Rhys Meyers) in Velvet Goldmine, set in London at the height of the glam-rock era, is not unlike the androgynous rock star played by Mick Jagger in Nicolas Roeg and Donald Cammells cult classic Performance. Mr. Hayness AIDS-era parable, Safe, is paired with Douglas Sirks final Hollywood film, Imitation of Life, a critique of racial and class divisions in America disguised as a sudsy weeper. (Through Nov. 29; filmlinc.org.)

title: Carson Elrod Wears a New Comic Hat While Facing Fashions of the Future
description: Some performers you simply want to watch in anything, and the quirky, dexterous actor Carson Elrod is on my shortlist. Fortunately, he hasnt been hard to find of late. In the 20th anniversary revival of David Ivess All in the Timing and Mr. Ivess more recent Lives of the Saints, Mr. Elrods puckish humor has been a welcome presence. (That was also him, in blue body paint, spouting gibberish in The Explorers Club.)

title: Soul and Gospel Grit, Caribbean Strains and Denver Roots Rock
description: BACK IN TIME

title: A Former Brewery, Now Hotel
description: Robin Standefer and Stephen Alesch, the husband and wife behind the celebrated design firm Roman and Williams, make their Texas debut with the 146-room Hotel Emma, housed in a massive former brewery built on San Antonios eponymous river in 1894. There is something extraordinary about these old, vast abandoned buildings and this one was so embedded in the fabric of the region, says Standefer.

title: Ted Cruz Challenges President Obama to Debate on Syrian Refugees
description: One day after President Obama assailed the political posturing of Republicans who have called for barring the Syrian refugees from entering the United States, Senator Ted Cruz delivered this retort: Come back and insult me to my face.

title: Visualize This: Mapping Regions Polluted by Rigged VW Diesels
description: Ive written about the challenges and opportunities in visualizing diffusepublic health threats in new ways. Heres a new effort, created by Kevala Analytics fortheCalifornia Clean Energy Fund. Kevalas blog post is invaluable.*

title: La tierra de Stonehenge
description: Para muchos visitantes, Stonehenge no es mucho ms que una serie de piedras enormes. Pero la historia no est slo en Stonehenge.

title: Education Dept. Drops Proposal to Rezone Upper West Side Schools
description: The New York City Education Department is dropping a controversial proposal to rezone several elementary schools on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, a move that would have shifted many families from the zone of a highly sought-after school where students are mostly white to that of a school with a mostly black and Hispanic population that this year was labeled persistently dangerous.

title: Misty Copeland to Write Book on Health and Fitness
description: Misty Copelands big year isnt over yet. After making history by becoming American Ballet Theaters first black female principal dancer, performing on Broadway to favorable reviews and starring in a documentary about her life, she will now write her third book.

title: Girls Arent Meaner Than Boys. It Only Looks That Way.
description: Girls can be mean. Really mean. Yet despite their widespread reputation for cruelty, we have little evidence that girls are meaner than boys. Its no surprise to learn that boys are more likely than girls to use physical aggression, but we also know that boys surpass girls when it comes to attacking peers verbally and engaging in cyberbullying. Some research suggests that girls pick up the slack by engaging in more relational aggression: being emotionally manipulative, spreading rumors, excluding peers. But other studies find that boys can outpace, or at least match, girls in the use of indirect forms of interpersonal treachery.

title: With Mustang, a Director Breaks Free of Cultural Confines
description: PARIS  For a film about death, Mustang is incredibly alive. It tells the story of five orphaned sisters in rural Turkey whose boundless lust for life runs up against the confines of a conservative Muslim society, leading some to suicide. A first feature by Deniz Gamze Ergven  directed, written by and starring young women  it was a hit when it played the Directors Fortnight for independent films at Cannes and is Frances foreign-language Oscar submission.

title: The Cult of the Toto Toilet
description: Last year, Bennett Friedman, who owns a plumbing showroom in Manhattan called AF New York, took a business trip to Milan. On the morning of his return he faced a choice: stop in the bathroom there or wait until he got home. The flight was nine hours. He waited.

title: Share Your Thoughts: How Should We Balance Civil Liberties and National Security?
description: The deadly terrorist attacks in Paris last week have reignited a debate in much of the world on the balance between civil liberties and national security.

title: Time for a New Bobby Jindal Video
description: You could easily be forgiven for not noticing that Gov. Bobby Jindal of Louisiana dropped out of the Republican nominating contest on Tuesday. In fact, you could be forgiven for not knowing he was running in the first place.

title: Italian Missionary Wounded in Bangladesh
description: An Italian doctor working as a Roman Catholic missionary in northern Bangladesh was shot by unidentified assailants early on Wednesday.

title: How Do We Get Young People to Stop Sexting?
description: To the Editor:

title: Overrating Outrage in Obamas Response to Paris Attacks
description: With all the reporting and commentary that faulted President Obama for not displaying more anger at his news conference Monday on the Paris attacks, it almost seemed as if people hoped he would bring back Luther, the satirical anger translator played by Keegan-Michael Key who appeared alongside him at the White House Correspondents Dinner in April.

title: Fed Minutes Signal Readiness for December Rate Increase
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve, setting aside its habitual reticence, is issuing increasingly explicit warnings that it is likely to start raising its benchmark interest rate in December.

title: Scene City: Cate Blanchett Honored at MoMA Film Benefit
description: Graydon Carter, Martin Scorsese, Cindy Sherman and others toast Ms. Blanchett.

title: App Smart | Thanksgiving Prep
description: Let new technologies do some of the heavy lifting for Thanksgiving dinner. Apps from AnyList and Butterball help coordinate the shopping list and teach the cooking skills needed for the big meal.

title: Europe, Shaken by Paris Attacks, Weighs Security With Privacy Rights
description: As France comes to terms with its deadliest domestic attack since World War II, attention has quickly turned to whether European governments need to reassess how they collect, manage and use peoples digital footprint.

title: With TV Viewing Changing, Networks Take Longer to Drop Shows
description: Last Friday, something happened in network television thats almost unheard-of these days: A show got canceled.

title: Video Feature: Apps to Streamline Thanksgiving at Every Step of the Process
description: Thanksgiving is one of those times when you find yourself frantically juggling dozens of tricky tasks. But nowadays you dont need to panic about task planning, recipe ideas or even cooking because your smartphone is the perfect tool for easing your holiday stress.

title: Exploring Alices Wonderland
description: Through photos, exploring the setting for the tale of a little girl who fell down a rabbit hole and had a wonderful adventure 150 years ago.

title: Cond Nast Closing Details Magazine
description: Cond Nast will stop publishing Details magazine at the end of the year, the companys president, Robert A. Sauerberg Jr., said in a memo to employees on Wednesday.

title: Electric Daisy Carnival to Return to Citi Field in 2016
description: Electric Daisy Carnival, a multicity electronic dance music festival, will return to Citi Field on May 14-15 after spending two years at Metlife Stadium in New Jersey. This is the fifth iteration of the New York branch of the festival, and will include four stages, carnival rides and art installations.

title: Jeb Bush Calls for Global Coalition and U.S. Ground Troops to Fight ISIS
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  Seizing on the Paris terrorist attacks, Jeb Bush called Wednesday for a United States-led global coalition, including troops on the ground, to take out the Islamic State with overwhelming force.

title: Using Go and Python NLTK for News Analysis
description: I had the opportunity to speak at this years GothamGo conference in New York City about a side project Ive been working on at The New York Times for several years now: Newshound.

title: Op-Art: What We Saw in Paris
description: Here are some moments from around the city that have moved us in recent days.

title: The Latest on Marriott and Starwood Rewards Programs
description: Marriott International announced Monday that it plans to acquire Starwood Hotels and Resorts Worldwide, creating the worlds largest hotel company with over 5,500 hotels. But the loyalty programs operated by the two companies, Marriott Rewards and Starwood Preferred Guest (SPG), will remain separate entities for now.

title: For France, an Alliance Against ISIS May Be Easier Said Than Done
description: PARIS  By attacking civilian targets well beyond its territory, the Islamic State has seemingly accomplished what diplomats had failed to do. Suddenly, the international order has been scrambled, drawing the United States, Russia and France together in a possible alliance against the terrorist group.

title: Sequin Tops Can Be Great Holiday Party Looks
description: Plus: What the latest Bond girl carries in the desert in Spectre"; Sleepy Jones loungewear gets inspiration from John Derian; and Emily Satloff uses foiled gemstones, an 18th-century technique, for vibrant stones.

title: A Travel Service for the 1 Percent
description: Name Karl Backlund

title: Fall Fashion: Too Warm to Be Cool
description: Bridget Capobianco, a Brooklyn mother and former boutique owner, was sitting on a playground bench on a Wednesday in early November, wearing shearling-lined clog boots under the gentle patter of a 60-degree rain. I was impatient to wear these boots, because I love them, but my feet are sweating like crazy, Ms. Capobianco said.

title: Donald Trump Runs Radio Ads Criticizing Obama on Paris Attacks
description: Donald J. Trump released a set of radio ads in Iowa, New Hampshire and South Carolina on Wednesday, seizing on the attacks in Paris as evidence that his brand of leadership is needed to keep America safe.

title: Thursdays N.F.L. Matchup: Titans at Jaguars
description: 8:25 p.m., NFL Network

title: A Flurry of Growth in the Online Financial Advice Field
description: As the competition among so-called online robo advisers intensifies and more entrants crowd the field, some of the oldest firms in the niche are increasing their efforts to recruit investors.

title: The Soup Will End in December
description: Viewers will soon have to turn elsewhere for snarky snippets from Party Down South and Bad Girls Club.

title: Examination Reveals a Mysterious Message on Malevichs Black Square Painting
description: MOSCOW  Sophisticated X-ray technology revealed a mysterious inscription on Kazimir Malevichs renowned 1915 Black Square painting, offering insights into the works cultural origins and meaning, experts at the Tretyakov Gallery said at a news conference here on Wednesday.

title: The Best-Selling Sports Books
description: Here are the best-selling sports books in October 2015, according to the New York Times best-seller list:

title: Review: Kurt Cobains Montage of Heck: The Home Recordings
description: Montage of Heck: The Home Recordings

title: Review: Jean Butler, With Neil Martin, Taps Her Roots
What Is Good Czech Design?
description: In Prague, what was once a brick factory is now home to some of the best modern Czech glass, porcelain, jewelry and furniture. The Cihelna Concept Store, which opened quietly over the summer in the old 18th-century building, is just off the Vltava River in the historical Lesser Town district. Its curator, the designer Silvie Lubenova, explains that she deals exclusively in Czech designers and companies, and will rotate solo exhibitions to celebrate the countrys design past and present.

title: Health Care Law Forces Businesses to Consider Growths Costs
description: When LaRonda Hunter opened a Fantastic Sams hair salon 10 years ago in Saginaw, Tex., a suburb of Fort Worth, she envisioned it as the first of what would eventually be a small regional collection of salons. As her sales grew, so did her business, which now encompasses four locations  but her plans for a fifth salon are frozen, perhaps permanently.

title: De Blasio Chides Christie on Immigrants
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York criticized Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey for not accepting Syrian refugees, calling the position un-American.

title: Syrians Seen Dragging Missile
description: Social media video captured in Syria shows missiles raining down and one that exploded in the air being dragged along a street.

title: The Real Terror Threat Congress Should Confront
description: As Republicans grope for rationales to block asylum for Syrian refugees, Texas State Representative Tony Dale, a gun rights stalwart with an A rating from the National Rifle Association,is arguing that they should all be blocked because its far too easy in this country for people with terrorist motives to buy guns and cause mayhem.

title: Complaints Against Police Officer Jason Van Dyke
description: Numerous civilian complaints against Mr. Van Dyke, a Chicago officer, include use of excessive force and using racial slurs. None of the complaints in these pages were sustained.

title: Review: A Rigorous Tap Dancing Lesson in What the Eye Hears
description: What the Eye Hears is the title Brian Seibert gives his big, smart, wonderfully anecdotal and definitive history of tap dance. Both eyes and ears are needed to get the full effect of tap, the only purely American dance genre weve got. Tap, writes Mr. Seibert, a dance critic for The New York Times, is dance and music, sound and movement. Here he takes us back a couple of centuries to search out the arts two-pronged beginnings, then scrolls up to a survey of its revitalized present.

title: Chicago Rarely Penalizes Officers for Complaints, Data Shows
description: In 18 years with the Chicago Police Department, the nations second-largest, Jerome Finnigan had never been disciplined  although 68 citizen complaints had been lodged against him, including accusations that he used excessive force and regularly conducted illegal searches.

title: Russia Strikes Syrian Oil Infrastructure
description: Russian airstrikes have started targeting strategic oil infrastructure in Syria controlled by the Islamic State. The Treasury Department estimates that the group earns as much as $40 million per month from oil sales.

title: Review: Twyla Tharps Choreography Celebrated to Bach and Jazz
description: If the thought processes within Twyla Tharps dances could be written down in book form, it would be the worlds most densely packed, intelligent, artful guide to high-entertainment dance-making. Already the author of a series of American dance classics, she is celebrating her 50th anniversary as a choreographer by presenting a double bill of premieres. This week, that program, after two months of touring the United States, has reached the David H. Koch Theater (though its the Joyce Theater thats presenting it). The first half is to Bach (Preludes and Fugues), the second to jazz (Yowzie).

title: De Blasios Plan for the Homeless
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio explained his plan to aid homeless people on the streets of New York City, with a path to safe, long-term shelter.

title: Fresh Doubt Over Chinas Pledge to Amend Transplant Policy
description: Read in Chinese |

title: Boko Haram Ranked Ahead of ISIS for Deadliest Terror Group
description: DAKAR, Senegal   As much of the world remains focused on the Islamic State and its horrific attacks in Paris, another radical band of extremists has, by one account, captured the infamous title of the worlds deadliest terrorist group: Boko Haram.

title: At the Whitney, Thea and Ethan Wagner Show the Fruits of Prescient Collecting
description: Thea Westreich Wagner can remember every time she has walked into a gallery with her husband, Ethan Wagner, and thought to herself, This is the last piece by this artist were going to be able to afford.

title: Home, Food, Family, Giving:  Nonboring Thanksgiving Reading Chosen by Our Student Council
description: Earlier this month, we asked the 22 members of our Student Council to hunt through The New York Times and find pieces on seasonally resonant themes like home, food, family and giving.

title: Paris Attacks Highlight Jihadists Easy Path Between Europe and ISIS Territory
description: LONDON  One of the militants in the Paris attacks traveled to Syria from his hometown in France and back, officials said, even after his passport had been confiscated and he had been placed under judicial oversight. So did another, despite having been arrested eight times in petty crimes and having been listed as a national security risk in France.

title: Morgan Stanley Names Susie Huangto Lead Mergers in the Americas
description: Morgan Stanley has named Susie Huang head of mergers and acquisitions for the Americas, two weeks after her predecessor announced his plans to leave for Comcast.

title: Volkswagen Faces Major Spending Cuts and Regulatory Deadlines
description: FRANKFURT  Volkswagen is expected to announce substantial spending cuts on Friday as the carmaker braces for the financial impact of its emissions-cheating crisis  potentially setting up a confrontation with its powerful labor representatives.

title: Review: New Juilliard Ensemble Embraces Rilke
description: Why so little Rilke-music? a critic from The New York Times asked over 20 years ago, noting how many composers have kept a respectful distance from this great poet. Among those who have heeded the challenge of setting his texts is the composer James Primosch, who has turned to Rilkes religious poetry for a number of songs that elegantly combine personal fervor and worldly sophistication.

title: Adviser Who Questioned Ben Carsons Grasp of Mideast Is Consulted for Op-Ed Piece
description: A foreign policy adviser whom Ben Carson publicly distanced himself from after the adviser criticized Mr. Carsons grasp of the Middle East provided input for an opinion column Mr. Carson published online in The Washington Post on Wednesday about defeating the Islamic State.

title: Review: A Pierre Boulez Tribute, Eight Months Late
description: This city has not done right lately by Pierre Boulez, who turned 90 in March. The New York Philharmonic  of which he was music director from 1971 to 1977, in a tenure now often criticized as recondite in its programming (untrue) and dire in its ticket sales (ditto)  did nothing to honor the birthday. Nor did our other major cultural institutions.

title: PHD Terrace Brings Downtown Cool to Midtown
description: Offices, offices, offices, said Matt Strauss, the managing partner of PHD Terrace in Midtown. Tourists, tourists, tourists. He was waving toward the kaleidoscopic lights and humanity glob of nearby Times Square, visible from the two-floor lounge that opened in early October atop the Dream Midtown hotel. But were infusing it with our brand of downtown cool, he said.

title: Super PAC Backing Jeb Bush to Air Ads in Ohio, Home of John Kasich
description: The super PAC supporting Jeb Bushs presidential campaign will start showing television ads next week in Ohio, the home state of Gov. John R. Kasich  a rival candidate who shares a similar political space with Mr. Bush in the Republican primary.

title: Treasury Plans Additional Rules to Deter Inversions
description: The Treasury Department plans to announce additional proposals this week to deter corporate inversions, a strategy some American companies have used to move their headquarters to lower-tax nations overseas by way of a corporate merger.

title: Pictures of the Day: France and Elsewhere
description: France and Elsewhere: Pictures of the Day

title: Lea Salonga To Star in Fun Home in the Philippines
description: Lea Salonga, the Tony Award-winning actress who is now starring on Broadway in Allegiance, will return to her native Philippines next year to star in the first international production of Fun Home.

title: Nov. 18, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from France, Serbia, India and Spain.

title: At Of Mercer,Making Workwear Less Work
description: Getting dressed for the office is rough. A girl could croak trying to get it right, wrote Helen Gurley Brown in her advice bible Having It All.

title: Art Bookstore Printed Matter Has New Home
description: In 2012, Printed Matter, the nonprofit art bookstore started by Sol LeWitt and the art critic Lucy R. Lippard, lost more than 9,000 books and sustained hundreds of thousands of dollars in damage during Hurricane Sandy.

title: Review: Krysten Ritter Is a Gumshoe With Superhero Troubles in Jessica Jones
description: Jessica Jones, the second of Netflixs original series based on Marvel comic books (after Daredevil), is reluctantly superheroic. Created by Melissa Rosenberg, the screenwriter of five Twilight movies as well as a writer on TV shows including Dexter, and starring the acerbic Krysten Ritter of Dont Trust the B____ in Apartment 23, its a clever 21st-century take on film noir, featuring a heroine who hides her superstrength because its at the root of her extreme emotional vulnerability and fear. Theres a tricky balancing act going on  crossing a moody detective show with both a comic action thriller and a woman-in-peril psychological drama  but Ms. Rosenberg proves to be mostly up to the task.

title: Settlement in New York Domestic Violence Case May Set Broader Precedent
description: The New York State attorney general has reached a potentially significant settlement with Bon-Ton Stores, which has more than 200 department stores across the northern part of the country, over a workplace discrimination complaint filed by a victim of domestic violence.

title: Review: Adele Holds Firm on 25, Even as Pop Shifts
description: Absence has a way of ossifying an idea and amplifying a legend. Those have been gifts for Adele, who has just returned after a break of almost five years with her third album, 25 (XL/Columbia).

title: Review: Contact! Presents Young Americans, a New York Philharmonic Showcase for Emerging Composers
description: Before introducing his piece Flashbacks on Monday evening at National Sawdust, the new performance space in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, Mario Davidovsky joked that he didnt know how he ended up on a lineup of such talented and handsome composers.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing: Paris, Russia, Boko Haram
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Patrick Fallon, Whose Midwest Ad Agency Had National Reach, Dies at 70
description: Patrick R. Fallon, a co-founder of the Minneapolis-based advertising agency that made its name with imaginative campaigns for media companies and luxury carmakers like BMW and Porsche, died on Friday in Robbinsdale, Minn. He was 70.

title: Maryland College to Remain Closed as Police Search for Student
description: With the police still unable to locate a student who disappeared and may have a gun, the Maryland college he attends said Wednesday that it would remain closed until after the Thanksgiving weekend  two weeks after the search for him began.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Marine Le Pens Change in Tone
description: Following the attacks in Paris, a look back at how the National Front party leader's language has evolved over the last five years on issues such as immigration and nationalism.

title: Cate Blanchett of Carol Takes a Bow
description: Cate Blanchett seemed only dimly aware of the cameras registering her arrival Tuesday night at the Museum of Modern Art: She was too deep in conversation with Martin Scorsese, whom she towered above.

title: A Feminist T-Shirt Resurfaces From the 70s
description: In October, Cara Delevingne was photographed in Paris wearing a navy sweatshirt that read The Future Is Female in clean white text. The same month, Ms. Delevingnes girlfriend, the musician Annie Clark (a.k.a. St. Vincent), wore the same shirt, paired with a white Chanel bag, to the Chateau Marmont in Hollywood.

title: Review: Celebrating Cecil Taylor, a Pianist of Endless Influence
description: Cecil Taylor: From the Five Spot to the World, a gala concert at the Harlem Stage Gatehouse on Tuesday night, opened with welcoming remarks wrapped around a disclaimer. Cecil will not be with us this evening, Pat Cruz, the executive director of Harlem Stage, announced in a soothing tone, and we will miss him.

title: Half of New Yorkers Say They Are Barely or Not Getting By, Poll Shows
description: Half of New York City residents say they are struggling economically, making ends meet just barely, if at all, and most feel sharp uncertainty about the future of the citys next generation, a new poll shows.

title: Punk Portraits of New York
description: William Coupons classic style started out in an chaotic place: the Mudd Club. He slowed things down to the pace of formal portraiture, taking the circus out of the tent.

title: Officer Shoots Man Reaching for Gun After Chase in Brooklyn, Police Say
description: For Kareem Thomas, Wednesday started with an appearance in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn, where he is fighting charges of attempted murder in connection with a shooting at a bodega in October 2011. By the evening, the authorities said, Mr. Thomas was in Kings County Hospital Center, a gunshot to his lower back from a police bullet.

title: Full Results of The New York Times/Siena College Poll
description: A survey found 51 percent of New York City residents feel they are either just getting by or finding it difficult to do so, with residents in Brooklyn and the Bronx having the most pronounced sense of economic insecurity.

title: The Right Tools for Richer Audio
description: Digitizing music has not delivered the sound of CDs and vinyl records. Now that quality can be conjured with the right products.

title: Turkeys Role as Migrant Gateway Is Source of New Urgency for E.U.
description: BERLIN  The Turkish border police detained eight Moroccans in Istanbul this week after becoming suspicious that they were Islamic radicals who planned to infiltrate Europe by joining the migrant stream.

title: Gwyneth Paltrow and Valentino Channel Wonder Woman
description: Select looks from the collaboration that will go on sale on Nov. 23.

title: Gwyneth Paltrow Talks About a Surprising Fashion Muse
description: On a recent morning, a soundstage in Long Island City, Queens, was filled with people. The photographer Terry Richardson was running about in one of his trademark flannel shirts. Organic food was being served by the truckload.

title: New York Store Openings and Other Shopping Events
description: Skip your trip to the dry cleaner this week. On Friday, the Laundress, an eco-friendly detergent line founded by Gwen Whiting and Lindsey Boyd, who met studying fiber science at Cornell and left jobs at Chanel and Ralph Lauren to educate consumers about alternative fabric care, will open a shop in SoHo. The cedar-extract, sulphite-free wool and cashmere shampoo ($19) works wonders in the washing-machine delicate cycle. At 199 Prince Street.

title: Review: Tyshawn Sorey Goes His Own Way at the Vanguard
description: Its going to be rare to see the improvising drummer Tyshawn Sorey do anything mechanically or thoughtlessly at the Village Vanguard this week. Hes got hyperprecision technique; he could keep you engaged for a long time with straight swing or regularly accented music, and hes done that in plenty of groups led by other people, jazz or otherwise.

title: Marco Rubio Returns Fire on Ted Cruz
description: Two can play at this game, Senator Cruz.

title: Hurdles for Canadian Pacific-Norfolk Southern Deal
description: Canadian Pacific Railway will probably have to come up with more than $28.4 billion to keep a Norfolk Southern deal on track. The company justifies its unsolicited bid for its American rival by promoting cost savings worth more than $12 billion. But Canadian Pacific shareholders would keep $5 billion of that amount for themselves. Given antitrust risks, the merger price could use stoking.

title: Results of U.A.W. Vote Show Ford Pact Losing
description: DEARBORN, Mich.  Leaders of the United Automobile Workers union said on Wednesday that a slight majority of workers at Ford Motor Company have so far voted against a proposed new labor agreement.

title: Attorney General of N.Y. Picks Top Deputies
description: The New York attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, has named two top lieutenants who will split oversight of criminal cases and the civil cases brought by the office.

title: U.S. to Sue Contractor It Says Bilked the Navy
description: After nearly two years of settlement talks broke down, the Justice Department announced Wednesday that it was moving forward with a civil fraud lawsuit against one of the ship-supply contractors said to have overcharged the Navy by tens of millions of dollars.

title: For Its I.P.O., Square Scales Back Valuation by $3 Billion
description: The long-running gold rush into hot technology start-ups showed signs of faltering on Wednesday, as a much-anticipated market debut had to scale back its ambitions.

title: Pleased With Progress, Jets General Manager Says There Is Still Work to Do
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  General Manager Mike Maccagnan praised his coach, extolled his starting quarterback, complimented his backup quarterback, hailed the Jets depth and lauded their progress. His responses at his midseason news conference Wednesday, in other words, were predictable for a first-year general manager presiding over a team that is  at 5-4 and on the periphery of the A.F.C. wild-card chase  an improvement by any measure over last seasons fiasco.

title: Fantasy Sports Inquiry Puts Spotlight on a Success for Yahoo
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Yahoo has long been a top online destination for sports fans, and this year, it made two big bets to expand that audience: its multimillion-dollar deal to webcast a National Football League game and its July entrance into the world of daily fantasy sports contests.

title: Jake Arrieta and Dallas Keuchel, Newly Anointed Aces, Win Cy Young Awards
description: Jake Arrieta and Dallas Keuchel reported to spring training in February with a combined career record of 55-59 and zero appearances on Cy Young Award ballots. By the end of the season they were certified aces, lifting their teams to the division series with shutout pitching in the wild-card games.

title: Robert F. Dall, Mastermind of Mortgage-Backed Bonds, Dies at 81
description: Robert F. Dall, an investment banker and a pioneer of the mortgage bond market on Wall Street, died on Sunday in Manhattan. He was 81.

title: China Insists to U.N. That Its Combating Torture
description: GENEVA  Senior Chinese officials dismissed allegations of the widespread use of torture, responding Wednesday to questions from a United Nations panel by affirming their commitment to eliminating the practice  though with a dearth of details.

title: Pfizer and Allergan Said to Be Near Merger for Up to $150 Billion
description: Pfizer is nearing a deal to buy Allergan, a rival drug maker that has its headquarters in Ireland, for as much as $150 billion, potentially helping the company move its corporate citizenship abroad and reduce its tax bill, a person briefed on the matter said on Wednesday.

title: De Blasio, Drawing New Battle Line, Takes Aim at Christie on Refugees
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio is already battling one governor. Now he is taking on another.

title: Malloy Welcomes a Syrian Family to Connecticut as Christie Shuns Refugees
description: Gov. Dannel P. Malloy of Connecticut on Wednesday personally welcomed a refugee family from Syria who had been diverted from Indianapolis to New Haven.

title: F.B.I. Director Repeats Call That Ability to Read Encrypted Messages Is Crucial
description: The F.B.I. director and the Manhattan district attorney on Wednesday sought to reopen the argument that law enforcement and intelligence officials need to have access to encrypted information on smartphones with court approval.

title: Refugees From War Arent the Enemy
description: The House is expected to vote Thursday on H.R. 4038, the American Security Against Foreign Enemies (SAFE) Act of 2015, which Republican sponsors say would put in place the most robust national-security vetting process in history for refugees, one that would do everything possible to prevent terrorists from reaching our shores.

title: Republicans Push to Halt Syrian Refugee Program
description: WASHINGTON  Congressional Republicans increased pressure on the White House on Wednesday to halt a program for Syrian refugees, setting up a confrontation with President Obama over the issue as they head into a battle over spending next month.

title: Senators Revive Financing Tactic From 70s for Carbon Emissions
description: For years, power companies, manufacturers and entrepreneurs have tried to make capturing and storing carbon emissions from industrial operations like burning coal into a business, to little avail.

title: Upset Over a Fracking Ban
description: In a phone conversation secretly recorded by the F.B.I., Senator Dean G. Skelos and his son, Adam, discuss Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos support for a fracking ban.

title: Review: Complexions Contemporary Ballet Performs to Bach and Metallica
description: Complexions Contemporary Ballet, a company formed in 1994 by Dwight Rhoden and Desmond Richardson, has done what, for many midsize companies, remains impossible: It has lasted. But for a troupe named in honor of the multicultural makeup of its dancers, it remains distressingly bland. Where diversity also matters  in its choreography  is where this company falls short. No matter the mood or music, a sequence often repeats in Mr. Rhodens pieces: After a running start, a dancer slides onto the stage, strikes an assertive pose and then  as if trapped inside a force field  shifts position by flicking a hip or tossing off a pirouette before retreating to the wings.

title: Kristaps Porzingis, Wanting More, Gives the Knicks Hope
description: Long before it took Kristaps Porzingis all of 12 regular-season games to become a sensation with the Knicks, he plied his trade for Baloncesto Sevilla of Spains ACB League. As Sevillas general manager, Jos Luis Galilea became uniquely familiar with Porzingis, and he could sense the players bright future.

title: What Presidential Candidates Have Said About the Black Lives Matter Movement
description: What some of the presidential candidates have said about the Black Lives Matter movement.

title: One Slogan, Many Methods: Black Lives Matter Enters Politics
description: When the Democratic National Committee recently rejected adding a presidential debate focusing exclusively on issues affecting black people, it got divergent responses from two groups widely associated with the Black Lives Matter movement.

title: De Blasio Unveils Plan to Create 15,000 Units of Housing
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio, seeking to bolster his administrations efforts on homelessness, unveiled a plan on Wednesday to create 15,000 units of housing aimed at veterans, victims of domestic violence, people with mental illness and others with complex needs that go beyond the economics of paying for a place to live in New York.

title: With Eviction Looming, an Injured Worker Accelerates His Job Search
description: For the 18 months he was homeless, Andre Gomes spent nights sleeping on No. 6 subway trains. He felt safer on the trains than he did in a shelter, where people had threatened his life and knocked out his bottom teeth.

title: Jury Hears Where Sheldon Silvers Money Went as U.S. Rests Case
description: With State Assemblyman Sheldon Silver accused of taking in nearly $4 million in illicit fees through various quid pro quo schemes, a question has arisen: Where did the money go?

title: Search Engine Feature
description: To sleep, perchance to Dream; aye, theres the RUB   Hamlet, Act III, Scene 1

title: Review: In Steve, Contemplating Middle Age and Monogamy
description: Hello, not-so-young lovers, wherever you are. Do you know what Rodgers and Hammerstein show Im (sort of) quoting there? Even if you dont (its The King and I), youre likely to have a swell time at Steve, a surprisingly serious comedy by Mark Gerrard in which no event is so grave or so trivial that it cannot be annotated with a musical comedy reference.

title: Ad Supporting John Kasich Derides Rivals Experience
description: An independent group backing Gov. John R. Kasich of Ohio accuses Ben Carson and Donald J. Trump of being unprepared for the presidency in a new TV ad, linking the political outsiders to President Obama in requiring on-the-job training.

title: Reviews Reveal Divisions Within the Clinton Health Initiative, Starting at the Top
description: Inside the sprawling philanthropy founded by former President Bill Clinton, its health initiative, run by a longtime friend and policy adviser to the Clintons, holds a vaunted place, with the largest budget of any program in the foundation and a distinguished record of fighting diseases like AIDS and tuberculosis in underdeveloped countries.

title: Jonah Lomu, 40, Dies; Rugby Superstar Melded Power and Speed
description: Jonah Lomu, whose size, strength and speed made him one of rugbys most fearsome wings, a record-setting, nearly unstoppable scorer for the All Blacks, New Zealands national team, died late Tuesday or early Wednesday at his home in Auckland, New Zealand. He was 40.

title: California Judge Orders Frozen Embryos Destroyed
description: In the first decision in California to address a dispute over the fate of frozen embryos after a couples divorce, a state judge in San Francisco on Wednesday ordered the destruction of five embryos after a man challenged his ex-wifes right to use them.

title: Stephen Birmingham, Chronicler of the Rich and Other Elites, Dies at 86
description: Stephen Birmingham, the prolific novelist, purveyor of popular sociology and raconteur of the rich and famous in best-selling books like  Our Crowd: The Great Jewish Families of New York and The Right People: A Portrait of the American Social Establishment, died on Sunday at his home in Manhattan. He was 86.

title: F.D.A. Approves a Nasal Spray to Combat Opioid Overdose
description: A nasal spray designed to reverse opioid overdoses won approval from the Food and Drug Administration on Wednesday, expanding the options for treating drug overdoses without medical training. Until now, all versions of the overdose reversal drug naloxone were injectable. The spray, called Narcan, will make it easier for ordinary people to treat someone who has taken too much oxycodone, morphine or heroin. Adapt Pharma Inc., the company that makes it, said it would offer the spray at a discount to emergency workers, firefighters and the police.

title: Syria: Truce Near Damascus Is Planned
description: Syrian antigovernment activists said Wednesday that government forces and insurgent factions in the Damascus suburbs planned to announce a Russian-brokered deal for a 15-day cease-fire that could begin as soon as Thursday. United Nations officials and international negotiators are trying to hammer out a countrywide cease-fire as world leaders gather in Vienna in an effort to renew peace talks, and it was unclear whether the Russian-brokered effort was separate and parallel, or a step toward reaching a more comprehensive agreement. The Russian involvement was seen as a sign that it now had the upper hand  more so than Iran, President Bashar al-Assads closest ally. The truce would cover the East Ghouta suburbs that have been cut off from Damascus by the fighting. The truce would open checkpoints into East Ghouta, allowing humanitarian aid to get in and civilians to leave, according to several antigovernment activists reached in the area.

title: Group Led by Turing Chief Acquires Majority of Biotech Firm
description: Martin Shkreli, the brash pharmaceutical executive whose abrupt fiftyfold increase in the price of an old infectious disease drug sparked an uproar, has acquired a majority of the shares of a publicly traded biotechnology company that was about to go out of business.

title: Ta-Nehisi Coates Wins National Book Award
description: Ta-Nehisi Coates won the National Book Award for nonfiction Wednesday night for Between the World and Me, a visceral, blunt exploration of his experience of being a black man in America, which was published this summer in the middle of a national dialogue about race relations and inequality.

title: Taking Power
description: Adam Skelos calls to congratulate his father for ousting Senator Jeffrey Klein from his position as co-leader of the Senate.

title: Tapes Played at Skelos Corruption Trial Portray Strategy Used Against Democrats
description: Jurors at the federal corruption trial of the former State Senate majority leader, Dean G. Skelos, and his son listened on Wednesday to a series of riveting, raw and sometimes bizarre wiretapped conversations. Prosecutors played them as part of an effort to show what was going on behind the scenes as the senator voted on legislation and took other actions that the government has said would benefit his son, a situation most of his fellow legislators were not aware of.

title: Three Conference Finalists Are Fighting to Return to Last Seasons Level
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The tone of Brian Boyles voice had the urgency that N.H.L. players usually save for spring. Emotional and physical reservoirs are only so deep, and the draining quest for a Stanley Cup can grind on for nine months.

title: Princeton Students Hold Sit-In on Racial Injustice
description: PRINCETON, N.J.  Amid racial tension on campuses across the country, Princeton University announced on Wednesday that it would change the title of those who oversee its residential colleges to head from master.

title: An Improbable Survival
description: Sbastien rescued a woman hanging from the window of the Bataclan concert hall in Paris. Then he survived a two-hour hostage standoff.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | feral
description: feral  \fir-l, fer-; fe-rl\  adjective

title: Arena Security Reviewed After Paris Terror Attacks
description: PARIS  In Trinidad, armed police officers in riot gear were called in to secure a soccer match. In Japan, officers positioned on rooftops monitored a marathon. And in Spain, a very intense security apparatus is planned for Saturdays Real Madrid-Barcelona soccer showdown, including a three-layer perimeter around the famed Santiago Bernabu Stadium and a doubling of the already increased number of security personnel who will, among other things, inspect fans sandwiches.

title: What to Watch Thursday
description: The holiday starts early, and a mite strange, with a lip sync battle and a series about art smuggling. And its the last chance in 2015 for a Shonda Rhimes night.

title: Corrections: November 19, 2015
description: NATIONAL

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I say it firmly: France will remain the country of liberty, of movements, of culture. An active, valiant, dynamic country.

title: Israeli Officer Sentenced to Community Service in Beating of Palestinian-American
description: JERUSALEM  An Israeli border police officer who was filmed beating a Palestinian-American teenager on the edges of a riot in East Jerusalem in July 2014 has been sentenced to 45 days of community service and a suspended prison term of four months, Israeli officials said.

title: Stung by Edict on Gays, Mormons Leave Church
description: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints did not seem eager to draw attention to its recently updated guidance on gay marriage. In a memo shared confidentially, the church instructed leaders that Mormons in same-sex relationships were to be treated as apostates. Children being raised by two moms or two dads, the edict held, should be banished from the church until they become adults and can renounce their parents union.

title: Chris Christies Bridge Scandal
description: To the Editor:

title: Sleazy Business as Usual in Albany
description: The separate federal trials this month of the former Assembly speaker, Sheldon Silver, and Dean Skelos, former leader of the State Senate, are about the same thing: public corruption at the highest levels of New York State government. Both men were bounced from their leadership jobs and both now confront multiple charges of kickbacks, bribery and extortion, all carefully hidden in secret documents and phone calls.

title: A Holiday Treat From Congress
description: In honor of the coming vacation travel season, the Senate is working on a bill that would loosen the requirement that pilots take medical examinations.

title: Europes Welcome Sign to Terrorists
description: EUROPES open-border arrangement, which enables travel through 26 countries without passport checks or border controls, is effectively an international passport-free zone for terrorists to execute attacks on the Continent and make their escape.

title: Homeless Schoolchildren
description: To the Editor:

title: Grappling With ISIS and the Refugees
description: To the Editor:

title: When Should Presidential Candidates Drop Out?
description: Bobby Jindal, the governor of Louisiana, decided it was time to stop his presidential run this week. Unable to find any traction in the crowded Republican field, he said Tuesday night, Ive come to the realization this is not my time.

title: They Are Us
description: Desperate refugees flee persecution and war, but American politicians  worried about security risks  refuse to accept them.

title: Protect Doctor-Patient Confidentiality
description: WHEN should a doctor betray a patients confidence? This week the Supreme Court of the State of Washington heard arguments on this question in a case that has profound implications for the doctor-patient relationship.

title: The G.O.P. Establishment Has a Big New Hampshire Problem
description: The last two Republican presidential primary contests have followed the same script: A conservative candidate wins in Iowa, a relative moderate wins in New Hampshire, and the latter  with broader appeal and all of the establishments resources  outlasts the former in a protracted fight for the nomination.

title: After Paris Attacks, a Slow Reawakening for Citys Cultural Offerings
description: PARIS  On Wednesday morning, May Zhang, a tourist from Shanghai, was outside the Louvre using a selfie stick to snap photographs with a friend. The courtyard is normally packed with tourists, but they had it mostly to themselves  and to the dozen or more heavily armed police officers pacing in the background.

title: News Qs | Raw Talent and College Sports Mix at Culinary Institute of America
description: Before Reading Raw Talent and College Sports Mix at Culinary Institute of America:

title: What Are Your Thanksgiving Traditions?
description: You might know the Thanksgiving story  of the Pilgrims feasting alongside Native Americans in 1621 after a bountiful corn harvest. But do you know where your own familys traditions come from, whether you eat turkey, snicker salad or sopapilla cheesecake?

title: A Foothold on the Lower East Side
description: After graduating from Syracuse University in 2013, Sarah Sterns landed a job in Norwalk, Conn. She rented a studio in a modest brick building in nearby Stamford for a little more than $1,000 a month.

title: The Doomsday Scam
description: The hunt for the ultimate weapon began in January 2014, when Abu Omar, a smuggler who fills shopping lists for the Islamic State, met a jihadist commander in Tal Abyad, a Syrian town near the Turkish border. The Islamic State had raised its black flag over Tal Abyad several days before, and the commander, a former cigarette vendor known as Timsah, Arabic for crocodile, was the areas new security chief. The Crocodile had an order to place, which he said he had received from his bosses in Mosul, a city in northwestern Iraq that the Islamic State would later overrun.

title: A Virtual Reality Revolution, Coming to a Headset Near You
description: Virtual reality  once the stuff of science fiction  is still in its infancy. But theres already a gold rush around the technology, which plunges viewers into a simulated 3-D environment and lets them explore their surroundings as if they were really there.

title: Offline, D.I.Y. Weddings Arent So Picture Perfect
description: For those couples who like to exhibit their inner Michelangelo or Martha Stewart, weddings have become festivals of do-it-yourself creativity. But in the days leading up to the event, a couples desire for those artisanal touches can come at a cost in lost hours and increased anxiety.

title: U.S. Investigators Struggle to Track Homegrown ISIS Suspects
description: WASHINGTON  At least three dozen people in the United States suspected of ties to the Islamic State were under heavy electronic or physical surveillance even before the Paris attacks, senior American officials say. But unlike the attackers in France, the officials say, the majority of those under investigation here never traveled to Syria to fight alongside the Islamic State or receive training from it.

title: Punk Portraits of New York
description: William Coupon photographed Ronald Reagan and he photographed Lydia Lunch, both in the same way: against a backdrop of hand-painted Belgian linen, side-lit by a single fixture. For three and a half decades, he has varied little from this method, whether working in the Oval Office or the tribal regions of the Amazon rain forest. Its the classic medium shot, chiaroscuro light, Mr. Coupon, 62, said the other day, describing his method and mission. I knew if I focused on other subcultures I could hit on a range of people. I thought, I want to photograph everyone in the world.

title: A Quarterbacks New Role
description: Clint Trickett, a former West Virginia quarterback who was forced to retire because of a number of concussions, is the quarterbacks coach of a top junior college team in Mississippi.

title: Concussions Ended His Football Dreams. Now, at 24, He Helps Others Achieve Theirs.
description: SCOOBA, Miss.  For months, reporters have called Clint Trickett wanting to talk about football and, more specifically, about football safety. Some called soon after he announced his retirement as a player last December, when he revealed that he had sustained five concussions in 14 months in the previous two seasons as West Virginias starting quarterback  the last one a year ago Friday. Others have called more recently, prompted by the coming release of the film Concussion, in which Will Smith plays the doctor who helped identify a degenerative brain disease linked to repeated head trauma.

title: Paris Attacks Suspect Killed in Shootout Had Plotted Terror for 11 Months
description: VERVIERS, Belgium  Black smudges and faded traces of gunfire on a red brick rowhouse here in eastern Belgium mark the death foretold of Abdelhamid Abaaoud. It is the spot where, 11 months before the announcement on Thursday that he had been killed outside Paris, he began plotting an elaborate campaign of terror across Europe.

title: Hillary Clinton Presents Her Plan to Battle ISIS
description: Republican presidential candidates wasted no time after the terrorist attacks in Paris to put forth their ideas for fighting the Islamic State. Theyve proposed bombing oil fields in the Middle East (Donald J. Trump), allowing only Christian refugees into the United States (Senator Ted Cruz of Texas) and sending 10,000 American troops to Iraq and Syria (Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina).

description: This article appeared in the November 22, 2015 issue of The New York Times Magazine.

description: Updated 9:49 a.m.

title: Croatia, Macedonia and Serbia Start Screening Refugees by Nationality
description: GENEVA  Croatia, Macedonia and Serbia have started screening migrants and refugees on the basis of nationality and allowing entry only to those from Afghanistan, Iraq or Syria, the United Nations refugee agency said on Thursday.

title: Short Films to Celebrate Shakespeares Plays
description: LONDON  Thirty-seven short films based on Shakespeares plays will screen this spring as part of Shakespeares Globes commemorations of the 400th anniversary of the playwrightsdeath, the company announced Thursday.

title: Labor Union to Start Substantial Ad Campaign Hitting Republicans on Immigration
description: Republicans have been talking tough on immigration this primary season, and on Thursday, they will get a taste of how Democrats might use that against them in a general election.

title: Bernie Sanders to Invoke F.D.R. in Speech Defining His Vision of Democratic Socialism
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont will be channeling Franklin D. Roosevelt more than Eugene V. Debs on Thursday afternoon as he delivers the most important speech of his bid for the Democratic presidential nomination: an attempt to demystify Democratic Socialism, his long-held political philosophy, and tie it to his vision of America.

title: Where to Go in Melville, Johannesburg
description: While some lament that the bohemian enclaves glory days have passed, others enjoy its clutch of antiques shops, independent designers and good dining.

title: Life on the Train
description: On the road with Ringling Brothers.

title: An Unlikely Tourist Attraction in Poland: Storks
description: About a half-mile from the Russian border, hidden in the rolling hills of northernmost Poland, is the tiny village of Zywkowo, population 25 humans and 43 pairs of nesting white storks. It is one of the countrys largest stork breeding colonies  their massive, tousled nests dot chimneys, rooftops and specially made platforms. They are wedged into tree branches and balanced above electrical wires.

title: Review: The Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part 2, Katnisss Final Battle
description: Theres no risk that Katniss Everdeen, the warrior who has led the charge against oppression in The Hunger Games movies, can ever return to her current incarnation. Even if she and her world are rebooted back into franchise existence by a ravenous studio, her moment was now. Katniss, as played by Jennifer Lawrence over three years and four blockbusters, has evolved from a backwoods scrapper in the first movie into a battle-scarred champion and an exemplar of female power on screen and off  and the battles shes fought have extended far beyond the fictional nation of Panem.

title: Running Away With the Circus
description: Just for the sake of argument, consider the Ringling Brothers Circus of the year 1890, roughly 17 years before it became the Ringling Brothers and Barnum & Bailey Circus. That year, you could see Anzo, the Human Serpent, slither on the ground. You could see the La Role brothers, Chris and Harry, the two Flying Men of the Air, and the wondrous Nellie on her airborne trapeze. You could see Edward Billings, the King of the High Stilts, as he confounded audience members with his height and balance, and watch the educated horses ridden two at a time by one man. You could see Barretta, the Boneless Wonder, whom, years before, a young Winston Churchill had begged in vain to see. (According to Boris Johnsons biography, The Churchill Factor, his parents decided the sight would be too demoralizing and revolting for a child.)

The Chief Suspect

title: Bombardier to Receive $1.5 Billion From Quebec Pension Fund
description: OTTAWA  Bombardier is on steadier financial ground, as Quebecs pension fund moved on Thursday to buy a nearly one-third stake in the companys train and transit group for $1.5 billion.

title: Geert Wilders: Let the Dutch Vote on Immigration Policy
description: The Hague  The first thing France did after last Fridays terrorist attacks in Paris was to temporarily close its borders. It was a wise move. The attacks showed just how unsafe Europe has become as a result of the European Unions open border policies and decades of foolish decisions by governments across the Continent to open their doors to mass immigration from Islamic countries.

title: To Stop Radicalization, the French Need More Fraternit
description: AS a security professional with counterterrorism experience, I understand the threat posed by religious extremism. As a former Secret Service agent who has taught about radicalization to the C.I.A., the N.S.A., the Department of Homeland Security and the United States military, I have seen up close how Muslims are treated in European society, especially French society.
