description: The list of what a child needs in order to flourish is short but nonnegotiable.

title: Thanksgiving, With or Without Turkey
description: LOS ANGELES  FOUR centuries after the pilgrims, families are still celebrating their successful arrival on North American shores with a big meal at the end of November. But the big roasted turkey doesnt always have the starring role.

title: One Jet Closer to a Wider Confrontation
description: Turkeys downing of a Russian fighter jet on Tuesday is just the kind of volatile incident that has been feared since Moscows military intervention added new uncertainty to the already complicated Syrian civil war. The attack adds to tensions between Ankara and Moscow, which support different factions in Syria, and threatens to worsen relations between Russia and Turkeys NATO allies, which have been going downhill since Russia invaded Ukraine.

title: A Better Way to Screen for Prostate Cancer
description: With prostate cancer, as with other diseases, there has been a vigorous debate about who should be tested. Screening too many people leads to unnecessary treatment, too few and you miss cancers that could have been stopped. A new study points to what may be a better approach: screen smarter.

title: Paris and the Presidential Election
description: The Paris attacks  as well as developments in Brussels, Egypt and Mali  may have improved Republican prospects in 2016.

title: A More Conservative Catholic Church Awaits Pope Francis in Africa
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Headlines here call him the Pope of Hope. Because of him, Kenyans say they are more enthusiastic about going to church, praying regularly and treating others kindly. They want him to preach about corruption, living in peace and governing fairly.

title: Mothering My Dying Friend
description: In a Venn diagram of tending helpless people at the extremes of life, the circle of caring for a dying person overlaps almost completely with the one for caring for a baby. Both are repetitive, intimate, often gross, sometimes funny, weirdly frantic even as theyre crushingly tedious, and a total act of devotion. In the nonoverlapping part of the end-of-life circle, theres pain, grief, despair and a dreadful fading. There is movement not forward, toward consciousness, but backward, away from it. And for all of your endless patience there is nothing at the end. Just death, and your only job is a kind of mothering right up to the lip of the abyss.

title: South Korea Says Its Working to Halt Refugees Return to North
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The office of President Park Geun-hye of South Korea said Wednesday that her government was trying to secure the freedom of nine North Koreans, including a baby, who a rights group said were in danger of being sent back from China to face harsh punishment for leaving the North.

title: Dometic Group Raises $528 Million in I.P.O. in Stockholm
description: LONDON  Dometic Group, a Swedish maker of appliances for boats and recreational vehicles, said on Wednesday that it had raised 4.6 billion Swedish kronor, or about $528 million, in its initial public offering in Stockholm.

title: A Year After Phillip Hughess Death, Cricket Inches Forward on Safety
description: On Nov. 25 last year, the Australian cricketer Phillip Hughes was attempting to win a recall to the test-playing national team. He had reached 63 runs during a domestic match in Sydney, Australia, when he received a short ball aimed near his head. Trying to attack the delivery, Hughes was struck on the top of the neck and, after staggering for a few seconds, he collapsed on the field. Within 48 hours he was pronounced dead, three days before his 26th birthday.

title: Its Early, but the Warriors Are Dominating the N.B.A.
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  After the pregame introductions and usual pyrotechnics, but before the games opening tip, Golden State Warriors forward Draymond Green took a microphone to center court. He thanked fans at Oracle Arena for their support and wished them a happy holiday season.

title: The Origins of Jihadist-Inspired Attackers in the U.S.
description: Since Sept. 11, 2001, most of the attackers in the United States claiming or appearing to be motivated by extremist Islam were U.S.-born or naturalized citizens.

title: News Qs | Chicago Protests Mostly Peaceful After Video of Police Shooting Is Released
description: Note: We have chosen not to embed the graphic dashboard-camera video that shows Laquan McDonald, 17 being shot and killed by Officer Jason Van Dyke. It can be found here.

title: Navigator of Downed Russian Plane Says There Was No Warning
description: MOSCOW  The Russian navigator who parachuted out of a warplane shot down by Turkey said Wednesday that there had been no warning before a missile slammed into the aircraft, giving him and the pilot no time to dodge the missile.

title: Cuomo, in Shift, Is Said to Back Reducing Test Scores Role in Teacher Reviews
description: Less than a year ago, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York proclaimed that the key to transforming the states education system was tougher evaluations for teachers, and he pushed through changes that increased the weight of student test scores in teachers ratings.

title: Latest Miracle on 34th Street: Macys Keeps Wooden Escalators
description: Heres what you could do in 1920s Manhattan that you cant do today: Catch whats playing at the Roxy or whos playing at the Polo Grounds. Buy a pair of alligator shoes at Franklin Simon or see a pair of alligators at the Aquarium. Meet your spouse  or whomever  under the clock at the Biltmore Hotel.

title: Emirates Secretly Sends Colombian Mercenaries to Yemen Fight
description: WASHINGTON  The United Arab Emirates has secretly dispatched hundreds of Colombian mercenaries to Yemen to fight in that countrys raging conflict, adding a volatile new element in a complex proxy war that has drawn in the United States and Iran.

title: The Mudd Club Comes Back to Life, for One Night
description: A wet night in November and Steve Mass  a compact figure in baseball cap and stubble  was strolling through a jostling nightclub in TriBeCa. Voices were rising, drinks were beginning to slosh and serious dj vu was setting in: More than three decades after closing the anarchic Mudd Club, he was presiding over a roiling reunion.

title: Living in West Hempstead, N.Y.
description: Home buyers, including some from pricey areas of Brooklyn and Queens, are finding value in West Hempstead.

title: Putting Down Roots inWest Hempstead, N.Y.
description: When Kathleen and Stephen Dunne look back on the purchase of their home in West Hempstead, N.Y., just a couple of weeks before they were married in 1990, they remember not just the hectic scramble to get everything done but also their excitement at finding a house in the same Nassau County hamlet where Stephen had grown up and his mother still lived.

title: What Are You Grateful For?
description: Weve asked this question before, but seemingly every year there is new scientific research showing that being grateful is good for you.

title: Singapore Court Orders Release of Man Accused of Fixing Soccer Matches
description: Singapores Court of Appeal has ordered the release of a man accused of fixing soccer matches around the world, ruling on Wednesday that the allegations against him do not warrant extended detention without trial.

title: Counting Your Bites for Weight Loss
description: Thanksgiving and the rest of the holiday season are famously ruinous to waistlines. But a new study suggests that we might be able to fend off weight gain and even drop a few pounds in the coming weeks by taking note of every time we put teeth to food or drink.

title: Tour and Hotel News: Dance and Music in India; Safaris in Tanzania
description: A TASTE OF ITALY IN LAS VEGAS

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Russia, Chicago Police, Golden State Warriors
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Pilgrims and Pumpkin Pie
New York Today: Ways to Give Thanks
description: Updated 7:49 a.m.

title: Ask Well: Do Cranberries Offer Health Benefits?
description: Question:

title: 1940: Britain Expects Aid from U.S.
description: WASHINGTON  The Marquess of Lothian, British Ambassador, who said on his return from London Saturday that the British were nearing the end of their cash resources, had long talks with President Roosevelt and Secretary of State Cordell Hull this afternoon [Nov. 25], after which he told reporters that Great Britain expected substantial aid from the United States next year in the form of credits, warplanes, ships and munitions. However, he said the President had made no promises. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, November 26, 1940

title: Transplant Chief in China Denies Breaking Vow to Ban Prisoners Organs
description: BEIJING  A top Chinese health official has denied that the countrys new organ transplant system allows organs to be harvested from executed prisoners, saying that earlier comments he made suggesting that a loophole allowed the practice to continue had been misconstrued.

title: Morning Agenda: Treasury Secretary Warns Foes of Dodd-Frank
description: TREASURY SECRETARY WARNS FOES OF DODD-FRANK | Last year, Congress passed a measure dismantling a piece of the Dodd-Frank Act that governed swaps by attaching the new legislation to a wider spending bill. On Tuesday, Treasury Secretary Jacob J. Lew warned critics of Dodd-Frank against trying the same tactic again, saying he would push back against any attempts to weaken financial regulation through amendments to the spending bill, which Congress must pass by Dec. 11 to avert a government shutdown,  Peter Eavis reports in DealBook. I have publicly made clear that my recommendation to the president would be that if there are legislative measures that will roll back the clock, that would take us back toward where we were before the financial crisis, I would recommend a veto, Mr. Lew said via email.

title: Is Hillary Clintons Challenge a Glass Ceiling or a Glass Curtain?
description: In seeking to break through the highest, hardest glass ceiling, as Hillary Rodham Clinton deemed the potential election of the first female president in 2008, the Democratic presidential candidate first must break through with voters, a challenge she is having trouble overcoming, according to a recent focus group of Ohio voters.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: Missing Nohemi
description: Nohemi Gonzalez, 23, was an industrial design student at California State University, Long Beach. She was studying abroad in Paris when she was killed in the terrorist attacks on Nov. 13.

title: Sleep Apnea
description: Often when I read a poem, I encounter an experience I havent actually had  the language and imagery evoking a shared emotional response. But reading this poem, I found a vivid depiction of my own actual experience: listening for the breathing of my father, holding my breath like the speaker as I waited.

title: Orpheus and Apollo, Dismantled, May Be Gone for Years, Some Fear Permanently
description: Will Orpheus return from the underworld this time? Will Apollo ever glitter again in sunlight? Is it possible that one of the largest works of public art in New York  a five-ton, 190-foot-long, 39-foot-high sculpture  could disappear with few people noticing?

title: The 11.15.15 Issue
description: RE: THE FUTURE

title: How to Navigate By the Stars
description: Use the stars to find the four cardinal directions, says Chadd Onohi Paishon, a master navigator with the Polynesian Voyaging Society who steers double-hulled canoes from Hawaii to Tahiti and beyond without any instruments or charts. Paishon doesnt know how to use a GPS device or a magnetic compass, but he can orient himself on land or sea with a glance at the heavens. Determine north by finding the North Star, which does not set when youre north of the Equator. As seafarers have done for millenniums, you can determine about how many miles north of the Equator you are by measuring the distance between the North Star and the horizon. To do this, stretch out your arm. For most, one fist equals approximately 10 degrees; latitudinal degrees each represent about 69 miles. The farther north you go, the higher the star looks in the sky. South of the Equator, you wont see the North Star but must rely on a constellation called the Southern Cross to help you find south.

title: Should My Rich Friends Apply for Financial Aid?
description: Close friends of mine are raising four young children in a city with an extremely high cost of living. Not a small feat. They are not millionaires, but they are not poor either. Because of the school zone in which they live, they prefer to send their children to a private school, where tuition is upward of $27,000 per year per child. They made the situation work when only two children were of school age, but in the next academic year, there will be three children enrolled, and four not long after.

title: Judge John Hodgman on the Elaborate Handshake
description: Joe writes: My friend insists that we high-five and then snap our fingers when saying goodbye, as he did with his friends back in Emporia, Kan. Hes so pushy that I now refuse to high-five. I instead offer a fist bump or a choice Cool Runnings quote. Ive never seen anyone sadder to get a fist bump.

title: Watch Lynsey Addario Discuss The Displaced With Cate Blanchett
description: In the weeks since New York Times Magazine readers had the opportunity to experience the magazines The Displaced virtual-reality film with Google Cardboard V.R. viewers delivered to subscribers, the film has been shown around the world. Before a screening in New Delhi on Friday, Women in the World, a live-event series associated with The Times, hosted a discussion on the global refugee and migrant crisis moderated by the actress Cate Blanchett and featuring the photojournalist and frequent Times Magazine contributor Lynsey Addario among its guests.

title: Drinking Food
description: Yusuke Shimoki runs Engawa, a tiny bar in Kaga, in the Ishikawa Prefecture of Japan, on the mountainous north-central coast, near the Sea of Japan. When he recently came to America for a visit, he packed bottles of local sake into his luggage. He also brought six styles of glassware to serve it in, as well as a bottle of his favorite soy sauce and, for no particular reason other than he is proud of it, a framed certificate naming him a qualified sake sommelier in Japan. There was little room for clothes.

title: Edmund de Waal and the Strange Alchemy of Porcelain
description: Within a few minutes of my meeting Edmund de Waal, he was putting things in my hands. He handed me, for instance, a 1,000-year-old Chinese porcelain plate  the kind of object you would expect to see in a climate-controlled glass case in a museum, protected, at great expense, from clumsy, meaty, oily, inexpert hands like mine. De Waal just passed it to me as if it were nothing. To understand an object, he believes, you have to touch it.

title: Poll Shows Hillary Clinton Wins Iowans Heads, but Not Hearts
description: More than four out of five Iowa Democrats think Hillary Rodham Clinton can win the general election, compared with only half who think the same of Senator Bernie Sanders.

title: Koch Brothers Woo Hispanic Voters With Turkeys and Questionnaires
description: MIAMI  The crowd that lined up around a megachurch here last week  largely Hispanic and mostly poor  came for the Saturday services, but also for the free flu shots that were being offered in the church, and for the Thanksgiving turkeys being given away just outside.

title: Looking for a Break From the Campaign? Stay Away From the TV
description: For residents of the four early voting states seeking respite this holiday weekend from the political rantings of a charged relative, the traditional comfort of television might not provide much of an escape.

title: Silicon Valley Is Growing Up, Giving Parents a Break
description: Silicon Valley is beginning to admit it isnt just for young people anymore.

title: Range of Frustrations Reached Boil as Turkey Shot Down Russian Jet
description: ANKARA, Turkey  Turkey and Russia promised on Wednesday not to go to war over the downing of a Russian military jet, leaving Turkeys still-nervous NATO allies and just about everyone else wondering why the country decided to risk such a serious confrontation.

title: Small Shops Take Pride in Turning Their Backs on Black Friday
description: On Black Friday, as hordes of people begin their holiday shopping rites, Nan Morningstar will keep the door closed at Free Radicals, the clothing and costume boutique she and her husband own in Albuquerque.

title: Francine Proses Food Crawl Down Sunset Boulevard
description: For many people, especially those who dont live in and around Los Angeles, the idea of Sunset Boulevard conjures up the iconic Billy Wilder film of that name, or the fictional nightclub at 77 Sunset Strip, where one of the most popular TV series of the early 1960s was set, or images of historic Hollywood landmarks: the Chateau Marmont hotel, whose poolside bar is prime territory for movie-star sighting, and where several recent films (Sofia Coppolas Somewhere and David Cronenbergs Maps to the Stars) were shot; the Laugh Factory, where some of the countrys greatest comedians, from Richard Pryor and Jerry Seinfeld to Robin Williams and Eddie Murphy, have performed. But for Los Angeles residents, those two words  Sunset Boulevard  are more likely to seem like shorthand for their shared obsession: traffic.

title: Where to Shop in Romes Campo Marzio
description: In a neighborhood in Romes historic center, locals come to hit the collection of clothing and lifestyle boutiques featuring goods produced in Italy.

title: 1965: Mobutu Seizes Power in Coup
description: LEOPOLDVILLE  In a bloodless, almost troopless coup, Gen. Joseph Mobutu seized power in the Congo today [Nov. 25]. He dismissed President Joseph Kasavubu, named himself head of state for five years and asked Col. Leonard Mulamba to form a broadly based government. The coup was prompted by a political deadlock that had threatened to open a new chapter of violence in the Congo. It also was seen as an attempt to close an opening to the left within the Kasavubu government. The 35-year-old general said his move was not designed to impose a military dictatorship. He said he had acted to save the nation, to put a definite end to chaos and anarchy.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, November 26, 1965

title: Golden Anniversary on the West Side
description: Dear Diary:

title: Stedman Bailey of St. Louis Rams Is Hospitalized After Being Shot
description: Stedman Bailey, a receiver for the St. Louis Rams, was hospitalized after he was shot in Florida on Tuesday evening, the police said.

title: 4 Killed in Gunfight Between Indian Army and Militants in Kashmir
description: NEW DELHI  The Indian Army killed three militants in the Kashmir region on Wednesday in an hourslong gun battle at an army base close to the highly militarized border with Pakistan.

title: Evening Clutches for Holiday Parties
description: The small but mighty minaudire gets all dressed up, in crystals, sequins, silver and gold.

title: The Eternal Drama of the Red Lip
description: In May 1969, Claes Oldenburg and a group of students, faculty and alumni mounted a towering tube of red lipstick on a tank on the grounds of Yale University. Lipstick (Ascending) on Caterpillar Tracks was a protest against the Vietnam War and a joke about American consumer culture  as well as an advance guard for Yale Colleges first female students, who arrived on campus the next semester. Most women werent wearing heavy makeup in 1969, but Oldenburg wasnt aiming for social realism. Red lipstick is symbolic of symbols. Its what you put on when you want to make a statement.

title: What You Get for  $800,000
description: A condo in Chicago, a cottage in New Orleans and an old farmhouse in Pennsylvania

title: $800,000 Homes in Chicago, New Orleans and Pennsylvania
description: CHICAGO

title: Anonymous Hackers Fight ISIS but Reactions Are Mixed
description: People from various hacking collectives have tried for several months to block social media accounts that spread propaganda and attempt to recruit fighters for the Islamic State, but those campaigns gained a new energy on Twitter after the Paris attacks.

title: World Press Photo Introduces New Ethics Guidelines for Contest
description: The World Press Photo Foundation on Wednesday announced major changes to its photo contest for 2016, including a code of ethics for entrants and detailed guidelines regarding digital manipulation of images. The new rules also include an independent fact-checking process for the captions of winning photos and a 36-hour period for entrants whose images may have been unduly altered to explain their process.

title: Handing Civilians the Keys to a Guatemalan Forest
description: An experiment in the Maya Biosphere Reserve is testing whether the most effective way to protect forests is to give control of them to those who already live there.

title: In Guatemala, People Living Off Forests Are Tasked With Protecting Them
description: UAXACTN, Guatemala  Deep in the jungle, where the forest canopy bends sunlight into a lattice of overlapping greens, where jaguars glide and the throaty cries of howler monkeys resound over the bird song, sits a sawmill that slices giant mahogany logs.

title: A Renovated Three-Bedroom Apartment in Milan
description: Dating to the turn of the 20th century, the apartment, which was renovated in 2007, is on the market for $1.93 million.

title: House Hunting in ... Milan
description: A RENOVATED THREE-BEDROOM APARTMENT IN THE CITY CENTER

title: World Press Photo Introduces New Ethics Guidelines for Contest
description: After two years of controversy over images submitted to the World Press Photo contest, the organization has announced major changes to the competitions rules.

title: Sweaters for the Slopes  or the Streets
description: The classic ski sweater is now cool.

title: Glittering Evening Clutches
description: The small but mighty minaudire gets all dressed up, in crystals, sequins, silver and gold.

title: Updating Windows 10
LoftOpera Takes on Brittens Rape of Lucretia
description: In just a few seasons, LoftOpera  an innovative company that stages full operas and excerpts in unusual spaces like a former warehouse in Bushwick, Brooklyn  has impressed with the caliber of its stylish ventures. For its new multimedia staging of Brittens unsettling chamber opera Rape of Lucretia, the company returns to 501 Union, a former car restoration shop in Gowanus, Brooklyn.

title: Tere OConnor Thinks Big With The Goodbye Studies
description: For one semester a year, Tere OConnor trades New York City for the University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign, where he is a professor of dance. The good part is that he always returns, ready to start a new work, and this season its a doozy in sheer numbers alone.

title: Bill Murray in A Very Murray Christmas Full of Stars
description: Take Nick the Lounge Singer and mix with Bing Crosby, add an uptown hotel, two shots of bubbly, a scoop of cheer and a sprinkle of hipster cred. Shake, pour and  faster than you can say Scrooged  its A Very Murray Christmas, streaming Friday, Dec. 4, on Netflix and starring Bill Murray as a singer whose Christmas Eve cabaret act at the Carlyle Hotel goes bust when New York is shut down by the blizzard of the century. So he improvises, with the help of his pianist sidekick, Paul Shaffer, as well as Rashida Jones, Amy Poehler, Michael Cera, Jason Schwartzman, Maya Rudolph, Chris Rock, Jenny Lewis, David Johansen and the band Phoenix, as guests and staff. Its all a little boozy, a little woozy, as if your coolest, most vocally gifted friends were transported into a Sofia Coppola flick. Which it is.

title: Pop, Robert Smithsons Playful Drawings Inspired by New York Detritus
description: It makes sense that James Cohan is opening his Lower East Side gallery with a show devoted to Robert Smithson. Titled Pop, it features works on paper and sculpture dating from 1963 to 1965, when the artist was in his 20s. Though far better known for his Earthworks of the late 1960s and early 70s, like Spiral Jetty, Smithson was prolific on paper.

title: Kelela Continues the Swagger of 90s R&B on Hallucinogen
description: In 2013 Kelela released Cut 4 Me, her debut mixtape full of narcotic R&B, and one of the jumping-off points for a new wave of genre reimagination.

title: Anomalisa, a Stop-Motion Feature at MoMA
description: Between 2005 and 2008, Cartoon Networks late-night programming block Adult Swim ran Moral Orel, a hilariously stinging and subversive stop-motion series created by Dino Stamatopoulos. Moral Orel  a lampoon of 1960s and 70s inspirational childrens fare like Art Clokeys Davey and Goliath  avoided glib messages of uplift in its tales of a Midwestern boy whose religious faith remains steadfast despite the shortcomings of adults around him.

title: Presidential Thanksgivings
description: The holiday through the years with presidents, their families, carving knives and turkeys (some survived).

title: Daily Report: Turkey, Travel and Technology
description: Nothing says Thanksgiving like overcrowded airports and traffic jams. But given the holiday, lets be thankful for a minute  for the intersection of technology and travel.

title: Giving Thanks for a Proper Got Your Nose Bit
description: My own father never took my nose. He is a member of the Greatest Generation, which perhaps had bigger concerns (helloooNazis!). From an early age, at holiday gatherings, when I saw my cousins and friends get their noses taken by their fathers, I never understood what was going on. It seemed horrific, but the kids always laughed in the end. I missed out, and today I can only think it was due to the fact that thrusting a fist in my face with a thumb-that-seems-to-be-a-nose sticking out between two fingers and then taunting me about it until I laughed at the incredulousness of it all possibly hit too close to home for him. War, you know.

title: Q. and A.: Holly Holm and the Thrill of the Fight
description: It does not take much to go from mostly unknown athlete to the talk of the sports world. All it takes is dominating and then knocking out a fighter generally considered to be unbeatable.

title: City Chefs Gone Country
description: Four New York City chefs who have taken their Brooklyn-style farm-to-table cuisine upstate  giving weekend travelers yet another reason to get out of town.

title: Becoming Modern: The Mets Mission at the Breuer Building
description: It is probably revealing that Sheena Wagstaff, who was brought to the Metropolitan Museum of Art to ramp up its presence in contemporary art, is about to make her debut at the museums new Breuer building with an exhibition of an artist who has been dead for more than 20 years. Nasreen Mohamedi  is a beloved if little-known modernist who is sometimes called the Indian Agnes Martin, a reference to her penchant for pristine grids.

title: U.S. General Says Kunduz Hospital Strike Was Avoidable
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The top American commander in Afghanistan, Gen. John F. Campbell, said Wednesday that several service members had been suspended from duty after an internal military investigation of the American airstrike on a Doctors Without Borders hospital in Kunduz last month.

title: Bluestockings, Radical Since 1999
description: The bookshop and cafe on the Lower East Side is a haven for those interested in feminist, queer and gender studies, and much more.

title: At Bluestockings, a Manhattan Activist Center, Radical Is Sensible
description: Are we anarchist? Senia Hardwick asked. Technically, yes. Mx. Hardwick, 27, who prefers not to be assigned a gender  and also insists on the gender-neutral Mx. in place of Ms. or Mr.  is a staff member at Bluestockings, a bookshop and activist center at 172 Allen Street on the Lower East Side. Mx. Hardwick was explaining that the ethos of Bluestockings, which is run by a collective of volunteers, is difficult to classify. But if you must: Anarchist is O.K.

title: Q & A with Austin Meyer, 2015 Win-a-Trip Winner
description: Austin Meyer was Nicholas Kristofs 2015 win-a-trip winner, and he traveled first to Baltimore, where he wrote about heroin use, and later to rural India and Nepal, where he wrote about malnutrition and cataract surgery. For students applying this year, and those curious about what its like to travel with Nick, Austin has answers. (Speaking of which, if youre a student with a U.S. passport studying at a U.S. university and want to apply for his 2016 trip, here are the details.)

title: Autumnal Wine Pairings, From Momofukus Beverage Director
description: Jordan Salcito recommends bottles to enjoy with seasonal dishes, from pot roast to pumpkin pie.

title: Chinese Utility to Pay Brazil $3.7 Billion to Run 2 Power Plants
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  China is ramping up its investment in Brazils electricity sector.

title: The Islamic States Bahraini Backers
description: LONDON  Sectarianism failed, Bahrains foreign minister, Sheikh Khalid bin Ahmed al-Khalifa, told a news conference attended by Secretary of State John Kerry in Washington last week. It had not gained a foothold in our country, he went on, but we will continue to be on our toes facing it.

title: At Home With the Wildlife of Industrial Chicago
description: Dana Arnett

title: Thanksgiving Quiz: Whos Eating What, Where
description: Take our quiz on regional variations of favorite Thanksgiving foods.

title: Paths to Peace
description: As a columnist at The Village Voice and a radio host, Howard Smith, who died in 2014 at 77, chronicled and helped to shape the counterculture. The Smith Tapes collects his interviews with Jerry Garcia, Andy Warhol and dozens of other stars from 1969 to 1972.

title: On the Eve of the Feast
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: 2 Valeant Dermatology Drugs Lead Steep Price Increases, Study Finds
description: Two drugs sold by Valeant Pharmaceuticals International to treat cancer-related skin conditions increased in price by about 1,700 percent over the last six years, according to a newly published survey that found big increases in the cost of dermatology drugs across the board.

title: Ousted Founder of Mens Wearhouse Watches His Old Company Struggle
description: When George Zimmer, founder and public face of the retail chain Mens Wearhouse  Youre going to like the way you look. I guarantee it.  was fired two years ago by his handpicked board, there was no sugarcoating the message.

title: Gardening Start-Up in China Chances Upon U.S. Marijuana Market
description: In China, concerns about food safety are so serious that residents at times take to the green spaces between tenements to plant gardens. Others farm on windowsills and balconies, or use specialized e-commerce services to track down safe vegetables and meats.

title: At the Movies With Franois and Hitch
description: Culled from six days of interviews that the French director Franois Truffaut conducted with his idol Alfred Hitchcock, the book Hitchcock immediately stood out from other books about movies when it was published in an English translation in 1967.

title: Putin Criticizes Turkish Leaders
description: A day after Turkey shot down one of Moscows jets, Russian president Vladimir V. Putin said Turkeys political leaders had been "supporting the Islamization of their country."

title: Miguel Gomes Blends Fantasy and Real Life Arabian Nights
description: Many current filmmakers make hybrid films or so-called documentary fictions, but the Portuguese director Miguel Gomes may be the most baroque in dreaming up new ways to combine the factual and the fantastic. One attribute of his cinema is its denial of categories. Another is the degree of self-reflexivity: to watch his films to think about how they were made.

title: Which Is More Ludicrous? Donald Trump Edition
description: In this campaign season, when so much of what Republican presidential candidates say is made up, I thought it would be fun to play a game: Which Is More Ludicrous?

title: Making the Crossing to Lesbos
description: Under Europes system of open internal borders, this thinly patrolled, easily accessible coastline might as well be the frontier of France or Germany or Sweden.

title: Regulating Flow of Refugees Gains Urgency in Greece and Rest of Europe
description: MYTILENE, Greece  On a recent day here on the Greek island of Lesbos, hundreds of asylum seekers squatted on ragged hillsides or rested in a warren of tentlike structures, clothes drying on leafless trees, as they waited to be registered and sent by ferry to the European mainland.

title: Black Friday Deal or Dud? How to Shop Smart This Holiday Season
description: Before lining up at a retail store or firing up your computer for Black Friday bargains this week, ask yourself one question: Have you ever scored a great deal from the annual post-Thanksgiving shopping bonanza?

title: Hoverboarding at Venice Beach
description: Hoverboards are this holiday seasons hottest item.

title: Laws Struggle to Keep Up as Hoverboards Popularity Soars
description: MILL VALLEY, Calif.  They are this years must-have holiday item, coveted by children and adults alike. Retailers are promoting them heavily online and on catalog covers, and they are an increasingly common sight on city streets across America. But in many places  from New York State to individual schools, malls and stores  they are illegal.

title: This Thanksgiving, Theres Plenty to Be Grateful for in Sports
description: On this Thanksgiving Day, sports must extol the somber scene at the recent England-France soccer friendly at Wembley Stadium in London, four nights after the Paris terrorist attacks, as thousands of spectators from the rival nations and 44 players, arm in arm, sang La Marseillaise, the French anthem. Merci, soccer.

title: William Paterson Forfeits Game After Coachs Departure
description: William Paterson, a Division III university in Wayne, N.J., forfeited a mens basketball game on Tuesday night, apparently because the players declined to play after the departure of their coach.

title: Sheldon Silver Trial Jury Stops for Thanksgiving; Deliberations to Resume Next Week

description: The zombie apocalypse will hit New Jersey in December when The Walking Dead Experience, an immersive theater production based on the popular horror franchise, arrives at the Meadowlands.

title: Pope Francis Arrives in a Kenya Fed Up With Graft
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Pope Francis is known for his humility, but many Kenyans still could not believe what they saw him do when he arrived in Nairobi on Wednesday: He drove in from the airport in a little gray Honda.

description: Eight short word games, from easy to hard, that can be played with your whole family. By Will Shortz and Joel Fagliano.

title: Jackie Hoffman Kvetches Her Way to Royalty in Once Upon a Mattress
description: On a recent morning, the actress Jackie Hoffman sprawled on a bed costing thousands of dollars. She was at a Hstens showroom in the Flatiron district, lounging on a mattress covered in a tasteful checked throw that clashed apologetically with her bright pink puffer jacket and flowered socks. Theres nothing like expensive, she sighed. Makes you want to sink right in.

description: Did you see that? the parent asks.

title: E. Coli Outbreak Linked to Costco Chicken Salad, C.D.C Says
description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said on Tuesday that public health officials were investigating an outbreak of E. coli that had sickened 19 people in seven states. The outbreak is thought to be linked to chicken salad from Costco, the C.D.C. said.

title: As Mayor, Bernie Sanders Was More Pragmatist Than Socialist
description: BURLINGTON, Vt.  When Bernie Sanders, a self-declared socialist, served as mayor here in the 1980s, he often complained that the United States had its priorities wrong, that it should be diverting money from the military to domestic needs like housing and health care.

title: Many Doctors Unaware of Truvada, Drug for Preventing H.I.V.
description: Even though taking a daily pill can protect almost completely against getting H.I.V., a third of primary care doctors and nurses in the United States have never heard of it, federal health officials said this week.

title: App Smart | Beating Black Friday
description: Apps like Nifti and ShopSavvy can help you avoid the in-store crowds on Black Friday and still find the best deals.

title: Video Feature: Replacing the Black Friday Rush With a Few Leisurely Taps
description: This Black Friday, you wont find me charging into stores at the crack of dawn in search of supposed bargains. Thats because often the best prices for many products arent found on this famous shopping day. Instead, I plan to buy from the comfort of my couch, with the help of apps that tell me the optimal time to purchase things I want.

title: Zachary Quinto and Robin Tunney to Star in Smokefall Off Broadway
description: When Zachary Quinto returns to the stagein MCC Theaters Smokefall early next year, he will be joined by Robin Tunney of CBSs The Mentalist and Julia Garner, a costar with Lily Tomlin in the independent film Grandma.

title: Invisible Thread, a New Musical at Second Stage
description: When Griffin Matthews, a New York actor in his 20s tired of the usual audition-audition-rejection routine, decided to head to Uganda as a volunteer for a charity, he didnt have writing a musical in mind. But his work at an orphanage there and its life-changing aspects have become the basis for Invisible Thread, a musical he wrote with his partner, Matt Gould, coming to Second Stage Theater.

title: In Murray Hill, the Aha! Apartment
description: Last spring, Emily Beals was accepted by the New York University College of Nursing.

title: Obama Seeks to Reassure Skeptical Public on ISIS Fight
description: WASHINGTON  After meeting with his national security team, President Obama headed from the Situation Room upstairs to a bank of waiting cameras to reassure the nation on Wednesday that it had nothing to fear as it headed into the Thanksgiving weekend.

title: No Credible Threat Seen, Obama Says
description: President Obama said that the United States was safe going into the Thanksgiving holiday, declaring that no credible intelligence pointed to a plot on domestic soil.

title: How Allergan Deal Will Rebuild Pfizers War Chest
description: It sounds counterintuitive, but Pfizers $152 billion takeover of Allergan will rebuild the acquisitive drug giants war chest to do even more deals. Because it was structured as a merger, allowing it to flip its tax liabilities overseas, most of what Pfizer is paying comes in the form of stock. That means the pharma mega-beast will be flush with cash and eager to put it to work.

title: Toyota Expands Airbag Recall in Japan
description: TOKYO  Toyota Motor said on Wednesday it would replace potentially dangerous airbag inflaters in 1.6 million vehicles in Japan that it had previously judged were safe, further expanding the worlds biggest auto safety recall.

title: With TV Proposal, Ahmad Rashad Married Sport and Pop Culture
description: In the Henry Wadsworth Longfellow poem The Courtship of Miles Standish, the titular Pilgrim proposes to the lovely Priscilla Mullins by proxy  his roommate, John Alden, does it for him. Thirty Thanksgivings ago, on Nov. 28, 1985, the sportscaster Ahmad Rashad performed a similar ritual, asking for his intendeds hand through an intermediary on live television, before an estimated 40 million viewers.

title: Black Friday Falters as Consumer Behaviors Change
description: In 1939, the nations largest retailers sent Franklin D. Roosevelt an urgent plea. Thanksgiving fell on the last day of November that year, giving merchants too few days before Christmas to unleash the seasons sales.

title: Workshops of Empire, by Eric Bennett
description: Less than a lifetime ago, reputable American writers would occasionally start fistfights, sleep in ditches and even espouse Communist doctrines. Such were the prerogatives and exigencies of the artists existence, until M.F.A. programs arrived to impose discipline and provide livelihoods. Whether the professionalization of creative writing has been good for American literature has set off a lot of elegantly worded soul-searching and well-mannered debate recently, much of it in response to Mark McGurls seminal study, The Program Era. What Eric Bennetts Workshops of Empire contributes is an understanding of how Cold War politics helped to create the aesthetic standards that continue to rule over writing workshops today.

title: Im Frightened: After Attacks in Paris, New York Muslims Cope With a Backlash
description: The safety tips, concise and chilling, have been passed from friend to Muslim friend on social media, by imams to their congregations, by Islamic groups to their members, by parents to their children heading off to school:

title: Rem Koolhaass Firm Chosen for New Manchester Arts Center in England
description: Rem Koolhaass Office for Metropolitan Architecture has won an international competition to design the Factory Manchester, a major new arts center in Manchester, England. The project, which the firm won over high-profile shortlisted competitors like Rafael Violy, Zaha Hadid and Diller Scofidio + Renfro, will be the first large-scale British building for the Rotterdam-based practice, which this year completed the Garage Museum of Contemporary Art in Moscow and the Fondazione Prada in Milan.

title: 3 Tips on What to Wear This Holiday Season
description: This holiday season, dont hold back. A little black dress and heels will always be right, but glitz and glam summon the holiday spirit. For a festive punch, go for sparkle and stellar accessories. Only a Christmas grouch would suggest you tone it down.

description: To the Editor:

title: Andrew Norman on Loving Star Wars and Pushing Musical Boundaries

We watched it every weekend for, seriously, years on end, he said in October, during a short hike up a steep hill near his home. Fascinated by John Williamss classic score, Mr. Norman decided when he was young that he wanted to be a composer.

title: Robert Battle Finally Has His Steps in the Spotlight
description: It was a tight fit, and so not altogether a surprise when Jacqueline Green, gliding past a row of dancers, was suddenly smacked in the face.

title: Volkswagen Reveals Emissions Fix for Diesel Cars in Europe
description: WOLFSBURG, Germany  Volkswagen said on Wednesday that it would be able to bring its diesel cars into line with European clean-air standards by updating engine software and installing a small, tube-shaped part roughly the same diameter as the cardboard tube in a roll of paper towels.

title: Court Filing Challenges Competence of Sumner Redstone
description: LOS ANGELES  A former companion of the ailing media mogul Sumner M. Redstone, executive chairman of Viacom and CBS, challenged his mental competence on Wednesday in a detailed filing with the Los Angeles County Superior Court.

title: Pfizer Didnt Need an Inversion to Avoid Paying U.S. Taxes
description: Pfizers declaration that it intends to merge with Allergan and cut taxes by moving its tax home to Dublin from New York City has set off something of a furor.

title: Embattled Pennsylvania Attorney General Gets New Setback
description: Pennsylvania lawmakers took a significant step Wednesday toward removing from office the state attorney general, Kathleen G. Kane, who faces criminal charges. And Ms. Kane vowed a wide-ranging investigation into embarrassing emails from state officials, raising the stakes in a drama that has transfixed the state government for months.

title: Wall St. Faces Mounting Criticism From Regulators
description: Despite the fallout from the 2008 financial crisis, Wall Street still has a tendency to dismiss as frivolous some of the ethical issues it faces daily.

title: Selling China Doll: An Image Ready for Takeoff
description: China Doll is a top-selling ticket on Broadway thanks to the one-two punch of Al Pacino (star) and David Mamet (playwright). It could probably advertise with the word Pacino scribbled in crayon on toilet paper and still sell like hot cakes.

description: The musical world doesnt seem quite so huge when in the hands of Shaina Taub. This 27-year-old singer-songwriter has a knack for bridging the gap between genres and forms: She has sung jazz-influenced pop at Lincoln Center; written and arranged for theater and Sesame Street; and, fittingly, was the first signee of a venture between Razor & Tie Music Publishing and Ghostlight/Sh-K-Boom Records for songwriters who work in both pop and theater.

title: Scott Fagans Long Strange Trip, With Detours
description: Rock n roll is littered with stories about should-be stars who never got a shot. But increasingly, enterprising fans, filmmakers and archivists are bringing little-known talents to light. The folk musician Rodriguez became a sensation following Searching for Sugar Man, the Oscar-winning documentary exploring his disappearance. The singer Vashti Bunyan released one album in 1970, returning in 2005 after she was discovered by a new school of freak folk performers.

title: No, Kissing Bugs Are Not a New Scourge
description: If social media is any indication, many people are suddenly very concerned about dying from the bite of kissing bugs.

title: New York Store Openings and Other Shopping Events
description: On Black Friday, Alison Lou will open a holiday pop-up in SoHo. The jewel box of a space will be draped in navy velvet curtains and showcase the designer Alison Chemlas signature emoji jewelry, including a peace hand symbol necklace in gold ($495) and a crying face signet ring ($495). At 107 Mercer Street.

title: Consumer Bureau Faulted on Auto Lending Inquiry
description: A congressional report criticizing a 2013 settlement by Ally Financial over discriminatory auto lending practices could give more ammunition to lawmakers trying to abolish the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.

description: As an expected three million spectators turn their eyes skyward on Thursday morning, police sharpshooters on rooftops will be peering down for any signs of trouble at the Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade.

title: Publisher Releases Signed Edition of Harper Lees Watchman
description: Harper Lees novel Go Set a Watchman, one of the most widely debated and controversial books of the year, was an instant best seller when it was published in July, selling more than two million copies in its first two months on sale.

description: Jonathan Stewart is not a fan of your fantasy football team.

description: Residents of Nairobi, Kenya, met Pope Francis' motorcade with Kenyan flags and songs.

title: The Big Green Tent, by Ludmila Ulitskaya
description: Ludmila Ulitskayas latest novel, The Big Green Tent, is as grand, solid and impressively all-encompassing as its title implies. Yet the fact that it covers the Soviet dissident movement with such force shouldnt be surprising. After all, Ulitskaya has an intimate knowledge of the subject. One of 21st-century Russias most prominent writers, she was among the dissidents of the Soviet era and she opposes Vladimir Putin now.

title: Fleeing North Korea
description: A THOUSAND MILES TO FREEDOMMy Escape From North KoreaBy Eunsun Kim with Sbastien FallettiTranslated by David Tian228 pp. St. Martins, $24.99.

title: Margaret Atwood: By the Book
description: The author, most recently, of The Heart Goes Last met Gnter Grass at a Cold War literary festival in Finland: He thought I was either the secretary or the floozy, Im not sure which.

title: India at War, by Yasmin Khan
description: In October and November 1962, India and China fought a brief war in the high Himalayas. That conflict is still a large part of the Indian consciousness, with dozens of scholarly works and popular accounts being written about it. It is seen as a moment of humiliation, both personal and national, when Jawaharlal Nehru lost his credibility as prime minister and India lost the leadership of Asia to its archrival, China.

title: Kevin Barrys Beatlebone
description: Some of the very best fiction is spun from a single filament of fact woven tightly  or loosely, if necessary  in and out of an asymmetrical framework of empathy, imagination and sheer audacity. Michael Ondaatjes Coming Through Slaughter (about the early jazz trumpeter Buddy Bolden) and Nick Tosches In the Hand of Dante (about, among other things, the writing of The Divine Comedy) come to mind, both masterly literary extrapolations.

title: John Irvings Avenue of Mysteries
description: As the author of 14 novels, John Irving flaunts his obsessions: fatherless children, clergymen, prostitutes, circuses and, of course, writers. Alongside these fascinations is the one that haunts us all: the personal past that surrounds us like faces in a crowd.

title: The Evolution of Everything, by Matt Ridley
description: What are we to make of the following developments?

title: Mary Gaitskills The Mare
description: Desire and damage have long intertwined, an inseparable couple, in the work of Mary Gaitskill. With her first collection of stories in 1988, Bad Behavior, Gaitskill staked out her territory: love, or something, among the ruins  the ruins of self, the ruins of hope, the ruins created by cruelty, both literal and psychological. In Gaitskills work, people hurt one another for fun, for spite, inadvertently, because they can, and (as she titled a later collection) because they wanted to. In one of Gaitskills most famous stories, Secretary, which later became a film of the same name, an alienated young woman is sexually used by her boss, but finds the encounter has an array of effects. She is simultaneously dissociated, disgusted, turned on, depressed, oddly loyal to the boss and somehow liberated. It is not right, and it also awakens something vital in her. Gaitskills story doesnt prioritize one emotion over any others or draw any moral conclusions. As she wrote in a 1994 Harpers essay, On Not Being a Victim, pain can be an experience that defies codification. In that story, as in much of Gaitskills work, the heroines ability to remain aware of all uncodifiable experience, to turn it over and examine it, is how she stays alive.

title: Tunisia Says Attack in Capital Was Suicide Bombing
description: TUNIS  The government of Tunisia said that a suicide bomber had set off the explosion on Tuesday that killed 12 members of the presidential guard in downtown Tunis and moved on Wednesday to step up security around the country.

description: Eagles (4-6) at Lions (3-7)

title: Jessica Jones Episode 6: The Truth Comes Out
Its A Conspiracy!
description: Greg Sargent has lately been driving home the point that Donald Trump just isnt vulnerable to typical establishment attacks  at least in the Republican primary. (The general election might be different.) Catch him making an utterly false assertion, and his supporters just see it as the liberal media conspiring against him. Its driving the establishment Republicans wild.

description: Frank Gifford, a Hall of Fame running back who was involved in one of the most brutal collisions in the N.F.L.s history, was found to have had chronic traumatic encephalopathy, a degenerative brain disease.

title: Kentuckys Governor Lets the (Formerly Incarcerated) People Vote
description: Gov. Steven L. Beshear of Kentucky did a good thing on Tuesday when he issued an executive order making about 140,000 residents of his state with a nonviolent felony conviction immediately eligible to register to vote.

title: Review: In Carly Simons Memoir, Few Secrets Left Untold
description: Carly Simon would like to correct the notion that she is any kind of bourgeois princess, even if one of the first things she did after marrying in 1972 was to change her Bloomingdales charge card to read Mrs. James Taylor. Her upbringing as a privileged daughter of Richard L. Simon, a founder of Simon & Schuster, used to be held against her. In her bohemian days  that is, when she wore bohemian clothes  it may even have hurt her professionally. Albert Grossman, the manager whose clients included Bob Dylan, called her a nine out of a perfect 10, docked one point because of her prosperous background. Its rare for managers to take offense at money.

title: On Dark Sky Island, Enya Doesnt Stray Far From Continuity and Comfort
description: Dark Sky Island

title: Britains Treasury Chief Drops Plan to Cut Welfare
description: LONDON  George Osborne, the British chancellor of the Exchequer, abandoned a plan on Wednesday to cut welfare benefits, making a significant tactical retreat in his drive to shrink the British state and balance its budget.

title: Classical Playlist: Beethoven, Handel and Bach
description: BEETHOVEN: Symphonies No. 5 and 7Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra; Manfred Honeck, conductor(Reference Recordings)Ninety seconds is all it takes to understand that Manfred Honecks is no sanitized Beethoven: the plethora of colorations, articulations and moods through which he forces the Fifths famous motto sees to that. Every phrase, every balance has been thought through in interventionist readings that are idiosyncratic but fully attuned to the spirit, if not the letter, of the scores. Despite superb playing and audio quality, Beethoven so Romantic wont convince everybody. Still, this partnership seems incapable of laying down an ordinary recording. (David Allen)

The Los Angeles project, slated for 2016, will star Scott Porter, who played Jason Street in the television show, and be produced by Lindsey Rosin and Jordan Ross, producers behind musical spoofs of Cruel Intentions and The O.C.

description: Mutant

Not long after Andris Nelsons finished his first season as music director of the Boston Symphony Orchestra earlier this year, he was also appointed to the Leipzig Gewandhaus Orchestra in Germany.

The next step should registering that phone on the governments do-not-call list at donotcall.gov.

title: Hey, Are You Looking at Me? Good. Now, Buzz Off.
description: Lets see. Theres slow food, slow TV, slow cinema, slow theater, slow art, and now slow fame, in which stars spend several hours (or a few days) critiquing being famous. Two weeks ago, the actor turned stunt artist Shia LaBeouf took a seat toward the front of the house at the Angelika Film Center in Manhattan and watched all 29 of his movies, uninterrupted, in reverse chronology. The camera positioned in front of his aisle seat recorded and streamed live every second of his willing descent into stewed narcissism, which was called #AllMyMovies.

description: WASHINGTON  The Treasury Department on Wednesday announced sanctions against a Syrian construction executive it said was helping President Bashar al-Assad buy oil from the Islamic State, as well as against a Russian businessman who leads the World Chess Federation and who is accused of having financial dealings with the Syrian leader.

title: Bad Cheer: The Holiday Exchange Precipitating Bridge of Spies

title: What James Donovan Did After the Bridge of Spies
description: Just six months after the spy swap at the center of Steven Spielbergs Bridge of Spies, James B. Donovan, the New York lawyer who negotiated that exchange in real life, sat down in Havana with Fidel Castro for high-stakes talks about the prisoners captured after the disastrous Bay of Pigs invasion attempt.

description: Photos from Greece, the West Bank, Saudi Arabia and the United States.

title: What Will Your Kids Cook for Thanksgiving?
description: Even for the most seasoned, passionate cooks, Thanksgiving for a crowd is daunting. (Right? Tell me Im right.) I love to cook, but the big meal for 20 coming up Thursday does have me frantically scrawling grocery lists and timetables and enlisting various family members to produce their specialties (and to buy the wine).

title: The Short-Order Sofa
description: A new breed of online furniture manufacturers offers high-end quality and customization  and often a quick turnaround time  at low-end prices.

title: Review: Complexions Contemporary Ballet Recycles With Chronicle
description: Choreographers are often fueled by the last dance they made, so for the vigilant viewer watching how one bleeds into the next can be an enthralling way to follow an artists career. Dwight Rhoden, who along with Desmond Richardson is a founding artistic director of Complexions Contemporary Ballet, quelled that notion on Tuesday with his two-part Chronicle, in which he takes inspiration from an older dance to create an evening-length work.

title: The Near-Impossibility of Assimilation in Belgium
description: Some years ago, I was invited to sit on a panel in Antwerp  together with other distinguished foreigners, in the words of the panel organizer  to discuss language and culture in Flanders. I had, by then, become a naturalized Belgian, but I had never felt accepted enough to claim that identity; when people asked where I was from, I still said Nigeria. I had come to Belgium as an adult. Neither my Dutch nor my French was as fluent as the average Belgians. Perhaps, I reasoned, people had every right to deny me access to that identity.

title: Thanksgiving Throwdowns Are Good for You
description: The Democratic National Committee is ready for Thanksgiving  and any fraught family moments that all the holiday togetherness might bring. On Tuesday, the organization released an updated version of YourRepublicanUncle.com, a website aimed at arming Democrats with the rhetorical ammunition they need to argue with conservative relatives.

title: Perfect Black Friday Fare: An Oversized Book About Overconsumption
description: As the world (no longer just the United States) prepares for the shopping blitz called Black Friday, which has increasingly migrated into Thanksgiving Thursday in the United States, I find myself asking a question about some illustrated books on environmental themes that have come to me at The Times in recent months.

Speaking to Vice in a video interview, the bands singer, Jesse Hughes, broke down in tears several times while describing coming face to face with one of the gunmen and the horrors that audience members endured. But he vowed the band would return to France.

title: New Catfish Inspections Stir Debate Over Safety vs. Trade
description: WASHINGTON  After years of delay, the Agriculture Department on Wednesday established tough new rules to inspect imported catfish, yielding to pressure from domestic catfish producers that risks retaliation from Americas trade partners.

description: A Rikers Island correction officer has been arrested on charges that he tried to smuggle seven scalpels, synthetic marijuana and a prescription painkiller into the New York City jail complex, presumably to sell to inmates, the citys Investigation Department announced on Wednesday.

title: What Is It About Adele?
description: Adele has had quite a week.

description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Wednesday signed a defense bill into law despite provisions that will continue to impede his goal of closing the wartime prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba. But he again suggested that he thought those provisions might be unconstitutional and not necessarily binding.
