title: Iceland, Ireland, and Devaluation Denial
description: One of the big lessons of the euro crisis has been that Milton Friedman was right  not about monetarism, but about the case for flexible exchange rates. When big adjustments in a countrys wages and prices relative to trading partners are necessary, its much easier to achieve these adjustments via currency depreciation than via relative deflation  which is one main reason there have been such big costs to the euro.

title: Kobe Bryants Decline Puts Lakers on Wrong Side of History
description: The Warriors have become the first N.B.A. team to start a season 16-0. On Tuesday, the 76ers could become the first to start 0-19. In each case, the opponent for the record-breaking game is the Lakers.

title: Driver Charged in Death of Retired Police Officer on Thanksgiving in Brooklyn
description: The retired police officer, alone on Thanksgiving night, had just picked up a newspaper about a mile from her home in Brooklyn when she stepped into the street to get into her minivan.

title: Allowing Pop-Up Windows From Approved Sites
With N.F.L. Defenses Mining for Fumbles, Runners Treat the Ball Like Gold
description: PHILADELPHIA  Greeting entrants to the locker room at the Eagles training complex is a nearly 7-foot-tall orange tackling dummy. Its right arm, elevated at a 90-degree angle like a passers, and its left, lowered and tucked into the body like a runners, each have half of a football stitched into them.

title: As Gay Rights Ally, Bernie Sanders Wasnt Always in Vanguard
description: BURLINGTON, Vt.  As Senator Bernie Sanders tries to distinguish himself from Hillary Rodham Clinton and rally his progressive base, one issue where he has claimed a clear advantage is in the long battle over gay rights.

title: Amaranto
description: The food of Puebla at a family-run restaurant in Bushwick, Brooklyn.

title: Amaranto in Bushwick Is a Family Effort
description: At Amaranto in Bushwick, Brooklyn, the tamale arrives bare, shorn of its corn-husk wrap and half-submerged in chilpachole, a reddish-gold crab broth tasting of sea floor and muddy burrows, as if siphoned from the Gulf of Mexico. Mussels gawk from the bowl, mouths full of chorizo, cut in hunks like lardons.

title: What I Love | Sierra Boggess
description: The actress, a star of Broadways School of Rock, on her new Upper West Side apartment.

title: Broadways Sierra Boggess at Home
description: Whenever Sierra Boggess has the slightest flicker of doubt about the progress of her career, she can find quick reassurance on the ego wall near the entrance to her apartment on the Upper West Side.

title: Leftovers!
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: HUD Homes at Half Price
description: A little-known program sponsored by the Department of Housing and Urban Development allows police officers, teachers, firefighters and emergency medical technicians to buy certain homes for half price. But financing these purchases comes with some strings attached.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Dark Matter and the Dinosaurs
description: This week, Lisa Randall talks about Dark Matter and the Dinosaurs; Alexandra Alter has news from the publishing world; Louisa Lim discusses five new memoirs about fleeing North Korea; and John Williams has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

title: Roman Polanski Will Not Be Extradited to U.S., Poland Says
description: WARSAW  Poland will not extradite Roman Polanski to the United States on charges of having sex with a minor, after Polish prosecutors sided with the director and declined to appeal a court ruling against the extradition. This decision effectively closes the yearlong case of the Oscar-winning director here.

title: Home Sales Around the New York Region
description: Information on sales in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Philippines Hopes Website Will Help Find Art Owned by Imelda Marcos
description: The Philippine government is starting a crowdsourcing website to try to find some 200 prized pieces of art  by Picasso, Van Gogh, Michelangelo, Rembrandt and others  last believed to have been in the collection of Imelda R. Marcos, the countrys profligate former first lady known for owning 3,000 pairs of shoes and inspiring anOff Broadway musical.

title: As Pope Francis Visit Nears, Central African Republic Violence Rises
description: GENEVA  Only days before Pope Francis is scheduled to visit the Central African Republic, the United Nations warned on Friday that a resurgence of violence in the conflict-torn nation has driven tens of thousands of people from their homes and increasingly threatens the delivery of humanitarian aid to the impoverished population.

title: An Alley Entrance for a NoHo Condo
description: The New York City alley, in all its grittiness, has long been a Hollywood favorite. Yet, in reality, New York has only a handful of them, as the designers of the citys grid left little room for such passageways. Now one of the remaining few, Great Jones Alley, between Broadway and Lafayette Street, will assume a more rarefied role when it becomes the exclusive entrance for a 12-story condominium.

title: Jim Gilmore Uses Free Airtime for Ad Tied to ISIS Threat
description: Dont say Donald J. Trump hasnt done Jim Gilmore any favors.

title: At Grace Farms, Encountering Art at Every Bend
description: Up close, each of the small silvered glass cubes in Teresita Fernndezs installation Double Glass River holds a tiny reflection of the glorious landscape it faces. From farther away, approximately 10,000 of those cubes coalesce into a flowing form stretching 61 feet across a curved wall. Wherever viewers stand, the piece changes with the weather, the season and the time of day.

title: Israel to Open Diplomatic Office in United Arab Emirates
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank  Israel will open a diplomatic office in the United Arab Emirates, officials said Friday, the first time in more than a decade that there will be an official Israeli presence in the Persian Gulf.

title: What Consumers Need to Know About Takata Airbag Recalls
description: Heres what several automakers said when asked if new vehicles have Takata airbag inflaters, faulty versions of which have been linked to several deaths.

title: Navigating the Takata Airbag Recall
description: People take dozens of uncalculated risks each day. Every time they swallow a pill, bite into a burger or get behind the wheel, they are trusting the systems that delivered those products to market.

title: Stuff We Liked: Thanksgiving Facts andRenaissance Table Manners
description: It should come as no surprise that some of the stuff we liked this week was Thanksgiving-related.

title: Gentrification in a Brooklyn Neighborhood Forces Residents to Move On
description: They are a living reminder of the challenges facing a city struggling to make room for all its current residents, and all the new ones to come: the people of an older Crown Heights, who cannot afford the new.

title: Working to Lower Drug Costs by Challenging Questionable Patents
description: J. Kyle Bass made a fortune in the financial crisis when his hedge fund, Hayman Capital Management, bet big against subprime mortgages. Now Mr. Bass is wagering against pharmaceutical companies that he says exploit the patent system, keeping drug prices  and their profits  in the stratosphere.

title: A Famous Crooner Paints the Good Life
description: Mornings in Central Park, Tony Bennett can often be found indulging his passion for painting before the crowds arrive.

title: Tony Bennett Finds His Heart in Central Park
description: Tony Bennett sat on a green bench in the morning calm of Central Park, painting the fiery foliage of a tree reflecting against a duck pond.

title: New York Celebrates Billy Strayhorns Centennial With Special A Train Ride
description: All aboard the A Train! This Sunday, Jazz at Lincoln Center will celebrate the centennial of jazz great Billy Strayhorn with a series of performances  including a surprise pop-up concert on the subway that inspired Strayhorns most famous composition, Take the A Train.

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks properties include a five-bedroom in Holmdel, N.J., and a six-bedroom in Sea Cliff, N.Y.

title: Homes for Sale in New York and New Jersey
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in the New York region:

title: Big Ticket | The Dakota
description: Lauren Bacalls three-bedroom co-op apartment was sold by her estate for $21 million.

title: Lauren Bacalls Dakota Apartment Sold for $21 Million
description: The grand apartment at the landmark Dakota that Lauren Bacall called home for more than half a century, filling its nine commodious rooms with an eclectic mix of artwork, antiques and countless mementos, many of them from her fabled Hollywood career, sold for $21,000,000 and was the most expensive closed sale of the week, according to city records.

title: How Daniel Jacobs, Boxing World Champion, Spends His Sundays
description: Daniel Jacobs, a son of Brownsville, Brooklyn, is the World Boxing Associations middleweight champion. Before that, he was a cancer survivor. Mr. Jacobs, 28, learned he had osteosarcoma in 2011, which could have ended his career. Instead, after surgery and radiation, he returned to the ring 19 months later and has been undefeated since. He is set to defend his title against Peter Quillin at Barclays Center next Saturday. In the months before a fight, Mr. Jacobs lives and trains on Long Island, leaving only to spend Sundays in Brooklyn with his partner, Natalie Stevens, 28, a makeup artist, and their son, Nathaniel Jacobs, 6.

title: Once inGuantnamo, Afghan Now Leads War Against Taliban and ISIS
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Hajji Ghalib did just what the American military feared he would after his release from the Guantnamo Bay prison camp: He returned to the Afghan battlefield.

title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn and Manhattan
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in New York City:

title: A Review of Miracle on 34th Street: The Musical
description: When the show now known as Miracle on 34th Street: The Musical had its Broadway premiere in 1963, it was called Heres Love, and received reviews that varied wildly, including a rather dismissive one from The New York Times (right off the assembly line, shrewdly engineered, the critic Howard Taubman wrote).

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are in the East Village; in Greenwich Village; and in Park Slope Brooklyn.

title: When Some Turn to Church, Others Go to CrossFit
description: Ali Huberlie, a 27-year-old education consultant in Boston, awakens at 4:45 every morning to go to her CrossFit box, or gym, where she spends two hours. When she and her boyfriend, whom she met through CrossFit, went apartment-hunting, they chose a neighborhood near their box. This year, as a student at Harvard Business School, Ms. Huberlie wrote a case study about a founder of CrossFit that was incorporated into the schools curriculum. And when Harvard Divinity School researchers were studying spaces other than churches that function as spiritual communities, they interviewed Ms. Huberlie.

title: Fantasy Football Week 12: Rankings and Matchup Analysis
description: Fantasy football analysis for N.F.L. Week 12 games and Mondays matchup between the Baltimore Ravens and the Cleveland Browns. You can also follow the Sablich brothers on Twitter at @5thDownFantasy and see their complete Week 12 player rankings.

title: Her Art Hangs in Museums and Empire
description: AGE 34

title: Suspect Charged in Chicago Shooting
description: Chicago police announced that charges have been brought against 27-year-old Corey Morgan for shooting 9-year-old Tyshawn Lee.

title: Anger Over Killing by Police Halts Shopping in Chicago
description: CHICAGO  Hundreds of demonstrators on Friday marched down the middle of North Michigan Avenue, the citys premier downtown shopping district, forcing the police to close the six-lane thoroughfare to vehicles and prompting some businesses to lock their doors for at least part of one of the busiest shopping days of the year.

title: Justin Bieber and Ariana Grande Use an Award Show to Speed a Comeback
description: Watching the rapturous reactions to the performances of Justin Bieber and Ariana Grande on the American Music Awards last Sunday, you would have been hard-pressed to recall that one was an immature scofflaw recently dismissed as a has-been, and the others career seemed all but dead after getting caught on video licking a doughnut at a Southern California bakery and saying, I hate America.

title: Baking Books 2015
description: Dessert cookbooks from Food52, the Violet Bakery in London, Franois Payard, and more.

title: Joseph Silverstein, Violinist and Boston Symphony Concertmaster, Dies at 83
description: Joseph Silverstein, a conductor and violinist who was concertmaster of the Boston Symphony Orchestra for 22 years, died on Nov. 21 in Springfield, Mass. He was 83.

title: The Sound of Mavericks at Copland House
description: The sun was setting outside Aaron Coplands home in Cortlandt Manor as November winds began to blow. But inside, amid the cozy music room, the rehearsal was heating up as the pianist Michael Boriskin and the ensemble Music From Copland House rendered a rousing version of Charles Ivess epic Trio for Violin, Cello and Piano.

title: Baking Cookbooks That (Gently) Push the Limits
description: With cookbooks, those on the savory side have a lot more leeway to showcase innovative ideas and far-flung dishes. Armchair chefs are just as happy to read about smoking eels over green hay and butchering small game as they are to find a recipe for the best macaroni and cheese.

title: 3 Are Dead in Colorado Springs Shootout at Planned Parenthood Center
description: COLORADO SPRINGS  A gun battle erupted inside a Planned Parenthood center here on Friday when a man armed with an assault-style rifle opened fire and began shooting at officers as they rushed to the scene. The authorities reported that three people were killed, a police officer and two civilians, and nine were wounded before the suspect finally surrendered more than five hours after the first shots were fired.

title: Things to Do in New Jersey, Nov. 27 to Dec. 6, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: Scientists Link Moons Tilt and Earths Gold
description: The moons orbit is askew, and two planetary scientists believe that they have come up with a good reason.

title: Black-ish Star Yara Shahidi Is a Role Model Off-Screen
description: Life as a teenager can be down right chaotic, the actress Yara Shahidi, 15, told an audience last month at Cipriani 42nd Street, where she was being honored by the Young Womens Leadership Network. We must also realize that it is up to us whether these years will feel like a melancholy struggle or an opportunity for growth or experiences of a lifetime.

title: Supreme Court Justice Intervenes in Native Hawaiian Election
description: WASHINGTON  Justice Anthony M. Kennedy on Friday ordered officials in Hawaii not to count ballots or name the winners of an election there in which only people of native Hawaiian ancestry could vote.

title: News Article Appears to Contradict Trumps Claim About Reporter
description: The New York Daily News released an archived news article on Friday that seemed to contradict a claim by Donald J. Trump that he knew nothing about a reporter whose disability Mr. Trump appeared to mock at a rally earlier this week.

title: College Football Games to Watch on Saturday
description: No. 8 Ohio State at No. 12 Michigan

title: Things to Do on Long Island, Nov. 27 to Dec. 6, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Review: Trifonov Caps Rachmaninoff Fest With Pianistic Verve
description: Not every new board member of the New York Philharmonic gets to celebrate his or her ascendance by playing Rachmaninoffs Third Piano Concerto to a full house at David Geffen Hall. And thank goodness for that.

title: Adele Goes Viral, No Selfies or Tweets Needed
description: There is no one in music quite like Adele.

title: Adele Joins Limp Bizkit in an Exclusive Club
description: The singers 25 sold 3.38 million copies in the United States through its first week. The last time an album sold nearly that well was in 2000, when 2.4 million copies of No Strings Attached by N Sync were sold.

title: 36 Hours in Adelaide, Australia
description: No longer simply a stop on the way to its celebrated wine region, the city has seen a revival of cafes and an arts scene, among other draws.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review Podcast: Lisa Randalls Dark Matter and the Dinosaurs
description: Listen to this weeks podcast | Subscribe: iTunes | Stitcher

title: Review: Ann Hampton Callaway Honors Her Predecessors at Feinsteins/54 Below
description: Ann Hampton Callaway belongs to the school of gifted pop singers for whom majestic vocal display is not enough. Along with Barbra Streisand and Celine Dion, to name two obvious examples, Ms. Callaway uses pyrotechnics as a platform for conveying inspirational messages of peace and hope. And the opening-night performance of her new show at Feinsteins/54 Below, Feminine Persuasion: Ann Hampton Callaway Celebrates Women Songwriters, often had a sticky undertone of sentimentality.

title: Shooting in Planned Parenthood Clinic
description: Authorities responded to an active shooter near a Planned Parenthood clinic in Colorado Springs.

title: The Pain in Spain Falls Mainly Away From BBVA
description: BBVA, Spains second-largest bank, is often seen as more conservative than its Spanish peers. That reputation now looks deserved. The bank is the only major domestic player that does not have exposure to Abengoa, the Spanish engineering company seeking protection from its creditors.

title: Restaurant Review: Porta Napoli Offers Pizza for Every Palate
description: In early September, Porta Napoli in Harrison took the place of Rue des Crepes, known for its theatrical Parisian dcor and its neatly folded buckwheat crepes. It is Naples, not Paris, that the new proprietors hope to bring to mind. Authenticity is the catchword. Wood embers glow in a fire-engine-red pizza oven, which spreads cheer like a giant emoji. Menu headings are in Italian (sfizi, insalate, pizze rossi, pizze bianche). The flour in the supple pizza dough is 00 (doppio zero), as required by the Associazione Verace Pizza Napoletana. The wine list covers regions from Sicily to the Alps but never strays beyond Italys borders.

title: In London, Portuguese Fare, Served With a Twist
description: Though the chef Nuno Mendes was born in Lisbon and trained mostly in the United States, its his London restaurants  Chiltern Firehouse, for example  that have gained attention. His latest is Taberna do Mercado in East Londons Old Spitalfields Market. The informal, tightly packed 40-seat restaurant (with additional tables and a charcoal grill outside) looks like a sleek version of a Portuguese tavern: nothing fancy, but with plenty of attention to materials and details (including seating that is all too authentic: Some of the wooden chairs are really too small for grown-ups). The atmosphere is convivial; we had fun at the tiny concrete-topped bar, drinking and watching sausages being sliced.

title: As World Leaders Launch Paris Climate Talks Monday, Bill Gates Will Launch a Supporting Science Push
description: Heres the White House announcement on Mission Innovation and Bill Gatess explanation of the Breakthrough Energy Coalition:

title: Permanent Punk Invasion
description: This is Pepe, said Denise Mercedes, pulling out another cigarette and walking past her resplendent white cockatoo. You should see him dance. He knows more about music than half the people Ive played with.

title: Review: Nora, Ingmar Bergmans Adaptation of Henrik Ibsens A Dolls House
description: Torvald Helmer isnt generally viewed as a likable guy, but Ingmar Bergman thought of him that way. To him, the injured party at the end of Henrik Ibsens A Dolls House is Helmer, crushed by the aggression and brutality of his wife, Nora.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week.

title: Restaurant Review: At Atelier Florian in New Haven, Seafood Is King
description: Is there a better finish to a cold, blustery day on the New England coast than a steaming bowl of bouillabaisse? I mean the real deal: a rich, tomatoey, fish broth fragrant with saffron, fennel and garlic, and crowded with seafood that  if youre lucky  was caught just a few miles away.

title: Restaurant Review: At Sandbar, Familiar French Hands Behind the Menu
description: Sandbar, a sparkling new restaurant that opened in Cold Spring Harbor in late September, is a beauty. Diners enter through a bar with a soaring glass ceiling and emerge into an elegant dining room with plenty of windows, 11 chandeliers and pale, sand-colored walls. The light, bright room nonetheless has a subdued nautical look, with antique mahogany half hulls lining the walls, along with lovely paintings of the harbor by local artists.

title: Window Onto a Butcher Shop at the Cooper Hewitt
description: When visitors walk through the big bronze doors of the Cooper Hewitt, Smithsonian Design Museum on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, they are issued the Pen, the institutes remarkable Internet-accessible stylus. The 1901 Beaux-Arts building then becomes, in the words of The Atlantic magazine, the museum of the future.

title: An Expats Eye on Greece
description: Dimitri Melloss guide to his native land aims to take viewers past the pretty postcard images of sun-drenched beaches.

title: Pictures of the Day: France and Elsewhere
description: France and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Where Mere Mannequins Fear to Tread
description: Christmastime windows at department stores grow more elaborate.

title: The Artist Behind Candice Swanepoels Leather Victorias Secret Wings
description: A hairy wolfs head that doubles as a shoulder bag glowers from a wall at Jordan Bettens studio in West Chelsea. Striking it may be, but its not for sale, said Mr. Betten, the 41-year-old founder of Lost Art, a leather goods company that caters pretty much exclusively to fashion and rock royalty.

title: Nov. 27, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from France, Kenya, Greece and Belgium.

title: Foul-Mouthed and Proud of It on the 16 Campaign Trail
description: Donald J. Trump pledged to bomb the, uh, stuffing out of the Islamic State.

title: Jaco, a Documentary About the Jazz Musician Jaco Pastorius
description: When Jaco Pastorius first met Joe Zawinul, the keyboardist and composer behind Weather Report, he had his introduction ready. My name is John Francis Pastorius III, he said, as Zawinul later remembered. Im the greatest bass player in the world.

title: New Womens Political Party in Britain Demands Faster Equality
description: LONDON  It may seem an inopportune time to start a new party, given Britains crowded political scene, but Sandi Toksvig says she is tired of waiting.

title: National Geographic Takes Travelers to the Falklands
description: Lindblad Expeditions-National Geographic is introducing Falklands 360, its circumnavigation of the Falkland Islands. The voyage will also feature a visit to Argentinas Isla de los Estados, a national nature preserve. Set aboard the 102-passenger National Geographic Orion, the 13-day expedition will depart twice in October next year. Rates begin at $10,850 per person based on double occupancy.

title: Bill Cunningham |Bagatelle
description: Accessories and charms are dangling from bags and carryalls. The idea started with the Fendi Lagerfeld fur-doll charm, but Victor-John Villanuevas portraits have enlarged the idea to the level of a childs fantasy or the balloons in the Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade. A favored subject of Mr. Villanueva is the late performance artist Leigh Bowery, an outrageously dressed drag provocateur from Australia who was the toast of London clubs in the 1980s.

title: Evening Hours | Pre-Thanksgiving Rush
description: Celebrating a Parisiennes style, cultural exchange and more.

title: Review: In The Spymasters, C.I.A. Leaders Recount Tactics of the Post-9/11 Years
description: The Spymasters begins with an act of vengeance.

title: The Seasons Fashion Books From Cindy Crawford, Terry Richardson and More
description: Theres often an exotic quality to the massive, lushly photographed books that emerge on coffee tables every holiday season: They dazzle the eye with distant icebergs, cheetah-flecked savannas, endangered birds midflight, coral reefs and majestic mountains. But some of this years most striking gift books evoke the natural beauty of monuments much nearer at hand.

title: Preparing The Golden Bride for Its Big Day
description: Rachel Policar, a 27-year-old with a masters degree in vocal performance, has been trained to sing German, French and Italian. Yiddish? Not so much.

title: Kentucky, Beacon for Health Law, Now a Lab for Its Retreat
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Carolyn Bouchard, a diabetic with a slowly healing shoulder fracture, hurried to see her doctor after Matt Bevin was elected governor here this month.

title: A Slippery Number: How Many Books Can Fit in the New York Public Library?
description: As New York mysteries go, it hardly competes with Whos buried in Grants tomb? or How many pigeons live in the five boroughs? But for devotees of the New York Public Library, the question of how many books can be stored in the majestic central stacks on Fifth Avenue is far from academic. They say it goes to the heart of the librarys mission to keep as many research books as possible within arms reach of scholars.

title: Gunfire at a Colorado Planned Parenthood Clinic
description: A gunman inside the clinic in Colorado Springs engaged in a shootout with the police, killing three people and wounding others.

title: Evening Hours | Pre-Thanksgiving Rush
description: Celebrating a Parisiennes style, cultural exchange and more.

title: Bill Gates Expected to Create Billion-Dollar Fund for Clean Energy
description: WASHINGTON  Bill Gates will announce the creation of a multibillion-dollar clean energy fund on Monday at the opening of a Paris summit meeting intended to forge a global accord to cut planet-warming emissions, according to people with knowledge of the plans.

title: Bobs Are Back
description: Naomi Campbell, Gigi Hadid, Demi Lovato and more sport winters It-chop.

title: BTG Pactual, Brazilian Bank, Seeks to Calm Investors After C.E.O.s Arrest
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  With its chief executive in jail, BTG Pactual tried to calm investors on Friday, saying that it would cooperate with any investigation.

title: Maps of the Shooting at a Planned Parenthood Clinic
description: A gunman injured at least 11 people, including five police officers, at a Planned Parenthood clinic in Colorado Springs.

title: Friday Night Music: The Civil Wars, Billie Jean
description: Last week I featured The Lone Bellow reinterpreting the Rolling Stones, which was great; but by far the most revelatory cover Ive ever heard is this one, by the oh-so-sadly broken-up Civil Wars:

title: Black Voices Against Black Friday
description: Protesters gathered on Chicagos main shopping streets Friday to disrupt the shopping frenzy and draw attention to what they say is police brutality.

title: Road to Robotic Parking IsLittered With Faulty Projects
description: MIAMI BEACH  It seemed like the perfect night life accessory for the South Beach set  an automated robotic parking garage where trendy clubgoers could park their Porsches with a futuristic touch of a button.

title: Cubans Protest Stricter Rules for Traveling to Ecuador
description: MEXICO CITY  Dozens of Cubans crowded outside Ecuadors embassy in Havana on Friday, worried and angry about new rules that require Cubans to have a visa to enter Ecuador, which is a vital steppingstone for islanders trying to migrate to the United States.

title: Instability in Marketplaces Draws Concern on Both Sides of Health Law
description: WASHINGTON  The latest turmoil in health insurance marketplaces created by the Affordable Care Act has emboldened advocates on both sides of the political spectrum, providing ammunition to conservatives who want to shrink the federal role and liberals who want to expand it.

title: Paris Attacks Darken Tone of G.O.P. Campaign Ads
description: The terrorist attacks in Paris immediately changed the course of the presidential race as national security and foreign policy rose to the top of stump speeches and television interviews.

title: Massachusettss Common Core Path
description: To the Editor:

title: Taking a Different Tack on Mental Illness
description: To the Editor:

title: Boy Scouts, With Girls
description: To the Editor:

title: M.T.A. Contract Workers Push for Higher Wages and Better Working Conditions
description: Month after month, workers from a call center in Queens arrived at the Metropolitan Transportation Authoritys board meetings in Lower Manhattan to complain about low wages, a hostile work environment and bedbugs in their office.

title: With Fewer Skaters, N.H.L. Hopes for More All-Star Competitiveness
description: The N.H.L. announced last week that the All-Star Game, which had essentially become an Ice Capades, with virtually no contact and far too many goals, would be played in a three-on-three format, which has been used for the first time this season in the five-minute overtime period.

title: Mental Illness Cited in Murder Case of Manhattan Hedge Fund Manager
description: A few years ago, Thomas Gilbert Jr. appeared to have it all: movie-star looks, wealthy parents, an Ivy League education and entree to elite social circles in Manhattan and the Hamptons.

title: Two Sets of Twins Trace Lifetime Link to Two Teammates
description: As a rookie linebacker and long snapper with the Dallas Cowboys in 1984, Steve DeOssie assumed a mentality of being crazy all the time. A second-year teammate, however, made an important impression. Defensive end Jim Jeffcoat showed DeOssie that it was possible to assume a separate mentality off the field.

title: Black Friday Shopping Shifts Online as Stores See Less Foot Traffic
description: In shops across the country, including the empty malls of Georgia and the not too crazy crowds at struggling J. Crew, the relative calm that accompanied Black Friday shopping this year belied a frenzy for deals  many of them on the web.

title: The New Atomic Age We Need
description: THIS past summer, the Group of 7 nations promised urgent and concrete action to limit climate change. What actions exactly? Activists hope for answers from the coming United Nations climate conference in Paris, which begins Monday. They should look instead to Washington today.

title: Affordable Housing vs. Gentrification
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio has a plan that he says will preserve economically diverse neighborhoods in New York City, significantly and permanently increase the affordable-housing supply and create a more attractive streetscape. In community meetings across the city, New Yorkers are finally having their chance to say whether they agree with him.

title: Frances Cult of Fearlessness
description: Paris  SINCE the attacks two weeks ago, Ive been avoiding supermarkets  which seem like potential targets  and doing most of my shopping at a minimarket. The cashier there, a young man from Mali, keeps telling me not to be afraid.

title: President Obamas Hypocrisy on Syria
description: IN 2008, Barack Obama won the presidency promising that he would heal our political divisions. Instead, Mr. Obama has been as polarizing as any president in the history of modern polling. The debate over the Syrian refugee crisis illustrates why.

title: The Danger of Urban Oil Drilling
description: Many Los Angeles residents are familiar with a sight that may seem strange to outsiders: an oil pump operating mere feet from businesses or homes. A recent lawsuit claims that the city has systematically failed to address drillings environmental consequences, especially in lower-income neighborhoods that are majority black and Latino.

title: Helping Others and Accepting Help
description: Marvin Grossman, who will turn 79 on Tuesday, is used to doing things on his own. He never married or had children, but his life is filled with reading, writing and classical music. He is always willing to lend a hand to an elderly neighbor by running errands or doing the laundry.

title: Setsuko Hara, Japanese Star of Films by Ozu and Kurosawa, Is Dead at 95
description: Setsuko Hara, one of Japans most beloved actresses, best known for her subtle portrayals of women torn between the demands of family and their own desires in Late Spring, Tokyo Story and other films directed by Yasujiro Ozu, died on Sept. 5 in Kamakura, near Tokyo. She was 95.

title: Eldzier Cortor, Painter of Scenes From African-American Social Life, Dies at 99
description: Eldzier Cortor, a painter and printmaker perhaps best known for his elegant paintings of nude black women created when such works were seldom seen in the mainstream art world, died on Thursday at his sons home in Seaford, N.Y., on Long Island. He was 99.

title: Unblinking Gazer
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  On Saturdays, you have to approach a crossword carefully, with a healthy dose of suspicion, at least as it applies to the clues. Things are definitely not what they seem, but thats what can make solving the toughest puzzle of the week so much fun. And today, the cluing is especially thoughtful and tricky.

title: Joan Duddy, Nurtured Dance and Joyce SoHo in Manhattan, Dies at 78
description: Joan Duddy, an influential curator and advocate for new dance as the founder and director of the dance program at the Dia Center for the Arts (now Joyce SoHo) in Manhattan for 18 years, died on Nov. 7 in Cambridge, Mass. She was 78.

title: A Rite to Improve Karma for Man, Creature and, Now, the Environment
description: It works better with turtles  turtles just stand there and stare at you, Shi Benkong said as he stood near the Great Lawn in Central Park on Tuesday near several cardboard boxes containing not turtles but restless, rustling birds.

title: With Legal Aid, Immigrant Advocates Turn Focus to Citizenship
description: This election season, Sandra Ocampo is running her own campaign.

title: Former Rikers Inmate Who Received Settlement Is Fatally Shot in Brooklyn
description: For Robert Hinton, 2015 was supposed to be a year of new beginnings. In March, he was released from prison after serving time for a parole violation. In September, he was awarded $450,000 by New York City to settle a lawsuit against several jail guards who hogtied and severely beat him in 2012 while he was incarcerated at Rikers Island.

title: With Little Bench Relief, Knicks Run Out of Steam
description: The Knicks won 17 games last season, so the mere fact that they are no longer an unmitigated laughingstock has engendered an understandable measure of satisfaction among the team and its fans.

title: Battling Blindness and a Family Health Crisis, but Seeing Hope
description: Impaired vision has kept Cimeron DuBose from working for nearly 20 years. The days could be tedious, but they were also filled with purpose.

title: Garrett Swasey, Officer Killed in Colorado, Is Recalled for Courage and Faith
description: Garrett Swasey, 44, the University of Colorado Colorado Springs police officer who was shot and killed while responding to a shooting at a Planned Parenthood office, was described by his fellow church members and friends as a courageous man and loving father who drew strength and inspiration from his Christian faith.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: There are people out there for whom this may be the only record theyve bought in five years. The last one may have been 21, and now theyre coming back in force.

title: What to Watch Saturday
description: Take a walk on the wild side with Tangerine, watch the Property Brothers build edible homes and choose between a couple of spy movies  one real, one not so much.

title: Corrections: November 28, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Addicted to Distraction
description: ONE evening early this summer, I opened a book and found myself reading the same paragraph over and over, a half dozen times before concluding that it was hopeless to continue. I simply couldnt marshal the necessary focus.

title: A New York Trainer to Men About Town
description: Brendan Fallis, the D.J., entrepreneur and fashion model who is engaged to Hannah Bronfman, had a conundrum that many men concerned with fitness and style can relate to.

title: OMG! The Hyperbole of Internet-Speak
description: The text exchange was unspectacular: a friend explaining a video that had been posted by a classmate to his Snapchat feed. Jordana Narin, my 20-year-old research assistant, was half paying attention, sitting in my living room working on a project, texting between breaks.

title: Swell of Tupperware-Type Parties Overwhelms City Dwellers
description: Nine women were gathered in the immaculate Midtown East apartment of Mallorie Corcoran, 29. Tall, svelte and long-maned, the guests and their hostess clustered around a table in the living room, picking at fruit platters and sandwiches but generously pouring themselves wine and seltzer.

title: Elaborate Holiday Windows Dress Up New York Department Stores
description: It was 61 degrees on a recent November evening, but the scaffolds outside Lord & Taylor on Fifth Avenue were trimmed with artificial fir, and Santa Claus himself was bopping with Liz Rodbell, the stores president, to Austin Mahones Mmm Yeah.

title: The Return of Werner Erhard, Father of Self-Help
description: The silver-haired man dressed like a waiter (dark vest, dark slacks) paced the aisle between rows of desks in a Toronto conference room. If youre going to be a leader, youre going to have to have a very loose relationship with this thing you call I or me, he shouted. Maybe that whole thing in me around which the universe revolves isnt so central!

title: Paris Climate Talks Avoid Scientists Idea of Carbon Budget
description: After two decades of talks that failed to slow the relentless pace of global warming, negotiators from almost 200 countries are widely expected to sign a deal in the next two weeks to take concrete steps to cut emissions.

title: Tibetans Fight to Salvage Fading Culture in China
description: YUSHU, China  When officials forced an informal school run by monks near here to stop offering language classes for laypeople, Tashi Wangchuk looked for a place where his two teenage nieces could continue studying Tibetan.

title: Tashi Wangchuk: A Tibetans Journey for Justice
description: Worried about the erosion of Tibetan culture and language, one man takes his concerns to Beijing, hoping media coverage and the courts can reverse what he sees as a systematic eradication.

title: In Colorado, Bustling With Shoppers, Then Gripped by Chaos
description: COLORADO SPRINGS  The injured man staggered into the grocery store, his face and chest bloodied. Customers stopped and stared. He lifted his shirt up, and he had holes in his chest, said Miranda Schilter, 17, who had been waiting for a drink at an in-store coffee shop.

title: The Week on Instagram
description: Photos posted this week on @nytimes took followers from Hong Kong to the Lower East Side of New York.

title: A Plumbing Problem: Sludge in the Bathtub
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: The Roots of Chinas Real Estate Rush
description: Chinese money is reshaping real estate markets, as companies and individuals snap up commercial and residential properties.

title: Chinese Cash Floods U.S. Real Estate Market
description: Canyon Lake Ranch was once a playground for Christian day campers, and then was a corporate retreat with water-skiing, barbecues and cowboy shoot-em-up shows. Hawks now circle above 108 sunbaked acres occupied by copperhead snakes, a few coyotes and the occasional construction truck.

title: House-Hunting, Chinese-Style
description: Chinese families are looking for a safe place to invest their renminbi. From rural Texas to Silicon Valley, American real estate is an increasingly popular destination for their cash.

title: Ohio State Band Shows Flair Even as It Sticks to the Script
description: As fans clad in scarlet and gray clapped along to Le Rgiment de Sambre et Meuse on a warm September day in Columbus, members of Ohio States marching band and its alumni went about precisely spelling Ohio in script on Ohio Stadiums field.

title: Prominent Kurdish Lawyer Is Killed in Southeast Turkey
description: ISTANBUL  A prominent Kurdish lawyer and a Turkish police officer were killed on Saturday when clashes erupted after he spoke at a news conference in Turkeys volatile southeast.

title: Pope Francis Offers Mass in Uganda at Shrine for Christian Martyrs
description: NAMUGONGO, Uganda  On the very spot where some of this nations first Christians were burned to death for adhering to their beliefs, Pope Francis offered a Mass for hundreds of thousands of Ugandans on Saturday.

title: Big City Book Club
description: As the year winds down, the Big City Book Club is seeking the wisdom of the crowds to help make our next selections. For our next meeting, which will convene in early January, were asking for your suggestions: What is the best New York-centric book you read in 2015? For those of you just joining us now, you can read about previous choices here. There were some heavy hitters set in the city published this year, like City on Fire, by Garth Risk Hallberg, about New York in the 70s; Smash Cut, by Brad Gooch, about the 80s; and A Little Life, by Hanya Yanagihara, about traumatic transitions to adulthood. But the books you propose need not have been published in 2015. One of our liveliest recent discussions was about The Custom of the Country, by Edith Wharton, published in 1913.

title: Nudging the Boss for Your Performance Review
description: Send your workplace conundrums to workologist@nytimes.com, including your name and contact information (even if you want it withheld for publication). The Workologist is a guy with well-intentioned opinions, not a professional career adviser. Letters may be edited.

title: Anh Nguy: Research Is Her Recipe
description: Anh Nguy, 41, is a culinologist at Ingredion. She works in Bridgewater, N.J.

title: 2 Dead in Brooklyn House Fire Caused by Power Strip, Officials Say
description: Sharon Hinds, a home health attendant, was walking home from a party along a street in the East Flatbush section of Brooklyn early on Saturday when she heard screams and smelled smoke coming from a two-story house.

title: Variety: An Acrostic That Floats
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Do you have a hobby, a pastime, a passion that you find difficult to describe adequately to people who do not share your passion?

title: Obama Says Enough Is Enough After Colorado Shooting
description: President Obama responded angrily on Saturday to the mass shooting that took three lives, including that of a police officer, at a Planned Parenthood facility in Colorado Springs over the Thanksgiving holiday, calling the countrys recurring outbreaks of gun violence not normal.

title: Big Companies Put Their Money Where the Trash Is
description: The recycling industry has a dirty little secret: Much of the plastic that consumers diligently sort is never actually recycled. Instead, some of those yogurt containers, translucent takeout boxes and bottle caps are buried in landfills or incinerated.

title: A Pitch Is Framed by Diplomacy in Cuba
description: HAVANA  A minibus of Americans rumbled through a city in transformation, past the run-down housing and round-the-clock construction, the sparsely stocked bodegas and chic new restaurants, to a reception at the residence of the American chargs daffaires. The hint of change teased the November night.

title: Demand, Supply, and Macroeconomic Models
description: Im supposed to do a presentation next week about shifts in economic models, which has me trying to systematize my thought about what the crisis and aftermath have and havent changed my understanding of macroeconomics. And it seems to me that there is an important theme here: its the supply side, stupid.

title: Healthier, Wiser and Back With the Giants
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Craig Dahl, an undrafted rookie safety from North Dakota State, was a long shot to make the Giants in 2007. His roommate that season, linebacker and long snapper Zak DeOssie, was another first-year player trying to make the team.

title: With Steve Kerr Sidelined, Warriors Perfect Start Raises Questions of Credit
description: In a flawless start to the season, it is tempting to try to find fault amid the perfection. With the Golden State Warriors displaying no obvious issues on the court, close watchers of the team have set their sights on a rule that prevents Luke Walton, the interim coach, from getting credit for any of the victories.

title: Marco Rubio Bets the Grand Old Party Is Ready for His Younger Face
description: There is nothing particularly flashy about the endorsements that have been rolling in for Senator Marco Rubio lately: a handful of Republican members of Congress, mostly junior and not terribly influential.

title: A Step Forward for Contraceptive Access
description: Patients seeking birth control pills today typically have to get a prescription from a doctor, but reproductive health advocates have long argued that this process is unnecessary since the pills are safe for a vast majority of women. Now two states are about to allow patients to get them from a pharmacist without seeing a doctor first. Other states should consider similar moves.

title: Voting and Self-Interest
description: Why do many poor people support politicians who are opposed to a generous safety net?

title: One Governors Extraordinary Year
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md.  NEWLY bald and always blunt, Gov. Larry Hogan was wondering about his hair. When it might grow back. How it might grow back.

title: Dont Feel Bad About Bad Sex
description: DEAR Nominee,

title: Another Baltimore Injustice
description: Baltimore  THE trials of the six officers charged in the death of Freddie Gray, the 25-year-old black man who died after suffering a spinal injury in police custody, begin tomorrow. As a public defender here, I have watched the cases of the officers move through the Baltimore City Circuit Court.

title: Could Your Healthy Diet Make Me Fat?
description: SOME people eat as little fat as possible to lose weight and stay healthy, while others avoid carbohydrates. A vegan diet (with no animal products) and the paleo diet (with lots) both have enthusiastic devotees. One popular diet encourages intermittent fasting, another frequent small meals. Whos right?

title: Notes on the China Im Leaving Behind
description: BEIJING  I GOT together at a restaurant the other night with some Chinese and expatriate friends. While bossa nova played in the background, we sipped French merlot and snapped iPhone photos of one another making goofy faces.

title: Frank Sinatra in Hoboken: If I Can Make It There ...
description: HOBOKEN, N.J.  How did all these people get into my room? Frank Sinatra happily shouted in 1966, as he arrived before a cheering crowd and a swinging band eager for his concert at the Sands Hotel in Las Vegas. Backed by the Count Basie Orchestra, Sinatra recorded a virtuoso album that graying Sinatra fans still listen to for a whiff of lifes sheer exuberance and drive.

title: What Comes Out in the Wash
description: SYDNEY, Australia  ASK most people about the problem of waste plastics in the environment and they will talk about plastic bags caught in trees and the vast slicks of plastic trash found in remote areas of the Atlantic and Pacific. But the most menacing plastic waste problem is less visible and not so well publicized.

title: What the Paris Climate Meeting Must Do
description: In 1992, more than 150 nations agreed at a meeting in Rio de Janeiro to take steps to stabilize greenhouse gases at a level that would prevent dangerous anthropogenic interference with the climate system  United Nations-speak for global warming.

title: The Smartness Act of 2015
description: PUBLIC LAW 11469 114th CONGRESS

title: Digital Culture, Meet Analog Fever
description: IN the course of a recent move, I decided to cut the cord  that is, walk away from cable television and fully embrace the streamed-entertainment revolution. I felt very digital. Just a few weeks later, however, I discovered something that surprised me: Thousands of my fellow cord-cutters have taken to buying antennas, to pick up the seemingly quaint format of over-the-air television signals.

title: Tales of a Warmer Planet
description: Paul Smiths, N.Y.  ITS a mistake to think the climatic effects of our carbon emissions will be over within a few decades or centuries. Our intergenerational responsibilities run much deeper into the future.

title: Contaminating Our Bodies With Everyday Products
description: IN recent weeks, two major medical organizations have issued independent warnings about toxic chemicals in products all around us. Unregulated substances, they say, are sometimes linked to breast and prostate cancer, genital deformities, obesity, diabetes and infertility.

title: Versatile Standout Finds a Position, and a Home with Portland Timbers
description: There was never any doubt that Darlington Nagbe had talent. Talent is what made him the national player of the year in college, and it is what earned him goal of the year honors in his rookie season in Major League Soccer. It is also what drew the attention of United States Coach Jurgen Klinsmann, who eagerly threw Nagbe into two games this month almost as soon as the ink on his new citizenship papers was dry.

title: Red Bulls Home Edge Faces Stiff Test
description: The Red Bulls playoff game against the Columbus Crew on Sunday is already the biggest match at Red Bull Arena this season. The result will determine if it is also the last.

title: Spain Yesterday, Syria Today
description: BETWEEN 1936 and 1939, the Spanish Civil War condensed the awful drama of the 1930s into one conflict. Spain was where left-wing illusions about Stalinism went to die, where Hitlers war machine tuned up for the Blitzkrieg, where aerial bombardments of civilians and politically-motivated cleansing were normalized. It was a proxy war for the totalitarian powers, a magnet for volunteers from around the Western world, and an object lesson in the impotence of Europes liberal democracies.

title: Short Answers to Hard Questions About Climate Change
description: The issue can be overwhelming. The science is complicated. We get it. This is your cheat sheet.

title: The Heart Disease Conundrum
description: SOUTH ASIANS today account for more than half of the worlds cardiac patients. Heart disease is the leading cause of death in India, Pakistan and Bangladesh, and rates have risen over the past several decades. South Asian immigrants to the United States, like me, develop earlier and more malignant heart disease and have higher death rates than any other major ethnic group in this country.

title: Eric Winston
description: Eric Winston is an offensive tackle for the Cincinnati Bengals and the current president of the N.F.L. Players Association.

title: With Poor Starts Giving Them Fits, the Jets Plan to Go Back to Basics
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  The good news about the Jets is how well they tend to play after halftime. Only three teams  New England, Arizona and Houston  have outscored opponents by more points in the second half than the Jets have (49).

title: Sundays Matchup: Dolphins at Jets
description: 1 p.m., CBS

title: Sundays Matchup: Giants at Redskins
description: 1 p.m., Fox

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: With Diversity Comes Intensity in Amherst Free Speech Debate
description: AMHERST, Mass.  Hundreds of students crammed into Amherst Colleges Robert Frost Library for a sit-in against racial injustice that turned into a confessional, as one black or Hispanic student after another rose to talk about feelings of alienation and invisibility on campus.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Forget About Gargling, Coach. Just Learn to Project.

title: Obamas Legacy at Stake in Paris Talks on Climate Accord
description: WASHINGTON  At a joint news conference here Tuesday with President Franois Hollande of France, President Obama veered from his focus on the terrorist attacks in Paris to bring up the huge international gathering beginning in the French capital on Monday to hammer out a global response to climate change.

title: Ohio State and Ezekiel Elliott Run Wild Against Overmatched Michigan
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  Jim Harbaugh stood near the line of scrimmage, bent over, his hands on his knees, watching intently as Ohio State lined up needing a yard to convert a fourth down. Ohio State had knifed through Harbaughs defense all day. He looked as if he wanted to run onto the field and tackle Ezekiel Elliott, the Buckeyes running back, himself.

title: In Spain, New Political Party Makes Gains From Surprising Place  the Center
description: BARCELONA, Spain  The splintering of politics in Europe has spawned the rise of numerous upstart parties, usually on the extremes, be they left or right.

title: Transgender Argentines Confront Continued Murder and Discrimination
description: BUENOS AIRES  Diana Sacayn was found tied up in a 13th-floor apartment in Buenos Aires in October, stabbed to death. A month earlier, Marcela Estefana Chocobar, 26, was decapitated and her body dumped on a vacant lot in Ro Gallegos, in Patagonia. Also in September, in Santa Fe, a city on Argentinas Pampas lowlands, the corpse of Fernanda Olmos, 59, was discovered on her bedroom floor, a plastic bag pulled over her head. She had also been stabbed.

title: Siege Highlights Security Used in Abortion Clinics
description: COLORADO SPRINGS  As the heavily armed police officers entered the Planned Parenthood clinic here to hunt down the gunman and rescue those trapped inside, they had an advantage that seemed like something out of the movies. Officers in the command center outside the clinic were able to tap into security cameras throughout the complex, watch the siege unfold and give precise instructions to officers inside.

title: Four-Letter Words
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  What does it say about someones character if they are wont to throw around four-letter words? Probably nothing; Im not sure why I even brought that up.

title: Norman C. Pickering, Who Refined the Record Player, Dies at 99
description: Norman C. Pickering, an engineer, inventor and musician whose pursuit of audio clarity and beauty helped make phonograph records and musical instruments sound better, died on Nov. 18 at his home in East Hampton, N.Y. He was 99.

title: Josephine Chaus, Co-Founder and Re-Inventor of Fashion Brand, Dies at 64
description: Josephine Chaus, a fashion executive who founded Bernard Chaus Inc. with her husband and later rescued it from the brink of collapse, died on Wednesday at her home in Manhattan. She was 64.

title: Coping After a Shooting in Colorado Springs
description: People gathered in the city for a vigil the day after a gunman killed three people at a Planned Parenthood clinic, while investigators searched for a motive.

title: Merkel, While Refusing to Halt Migrant Influx, Works to Limit It
description: BERLIN  With as many as one million refugees having arrived in Germany this year, Chancellor Angela Merkel has found herself increasingly isolated in Europe and markedly less popular at home than she was during the crisis over the euro this spring.

title: Ex-Wife Says Robert Dear, Suspect in Colorado Rampage, Showed Few Signs of Obsession
description: GOOSE CREEK, S.C.  The blue eyes of Pamela Ross, 54, wince and cloud when she thinks back on the years that she spent with her ex-husband, Robert L. Dear Jr. They were together 16 years or so, and married for about a dozen of them.

title: After a Defeat in Houston, the Fight for Gay Rights Shifts to Jacksonville
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla.  The first major gay rights showdown since Houstons rancorous vote to repeal its anti-discrimination ordinance is shaping up here in Jacksonville, the largest city in the nation whose leaders have never enacted civil rights protections for gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender people.

title: Obamas Bookstore Haul: A Franzen, a Rushdie and a Wimpy Kid
description: It may say something about the era that even in his pleasure reading, President Obama cannot seem to get away from the dicey modern issues of security and liberty.

title: James Prideaux, Writer for Stage and for Television, Dies at 88
description: James Prideaux, who wrote television movies that starred Katharine Hepburn and Elizabeth Taylor and a play for which Julie Harris won a Tony Award for best actress, died on Nov. 18 in West Hills, Calif. He was 88.

title: Meetings, and Morning Workouts, With Members of Congress
description: Representative Tulsi Gabbard sometimes straddles a line between being a next generation leader for Democrats and a prominent critic of her partys leaders.

title: Tulsi Gabbard, Rising Democratic Star From Hawaii, Makes Mark on Party by Defying It
description: WASHINGTON  Between the chilly temperatures and the pace of the push-ups, there was plenty to complain about after eight lawmakers straggled into the park behind the Longworth House Office Building for their regular 6:30 a.m. workout.

title: Another Loss Leaves Rangers to Face Their Flaws
description: Just seconds after he had flattened Philadelphia defenseman Nick Schultz with a ruthless check, Rangers defenseman Dylan McIlrath found himself face-to-face on Saturday with the snarling Flyers defenseman Luke Schenn, who had taken exception to the hit and flung down his gloves.

title: Robert Dear, Suspect in Colorado Killings, Preferred to Be Left Alone
description: HARTSEL, Colo.  Robert L. Dear Jr. was a man who lived off the grid.

title: Battling Depression, a Young Man Finds Joy in Computers
description: Moises Ramos is a great talker. When he is comfortable  and he often is nowadays  he will settle back in a chair, arms hanging loose by his sides, and he will smile and gush about his new friends, his love of computers and the art he is working on.

title: Complexity and Contradiction
description: The painter Sam Gilliam talks to Rashid Johnson, who is known for his installation art.

title: Painting the 20th Century
description: Eldzier Cortor (1916-2015), a painter and printmaker, was part of a generation of black artists whose work was overlooked by many institutions but is now being recognized.

title: Two Generations
description: Talking to the sculptors Betye and Alison Saar, who live and work in Los Angeles.

title: Black Artists and the March Into the Museum
description: The painter Norman Lewis rarely complained in public about the singular struggles of being a black artist in America. But in 1979, dying of cancer, he made a prediction to his family. He said to us, I think its going to take about 30 years, maybe 40, before people stop caring whether Im black and just pay attention to the work,  Lewiss daughter, Tarin Fuller, recalled recently.

title: Chris Christie Endorsed by Key New Hampshire Newspaper
description: Chris Christies long-shot presidential campaign got a lift on Saturday night with the endorsement of The New Hampshire Union Leader, an influential paper in the state where the New Jersey governor has camped out in the hopes of catching fire.

title: ISIS Grip on Libyan City Gives It a Fallback Option
description: MISURATA, Libya  Iraqi commanders have been arriving from Syria, and the first public beheadings have started. The local radio stations no longer play music but instead extol the greatness of the Islamic States self-proclaimed caliph, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.

title: Stanford Kick Sends Notre Dames Playoff Hopes Reeling
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  At the moment the ball went through the uprights, the Stanford players, coaches and fans spilled onto the field.

title: Giants Losing Linemen
description: The Giants will face the Washington Redskins on Sunday without much of their starting offensive line as both center Weston Richburg and left guard Justin Pugh did not travel to Washington with the team Saturday. Pugh is recovering from a concussion and was not expected to play, but the Giants had been hopeful about Richburg, who sprained his ankle in the Giants last game on Nov. 15. The veteran John Jerry will replace Pugh, and Dallas Reynolds, a longtime N.F.L. backup, will most likely be the center. The starting tight end Larry Donnell, who has a neck injury, has also been ruled out for Sundays game.

title: As World Leaders Kick off Paris Climate Talks, Prescriptions Abound, from a Carbon Tax to a New Nuclear Push
description: As world leaders assemble in Paris for the Monday launch of the 21st round of negotiations aimed at improving on the ineffective 1992 climate change treaty, Ive assembled some worthwhile reading on the risks attending human-driven climate change and a host of prescriptions worth considering. None will be easy to achieve.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: 1890: Germanys Gift to the World
description: BERLIN  Herr Von Gossler, the Minister of Public Instruction replied to-day [Nov. 29] in the Prussian Chamber of Deputies to the interpellation of Herr Graf relative to the discovery of Professor Koch. The Minister replied that Professor Kochs discovery was for the present only an infallible means of diagnoses for tuberculosis, but that as a means of cure it would require years of experience to test it. There was, however, great hope that the results would be good. In any case Professor Koch has rendered an immense service to science in connection with all kinds of infectious diseases. The minister added that it was he who prevented Professor Koch from publishing the method of preparation of his remedy, for fear that it might be badly prepared and do more harm than good. The Prussian Government, he said, intended to purchase the secret and manufacture the remedy with its own guarantee, and supply it free of cost to all the hospitals of Germany and other countries. The New York Herald, European Edition, November 30, 1890

title: The Winter Garden at Brookfield Place
description: A bit of competition for the tree at Rockefeller Center.

title: Basking in a New Holiday Glow, No Evergreen Needed
description: The designer David Rockwell has created high-energy sets for Broadway hits like Kinky Boots and Hairspray, and he has given Nobu restaurants and W hotels their flashy looks. But lately he has been telling people he is working on the living room of Lower Manhattan.

title: Lawyers for Tamir Rices Family Release Outside Reports Criticizing Shooting
description: CHICAGO  Lawyers for the family of Tamir Rice, the 12-year-old boy fatally shot last year by the Cleveland police, have presented Ohio prosecutors with two outside reports that call an officers decision to shoot the boy unreasonable.
