title: On a Wall in the West Bronx, a Gentrification Battle Rages
description: Alberto Serrano has declared war on the shock troops of gentrification: hipsters. He has chosen as his front line a part of the Bronx, specifically a stretch along Walton Avenue in the Mount Hope neighborhood, which  for now  is free from goofy bars, twee crochet sculptures and overpriced cafes. His weapon? A huge mural depicting a grand comic-strip battle of the hip versus the hopeful.

title: 1940: Rome Declares Counterattack Has Halted Foe
description: ROME  Stiff counter-attacks by reinforced and reorganized Italian troops were said here tonight [Nov. 29] to have brought the Greek advance in Albania to a standstill. As the high command announced a turn for the better in the tide of battle, Gen. Ubaldo Soddu, who went to Albania recently to take command at the front, received promotion by royal decree. Greek efforts to advance yesterday, the high command said, were stopped by a counter-attack of the Ferrara, Siena and Centauro divisions of the 11th Army Corps. In the Koritza sector of the 9th Army Corps, all was reported quiet. Authoritative quarters were denied reports that the Greeks had captured Argyrokastron, one of the Italian bases in Albania, and that Gen. Pietro Badoglio had taken up headquarters in Tirana. Badoglio is in Rome, it was said, and Soddu is in supreme command at the front.New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, November 30, 1940

title: Breyer Sees Value in U.S. Supreme Courts Looking to Foreign Law
description: WASHINGTON  Justice Stephen G. Breyer, a progressive force on the United States Supreme Court for more than two decades, advocates the courts taking into account foreign law. Thats the stuff of a good debate, befitting a justice who got to the bench courtesy of former President Ronald Reagan and the archconservative Senator Strom Thurmond.

title: 3 Killed and 12 Injured in Crash Involving Cattle Trailer in New Jersey
description: A passenger van packed with restaurant workers returning home from work hit a car, a truck and a trailer hauling cattle that were parked on the shoulder of Interstate 287 near Bernards Township, N.J., on Saturday night. Three people were killed and 12 were injured.

title: E.U. Offers Turkey 3 Billion Euros to Stem Migrant Flow
description: BRUSSELS  Under heavy pressure from Germany to get a grip on the migrant crisis in the Continent after months of dithering, the European Union agreed to a deal on Sunday with Turkey that aims to slow the chaotic flood of asylum seekers into the 28-nation bloc.

title: Holiday Crowds Turn Out for Creed, The Good Dinosaur and Mockingjay Part 2
description: LOS ANGELES  Rocky Balboa made a near-triumphant return to movie theaters over the five-day Thanksgiving weekend, helping to bolster total domestic ticket sales by about 12 percent compared with the same period last year.

title: What to Watch Sunday
description: Groove into the workweek  and whittle off some holiday pudge  with the Soul Train Awards, complete with a how-to video. Cant move from the couch? Prepare for the final season of Downton Abbey or follow some elite mountain climbers into thin air.

title: Review: In Gluten! the Fashion Is in the Hazmat Suits
description: Those with sensitivities to milk, eggs, shellfish and ground and tree nuts have nothing to fear from Gluten!, a new comedy by Stephen Kaliski at 59E59 Theaters. Those with an allergy to labored satire may want to seek other fare.

title: In Oh, Hello, Nick Kroll and John Mulaney Have a Stage Senior Moment
description: Backstage at the Kings Theater in Brooklyn one recent Friday night, Nick Kroll and John Mulaney had finished putting on their silver-haired wigs, wrinkle makeup and billowy, threadbare bohemian clothing. These comedians had a few minutes before showtime, and as they relaxed, a familiar aroma began to fill the air: the scent of tuna fish, coming from a large plastic container that Mr. Kroll was emptying onto a slice of bread.

title: Murdochs British Tabloids Clean Up Their Acts
description: LONDON  A July article on a front page of The Sun on Sunday tabloid, owned by Rupert Murdoch, was a classic of its kind. Titled Lord Coke: Top peers drug binges with 200 prostitutes, its highlights included cross-dressing, bare breasts lined with cocaine and the 69-year-old deputy speaker of the House of Lords excitedly burbling, I just want to be led astray.

title: Adeles 25 Sells Record-Shattering 3.38 Million Copies
description: The final numbers are in, and they confirm expectations: Adele is a phenomenon.

title: Chinese Report on Climate Change Depicts Somber Scenarios
description: BEIJING  Rising seas besieging Chinas economically vital coastal zones. Mighty feats of infrastructure, like the Three Gorges Dam and railway in Tibet, strained by turbulent rainfall and the melting of frozen earth. And on the Himalayan frontiers, the risk in future decades of international conflict over dwindling water supplies as glaciers retreat.

title: Israel Aims to Recreate Wine That Jesus and King David Drank
description: HEFER VALLEY, Israel  The new crisp, acidic and mineral white from a high-end Israeli winery was aged for eight months  or, depending on how you look at it, at least 1,800 years.

title: Review: George Balanchines The Nutcracker at Lincoln Center
description: George Balanchines The Nutcracker begins with a yawn. The child heroine, Marie, has an exciting night ahead of her: a Christmas party with presents and dancing, the attention of a mysterious godfather and a handsome boy, a tree that grows 40 feet tall, a battle with giant mice, a walk in a blizzard and a journey to the Land of Sweets. And yet her first gesture suggests not just sleepiness but also boredom.

title: How to Use Google Now on Tap
Andy Murray Propels Britain to Victory in the Davis Cup
description: GHENT, Belgium  Giant foam fingers. A remarkable variety of percussion instruments. Vuvuzelas. Disturbingly oversize photos of the home players on wooden sticks. Copious face paint. And at least one trombone.

title: Peeling Back the Layers of a Born Salesmans Life
description: The woman on the telephone had news. Michael Forman was dead. She asked a reporter if there was any known next of kin.

title: L.S.U.s Les Miles Gets Another Chance. Some Teams Wont Be So Lucky.
description: After Louisiana States 19-7 victory against Texas A&M on Saturday, players hoisted Tigers Coach Les Miles onto their shoulders. He interrupted an on-field interview to sing along to the universitys alma mater  And may thy spirit live in us, forever L-S-U  before he was asked about the crowd chanting his name, in recognition of widely circulated reports that Miles was about to be fired.

title: Searching for Answers and Comfort After Killings at Planned Parenthood
description: COLORADO SPRINGS  After the congregation shared memories of a fallen police officer, Garrett Swasey, and cheered and cried through a grainy video of him competing at a 1992 skating championship, its members bowed their heads on Sunday morning to pray for the man accused of killing him at a Planned Parenthood clinic.

title: Rutgers Fires Its Football Coach and Athletic Director
description: Rutgers announced Sunday that it had fired its football coach, Kyle Flood, and athletic director, Julie Hermann, and had hired her replacement, Patrick Hobbs  three moves amid a flurry of personnel changes in major college football programs.

title: Nokia Tries to Reinvent Itself, Again, by Taking Over Alcatel-Lucent
description: ESPOO, Finland  Tucked away down a corridor at Nokias headquarters here is a reminder of its 150-year history. A colorful display traces its transformation from a maker of rubber boots in the 19th century to the worlds largest manufacturer of cellphones, whose market capitalization once peaked at almost $250 billion.

title: Optimism Abounds as Burkina Faso Votes for President
description: OUAGADOUGOU, Burkina Faso  A country that has endured months of upheaval that ousted one president and nearly toppled an interim government cast ballots Sunday in national elections intended to steady its shaky political environment.

title: Chicago to Expand Use of Police Body Cameras
description: CHICAGO  Mayor Rahm Emanuel announced on Sunday that the city would soon increase the number of police officers wearing video cameras, an expansion of a pilot program started in January in one police district.

title: Giants Wake Up Too Late to Seize a First-Place Opportunity
description: LANDOVER, Md.  The Giants refuse to conform. On the verge of prosperity, they wobble in the other direction. Dogged by adversity, they unexpectedly thrive. To the Giants, predictability is for losers, something they have now proved six times in 11 games this season.

title: How a Former Fugee Helped Elect the President of Haiti
description: When Kanye West announced his candidacy for the 2020 presidential election at the MTV Video Music Awards in August, it was his drop-the-mike moment. His remarks were met with cheers and howls of laughter that night and were captured in endless memes for weeks afterward.

title: Timely Lift for Jets Sagging Morale
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Jets had played some horrendous football the previous two games. The kind of football that produced embarrassed locker rooms, provoked a postgame tirade from their coach and prompted their hirsute quarterback to trim a beard more prolific than their offense.

title: Review: The Rio 65 Trio Resurrects the Barreling Sounds of a Samba-Jazz Band
description: A few years after the invention of bossa nova in Brazil, in the late 1950s, there appeared a wave of samba-jazz groups, often piano trios. The two styles are linked at the root by samba rhythm, but they can feel like opposites. The best bossa nova was light, sensitive, skeptical, measured, full of silence. The samba-jazz of the early 60s was dense and fast and barreling, and the Rio 65 Trio, who made two records in 1965 and 1966, embodied that sound.

title: Review: At Bargemusic, a Masterful Duo Dives Into Strauss With Breakneck lan
description: As a sort of postscript to the Berlin Philharmonics recent week of Beethoven at Carnegie Hall, Noah Bendix-Balgley, the newest of the orchestras three first concertmasters, played at Bargemusic on Friday evening with the pianist Orion Weiss.

title: Review: In Alisons House, a Family Struggles to Protect a Literary Legacy
description: There are many lenses through which to view Alisons House, Susan Glaspells 1930 drama exploring a familys angst over the literary output of a beloved dead relative. You could examine Glaspells early-20th-century feminist politics, or meditate on how the competing demands of celebrity and privacy have and have not shifted in the 85 years between its premiere and the current production, directed by Alex Roe at the Metropolitan Playhouse.

title: Woodrow Wilsons Legacy Gets Complicated
description: Was Woodrow Wilson a key founder of modern liberalism, a visionary whose belief in an activist presidency laid the groundwork for the New Deal and the civil rights legislation of the 1960s?

title: Review: In Paolo Giordanos Like Family, the Nanny Departs and Cracks Emerge
description: How, exactly, does one describe the role of that warm, hardworking woman (for she is almost always a woman) who appears at a familys doorstep day after day, year after year, to make its life possible? Is she simply an employee? A paid proxy aunt? Is her influence felt in every room and in every interaction, or is she weightless, invisible, a tidying ghost?

title: Review: Miley Cyruss World of Excess
description: Onstage at Terminal 5 on Saturday night, Miley Cyrus sang, I feel like a slab of butter that is melting in the sun and struggled to grab her crotch. Her movement was restricted, because she was dressed like a stick of butter, in a rectangular costume that ended halfway to her knees. In the venues balcony, two girls posed for a selfie, a middle-aged gentleman in a sport coat pressed record on his iPhone and a young man with a beard full of glitter glided by. We had just hit peak 2015.

title: Behind Puerto Ricos Woes, a Broadly Powerful Development Bank
description: If anything stands as a symbol of how Puerto Rico ended up mired in billions of dollars of debt, it is an oceanside golf resort going to seed some 15 miles east of San Juan.

title: Review: Not the Real Rob Schneider, Just One He Plays on Real Rob
description: Whats Real Rob doing on Netflix, besides bringing down the curve?

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Nov. 30
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Review: Baby Jane Dexter Is Back With a Vengeance and Pungent Wit
description: Hang on! When Baby Jane Dexter, a downtown cabaret fixture for more than four decades, sang those two words from the R.E.M. anthem Everybody Hurts at the Metropolitan Room on Saturday, her mighty pop contralto descended into a baritone and she exuded the authority of an inspirational commander-in-chief. Ms. Dexter has endured more than her share of hard times, but she keeps hanging on. And her new show, Its Personal!, is an impressive recovery after an engagement last year when she seemed to have lost the ability to sing on pitch or to remember lyrics.

title: In 2 Dope Queens a Duo Muses Over Life, and Stanley Tucci
description: In the cramped basement at Union Hall in Brooklyn, Jessica Williams and Phoebe Robinson have argued over Jay Z, clashed about Anita Baker and gone to war over Patti LaBelle. But when it comes to Billy Joel, they are on the same page.

title: Paris Deal Would Herald an Important First Step on Climate Change
description: PARIS  President Obama and more than 100 world leaders will convene with thousands of diplomats on Monday on the outskirts of Paris to open two weeks of intense negotiations aimed at forging an accord that could begin to avert the most devastating effects of global warming and redefine the economy of the 21st century.

title: Moneymaking Skill
description: Da da da da Da da da da   Excerpt from Beethovens Fifth Symphony in the KEY of C minor

title: Kohls Invests in Beatles Tune for Holiday Campaign
description: AS Beatles songs go, its no Hey Jude. But the department store Kohls hopes that the groups light, bouncy tune All Together Now will be the one thats stuck in consumers heads this holiday season.

title: Colorado Victims Identified as Iraq Veteran and Woman From Hawaii
description: COLORADO SPRINGS  As an Army specialist in Iraq, KeArre M. Stewart lived with fear and saw tragedy, a friend said. At home in the United States, he felt safe. Then a man in a trench coat opened fire at a Planned Parenthood clinic here  and shortly after, Mr. Stewart, 29, along with two others, was dead.

title: First Trial in Freddie Gray Death Is Set to Start in Baltimore
description: BALTIMORE  Seven months after this city erupted into riots over the death of Freddie Gray, a 25-year-old black man injured while in police custody, Baltimore is preparing for the criminal trial of the first of six officers charged in his death  another turn in the intensifying national debate over race and policing.

title: Thai Economy and Spirits Are Sagging
description: BANGKOK  Do not be fooled by the throngs of Chinese tourists clogging the entrance to the gilded Grand Palace, the roads buzzing with traffic or the plastic smiles of hostesses greeting the business lunch crowd at luxury hotels.

title: Jessica Jones Episode 7: Fear and Self-Loathing
description: Theres enough truth to the glaring streak of self-loathing that runs throughout the seventh episode of Jessica Jones to make it both palatable and believable. Thats no small feat for an episode that encourages viewers to forgive Jones, but never forces her to confront the demons that shes courting. Instead of accepting and confronting the guilt she feels over killing Reva Connors, Jones yo-yos between steps two and four of the five stages of grief: anger and depression.

title: Disneys Star Wars Attracts Investors in Midst of ESPN Woes
description: LOS ANGELES  FOR roughly a decade, ever since the DVD market started to implode, movie studios have been investor afterthoughts. Hits? Misses? Ho-hum, and back to the cable networks. With its steadily climbing subscriber fees, the Wall Street theory has held, cable would always save the day for the media conglomerates.

title: Tensions With Russia Add to a Chill in Turkeys Economy
description: ESKISEHIR, Turkey  A new high-speed rail line, completed last year, now links Eskisehir with Istanbul to the west and Ankara to the east. A narrow, serpentine river meanders through downtown, spanned by graceful blue bridges at almost every block, drawing tourists. Factories here make everything from cakes and cookies to refrigerators, large Ford freight trucks and aircraft parts.

title: Kobe Bryant Announces Retirement
description: Kobe Bryant of the Los Angeles Lakers announced Sunday that he would retire from professional basketball after the end of this season, his 20th in the N.B.A., bringing to a close one of the most decorated careers in the history of the sport.

title: Elegant Railroading of the Past
description: Dear Diary:

title: Injured in Hurricane Sandy, an Immigrant Faces Eviction
description: Resourcefulness once dictated much of Viktoriya Ignatyevas life.

title: Ted Cruz Surges in Iowa, Powered by Outsider Fervor
description: CHARITON, Iowa  Around 10 p.m. Saturday, with locals here stuffing the entryway of a general store known for something called taco pizza, the presidential campaign of Senator Ted Cruz seemed to be winning a bet with itself.

title: Marvel to Release Free Reprints of Hip-Hop Homage Comic Book Covers
description: Jay Z and the Black Panther. LL Cool J and the Punisher. Missy Elliott and the Black Widow. Vanilla Ice and Deadpool. These are some of the pairings that fans of Marvel Entertainment have been treated to since October as part of a series of comic book covers inspired by hip-hop album covers. On Jan. 6, at participating stores, Marvel will give away a 32-page comic that reprints 14 of the homage covers.

title: Tax Status of Museums Questioned by Senators
description: The Senate Finance Committee is scrutinizing nearly a dozen private museums opened by individual collectors, questioning whether the tax-exempt status they enjoy provides sufficient public benefit to justify what amounts to a government subsidy.

title: In Utah Feud Over Dirty Sodas, Flavored Darts Are Fired
description: AMERICAN FORK, Utah  Minivans circled the shop like wagons in a western epic. Employees passed giant cups through a drive-through window. And inside, a woman named Taylor Warner reveled in her bit role in the battle that has overtaken Utah: the soda war of 2015.

title: In Africa, Pope Francis Makes His First Visit to a War Zone
description: BANGUI, Central African Republic  Pope Francis made his first visit to a war zone on Sunday, landing in the capital of this divided and destitute country in a bid to support efforts at peace and reconciliation.

title: Chasing Endorsements, Chris Christie Showers New Hampshire With Calls and Texts
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  The pleading phone calls, solicitous text messages and eager dinner invitations come at all hours, even on holidays  an unrelenting wave of attention from a governor never known for offering small doses of himself.

title: France Uses Sweeping Powers to Curb Climate Protests, but Clashes Erupt
description: PARIS  The French government is using the sweeping emergency powers it gained after the Paris terrorist attacks to clamp down on any possible disruption to the two-week global climate conference that starts on Monday, limiting public demonstrations, beefing up security and placing two dozen environmental activists under house arrest.

title: Auto Sales, Nokias Deal and a Vote on Anthem-Cigna Merger
description: Here is what to look out for this week:

title: Cuomo to Highlight New Yorks Progress in AIDS Fight
description: Prescriptions for Truvada, a drug that protects against H.I.V. infection, have more than tripled since summer 2014 among people enrolled in Medicaid in New York State. Separately, the transmission of H.I.V. infections from mother to child dropped to zero in the state for the first time since the AIDS epidemic began.

title: Mondays Matchup: Ravens (3-7) at Browns (2-8)
description: 8:30 p.m. Eastern, ESPN

title: Red Bulls, Best in Regular Season, End Playoff Run With a Burst That Comes Too Late
description: HARRISON, N.J.  Yet another promising season ended badly Sunday for the Red Bulls, on a night when they awakened too late and when a ball bounced the wrong way off the post in the waning seconds.

title: Predatory Islamic State Wrings Money From Those It Rules
description: Three times a month, Mohammad al-Kirayfawai hands $300 to fighters from the Islamic State for the privilege of driving his refrigerated truck full of ice cream and other perishables from Jordan to a part of Iraq where the militants are firmly in charge.

title: Black Friday Just a Day This Year, No Longer a Bellwether
description: If the lines at Target or Macys this Black Friday seemed shorter than in years past, shoppers have the Internet to thank.

title: Hope for Nefertitis Tomb, and Egypts Economy
description: LUXOR, Egypt  For weeks, a group of explorers have scanned the walls of a tomb in the Valley of the Kings, using radar and infrared devices, in the hopes that science might confirm one Egyptologists theory: that hidden behind a wall of King Tutankhamens burial chamber sits the long-sought tomb of Queen Nefertiti.

title: N.B.A. Game of the Week: Spurs at Bulls
description: Every week, The New York Times will choose one essential game to watch, highlighting hot teams, winning and losing streaks and statistical intrigue in the N.B.A.

title: A Coalition in Which Some Do More Than Others to Fight ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  In the aftermath of the terrorist attack on Paris, President Obama wanted to make clear that much of the world was with the United States in fighting the Islamic State.

title: Yolanda Sonnabend, Designer Who Influenced Choreographer, Dies at 80
description: LONDON  Yolanda Sonnabend, a theater designer and painter who had a strong influence on the work of the British choreographer and Royal Ballet director Kenneth MacMillan, died on Nov. 9 in London. She was 80.

title: Discord Between Turkey and Russia Is Fueled by Leaders Similarities
description: MOSCOW  Russia has a new Enemy No. 1.

title: Win or Lose,Todd Bowles Demands Accountability
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  After watching his team absorb its fourth loss in five games last week, Todd Bowles broke from what had become the norm under his predecessor Rex Ryan and called out the Jets rookie players.

title: Shooting at Planned Parenthood Adds to Challenges for Congress
description: WASHINGTON  Even as the authorities say they remain uncertain what precisely led a gunman to attack a Planned Parenthood facility in Colorado Springs on Friday, a comment attributed to the suspect by a senior law enforcement official  no more baby parts  fed directly into an already high-pitched controversy over Planned Parenthood and its practices.

title: Junior Colleges Second Chances Become Dead Ends
description: VALHALLA, N.Y.  They were an island of misfit toys, the players on the mens basketball team at Westchester Community College. And on the old video, their joy during their shining moment was unambiguous.

title: Homeland Season 5, Episode 9 Recap: Its Going to Be O.K.
description: This recap contains spoilers for Sundays episode of Homeland.

title: The Leftovers Season 2, Episode 9: Nothing Can Stand in Her Way
description: If Kevin Garveys recent journey through purgatory suggested that mysticism would explain all things on The Leftovers going forward, the reveal at the end of this weeks episode clearly shows otherwise.

title: University of Chicago Cancels Classes After Online Threat
description: The University of Chicago canceled all classes and activities on its main campus Monday because of a specific anonymous threat of gun violence, the university said in a statement Sunday night.

title: The Affair Season 2, Episode 9: Storm Coming
description: It was a dark and stormy night. No, really.

title: The Walking Dead Season 6, Episode 8: My Dad Killed Your Dad
description: The Walking Dead wrapped up the first half of Season 6 in an episode that saw walkers finally arrive inside the walls of Alexandria.

title: Knicks Big Lead Collapses With a Thump
description: Seconds into the overtime period, Dwight Howard of the Houston Rockets jumped up to catch a lob pass that was drifting several feet away from the hoop and was still able to hammer the ball through the rim with both hands. Kristaps Porzingis, the popular Knicks rookie, could only flail his arms below.

title: A Brief History of Deadly Attacks on Abortion Providers
description: The fatal shooting of three people at a Planned Parenthood clinic in Colorado Springs was the latest incident in a long history of violent attacks on doctors and clinics providing abortions.

title: Musical Daddy Long Legs Will Stream Live Online
description: Your laptop now counts as Off Broadway. On Dec. 10, the musical Daddy Long Legs will be streamed live online for free from the Davenport Theater.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | caricature
description: caricature  \ker-i-k-chur, -chr, -tyur, -tur, \ noun and verb

title: Ted Cruz Defends Conservative Criticisms of Planned Parenthood After Shooting at Clinic
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas, chafing at the suggestion that conservative criticisms of Planned Parenthood might have played a role in the attack at a Colorado clinic on Friday, lashed out on Sunday at the vicious rhetoric on the left, blaming those who are pro-life.

title: What to Watch Monday
description: Gather around the littlest tree for a 50th-anniversary celebration of A Charlie Brown Christmas, think twice about sitting on a certain Santas lap and try to decide whether youll be shopping NBCs new Superstore when it officially opens in January.

title: A Whirlwind of Rugby on Randalls Island
description: The New York Rugby Club hosted its annual amateur tournament with teams from across the United States, Canada, Mexico and Fiji.

title: An Island Paradise for Rugby, Honking and Skyline Views Included
description: As a persistent drizzle drowned out the last fleeting moment of sunshine, Ben Rotstein scurried from field to field, chirping into his walkie-talkie and assuaging grievances of visiting rugby players, fully immersed in his first experience as the director of the New York Sevens Tournament.

title: The Best of Week 12 in the N.F.L.
description: With Jamaal Charles out for the year and Charcandrick West sitting with a hamstring injury, Spencer Ware got his first career start and ran for 114 yards and a score in a Chiefs victory over the Bills. Ware, who had 96 yards on 11 carries last week, was on Kansas Citys practice squad until Charles was hurt. A 2013 sixth-round draft pick by the Seahawks, he had just three career carries entering the season. But Ware seemed confident heading into the Buffalo game, writing on Twitter last week, Dont let others define u Dont let da past confine u.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: If we discover something, it will turn the world inside out. And they will come.

title: Desk Set
description: The pen may be an antiquated device for the texting generation, but for many its still relevant  and often prized  device for writing everything from a greeting card to a shopping list.

title: An Expats Eye on Greece
description: Dimitri Mellos believes that people put reality into boxes. Most, he says, have a stereotypical conception of different parts of the world. When they think of India, they think of the Taj Mahal. And when they think of his native Greece, they think of sunny Mediterranean beaches.

title: Corrections: November 30, 2015
description: NEW YORK

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: Inequality and the City
description: New York, New York, a helluva town. The rents are up, but the crime rate is down. The food is better than ever, and the cultural scene is vibrant. Truly, its a golden age for the town I recently moved to  if you can afford the housing. But more and more people cant.

title: Packing Guns in the Day Care Center
description: The gun lobbys drive to extend the range of citizens with gun permits to the most vulnerable circles of society  from college campuses to busy restaurants  is now advancing on day care centers. Thats right: Legislation approved two weeks ago by the Republican-controlled Ohio House would allow state residents with concealed-carry permits to pack their loaded, hidden guns into day care centers when they drop off the kids.

title: Laquan McDonald and the System
Why I Miss George W. Bush
description: WASHINGTON  AS a Briton who, like millions of my compatriots, opposed the American-led invasion of Iraq in 2003, I did not expect to ever find much to admire about President George W. Bush. But as a Muslim who has come to work in America, I have recently had to revise my opinion.

title: Free Tuition Is Not the Answer
description: THESE days, politicians on both the left and the right are very critical of higher education, especially the cost of attending college and the related debt that students and their families incur. But there is more to college affordability than lower prices.

title: The Inheritance of Disaffection
description: Daddy, are you happy? This is a question my son asks me on a regular basis. It is a beautiful yet sad question. It is beautiful because it is proof that my state of being registers with him, and that fact is the basis of essential virtues like sympathy, friendship and love. It is sad because often I am not happy and my son sees it just like I saw it on my own fathers face with troubling regularity.

title: Women Behind Bars
description: In the last few years, Americas out-of-control incarceration boom has finally started to get the sustained public scrutiny, and condemnation, that it deserves. But one key element of the story still receives too little attention: the number of women in the nations prisons and jails.

title: E.L.L. Practice | The 2015 United Nations Climate Change Conference
description: Note: We invite any English Language Learner student 13 years or older to post comments in response to the writing prompts in this post.

title: Does Polling Undermine Democracy?
Time to Bring Cuba Online
description: Millions of Cuban citizens could have affordable access to the Internet in a matter of months. The only thing keeping the island in the digital Dark Ages is a lack of political will. Cuban officials have long blamed the American embargo for their nations obsolete telecommunications systems. They no longer have that excuse.

title: Es hora de conectar a Cuba a Internet
description: Millones de cubanos podran tener acceso a Internet a un precio moderado en cuestin de meses. Lo nico que mantiene a Cuba en las tinieblas en plena era digital es la falta de voluntad poltica. Desde hace mucho tiempo, los lderes cubanos han dicho que el deplorable estado de la infraestructura de telecomunicaciones en la isla es culpa del embargo de Estados Unidos. Ya no tienen esa excusa.

title: The Findings of Chinas Climate Change Report
description: Ahead of climate change negotiations in Paris, the Chinese government has released its latest scientific assessment of how global warming has affected and is likely to affect China. The 900-page Third National Climate Change Assessment Report is the work of some 550 scientists and experts, summing up the advancing knowledge of the environmental consequences of rising greenhouse gas levels.

title: Exchange of Spies With China Is Positive Sign, Taiwan Says
description: Taiwans presidential office said Monday that a rare exchange of spies with China was a sign of improved ties between the neighbors and historic rivals.

title: News Qs | Gunman Attacks Outside a Planned Parenthood Clinic in Colorado
description: Before Reading In Colorado, Bustling With Shoppers, Then Gripped by Chaos:

title: Readers Debate the Wisdom of Pursuing a Lost Love
description: Thoughts on a Modern Love column, in which the writer had a simple message: real love, once blossomed, never disappears.

title: Dip in Tourism After Most Attacks Is Short-Lived, Study Says
description: In the hours after the terror attacks in Paris on Nov. 13, airlines, hotels and travel agencies witnessed a surge in cancellations as anxious visitors sought to avoid the French capital.

title: How Hard Is New Yorks Algebra Exam?
description: A sample of questions from this years New York Regents Algebra I exam, which was aligned with the Common Core curriculum.

title: Making the Most of Evolving Airline and Hotel Reward Programs
description: American Airlines is making international first-class award flights more expensive. Delta is making free upgrades to seats with more legroom more elusive for elites traveling with low-status companions. Marriott is acquiring Starwood, which will likely spell the end of a top hotel loyalty program.

title: Algebra Scores Prompt Second Look at Revamped Regents Exams
description: Here is the thorny math problem facing New York State education officials: If the percentage of students passing the Algebra I exam falls to 63 percent from 72 percent, and the passing grade is scheduled to increase by 9 points in coming years, should the test be made easier?

title: Who Are the PeopleFamous or NotYou Admire Most?
description: Think about the impressive feats youve witnessed recently, from Adele shattering records with the sales of her new album to an act of generosity that took place in your community or school.

title: Citing Urgency, World Leaders Converge on France for Climate Talks
description: LE BOURGET, France  One of the largest gatherings of world leaders in history began a multinational effort Monday toward forging what many called the planets last, best hope to stave off the worst consequences of climate change.

title: Two Jewish Teenagers Found Guilty of Murdering Palestinian, 16
description: JERUSALEM  Two Jewish teenagers were found guilty of murder by an Israeli court on Monday for their roles in the kidnapping and killing of Muhammad Abu Khdeir, a 16-year-old Palestinian who was bludgeoned with a wrench and burned to death in a Jerusalem forest in July 2014.

title: Gigi Hadids Bob Caused a Sensation: Heres How to Do It
description: Three days before this years American Music Awards, held in Los Angeles on Nov. 22, the hairstylist Bryce Scarlett received a text from the model Gigi Hadid: What do you think about wigs?
